uses: USES OF ACNAY GEL Treats mild to moderate acne
working: HOW ACNAY GEL WORKS  ACNAY GEL helps to treat acne, where Clindamycin reduces free fatty acid concentrations on the skin and suppresses the growth of Propionibacterium acnes (Corynebacterium acnes), a bacteria found in sebaceous glands and follicles and Nicotinamide exerts anti-inflammatory effect in acne and interrupts sebum production.
directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Apply ACNAY GEL as advised by your physician. It is for external use only. Before applying the medicine normally wash and dry the affected area and apply a thin layer of this medicine on the affected area. Treated areas on the face need not be covered with a plaster or bandage. Do not apply this medicine beyond the recommended duration. Avoid applying ACNAY GEL around your eyes, including eyelids. Rinse it off with water if you accidentally get it in these areas.
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF ACNAY GEL COMMON Contact dermatitis (red, itchy rash) Inflammation of hair follicles Itchy skin Dry skin Peeling of skin
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY  ACNAY GEL should be used with caution in pregnant women. Consult your doctor before applying.  BREASTFEEDING  ACNAY GEL should be used with caution in breastfeeding women. Consult your doctor before applying.  ALLERGY  ACNAY GEL is not recommended for use if you are allergic to Clindamycin, Nicotinamide or any other ingredients of this medicine.  OTHERS  ACNAY GEL is not recommended for use if you have:  Eczema (skin inflammation) Cut, scrapped, sunburnt skin  Use in Pediatrics:  ACNAY GEL is not recommended for use in children and adolescents (below 12 years). Consult your doctor before using it for your child.  Use in Geriatrics:  There is no information on the use of ACNAY GEL in elderly patients. Consult with your doctor before using.
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug - Drug interactions:  Before using ACNAY GEL, inform your doctor if you are taking any of the following medicines:  Acepromazine (used a sedative/tranquilizer) Acetaminophen (used to treat pain and inflammation)  Overdosage:  If you or anyone else accidentally ingests or applies too much of ACNAY GEL, consult your doctor immediately or visit the nearby hospital.
synopsis: SYNOPSIS Drug	:  	Clindamycin, Nicotinamide Pharmacological Category	:  	Lincomycin antibiotics, Vitamin B3 complex Therapeutic Indication	:  	Mild to moderate acne Dosage Forms	:  	Gel, Cream, Ointment
moreInfo: MORE INFORMATION Keep ACNAY GEL out of reach of children Store ACNAY GEL at a temperature below 25°C
faqs: FAQs ABOUT ACNAY GEL  What special precautions should I follow while using ACNAY GEL?  Before using ACNAY GEL inform your doctor if you have liver, kidney, lung or heart diseases. Avoid applying ACNAY GEL to a cut, scrapped, sunburnt or eczema affected skin. This medicine is not for oral, ophthalmic or intravaginal use.  What is ACNAY GEL used for?  ACNAY GEL is indicated for the treatment of mild to moderate acne in patients above 12 years of age. Do not use it for any other condition other than that prescribed by your doctor.  How should I use ACNAY GEL?  Always apply ACNAY GEL, as directed by your physician. It is for external use only. On the affected area, apply a thin layer of this medicine. Treated areas on the face need not be covered with a plaster or bandage. Do not apply this medicine on your face beyond 5 days. Avoid applying ACNAY GEL around your eyes, including eyelids.  Is ACNAY GEL safe to use in pregnant and breastfeeding women?  ACNAY GEL should be used with caution during pregnancy, women planning for pregnancy and in breastfeeding women. Consult your doctor before applying.  Can ACNAY GEL cause skin irritation or itchy skin?  ACNAY GEL may cause skin irritation or itchy skin. Avoid hot bath because hot water can irritate your skin further. Do not scratch the affected area. Use protective clothing when going outdoors. Regularly moisturize your skin and apply calamine lotion as a coolant. Discuss with your doctor if the symptom worsens.

name: Acnecure Gel 20gm
about: INTRODUCTION  ACNECURE GEL contains Clarithromycin which belongs to the group of medicines called Macrolide Antibiotics. It is used to treat acne vulgaris. It also treats blackheads, whiteheads, more severe forms of acne.  Acne is caused due to blockage and the inflammation of the skin pores or hair follicles. When oil is trapped in the hair follicles, the normal skin bacteria P.acnes (gram-positive commensal bacterium) will grow in the blocked pore. The bacteria produce chemicals that alter the composition of the oil, which makes it more irritating to the skin and causes inflammation of the skin pore. This results in superficial skin eruptions.  ACNECURE GEL is not recommended for patients who are allergic (hypersensitive) to clarithromycin, or to any other ingredients present in it.  This medicine should be used with caution in pregnant women and breastfeeding mothers. Consult your doctor before using ACNECURE GEL.  The most common side effects include skin dryness and possible irritation. Consult a doctor immediately if any of the symptoms worsen.
uses: USES OF ACNECURE GEL Treats pimples, blackheads, whiteheads and more severe forms of acne
working: HOW ACNECURE GEL WORKS  ACNECURE GEL prevents the growth of bacteria by interfering with its protein synthesis and binds specific proteins present in the bacterial ribosomes, thus stopping the growth of the bacteria inside the body, which helps to reduce the infection and its symptoms.
directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Always use ACNECURE GEL as directed by your physician. It is for external use only. Apply a thin layer of ACNECURE GEL to the affected area. Your doctor will give the right dose depending on your age, body weight and severity of the infection.
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF ACNECURE GEL COMMON Skin dryness Possible irritation
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY  ACNECURE GEL is not recommended for use during pregnancy. However, consult your doctor before using the medicine.  BREASTFEEDING  It is unknown that ACNECURE GEL pass into the breast milk, hence it should be used with caution during breastfeeding. However, consult your doctor before using the medicine.  ALLERGY  Do not use ACNECURE GEL if you are allergic (hypersensitive) to Clarithromycin and other macrolide antibiotics or to any other constituents of this medicine.
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug-Drug interactions:  Before using ACNECURE GEL, inform your doctor if you are taking prescription, non-prescription medicines or applying for any medicated soap, herbal or ayurvedic medicine on the skin for acne.  Overdosage:  ACNECURE GEL rarely can cause any effect on applying excess. However, if you or anyone else accidentally applied too much of ACNECURE GEL, consult your doctor immediately or visit the nearby hospital.
synopsis: SYNOPSIS Drug	:  	Clarithromycin Pharmacological Category	:  	Macrolide antibiotics Therapeutic Indication	:  	Acne Vulgaris Dosage Forms	:  	  Tablet, Injection, Dry syrup, Oral suspensions, Gel, Granules, Lotion, Solution
moreInfo: MORE INFORMATION Keep ACNECURE GEL out of reach of children Store at room temperature
faqs: FAQs ABOUT ACNECURE GEL  How to use ACNECURE GEL for treating acne?  Apply a thin layer of ACNECURE GEL to the affected area of the skin. Wash your hands before applying ACNECURE GEL to avoid infection. Initially apply for a limited time and then gradually increase the time of exposure of the medicine to the skin. Consult your doctor for advice.  When should I call a doctor immediately?  Consult a doctor immediately if you show symptoms such as allergic reactions like skin redness, rash, hives, itching, blisters, and swelling of the face, lips, or tongue.  What ACNECURE GEL is used for?  ACNECURE GEL is used to treat bacterial acne, pimples, blackheads, whiteheads and some severe forms of acne. Consult your doctor for advice before using.  Can I use ACNECURE GEL with any other face cream or moisturizer?  It is advisable not to use ACNECURE GEL with other topical anti-acne medicines unless prescribed by your doctor. It can increase the risk of side effects such as skin peeling, irritation, or dryness. However, consult your doctor for advice before using.  What are the side effects of applying ACNECURE GEL on my skin?  Skin dryness and possible irritation are the few side effects that can happen while using ACNECURE GEL. Consult your doctor if it becomes worse and unmanageable.

name: Acnedap Gel 15gm
about: INTRODUCTION  ACNEDAP GEL contains Dapsone which belongs to the group of medicines called Sulfone antibiotics. It is used in the treatment of acne vulgaris (a skin condition that occurs when the hair follicles are blocked with dead skin cells, bacteria and sebum). The most common symptoms of acne vulgaris are pimples, redness, blackhead and white heads.  Before using ACNEDAP GEL, inform your doctor if you have glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase (G6PD) deficiency, methemoglobinemia (a type of blood disorder) and if you are using other products including cosmetics or medicines applied to the skin.  ACNEDAP GEL should be used during pregnancy and breast-feeding only if clearly advised by the doctor. Consult your doctor before using the medicine.  This medicine is not recommended for use in children (younger than 12 years of age). ACNEDAP GEL should be used with caution in elderly patients (aged 65 years and above). Consult your doctor before using the medicine.  The most common side effects associated with the use of ACNEDAP GEL are oiliness/ peeling, redness and dryness. Consult your doctor if any of the side effect worsens.
uses: USES OF ACNEDAP GEL Treats acne vulgaris
working: HOW ACNEDAP GEL WORKS  ACNEDAP GEL works as both anti-bacterial and anti-inflammatory agent in the treatment of acne vulgaris. As an antibacterial agent, it works by inhibiting the synthesis of folic acid which is necessary for the growth of bacteria. Thus, stops the multiplication of bacteria. As an anti-inflammatory agent, it decreases inflammation and heals the breakout.
directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Always apply ACNEDAP GEL as directed by your doctor. It is for topical use only. Apply a thin layer of this medicine to the areas of your skin that have acne. Avoid contact with eyes, mouth and mucous membranes. Rub the medicine gently and completely. Wash your hands after applying ACNEDAP GEL. Your doctor will decide the duration and frequency of this medicine depending upon severity of the condition.
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF ACNEDAP GEL COMMON Oiliness/peeling Redness Dryness UNCOMMON Application site dryness, redness, burning and itching Fever Common cold Sinusitis Pain or irritation in the throat Cough Joint sprain Headache RARE  Stop using ACNEDAP GEL consult your doctor immediately if you experience any of the following side effects:  Signs of methemoglobinemia (such as dizziness, breathlessness, slate grey or blueish coloring of the skin, especially in buccal mucous membranes, lips and nail beds)
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY  ACNEDAP GEL should be used during pregnancy only if considered clearly necessary. Consult your doctor before using the medicine.     BREASTFEEDING  ACNEDAP GEL should be used during breast-feeding only if considered clearly necessary. Consult your doctor before using ACNEDAP GEL.    ALLERGY  Do not use ACNEDAP GEL if you are allergic to dapsone or any other ingredients of this medicine.  OTHERS  ACNEDAP GEL is not recommended for use if you:  Have congenital or idiopathic methemoglobinemia  Before using ACNEDAP GEL inform your doctor if you:  Are using other products including cosmetics or medicines applied to the skin Have glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase (G6PD) deficiency Have history of slate grey or blueish discoloration of skin, mucous membranes, lips and nail beds due to lack of sufficient oxygen in the blood (methemoglobinemia)  Use in pediatrics:  ACNEDAP GEL can be used in children of age 12 to 17 years. This medicine is not recommended for use in children younger than 12 years of age. Consult your child’s doctor before using ACNEDAP GEL to your child.     Use in geriatrics:  ACNEDAP GEL should be used with caution in elderly patients (aged 65 years and above).  Consult your doctor before using ACNEDAP GEL.
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug-drug interactions:  Before using ACNEDAP GEL, inform your doctor, if you are taking any of the following medicines:  Trimethoprim/sulfamethoxazole, nitrofurantoin (used in the treatment and prevention of urinary tract) Topical benzoyl peroxide (used to treat acne) Sulphonamides such as sulfadiazine, sulfamethizole (used in the treatment of bacterial infections) Acetaminophen, acetanilide (used to relive pain) Nitroprusside, nitrates and nitrites such as glyceryl trinitrate (used to treat angina) Benzocaine (used to relieve pain) Oral dapsone (used to treat leprosy, dermatitis herpetiformis) Pamaquine, chloroquine, para-amino salicylic acid, quinine (used to treat and prevent malaria) Phenacetin (used to treat fever) Phenobarbital, phenytoin (used in the treatment of fits)  Over dosage:  ACNEDAP GEL is only for topical use, it is not for oral use. If oral ingestion occurs, consult your doctor or visit the nearby hospital immediately.
synopsis: SYNOPSIS Drug	:  	Dapsone Pharmacological Category	:  	Sulfone antibiotics Therapeutic Indication	:  	Acne vulgaris           Dosage Forms	:  	Tablet, Gel
moreInfo: MORE INFORMATION Keep the medicine away from children Store at room temperature (15-30°C)
faqs: FAQs ABOUT ACNEDAP GEL  What should I tell my doctor before using ACNEDAP GEL?  Before using ACNEDAP GEL inform your doctor if you are using other products including cosmetics or medicines applied to the skin, glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase (G6PD) deficiency, history of slate grey or blueish discoloration of skin, mucous membranes, lips and nail beds due to lack of sufficient oxygen in the blood (methemoglobinemia).  How should I use ACNEDAP GEL?  Use ACNEDAP GEL exactly as told by your doctor. ACNEDAP GEL is usually used on your affected skin twice a day, once in the morning and once in the evening. Wash the areas of your skin where you apply the medicine. Gently pat your skin dry with a clean towel. Apply a thin layer of this medicine to the areas of your skin that have acne. A pea sized amount ACNEDAP GEL will usually be enough. Rub the medicine gently and completely.  What are the most common side effects of ACNEDAP GEL?  The most common side effects of ACNEDAP GEL are skin dryness, redness and oiliness/peeling of the skin. Consult your doctor if you experience any of the symptoms get worse.  How does ACNEDAP GEL work?  ACNEDAP GEL works as both anti-bacterial and anti-inflammatory agent in the treatment of acne vulgaris. As an antibacterial agent, it works by inhibiting the synthesis of folic acid which is necessary for the growth of bacteria. Thus, stops the multiplication of bacteria. As an anti-inflammatory agent, it decreases inflammation and heals the breakout.      Can ACNEDAP GEL be used in pregnant and breast-feeding women?  ACNEDAP GEL should be used during pregnancy and breast-feeding only if advised by the doctor. Consult your doctor for advice before using the medicine if you are pregnant or breast-feeding mother.

name: Acnedap Plus Gel 15gm
about: INTRODUCTION  ACNEDAP PLUS contains a combination of Adapalene and Dapsone, which belongs to the group of medicines called topical retinoids and sulfonamide antibiotics. It is used in the treatment of skin acne. Acne is a condition of the skin when the root of your hair (hair follicle) or skin pores gets clogged by oil or dead skin, which becomes prone to bacterial infection resulting in pimples, blackheads and spots or scars.  Adapalene is a form of vitamin A (retinoid) that acts as an antiacne agent by binding directly to the receptors of the skin which increases the rate of cell regeneration and decreases oil secretion preventing clogging of the hair follicles and pores. It also reduces swelling and inflammation. Dapsone is an antibiotic with a structure similar to PABA (para-aminobenzoic acid) that kills bacteria by competitively substituting PABA, a nutrient that bacteria use to generate folic acid for growth and survival. Before recommending ACNEDAP PLUS, your doctor may advise you to have tests to understand your existing condition for planning effective treatment methods. Stay well hydrated and protect your skin from exposure to sunlight or UV light.  Do not apply ACNEDAP PLUS if you are allergic to adapalene or dapsone or have bruises, cuts or burns on the skin, It should be used with caution and inform your doctor if have any disorder of the digestive system (colitis), a disorder of the immune system, anemia or G6PD deficiency. The common side effects of using ACNEDAP PLUS may include dry skin, burning, itching, redness or irritative sensation of the skin and peeling of the skin.
uses: USES OF ACNEDAP PLUS Treats acne
working: HOW ACNEDAP PLUS WORKS  ACNEDAP PLUS is a combination of Adapalene (Retinoid) and Dapsone (Sulfonamide). Adapalene, a form of vitamin A, works as an antiacne agent by attaching directly to the skin's receptors, which increases cell regeneration and decreases oil secretion preventing blockage of the hair follicles and pores It also reduces swelling/inflammation of the skin. Dapsone is an antibiotic with a structure similar to PABA (para-aminobenzoic acid) that kills bacteria by competitively substituting PABA, a nutrient that bacteria use to generate folic acid for growth and survival.
directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Apply ACNEDAP PLUS as advised by your doctor. It is for external use on the skin. Avoid applying ACNEDAP PLUS around or onto your eyes, including eyelids.
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF ACNEDAP PLUS COMMON Dryness of the skin Burning, itching, redness of the skin Scaling and/or peeling of the skin UNCOMMON Flaring of acne Sunburns Local skin reaction Fever Headache  Stop using ACNEDAP PLUS and contact your doctor immediately if you experience any of the following side effects:  Severe allergic reactions (such as skin rash, itching, swelling of the face, lips, tongue and other parts of the body, difficulty in breathing or wheezing, blisters on the skin, sore throat, fever, headache etc.)
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY  ACNEDAP PLUS is not recommended for use in pregnant women. Consult your doctor for advice.  BREASTFEEDING  ACNEDAP PLUS is to be used with caution in breastfeeding mothers only if recommended by your doctor. Avoid applying ACNEDAP PLUS on the chest to avoid contact exposure to the baby while breastfeeding.  DRIVING AND USING MACHINES  ACNEDAP PLUS may not interfere with your ability to drive or use the machine. However, protect your skin from sun or UV light while travelling and follow appropriate protective measures recommended by your doctor.  ALLERGY  Talk to your doctor if you are allergic to Adapalene and/or Dapsone.  OTHERS  ACNEDAP PLUS is not recommended for use if you have:  Cuts or bruises on the skin Sunburns Skin conditions like eczema (itching, dry and red skin)  Use in pediatrics:  ACNEDAP PLUS should be used with caution in children less than 12 years of age.  Use in geriatrics:  ACNEDAP PLUS should be taken with caution in the elderly above 65 years of age. Consult your doctor for advice.
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug-Drug interactions:  Inform your physician, if you are taking or using,  Medicated soap for skin, other cosmetic products with a high concentration of alcohol, astringents, sulfur etc Resorcinol – use for itching or irritation of the skin and scalp, loss of hair, dandruff etc Salicylic acid – used for skin acne, dandruff, etc Trimethoprim-Sulfamethoxazole – used to treat bacterial infection Topical Benzoyl Peroxide – used to treat acne Paracetamol – used to relieve pain Phenytoin – used to prevent and control fits/seizures  B. Drug-Food interaction:  The interaction of foods with ACNEDAP PLUS is not known. Consult your doctor for diet advice.  Overdosage:  In case of using ACNEDAP PLUS in excess than recommended, you may experience dryness, scaling, redness and discomfort of the skin. Contact your doctor immediately if the symptoms are worsening or persists.
synopsis: SYNOPSIS Drug	:  	Adapalene, Dapsone Pharmacological Category	:  	Topical retinoids and Sulfonamide antibiotics Therapeutic Indication	:  	Treat acne Dosage Forms	:  	Gel
moreInfo: MORE INFORMATION Keep out of reach from children Store at room temperature Keep away from sunlight
faqs: FAQs ABOUT ACNEDAP PLUS  Can ACNEDAP PLUS be used for skin acne?  Yes. The ingredient adapalene is a form of vitamin A, which decreases swelling, inflammation and treats acne scars. Dapsone helps to fight against bacterial skin infections.  Can ACNEDAP PLUS cause peeling of skin?  Yes. The side effects of using ACNEDAP PLUS may include dryness of the skin, burning, itching, redness of the skin, skin irritation, scaling or peeling of the skin  Can ACNEDAP PLUS cause dryness of the skin?  Yes. ACNEDAP PLUS can cause dryness of your skin. Stay hydrated and apply the moisturizer recommended by your doctor.  Can I use moisturizer while using ACNEDAP PLUS?   Yes. Moisturizer recommended by your doctor can be used while using this medicine.  Can ACNEDAP PLUS be used in children?  ACNEDAP PLUS should be used with caution in children less than 12 years of age, Consult your doctor for advice.

name: ACNEGEL B Gel 15gm
about: INTRODUCTION  ACNE B is a combination of Clindamycin and Benzoyl peroxide which belongs to the group of medicines called Anti-acne preparations. It is used in the treatment of mild to moderate acne in adults and in adolescents (aged 12 years or older).  Acne is a common skin problem caused due to clogging off skin pores with dead skin cells or sebum (oil produced by the skin) with or without bacterial infection. It makes the skin inflamed with redness and pustules, along with small bumps on the skin which may be whiteheads or blackheads.  Clindamycin is a topical antibiotic and benzoyl peroxide is an antibacterial agent with sebum controlling properties. Both clindamycin and benzoyl peroxide acts by stopping the growth and multiplication of the acne-causing bacteria. Additionally, benzoyl peroxide can remove the accumulated dead skin cells and excess oil from the skin pores that triggers acne breakouts.  Use ACNE B as directed by the physician. It is for external use only. Avoid using ACNE B on inflamed, irritated, or sensitive skin areas. ACNE B may bleach your clothes, therefore avoid the contact of ACNE B with coloured fabrics.  Before using ACNE B inform your doctor if you have recently used any medicine that contains clindamycin or erythromycin. You must also inform your doctor if you have any problems in your gut (ulcerative colitis) or are pregnant or breastfeeding as a precaution.  ACNE B may cause skin redness and peeling in some individuals during the first few weeks of therapy. If you experience this, stop using ACNE B for a short period until your skin recovers. However, consult your doctor immediately if your skin irritation becomes severe and accompanied with skin redness, dryness, itching, stinging, or burning sensation.
uses: USES OF ACNE B Treats mild to moderate acne in adults and in adolescents (aged 12 years or older)
working: HOW ACNE B WORKS  ACNE B effectively controls acne breakouts both in adults and in adolescents. It contains clindamycin and benzoyl peroxide both which acts by preventing the growth and multiplication of acne-causing bacteria. Additionally, benzoyl peroxide opens the skin pores and removes the accumulated dead skin cells and excess oil that triggers acne breakouts. Over time, it can also reduce oil production in the skin.
directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Always use ACNE B as directed by your physician. It is for external use only. Wash the affected area of the skin with warm water before application. Pat it dry. Apply a thin layer of ACNE B on the affected area. Let the medicine completely dry on your skin before applying any make-up products or cosmetics.  Do not use any cosmetics or make-up products before applying ACNE B. Check the label of the medicine or consult your doctor regarding the quantity of the medicine that needs to be applied.  Contact your doctor if you experience any skin dryness or irritation after using ACNE B. Avoid contact of ACNE B with eyes, ears, nose, or mouth. Your doctor will decide the duration of therapy for you depending upon your disease condition.
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF ACNE B COMMON Skin redness, irritation, itching, burning or stinging sensation at the site of application Skin dryness, peeling of the skin, sensitivity to sunlight Headache UNCOMMON Sensation of numbness Worsening of acne RARE  Stop using ACNE B and contact your doctor immediately if you experience any of the following side effects:  Signs of allergic reactions (such as swelling of your face, eyes, lips, tongue, or throat, trouble breathing, nettle rash, severe dizziness, collapse) Severe or prolonged diarrhea with stomach cramps Severe itching, or burning or peeling of the skin
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY  There are only limited data regarding the use of ACNE B in pregnant women. Therefore, consult your doctor before using ACNE B if you are pregnant or planning to become pregnant. Your doctor may prescribe you with ACNE B based on the risk and benefit ratio.  BREASTFEEDING  There are only limited data regarding the use of ACNE B in breastfeeding women. Therefore, consult your doctor before using.  ALLERGY  Do not use ACNE B if you are allergic to Clindamycin, Benzoyl peroxide or lincomycin.  OTHERS  Before using ACNE B inform your doctor if you:  Have any skin inflammation, irritation, or photosensitivity Have problems in the gut (such as regional enteritis, ulcerative colitis or stomach inflammation caused due to use of antibiotics) Have recently used any medicine that contains clindamycin or erythromycin in it Have an upcoming surgery  Use in pediatrics:  ACNE B should be used in children and in adolescents (aged 12 years or older) only if prescribed by the physician. It is not recommended for use in children aged below12 years due to lack of safety data. Therefore, consult your doctor before using it.  Use in geriatrics:  ACNE B should be used with caution in elderly patients. Therefore, consult your doctor before using it.
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug-Drug Interaction:  Before using ACNE B inform your doctor if you are taking any of the following:  Other medicines used for acne (such as tretinoin, isotretinoin or tazarotene) Erythromycin, sulfacetamide (medicines used to treat bacterial infections) Dapsone (a medicine used to treat leprosy) General anesthetics (used for relaxing skeletal muscles before surgery) Ex. pancuronium, vercuronium Medicated or abrasive soaps and cleansers Products contain large amounts of alcohol or astringents (Ex. skin cleansers or toners)  Overdosage:  Excessive application of ACNE B may cause skin irritation and dryness. If this happened, rinse it off with warm water. If irritation persists, stop using ACNE B for a few days or until irritation subsides or consult your doctor if necessary.
synopsis: SYNOPSIS Drug	:  	  Clindamycin, Benzoyl peroxide   Pharmacological Category	:  	  Lincomycin antibiotics, Antibacterial agents   Therapeutic Indication	:  	Acne Dosage Forms	:  	  Gel, Cream, Gel (Topical)
moreInfo: MORE INFORMATION Keep ACNE B out of reach of children Store ACNE B in a cool, dry place or in a refrigerator (2-8?) depending upon the instructions mentioned in the label Avoid contact of ACNE B with eyes, ears, nose, or mouth. If contact happens accidentally, rinse it off with warm water Avoid contact of ACNE B with coloured fabrics, including clothing, towels, bed linen, furniture or carpeting as it may bleach them
faqs: FAQs ABOUT ACNE B  How long does it take for ACNE B to show the results?  It may take up to 2-3 weeks for ACNE B to improve your acne. However, this period may vary from patient-to-patient depending upon the severity of acne. Therefore, regularly use ACNE B for the stipulated duration mentioned by your doctor.  Will ACNE B be more effective if I overuse it?  Do not overuse ACNE B. Excessive application of ACNE B may cause skin irritation and dryness. Therefore, use ACNE B only directed by your physician.  What precautions do I need to follow while using ACNE B?  Use ACNE B as directed by the physician. Avoid using ACNE B on inflamed, irritated, or sensitive skin areas. ACNE B may bleach your clothes, therefore avoid the contact of ACNE B with coloured fabrics. Before using ACNE B inform your doctor if you are pregnant or breastfeeding as a precaution. Contact your doctor if your skin condition worsens.  Can the use of ACNE B make my skin sensitive to sunlight?  Yes. ACNE B may make your skin more sensitive to sunlight. Therefore, use protective clothing while going outdoors. Do not exposure the affected part of the skin to the direct sunlight. Consult your doctor if you require any sunscreen to protect your skin while going outdoors. Consult your doctor if your skin condition worsens.  What are the common side effects of using ACNE B?  ACNE B may cause skin redness and peeling in some individuals during the first few weeks of therapy. If you experience this, stop using ACNE B for a short period until your skin recovers. However, consult your doctor immediately if your skin irritation becomes severe with redness, dryness, itching, stinging, or burning sensation.  Can ACNE B be used in children?  ACNE B is not recommended for use in children (aged below 12 years). It should be used in children and adolescents (aged 12 years or older) only if prescribed by the physician. Therefore, consult your doctor before using.  How does ACNE B works?  ACNE B acts by preventing the growth and multiplication of acne-causing bacteria. It can also open the skin pores and removes the accumulated dead skin cells and excess oil that triggers acne breakouts. Over time, it can also reduce oil production in the skin.  Can I use ACNE B to treat acne during pregnancy?  Currently, there are only limited data regarding the use of ACNE B in pregnant women. Therefore, consult your doctor before using ACNE B if you are pregnant or planning to become pregnant. Your doctor may prescribe you with ACNE B based on the risk and benefit ratio.

name: ACNEJOY Face Wash 100ml
about: INTRODUCTION  Acnejoy Face Wash is specially formulated to prevent acne breakouts by controlling oil excess oil and microbial build up. It gently exfoliates to unclog skin pores thereby rejuvenating and purifying the skin. It contains zinc PCA, salicylic acid, niacinamide, licorice extract and D-panthenol as active ingredients to prevent acne breakouts.  Niacinamide reduces hyperpigmentation spots and inflammation. D-panthenol enhances the hydration, elasticity and smoothness of the skin. By blocking tyrosinase activity or scattering melanin, licorice extract lightens the skin and reduces hyperpigmentation.  Salicylic acid reduces acne by exfoliating the skin and keep the pores clear. Also, it penetrates into your skin and works to dissolve the dead skin cells and helps to prevent future breakouts. Zinc PCA has excellent anti-bacterial properties and reduces excessive      secretion of sebum to prevent pore blockage. Also, it reduces irritation, relieves inflammation and prevents acne formation and helps to maintain skin’s normal metabolism.    Always use Acnejoy Face Wash as advised by the doctor. It is for external use only. Wet the face and take an adequate amount of face wash on to your palm and gently apply it on face and massage for 2 minutes. Rinse thoroughly with water and dab your face dry with a clean towel.

name: Acnelak Pimple Care Soap 75gm
about: INTRODUCTION  Acnelak Pimple Care Soap is an oil free, pimple care soap with anti-microbial properties which helps in reducing bacterial contamination. It contains aloe vera, tea tree oil, lemon oil, palmarosa oil, and triclosan as active ingredients that helps to cleanse skin and remove excess oil from pimple-prone skin as well as provide antimicrobial action and soothes the skin.  Aloe vera helps to keep the skin clear and hydrated. Tea tree oil reduces and kills bacteria thus it helps to reduce the amount and severity of pimples. Lemon oil helps to reduce inflammation and makes the skin clear.  Palmarosa oil has antioxidant, antimicrobial, and antibacterial properties, that help to eliminate blemishes, prevent aging, and soothen irritation. Triclosan is an antimicrobial agent that helps in disinfection, and prevention of growth and spread of bacteria, fungus and mildew.  Use Acnelak Pimple Care Soap exactly as advised by your doctor. It is for external use only. Consult your doctor if you experience any allergic reactions while taking it.
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF ACNELAK SOAP  Consult your doctor if you experience any unusual symptoms like allergic reactions while using Acnelak Pimple Care Soap.
moreInfo: MORE INFORMATION Keep Acnelak Pimple Care Soap out of reach of children Store away from heat and sunlight
faqs: FAQs ABOUT ACNELAK SOAP  Q: Is Acnelak Pimple Care Soap good for pimples?  A: Acnelak Pimple Care Soap is an oil free, pimple care soap with anti-microbial and aloe vera advantage that helps to reduce bacterial contamination and thus reduce pimples. Consult your doctor before using it.  Q: Does Acnelak Pimple Care Soap remove dark spots?  A: Acnelak Pimple Care Soap contains ingredients that may help lighten dark spots, however, consult your doctor for advice.  Q: How to use Acnelak Pimple Care Soap?  A: Use Acnelak Pimple Care Soap exactly as advised by your doctor. It is for external use only. Wet the skin with water. Apply the soap and make a thick lather. Gently massage it over the skin for 2 minutes. Rinse of with water and dry your face with a clean towel to get an oil free and clear skin. Wash 2-3 times in a day to get better results.  Q: What if Acnelak Pimple Care Soap accidentally gets in my eyes?  A: If Acnelak Pimple Care Soap accidentally gets in your eyes, rinse your eyes with large amounts of cool water. Consult your doctor if any discomfort occurs.  Q: Can Acnelak Pimple Care Soap be used on face?  A: Yes. Acnelak Pimple Care Soap helps to remove excess oil from the skin and gives you a clear oil free skin. Consult your doctor before using.

name: Acnelak Clz Cream 15gm
about: INTRODUCTION  ACNELAK CLZ CREAM is a combination of Clindamycin and Zinc acetate which belongs to a group of medicines known as Antibiotics and Minerals respectively. It is used to treat mild to moderate acne.  Acne is a long-term skin condition that occurs when hair follicles plug with oil and dead skin cells which may be triggered by bacteria. It is characterised by uninflamed blackheads to pus-filled pimples or large, red and tender bumps.  Before using ACNELAK CLZ CREAM inform your doctor if you have inflammatory bowel disease (Ex. colitis or Crohn’s disease). Consult your doctor for advice.  ACNELAK CLZ CREAM should be used with caution in pregnant and breastfeeding woman as it may excrete in breastmilk and may pass to the baby. Consult your doctor for advice.  ACNELAK CLZ CREAM is not recommended for use in children and adolescents below 12 years of age. Consult with your physician.  The common side effects are skin dryness, skin burning sensation, redness of skin, worsening of acne, itchiness, irritation around the eyes. Consult your doctor if any of the side effects worsens.
uses: USES OF ACNELAK CLZ CREAM Used to treat mild to moderate acne
working: HOW ACNELAK CLZ CREAM WORKS  ACNELAK CLZ CREAM works effectively where Clindamycin acts by inhibiting the protein synthesis which is necessary for the bacterial growth thereby it stops the growth of acne causing bacteria. Zinc acetate reduces the sebum production, inhibits the neutrophils and TNF production (substances responsible for inflammation), increases the tissue healing capacity and it also supress the bacterial growth.
directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Use ACNELAK CLZ CREAM as directed by your physician. It is for external use only. Wash as usual and pat dry the skin. A thin film of ACNELAK CLZ CREAM should be applied in affected area only.
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF ACNELAK CLZ CREAM COMMON Skin dryness Skin burning sensation Redness of skin Worsening of acne Itchiness Irritation around the eyes UNCOMMON Pain in skin Rashes with scaly appearance RARE  Stop applying ACNELAK CLZ CREAM and contact your doctor immediately if you experience any of the following side effects:  Diarrhoea with mucus and blood
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY  ACNELAK CLZ CREAM should be used with caution in pregnant woman or if you think you might be pregnant. Consult your doctor for advice.  BREASTFEEDING  ACNELAK CLZ CREAM should be used with caution in breastfeeding woman as it is excreted in breastmilk and may pass to the baby. Consult your doctor for advice.  ALLERGY  Do not use ACNELAK CLZ CREAM if you are allergic to Clindamycin and Zinc acetate or any other ingredients of this medicine.  OTHERS  Before using ACNELAK CLZ CREAM, inform your doctor if you:  Have inflammatory bowel disease (Ex. colitis or Crohn’s disease)  Use in Pediatrics:  ACNELAK CLZ CREAM is not recommended for use in children and adolescents below 12 years of age. Consult with your physician for advice.
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug - Drug interactions:  Before using ACNELAK CLZ CREAM, inform your doctor if you are taking any of the following medicine:  Erythromycin, metronidazole, gentamicin, neomycin (medicines used to treat infections)  Overdosage:  If you or anyone else accidentally applies too much of ACNELAK CLZ CREAM, consult your doctor immediately or visit the nearby hospital.
synopsis: SYNOPSIS Drug	:  	Clindamycin, Zinc acetate Pharmacological Category	:  	Lincomycin antibiotics, Minerals Therapeutic Indication	:  	Acne Dosage Forms	:  	Cream
moreInfo: MORE INFORMATION Keep ACNELAK CLZ CREAM out of reach of children Store at a temperature below 25°C
faqs: FAQs ABOUT ACNELAK CLZ CREAM  Q: What is ACNELAK CLZ CREAM used for?  A: ACNELAK CLZ CREAM is a combination of Clindamycin and Zinc acetate. It is used to treat mild to moderate acne characterised by uninflamed blackheads to pus-filled pimples or large, red and tender bumps.  Q: How to use ACNELAK CLZ CREAM?  A: Always use ACNELAK CLZ CREAM as directed by your physician. Wash as usual and pat dry the skin. A thin film of ACNELAK CLZ CREAM should be applied in affected area only. It is for external use only.  Q: Is ACNELAK CLZ CREAM safe in pregnant and breastfeeding women?  A: ACNELAK CLZ CREAM should be used with caution in pregnant and breastfeeding woman as it may excrete in breastmilk and may pass to the baby, consult your doctor for advice.  Q: Is ACNELAK CLZ CREAM safe for use in children?  A: ACNELAK CLZ CREAM is not recommended for use in children and adoelscents below 12 years of age. Consult your doctor for advice before taking ACNELAK CLZ CREAM.  Q: Does ACNELAK CLZ CREAM cause burning sensation?  A: Yes, it may cause burning sensation in some individuals. Try to avoid hot showers because it may cause skin irritation. Avoid frequent contact and rubbing over the affected area. Use sunscreen and protective clothing when outdoors. If this symptom does not get better, speak to a doctor.

name: ACNELEX Face Wash 100gm
about: INTRODUCTION  ACNELEX Face Wash is a daily use face wash helps to exfoliate, controls acne causing bacteria, brightens, and balances the skin tone. It is used to reduce blemishes, acne, spots, discolouration, and to improve skin complexion. ACNELEX Face Wash contains Potassium Azeloyl Diglycinate, Salicylic acid, Oatmeal, Mandelic acid, Niacinamide, Panthenol as active ingredients.  Potassium Azeloyl Diglycinate helps to prevent the occurrence of mild to moderate acne. Salicylic acid balances the skin tone by clearing the blackheads and whiteheads. Oatmeal helps to cleanse the skin. Mandelic acid provides an even skin exfoliation, brightens the skin, restores the healthy pH to the skin, and treats acne. Niacinamide prevents the appearance of new spots and help to balance the skin tone. Panthenol helps to improve skin health.  Always use ACNELEX Face Wash as advised by your doctor. It is for external use only. As a face wash, wet your face and neck with lukewarm water. Apply small quantity of ACNELEX Face Wash into face and gently massage to the skin. Rinse thoroughly. Avoid ACNELEX Face Wash in direct contact with your eyes. As a face mask, apply on full face and leave for 4-5 mins to dry. Gently massage and wash off. Use twice in a week to get better results.

name: ACNEMOIST NEW Cream 60gm
about: INTRODUCTION  Acnemoist New Cream is a skin cream used to manage dryness caused due to Acne medications. It contains Caprylic/Capric Triglyceride, Isononyl Isononanoate, Jojoba oil Glycereth-8 Esters, Sea Salt, Ethylhexylglycerin, Saccharide Isomerate, Cetyl Alcohol as  active ingredients which helps to lighten and hydrate the skin.  Caprylic/Capric Triglyceride, Isononyl Isononanoate, Ethylhexylglycerin, Saccharide Isomerate and Cetyl Alcohol is an emollient which is used to soften the skin by trapping moisture in your skin and forms a protective layer. Jojoba oil Glycereth-8 Esters and Sea Salt has soothing anti-inflammatory agents, healing properties, moisturizer, and antimicrobial, which keeps skin from looking oily and helps prevent acne caused by clogged pores.  Always apply Acnemoist New Cream as advised by your physician. For external use only. After cleansing your face with a mild facewash take adequate quantity of Acnemoist New Cream onto the palm and apply liberally all over the face and neck. For best results, use Acnemoist New Cream twice daily. Avoid contact with eyes.
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF ACNEMOIST NEW CREAM  Consult your doctor if you notice any unusual side effects while using Acnemoist New Cream.
moreInfo: MORE INFORMATION Keep Acnemoist New Cream out of the reach and sight of children. Store in a cool and dry place
faqs: FAQs ABOUT ACNEMOIST NEW CREAM  Q: What is Acnemoist New Cream?  A: Acnemoist New Cream is a dermatologically tested and is non comedogenic, used to manage dryness caused due to Acne medications, for Acne patients. It is specially designed to suit Acne skin as it is non oily, feather light & provides intense hydration which helps you complete the Anti Acne therapy.  Q: Where Acnemoist New Cream should not be used?  A: Acnemoist New Cream should be used with caution in patients with skin cuts or infection or sores.  Q: For how long shall I use Acnemoist New Cream to see effective results?  A: This cream is effective and safe for a long-term use. Further, ask for your doctor’s advice on how long it should be used depending on your condition.  Q: Does Acnemoist New Cream cause sunburn?  A: Acnemoist New Cream may increase your skin's sensitivity to the sun and particularly the possibility of sunburn. Use a sunscreen, wear protective clothing, and limit sun exposure while using this product. Consult your doctor, if you get sunburned or have skin blisters/redness.  Q: Does Acnemoist New Cream reduces Acne?  A: Acnemoist New Cream has soothing anti-inflammatory agents, healing properties, moisturizer, and antimicrobial, which keeps skin from looking oily and helps prevent acne caused by clogged pores.

name: ACNESCAR Gel 15gm
about: INTRODUCTION  ACNESCAR Gel is a medicated gel used to reduce old/new scars associated with acne. It contains aloe vera extract, dimethicone, olea europea leaf extract, allium cepa, and allantoin as active ingredients which helps to reinforce skin’s natural defence mechanism and wound healing capacity thus reducing old/new scars associated with acne.  Aloe vera extract is an antioxidant agent which helps to lighten acne scar, and aids in wound healing. Dimethicone helps to hydrate and moisturize the skin. Olea europea leaf extract is an anti-inflammatory, and antibacterial agent which prevents bacteria causing acne thus inhibiting scar formation.  Allium cepa is an anti-inflammatory agent which aids in reducing scar formation, and improves colour stiffness and irregularity of scar. Allantoin reduces skin redness caused by acne and aids in cell rejuvenation by lightening the scars.  Apply ACNESCAR Gel as advised by your physician. It is a for external use only. Apply generously and gently rub onto the scars 3 to 4 times a day or as directed by your physician. Avoid applying on open wounds.
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF ACNESCAR GEL  Consult your doctor if you notice any unusual side effects while applying ACNESCAR Gel.
moreInfo: MORE INFORMATION Keep ACNESCAR Gel out of reach of children. Store ACNESCAR Gel in a cool and dry place, protected away from sunlight. Avoid freezing the gel.
faqs: FAQs ABOUT ACNESCAR GEL  Q. What is ACNESCAR Gel and why it is used?  A. ACNESCAR Gel is a medicated gel used to reduce old/new scars associated with acne. It contains aloe vera extract, dimethicone, olea europea leaf extract, allium cepa, and allantoin as active ingredients which helps to reinforce skin’s natural defence mechanism and wound healing capacity thus reducing old/new scars associated with acne.  Q. How to use ACNESCAR Gel?  A. Apply ACNESCAR Gel as advised by your physician. It is a for external use only. Apply generously and gently rub onto the scars 3 to 4 times a day or as directed by your physician. Avoid applying on open wounds.  Q. Is ACNESCAR GEL safe for all skin types?  A. Yes, ACNESCAR GEL is safe for all skin types as is a light, non-greasy, allergen fragrance free gel which is dermatologically tested and clinically proven to be applied for all skin types.  Q. How long can I use ACNESCAR Gel?  A. Apply ACNESCAR Gel as advised by your physician. Acne Scar gel should be used for a period of 8 - 10 weeks on new scars and for 3 - 6 months on existing scars. Consult your doctor if your symptoms persist.  Q. What are the common side effects of ACNESCAR Gel?  A. ACNESCAR Gel is unlikely to cause any side effects, however, consult your doctor if you notice any unusual side effects after using the solution.

name: Acnesol 1% Solution 25ml
about: INTRODUCTION  ACNESOL 1% SOLUTION contains Clindamycin, which belongs to the group of medicines called Antibiotics. It is used in the treatment of acne vulgaris. Acne vulgaris is a common skin condition that occurs when hair follicles get blocked with oil and dead skin cells. Symptoms include whiteheads, blackheads, small red, tender bumps, pimples, and pus-filled lumps on the skin.  Before applying ACNESOL 1% SOLUTION, inform your doctor if you have or ever had diarrhea, bloody diarrhea and pseudomembranous colitis. ACNESOL 1% SOLUTION is not recommended for use if you have a history of regional enteritis (inflammation of the small intestine), ulcerative colitis (inflammation of the large intestine) or antibiotic-associated colitis.  ACNESOL 1% SOLUTION should be used with caution during pregnancy or by breastfeeding women only if clearly needed. The safety and effectiveness of ACNESOL 1% SOLUTION in children under the age of 12 has not been established. The most common side effects of applying ACNESOL 1% SOLUTION are burning, itching, and redness of the skin. Consult your doctor if symptoms worsen.
uses: USES OF ACNESOL 1% SOLUTION Treats acne vulgaris
working: HOW ACNESOL 1% SOLUTION WORKS  ACNESOL 1% SOLUTION acts against the bacteria by binding to the 50S subunit of the bacterial ribosome (site of protein synthesis), which in turn prevents protein synthesis and kills the infection-causing bacteria.
directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Apply ACNESOL 1% SOLUTION as advised by your physician. It is for external use only. Wash your hands before use. Wash and dry the whole area, apply a thin film once daily to the skin where acne lesions appear and use enough to cover the entire affected area. In case of contact with the eyes, mouth or nostrils, rinse it off immediately and thoroughly with water. Your doctor will decide the correct dose and duration for you depending on your age, body weight and disease condition.
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF ACNESOL 1% SOLUTION COMMON Burning, itching or abnormal redness of the skin at the application site Scaling, pain, dryness and skin irritation at the application site UNCOMMON Abdominal pain Diarrhea Oily skin RARE Antibiotic-associated colitis  Stop applying ACNESOL 1% SOLUTION and contact your doctor immediately if you experience any of the following side effects:  Allergic symptoms (e.g., rashes, itchiness, difficulty in breathing or eye swelling) Severe or bloody diarrhea. (a sign of bowel inflammation, pseudomembranous colitis)
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY  The safety and effectiveness of ACNESOL 1% SOLUTION in pregnant women or women planning to have a baby have not been established yet. It will be given to you by the doctor only if clearly needed. Consult your doctor before applying ACNESOL 1% SOLUTION.  BREASTFEEDING  ACNESOL 1% SOLUTION should be used with caution in breastfeeding women as it is not known if the medicine is excreted in human milk. Your doctor will decide whether to discontinue nursing or the medicine, considering the benefits to the mother and baby. If it is applied to the chest, care should be taken to avoid accidental ingestion by the infant. Consult your doctor before applying ACNESOL 1% SOLUTION.  ALLERGY  Do not apply ACNESOL 1% SOLUTION if you are allergic to Clindamycin or any other ingredients of this medicine.  OTHERS  ACNESOL 1% SOLUTION is not recommended for use if you:  Have regional enteritis (inflammation of the small intestine) or ulcerative colitis (inflammation of the large intestine) Have a history of antibiotic-associated colitis  Before applying ACNESOL 1% SOLUTION inform your doctor if you:  Diarrhea, bloody diarrhea Pseudomembranous colitis (inflammation of colon) Atopic individuals (more prone to allergies)  Use in pediatrics:  Safety and effectiveness of ACNESOL 1% SOLUTION in children under the age of 12 have not been established. Consult your doctor before applying ACNESOL 1% SOLUTION.
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug-Drug interactions:  Before applying ACNESOL 1% SOLUTION, inform your doctor if you are taking any of the following medicine:  Neuromuscular blocking agents (Ex. rocuronium, vecuronium) Other anti-acne, topical agents  Overdosage:  If you or anyone else accidentally applied too much of ACNESOL 1% SOLUTION, consult your doctor immediately or visit the nearby hospital.

name: Acnesol A Nano Gel 15gm
about: INTRODUCTION  ACNESOL A NANO GEL contains a combination of Adapalene and Clindamycin, which belongs to the group of medicines called topical retinoids and lincomycin antibiotics. It is used in the treatment of skin acne (pimple). Acne is a condition of the skin when the root of your hair (hair follicle) or skin pores gets clogged by oil or dead skin, which becomes prone to bacterial infection and the formation of pimples, blackheads, spots and scars.  Adapalene is a form of vitamin A, that acts as an antiacne agent by binding directly to the receptor of the skin which increases the rate of cell turnover (cell regeneration) and decreases oil secretion preventing clogging of the hair follicles and pores, also decreasing swelling/inflammation. Clindamycin works by binding to the ribosomal unit of the bacteria and disrupts the production of the protein essential for its survival. Before recommending ACNESOL A NANO GEL, your doctor may advise you to have tests to understand your existing condition for planning effective treatment methods. Stay well hydrated and protect your skin from exposure to sunlight or UV light.  Do not apply ACNESOL A NANO GEL if you are allergic to adapalene or clindamycin, a disorder of the digestive system (colitis), a disorder of the immune system or have bruises, cuts or burns on the skin. The common side effects of using this medicine may include dry skin, burning, itching, redness or irritative sensation of the skin, scaling peeling of the skin etc.
uses: USES OF ACNESOL A NANO GEL To treat acne
working: HOW ACNESOL A NANO GEL WORKS  Adapalene, a form of vitamin A, works as an antiacne medicine by attaching directly to the skin's receptor, which increases cell turnover (cell regeneration) and decreases oil secretion preventing blockage of the hair follicles and pores. It also reduces swelling/inflammation of the skin. Clindamycin works by attaching to the bacteria's ribosomal unit and disrupting the production of a protein required for its very own survival.
directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Apply ACNESOL A NANO GEL as advised by your doctor. It is for external use on the skin only. Avoid applying ACNESOL A NANO GEL around or onto your eyes, including eyelids.
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF ACNESOL A NANO GEL COMMON Dryness of the skin Burning, itching, redness of the skin Scaling and or peeling of the skin UNCOMMON Flaring of acne Sunburns Local skin reaction  Stop using this medicine and contact your doctor immediately if you experience any of the following side effects:  Severe allergic reactions (such as skin rash, itching, swelling of the face, lips, tongue and other parts of the body, difficulty in breathing or wheezing, blisters on the skin, sore throat, fever, headache etc.)
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY  ACNESOL A NANO GEL is not recommended for use in pregnant women. Consult your doctor for advice if you are pregnant or suspect/planning pregnancy.  BREASTFEEDING  ACNESOL A NANO GEL is to be used with caution in breastfeeding mothers after consulting your doctor. The safe use of ACNESOL A NANO GEL in breastfeeding women and breastfed baby is not established.  DRIVING AND USING MACHINES  ACNESOL A NANO GEL may not interfere with your ability to drive or use the machine. However, protect your skin from sun or UV light while travelling and follow appropriate protective measures recommended by your doctor.  ALCOHOL  The risks associated with consuming alcohol are not known. It’s advised to avoid the consumption of alcohol while using ACNESOL A NANO GEL, as it could aggravate your existing condition.  ALLERGY  Talk to your doctor if you are allergic to Adapalene and/or Clindamycin.  OTHERS  ACNESOL A NANO GEL is not recommended for use if you:  Cuts or bruises on the skin Sunburns Skin conditions like eczema (itching, dry and red skin)  Use in pediatrics:  ACNESOL A NANO GEL is not recommended for use in children less than 12 years of age. Consult your doctor for advice.  Use in geriatrics:  ACNESOL A NANO GEL should be used with caution in the elderly (above 65 years of age) after consulting your doctor for advice.
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug-Drug interactions:  Inform your physician, if you are taking or using,  Medicated soap for skin, other cosmetic products with a high concentration of alcohol, astringents, sulfur,  Resorcinol – use for itching or irritation of the skin and scalp, loss of hair, dandruff etc. Salicylic acid – used for skin acne, dandruff, etc. Atracurium, cisatracurium, succinylcholine – used to relax muscles  B. Drug-Food interaction:  The interaction of foods with ACNESOL A NANO GEL is not known. Consult your doctor for diet advice.  Overdosage:  In case of using ACNESOL A NANO GEL in excess than recommended, you may experience dryness, scaling, redness and discomfort of the skin. Contact your doctor immediately for advice.
synopsis: SYNOPSIS Drug	:  	Adapalene, Clindamycin Pharmacological Category	:  	Topical retinoids and Antibiotics Therapeutic Indication	:  	Treat acne Dosage Forms	:  	Gel (topical), Gel, Cream, Ointment
moreInfo: MORE INFORMATION Keep out of reach from children Store at room temperature Keep away from sunlight
faqs: FAQs ABOUT ACNESOL A NANO GEL  Can ACNESOL A NANO GEL be used to treat scars on the skin?  Yes. Adapalene is a kind of vitamin A that reduces swelling and inflammation while also treating acne scars. Azithromycin is used to treat infections that cause skin infections to worsen.  Can ACNESOL A NANO GEL result in skin peeling?  Yes. Dryness of the skin, burning, itching, redness of the skin, skin irritation, scaling, and possibly peeling of the skin are all possible side effects of using this medicine.  Can [GBBNKEYWORD] cause skin dryness?  Yes. Your skin may get dry as a result of taking this medication. Maintain hydration and use the moisturiser that your doctor has prescribed.  How long can I use ACNESOL A NANO GEL?  Use ACNESOL A NANO GEL as advised by your doctor. Generally, it’s recommended for use depending on the severity of the existing skin condition.  Can I stop using ACNESOL A NANO GEL on my own?  No. It is not recommended to stop using ACNESOL A NANO GEL on your own as it may worsen the existing skin condition. Consult your doctor for advice.

name: Acnesol NC Gel 20gm
about: INTRODUCTION  ACNESOL NC GEL is a combination of Clindamycin and Nicotinamide which belongs to a group of medicines called Lincomycin antibiotics and Vitamin B3 complex, respectively. ACNESOL NC GEL is used to treat mild to moderate acne which is a skin condition that occurs when hair follicles become plugged with oil and dead skin cells which may occur due to variety of causes such as genetics, fluctuating hormone levels, stress, high humidity or using oily or greasy personal care products which may affect people of all ages.  It is characterized by symptoms such as open or closed plugged pores, small red & tender bumps, pimples, large, solid or painful lumps under the skin and painful & pus-filled lumps under the skin.  Before using ACNESOL NC GEL inform your doctor if you have liver, kidney, lung or heart diseases. Avoid applying ACNESOL NC GEL to a cut, scrapped, sunburnt or eczema affected skin.  ACNESOL NC GEL should be used with caution in pregnant and in breastfeeding women. ACNESOL NC GEL is not recommended for use in children and adolescents (below 12 years). Consult your doctor before applying.  The most common side effects of using ACNESOL NC GEL are skin inflammation, contact dermatitis (red, itchy rash), inflammation of hair follicles, itchy skin, dry skin and peeling of skin. Consult your doctor if any of these symptoms worsen.
uses: USES OF ACNESOL NC GEL Treats mild to moderate acne
working: HOW ACNESOL NC GEL WORKS  ACNESOL NC GEL helps to treat acne, where Clindamycin reduces free fatty acid concentrations on the skin and suppresses the growth of Propionibacterium acnes (Corynebacterium acnes), a bacteria found in sebaceous glands and follicles and Nicotinamide exerts anti-inflammatory effect in acne and interrupts sebum production.
directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Apply ACNESOL NC GEL as advised by your physician. It is for external use only. Before applying the medicine normally wash and dry the affected area and apply a thin layer of this medicine on the affected area. Treated areas on the face need not be covered with a plaster or bandage. Do not apply this medicine beyond the recommended duration. Avoid applying ACNESOL NC GEL around your eyes, including eyelids. Rinse it off with water if you accidentally get it in these areas.
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF ACNESOL NC GEL COMMON Contact dermatitis (red, itchy rash) Inflammation of hair follicles Itchy skin Dry skin Peeling of skin
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY  ACNESOL NC GEL should be used with caution in pregnant women. Consult your doctor before applying.  BREASTFEEDING  ACNESOL NC GEL should be used with caution in breastfeeding women. Consult your doctor before applying.  ALLERGY  ACNESOL NC GEL is not recommended for use if you are allergic to Clindamycin, Nicotinamide or any other ingredients of this medicine.  OTHERS  ACNESOL NC GEL is not recommended for use if you have:  Eczema (skin inflammation) Cut, scrapped, sunburnt skin  Use in Pediatrics:  ACNESOL NC GEL is not recommended for use in children and adolescents (below 12 years). Consult your doctor before using it for your child.  Use in Geriatrics:  There is no information on the use of ACNESOL NC GEL in elderly patients. Consult with your doctor before using.
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug - Drug interactions:  Before using ACNESOL NC GEL, inform your doctor if you are taking any of the following medicines:  Acepromazine (used a sedative/tranquilizer) Acetaminophen (used to treat pain and inflammation)  Overdosage:  If you or anyone else accidentally ingests or applies too much of ACNESOL NC GEL, consult your doctor immediately or visit the nearby hospital.
synopsis: SYNOPSIS Drug	:  	Clindamycin, Nicotinamide Pharmacological Category	:  	Lincomycin antibiotics, Vitamin B3 complex Therapeutic Indication	:  	Mild to moderate acne Dosage Forms	:  	Gel, Cream, Ointment
moreInfo: MORE INFORMATION Keep ACNESOL NC GEL out of reach of children Store ACNESOL NC GEL at a temperature below 25°C
faqs: FAQs ABOUT ACNESOL NC GEL  What special precautions should I follow while using ACNESOL NC GEL?  Before using ACNESOL NC GEL inform your doctor if you have liver, kidney, lung or heart diseases. Avoid applying ACNESOL NC GEL to a cut, scrapped, sunburnt or eczema affected skin. This medicine is not for oral, ophthalmic or intravaginal use.  What is ACNESOL NC GEL used for?  ACNESOL NC GEL is indicated for the treatment of mild to moderate acne in patients above 12 years of age. Do not use it for any other condition other than that prescribed by your doctor.  How should I use ACNESOL NC GEL?  Always apply ACNESOL NC GEL, as directed by your physician. It is for external use only. On the affected area, apply a thin layer of this medicine. Treated areas on the face need not be covered with a plaster or bandage. Do not apply this medicine on your face beyond 5 days. Avoid applying ACNESOL NC GEL around your eyes, including eyelids.  Is ACNESOL NC GEL safe to use in pregnant and breastfeeding women?  ACNESOL NC GEL should be used with caution during pregnancy, women planning for pregnancy and in breastfeeding women. Consult your doctor before applying.  Can ACNESOL NC GEL cause skin irritation or itchy skin?  ACNESOL NC GEL may cause skin irritation or itchy skin. Avoid hot bath because hot water can irritate your skin further. Do not scratch the affected area. Use protective clothing when going outdoors. Regularly moisturize your skin and apply calamine lotion as a coolant. Discuss with your doctor if the symptom worsens.

name: ACNESTAL 5.5 Syndet Bar 75gm
about: INTRODUCTION  ACNESTAL 5.5 Syndet Bar is gentle cleansing bar helps to manage acne prone oily skin . It contains Benzoyl peroxide, Zinc pyrolidone, Carboxylic acid, Allantoin as active ingredients helps to protect the dry skin.  Carboxylic acid, Benzoyl peroxide helps in managing acne and dry skin. Zinc pyrolidone works as antimicrobial agent. Allantoin used to relieve irritation and helps in dry skin.  Use ACNESTAL 5.5 Syndet Bar as advised by your doctor. It is for external use only. Discontinue the use if skin irritation occurs. It is a pH balance acne care.

name: Acnestal Soap 75gm
about: INTRODUCTION  Acnestal Soap is an acne care soap that is used to prevent and treat acne and oiliness on the face. It contains tea tree oil, aloe vera and allantoin as active ingredients that helps enhance the skin health.  Tea tree oil and allantoin helps prevent and clear acne as well as to remove black heads. Aloe vera helps keep the skin soft and supple.  Use Acnestal Soap as advised by your physician. It is for external use only. While cleansing the face and shoulder, keep the soap for a minute and then wash liberally with water 2-3 times a day, and then dry gently. Ask your doctor before using it for your child.

name: ACNETOIN I 20mg Capsule 10's
about: INTRODUCTION  ACNETOIN I 20MG CAPSULE contains Isotretinoin which belongs to the group of medicines called Retinoids. It is used in adults and children (older than 12 years of age) to treat severe form of acne (such as nodular acne, conglobate acne, and acne that is at risk of permanent scarring), which has not improved after other anti-acne treatments. Acne is an inflammatory skin condition which is characterized by spots, oily skin, nodular lesions etc. on face, back, and chest, which can be painful.  During treatment with ACNETOIN I 20MG CAPSULE your doctor might conduct certain blood tests and pregnancy tests, and you will be supervised by a skin doctor. You will be advised to reduce intensive exercise and physical activity. Before you go out in the sun, use a sunscreen with a high protection factor (SPF 15 or higher).  Avoid too much sun and using a sun-lamp or sun-bed. Avoid consuming alcohol while taking ACNETOIN I 20MG CAPSULE as it may cause side effects. Do not donate blood while consuming ACNETOIN I 20MG CAPSULE and after stopping ACNETOIN I 20MG CAPSULE at least for one month or undergo cosmetic procedures while taking ACNETOIN I 20MG CAPSULE or at least for 6 months after stopping it.  ACNETOIN I 20MG CAPSULE is not recommended for use in patients having liver or kidney disease, hyperlipidaemia (high blood lipid levels), high levels of Vitamin A. ACNETOIN I 20MG CAPSULE should be used with caution in patients who have or had mental illness or family history of mental illness, asthma, diabetes, heart or bone problems like osteoporosis, or eating disorder.  ACNETOIN I 20MG CAPSULE is not recommended for use in pregnant women, women planning a pregnancy, breast feeding women, and in children (below 12 years of age) so, consult your doctor for advice. ACNETOIN I 20MG CAPSULE should be used with caution in elderly patients (65 years and older).  ACNETOIN I 20MG CAPSULE may cause depression, psychosis, suicidal thoughts, or thoughts of self-harm in some patients. Consult your doctor if you experience any such behaviour or thoughts.  Most common side effects of taking ACNETOIN I 20MG CAPSULE are dry skin of face and lips, joint or muscle pain, headache, easy bruising or bleeding, weakness, etc. Consult your doctor if any of the symptoms deteriorate.
uses: USES OF ACNETOIN I 20MG CAPSULE Used in adults and children (older than 12 years of age) to treat severe form of acne which has not improved after other anti-acne treatments
working: HOW ACNETOIN I 20MG CAPSULE WORKS  ACNETOIN I 20MG CAPSULE helps in treating acne by inhibiting the function of sebaceous glands (oil glands in skin) thus, reducing the secretion of oil (sebum) in the skin. ACNETOIN I 20MG CAPSULE also inhibits keratinization (development of a horn-like character by the epithelial tissue), which might be a cause of acne.
directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Take ACNETOIN I 20MG CAPSULE as advised by your physician. Do not crush or chew it. Swallow ACNETOIN I 20MG CAPSULE as whole with a glass of water or a mouthful of food. Take it on a full stomach. Your doctor will decide the right dose and duration of therapy for you according to your age, body weight and disease condition.
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF ACNETOIN I 20MG CAPSULE COMMON Dry skin, especially of the lips and face, inflamed skin, chapped and inflamed lips, rash, mild itching, slight peeling More fragile and red skin than usual, especially of the face Back, muscle or joint pain (particularly in children and teenagers) Inflammation of the eye and eyelid area, dry and irritated eyes Raised liver enzymes Changed blood fat and cholesterol levels Easy bruising, bleeding or clotting Anaemia (weakness, dizziness, pale skin) Headache Protein or blood in the urine Becoming more prone to get infections Dry and crusted inside of the nose causing mild nosebleeds Sore or inflamed throat and nose RARE Hair loss  Stop taking ACNETOIN I 20MG CAPSULE and consult your doctor immediately in case you experience any of the following:  Persistent pain in your lower back or buttocks (signs of sacroiliitis) Severe skin reactions (Ex. erythema multiforme, Stevens-Johnson Syndrome, toxic epidermal necrolysis) (blistering and peeling of skin, severe rashes, fever, multiple lesions especially in mouth, nose, eyes and genitals, conjunctivitis, flu-like symptoms) Depression or related disorders (sad or altered mood, anxiety, emotional discomfort), worsening depression, becoming violent or aggressive Thoughts or feelings about hurting self or ending own lives, suicide attempts or suicide Unusual behaviour Psychosis (loss of contact with reality, like hearing voices or seeing things that are not real) Serious reactions (trouble breathing or swallowing due to sudden swelling of the throat, face, lips and mouth, sudden swelling of the hands, feet and ankles, hives, bruises, eczema, bruising, red patches on hands and legs) Sudden tight chest, breathlessness and wheezing, particularly if you have asthma Rhabdomyolysis (muscle weakness along with trouble moving arms or legs, painful, swollen, bruised areas of the body, dark urine, reduced or no urination, confusion or dehydration) Hepatitis (yellow skin or eyes, tiredness) Kidney inflammation (difficulty urinating, swollen and puffy eyelids, excessive tiredness) Increased intracranial pressure (continuous headache, along with nausea, vomiting and eyesight changes including blurred vision) Serious gut conditions (severe tummy pain, with or without severe bloody diarrhoea, nausea, vomiting) Vision problems like night vision problems, persistent dryness of eyes, intolerance to contact lenses Inflamed pancreas Hearing problems, ringing sound in ears Severe muscle weakness, muscle, joint, back pain, difficulty moving especially after exercise
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY  ACNETOIN I 20MG CAPSULE is not recommended for use in pregnant women and women planning a pregnancy. Inform your doctor if you become pregnant during treatment with ACNETOIN I 20MG CAPSULE. It is not recommended to get pregnant for one month after stopping ACNETOIN I 20MG CAPSULE treatment because some medicine may still be left in your body. Consult your doctor before taking it.  Contraception must be used for a month before taking ACNETOIN I 20MG CAPSULE, during treatment and for a month afterwards. Discuss with your doctor regarding suitable contraceptive methods.  BREASTFEEDING  ACNETOIN I 20MG CAPSULE is not recommended for use in breast feeding women as it may pass through breast milk. Consult your doctor before taking it.  DRIVING AND USING MACHINES  Do not drive or operate machinery if you experience dizziness, drowsiness or decreased night vision after taking ACNETOIN I 20MG CAPSULE.  ALCOHOL  Avoid consuming alcohol while taking ACNETOIN I 20MG CAPSULE as it may increase side effects. Inform your doctor if you are an alcoholic.  KIDNEY  ACNETOIN I 20MG CAPSULE should be used with caution in patients with kidney problems. Consult your doctor before taking it.  LIVER  ACNETOIN I 20MG CAPSULE is not recommended for use in patients with liver disease. Consult your doctor before taking it.  ALLERGY  Do not take ACNETOIN I 20MG CAPSULE if you are allergic to Isotretinoin, soya, peanuts or any of the other ingredients of this medicine.  LUNGS  ACNETOIN I 20MG CAPSULE should be used with caution in patients having asthma. Consult your doctor before taking it.  OTHERS  ACNETOIN I 20MG CAPSULE is not recommended for use if you have:  High blood fat levels High levels of Vitamin A  Before taking ACNETOIN I 20MG CAPSULE inform your doctor if you:  Have or had mental illness or family history of mental illness such as depression, mood disorders, psychosis, aggressive behaviour, or hurting or killing self Have diabetes Are fructose intolerant Are overweight  Use in paediatrics:  ACNETOIN I 20MG CAPSULE is not recommended for use in children below 12 years of age. ACNETOIN I 20MG CAPSULE can be used in adolescents (more than 12 years of age) only after puberty. Consult your child’s doctor for advice.  Use in geriatrics:  There is no proper information about the use of ACNETOIN I 20MG CAPSULE in elderly patients. Consult your doctor before taking it.
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug-Drug interactions:  Before taking ACNETOIN I 20MG CAPSULE, inform your doctor if you are taking any of the following medicines:  Vitamin A supplements Medicines used to treat bacterial infections (Ex. minocycline, doxycycline) Phenytoin (used to treat fits) Medicines used to treat various inflammatory conditions (Ex. betamethasone, prednisolone, dexamethasone) Medicines used to prevent pregnancy (Ex. Norethindrone, ethinyl Oestradiol) St. John’s wort (herbal medicine used to treat mental disorders) Other medicines used to treat acne like keratolytic or exfoliative agents (Ex. salicylic acid, benzoyl peroxide)  Overdosage:  In case you or anybody else accidently take too much of ACNETOIN I 20MG CAPSULE, consult your doctor immediately or visit the nearby hospital. Symptoms of ACNETOIN I 20MG CAPSULE overdose are severe headache, abdominal pain, nausea, dizziness, redness of face, vomiting, somnolence, irritability, and itching.
synopsis: SYNOPSIS Drug	:  	  Isotretinoin   Pharmacological Category	:  	  Retinoids    Therapeutic Indication	:  	  Severe Acne   Dosage Forms	:  	  Tablet, Soft gel Capsule, Capsule
moreInfo: MORE INFORMATION Keep ACNETOIN I 20MG CAPSULE out of reach of children Store ACNETOIN I 20MG CAPSULE between 15-30°C
faqs: FAQs ABOUT ACNETOIN I 20MG CAPSULE  Can ACNETOIN I 20MG CAPSULE cause irregular periods?  According to some studies, menstrual irregularity was observed during treatment follow-ups. Consult your doctor if you experience irregularity in your periods during treatment with ACNETOIN I 20MG CAPSULE.  Is ACNETOIN I 20MG CAPSULE safe to take in pregnancy?  No. ACNETOIN I 20MG CAPSULE is not recommended for use in pregnant women and women planning a pregnancy. Inform your doctor if you become pregnant during treatment with ACNETOIN I 20MG CAPSULE. It is not recommended to get pregnant for one month after stopping ACNETOIN I 20MG CAPSULE treatment because some medicine may still be left in your body. Consult your doctor before taking it. Contraception must be used for a month before taking ACNETOIN I 20MG CAPSULE, during treatment and for a month afterwards. Discuss with your doctor regarding suitable contraceptive methods.  Can I play sports during ACNETOIN I 20MG CAPSULE treatment?  Cut down on extreme exercise and physical activity as ACNETOIN I 20MG CAPSULE can cause muscle and joint pain especially in children and teenagers taking up vigorous physical activity. Consult your doctor if you can play sports during this treatment.  Can I go out in the sun during ACNETOIN I 20MG CAPSULE treatment?  Sensitivity to light may increase during treatment with ACNETOIN I 20MG CAPSULE so, avoid going too much into the sun and don’t use a sun-lamp or sun-bed. Before you go out in the sun, wear sunglasses and use sunscreen with a high protection factor (SPF 15 or higher).  Can undergo cosmetic procedures while taking ACNETOIN I 20MG CAPSULE?  No. Do not undergo cosmetic procedures such as skin waxing, dermabrasion, laser, or artificial UV light detanning while taking ACNETOIN I 20MG CAPSULE or at least for 6 months after stopping it as they could cause scarring, skin irritation, or changes in your skin colour. Consult your doctor before undergoing any cosmetic procedure while taking ACNETOIN I 20MG CAPSULE.
