name: Acnetor AD Gel 15gm
about: INTRODUCTION  ACNETOR AD contains a combination of Adapalene and Clindamycin, which belongs to the group of medicines called topical retinoids and lincomycin antibiotics. It is used in the treatment of skin acne (pimple). Acne is a condition of the skin when the root of your hair (hair follicle) or skin pores gets clogged by oil or dead skin, which becomes prone to bacterial infection and the formation of pimples, blackheads, spots and scars.  Adapalene is a form of vitamin A, that acts as an antiacne agent by binding directly to the receptor of the skin which increases the rate of cell turnover (cell regeneration) and decreases oil secretion preventing clogging of the hair follicles and pores, also decreasing swelling/inflammation. Clindamycin works by binding to the ribosomal unit of the bacteria and disrupts the production of the protein essential for its survival. Before recommending ACNETOR AD, your doctor may advise you to have tests to understand your existing condition for planning effective treatment methods. Stay well hydrated and protect your skin from exposure to sunlight or UV light.  Do not apply ACNETOR AD if you are allergic to adapalene or clindamycin, a disorder of the digestive system (colitis), a disorder of the immune system or have bruises, cuts or burns on the skin. The common side effects of using this medicine may include dry skin, burning, itching, redness or irritative sensation of the skin, scaling peeling of the skin etc.
uses: USES OF ACNETOR AD To treat acne
working: HOW ACNETOR AD WORKS  Adapalene, a form of vitamin A, works as an antiacne medicine by attaching directly to the skin's receptor, which increases cell turnover (cell regeneration) and decreases oil secretion preventing blockage of the hair follicles and pores. It also reduces swelling/inflammation of the skin. Clindamycin works by attaching to the bacteria's ribosomal unit and disrupting the production of a protein required for its very own survival.
directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Apply ACNETOR AD as advised by your doctor. It is for external use on the skin only. Avoid applying ACNETOR AD around or onto your eyes, including eyelids.
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF ACNETOR AD COMMON Dryness of the skin Burning, itching, redness of the skin Scaling and or peeling of the skin UNCOMMON Flaring of acne Sunburns Local skin reaction  Stop using this medicine and contact your doctor immediately if you experience any of the following side effects:  Severe allergic reactions (such as skin rash, itching, swelling of the face, lips, tongue and other parts of the body, difficulty in breathing or wheezing, blisters on the skin, sore throat, fever, headache etc.)
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY  ACNETOR AD is not recommended for use in pregnant women. Consult your doctor for advice if you are pregnant or suspect/planning pregnancy.  BREASTFEEDING  ACNETOR AD is to be used with caution in breastfeeding mothers after consulting your doctor. The safe use of ACNETOR AD in breastfeeding women and breastfed baby is not established.  DRIVING AND USING MACHINES  ACNETOR AD may not interfere with your ability to drive or use the machine. However, protect your skin from sun or UV light while travelling and follow appropriate protective measures recommended by your doctor.  ALCOHOL  The risks associated with consuming alcohol are not known. It’s advised to avoid the consumption of alcohol while using ACNETOR AD, as it could aggravate your existing condition.  ALLERGY  Talk to your doctor if you are allergic to Adapalene and/or Clindamycin.  OTHERS  ACNETOR AD is not recommended for use if you:  Cuts or bruises on the skin Sunburns Skin conditions like eczema (itching, dry and red skin)  Use in pediatrics:  ACNETOR AD is not recommended for use in children less than 12 years of age. Consult your doctor for advice.  Use in geriatrics:  ACNETOR AD should be used with caution in the elderly (above 65 years of age) after consulting your doctor for advice.
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug-Drug interactions:  Inform your physician, if you are taking or using,  Medicated soap for skin, other cosmetic products with a high concentration of alcohol, astringents, sulfur,  Resorcinol – use for itching or irritation of the skin and scalp, loss of hair, dandruff etc. Salicylic acid – used for skin acne, dandruff, etc. Atracurium, cisatracurium, succinylcholine – used to relax muscles  B. Drug-Food interaction:  The interaction of foods with ACNETOR AD is not known. Consult your doctor for diet advice.  Overdosage:  In case of using ACNETOR AD in excess than recommended, you may experience dryness, scaling, redness and discomfort of the skin. Contact your doctor immediately for advice.
synopsis: SYNOPSIS Drug	:  	Adapalene, Clindamycin Pharmacological Category	:  	Topical retinoids and Antibiotics Therapeutic Indication	:  	Treat acne Dosage Forms	:  	Gel (topical), Gel, Cream, Ointment
moreInfo: MORE INFORMATION Keep out of reach from children Store at room temperature Keep away from sunlight
faqs: FAQs ABOUT ACNETOR AD  Can ACNETOR AD be used to treat scars on the skin?  Yes. Adapalene is a kind of vitamin A that reduces swelling and inflammation while also treating acne scars. Azithromycin is used to treat infections that cause skin infections to worsen.  Can ACNETOR AD result in skin peeling?  Yes. Dryness of the skin, burning, itching, redness of the skin, skin irritation, scaling, and possibly peeling of the skin are all possible side effects of using this medicine.  Can [GBBNKEYWORD] cause skin dryness?  Yes. Your skin may get dry as a result of taking this medication. Maintain hydration and use the moisturiser that your doctor has prescribed.  How long can I use ACNETOR AD?  Use ACNETOR AD as advised by your doctor. Generally, it’s recommended for use depending on the severity of the existing skin condition.  Can I stop using ACNETOR AD on my own?  No. It is not recommended to stop using ACNETOR AD on your own as it may worsen the existing skin condition. Consult your doctor for advice.

name: Acnewar Gel 15gm
about: INTRODUCTION  ACNEWAR GEL contains Dapsone which belongs to the group of medicines called Sulfone antibiotics. It is used in the treatment of acne vulgaris (a skin condition that occurs when the hair follicles are blocked with dead skin cells, bacteria and sebum). The most common symptoms of acne vulgaris are pimples, redness, blackhead and white heads.  Before using ACNEWAR GEL, inform your doctor if you have glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase (G6PD) deficiency, methemoglobinemia (a type of blood disorder) and if you are using other products including cosmetics or medicines applied to the skin.  ACNEWAR GEL should be used during pregnancy and breast-feeding only if clearly advised by the doctor. Consult your doctor before using the medicine.  This medicine is not recommended for use in children (younger than 12 years of age). ACNEWAR GEL should be used with caution in elderly patients (aged 65 years and above). Consult your doctor before using the medicine.  The most common side effects associated with the use of ACNEWAR GEL are oiliness/ peeling, redness and dryness. Consult your doctor if any of the side effect worsens.
uses: USES OF ACNEWAR GEL Treats acne vulgaris
working: HOW ACNEWAR GEL WORKS  ACNEWAR GEL works as both anti-bacterial and anti-inflammatory agent in the treatment of acne vulgaris. As an antibacterial agent, it works by inhibiting the synthesis of folic acid which is necessary for the growth of bacteria. Thus, stops the multiplication of bacteria. As an anti-inflammatory agent, it decreases inflammation and heals the breakout.
directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Always apply ACNEWAR GEL as directed by your doctor. It is for topical use only. Apply a thin layer of this medicine to the areas of your skin that have acne. Avoid contact with eyes, mouth and mucous membranes. Rub the medicine gently and completely. Wash your hands after applying ACNEWAR GEL. Your doctor will decide the duration and frequency of this medicine depending upon severity of the condition.
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF ACNEWAR GEL COMMON Oiliness/peeling Redness Dryness UNCOMMON Application site dryness, redness, burning and itching Fever Common cold Sinusitis Pain or irritation in the throat Cough Joint sprain Headache RARE  Stop using ACNEWAR GEL consult your doctor immediately if you experience any of the following side effects:  Signs of methemoglobinemia (such as dizziness, breathlessness, slate grey or blueish coloring of the skin, especially in buccal mucous membranes, lips and nail beds)
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY  ACNEWAR GEL should be used during pregnancy only if considered clearly necessary. Consult your doctor before using the medicine.     BREASTFEEDING  ACNEWAR GEL should be used during breast-feeding only if considered clearly necessary. Consult your doctor before using ACNEWAR GEL.    ALLERGY  Do not use ACNEWAR GEL if you are allergic to dapsone or any other ingredients of this medicine.  OTHERS  ACNEWAR GEL is not recommended for use if you:  Have congenital or idiopathic methemoglobinemia  Before using ACNEWAR GEL inform your doctor if you:  Are using other products including cosmetics or medicines applied to the skin Have glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase (G6PD) deficiency Have history of slate grey or blueish discoloration of skin, mucous membranes, lips and nail beds due to lack of sufficient oxygen in the blood (methemoglobinemia)  Use in pediatrics:  ACNEWAR GEL can be used in children of age 12 to 17 years. This medicine is not recommended for use in children younger than 12 years of age. Consult your child’s doctor before using ACNEWAR GEL to your child.     Use in geriatrics:  ACNEWAR GEL should be used with caution in elderly patients (aged 65 years and above).  Consult your doctor before using ACNEWAR GEL.
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug-drug interactions:  Before using ACNEWAR GEL, inform your doctor, if you are taking any of the following medicines:  Trimethoprim/sulfamethoxazole, nitrofurantoin (used in the treatment and prevention of urinary tract) Topical benzoyl peroxide (used to treat acne) Sulphonamides such as sulfadiazine, sulfamethizole (used in the treatment of bacterial infections) Acetaminophen, acetanilide (used to relive pain) Nitroprusside, nitrates and nitrites such as glyceryl trinitrate (used to treat angina) Benzocaine (used to relieve pain) Oral dapsone (used to treat leprosy, dermatitis herpetiformis) Pamaquine, chloroquine, para-amino salicylic acid, quinine (used to treat and prevent malaria) Phenacetin (used to treat fever) Phenobarbital, phenytoin (used in the treatment of fits)  Over dosage:  ACNEWAR GEL is only for topical use, it is not for oral use. If oral ingestion occurs, consult your doctor or visit the nearby hospital immediately.
synopsis: SYNOPSIS Drug	:  	Dapsone Pharmacological Category	:  	Sulfone antibiotics Therapeutic Indication	:  	Acne vulgaris           Dosage Forms	:  	Tablet, Gel
moreInfo: MORE INFORMATION Keep the medicine away from children Store at room temperature (15-30°C)
faqs: FAQs ABOUT ACNEWAR GEL  What should I tell my doctor before using ACNEWAR GEL?  Before using ACNEWAR GEL inform your doctor if you are using other products including cosmetics or medicines applied to the skin, glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase (G6PD) deficiency, history of slate grey or blueish discoloration of skin, mucous membranes, lips and nail beds due to lack of sufficient oxygen in the blood (methemoglobinemia).  How should I use ACNEWAR GEL?  Use ACNEWAR GEL exactly as told by your doctor. ACNEWAR GEL is usually used on your affected skin twice a day, once in the morning and once in the evening. Wash the areas of your skin where you apply the medicine. Gently pat your skin dry with a clean towel. Apply a thin layer of this medicine to the areas of your skin that have acne. A pea sized amount ACNEWAR GEL will usually be enough. Rub the medicine gently and completely.  What are the most common side effects of ACNEWAR GEL?  The most common side effects of ACNEWAR GEL are skin dryness, redness and oiliness/peeling of the skin. Consult your doctor if you experience any of the symptoms get worse.  How does ACNEWAR GEL work?  ACNEWAR GEL works as both anti-bacterial and anti-inflammatory agent in the treatment of acne vulgaris. As an antibacterial agent, it works by inhibiting the synthesis of folic acid which is necessary for the growth of bacteria. Thus, stops the multiplication of bacteria. As an anti-inflammatory agent, it decreases inflammation and heals the breakout.      Can ACNEWAR GEL be used in pregnant and breast-feeding women?  ACNEWAR GEL should be used during pregnancy and breast-feeding only if advised by the doctor. Consult your doctor for advice before using the medicine if you are pregnant or breast-feeding mother.

name: Acnewar Plus Gel 15gm
about: INTRODUCTION  ACNEWAR PLUS contains a combination of Adapalene and Dapsone, which belongs to the group of medicines called topical retinoids and sulfonamide antibiotics. It is used in the treatment of skin acne. Acne is a condition of the skin when the root of your hair (hair follicle) or skin pores gets clogged by oil or dead skin, which becomes prone to bacterial infection resulting in pimples, blackheads and spots or scars.  Adapalene is a form of vitamin A (retinoid) that acts as an antiacne agent by binding directly to the receptors of the skin which increases the rate of cell regeneration and decreases oil secretion preventing clogging of the hair follicles and pores. It also reduces swelling and inflammation. Dapsone is an antibiotic with a structure similar to PABA (para-aminobenzoic acid) that kills bacteria by competitively substituting PABA, a nutrient that bacteria use to generate folic acid for growth and survival. Before recommending ACNEWAR PLUS, your doctor may advise you to have tests to understand your existing condition for planning effective treatment methods. Stay well hydrated and protect your skin from exposure to sunlight or UV light.  Do not apply ACNEWAR PLUS if you are allergic to adapalene or dapsone or have bruises, cuts or burns on the skin, It should be used with caution and inform your doctor if have any disorder of the digestive system (colitis), a disorder of the immune system, anemia or G6PD deficiency. The common side effects of using ACNEWAR PLUS may include dry skin, burning, itching, redness or irritative sensation of the skin and peeling of the skin.
uses: USES OF ACNEWAR PLUS Treats acne
working: HOW ACNEWAR PLUS WORKS  ACNEWAR PLUS is a combination of Adapalene (Retinoid) and Dapsone (Sulfonamide). Adapalene, a form of vitamin A, works as an antiacne agent by attaching directly to the skin's receptors, which increases cell regeneration and decreases oil secretion preventing blockage of the hair follicles and pores It also reduces swelling/inflammation of the skin. Dapsone is an antibiotic with a structure similar to PABA (para-aminobenzoic acid) that kills bacteria by competitively substituting PABA, a nutrient that bacteria use to generate folic acid for growth and survival.
directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Apply ACNEWAR PLUS as advised by your doctor. It is for external use on the skin. Avoid applying ACNEWAR PLUS around or onto your eyes, including eyelids.
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF ACNEWAR PLUS COMMON Dryness of the skin Burning, itching, redness of the skin Scaling and/or peeling of the skin UNCOMMON Flaring of acne Sunburns Local skin reaction Fever Headache  Stop using ACNEWAR PLUS and contact your doctor immediately if you experience any of the following side effects:  Severe allergic reactions (such as skin rash, itching, swelling of the face, lips, tongue and other parts of the body, difficulty in breathing or wheezing, blisters on the skin, sore throat, fever, headache etc.)
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY  ACNEWAR PLUS is not recommended for use in pregnant women. Consult your doctor for advice.  BREASTFEEDING  ACNEWAR PLUS is to be used with caution in breastfeeding mothers only if recommended by your doctor. Avoid applying ACNEWAR PLUS on the chest to avoid contact exposure to the baby while breastfeeding.  DRIVING AND USING MACHINES  ACNEWAR PLUS may not interfere with your ability to drive or use the machine. However, protect your skin from sun or UV light while travelling and follow appropriate protective measures recommended by your doctor.  ALLERGY  Talk to your doctor if you are allergic to Adapalene and/or Dapsone.  OTHERS  ACNEWAR PLUS is not recommended for use if you have:  Cuts or bruises on the skin Sunburns Skin conditions like eczema (itching, dry and red skin)  Use in pediatrics:  ACNEWAR PLUS should be used with caution in children less than 12 years of age.  Use in geriatrics:  ACNEWAR PLUS should be taken with caution in the elderly above 65 years of age. Consult your doctor for advice.
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug-Drug interactions:  Inform your physician, if you are taking or using,  Medicated soap for skin, other cosmetic products with a high concentration of alcohol, astringents, sulfur etc Resorcinol – use for itching or irritation of the skin and scalp, loss of hair, dandruff etc Salicylic acid – used for skin acne, dandruff, etc Trimethoprim-Sulfamethoxazole – used to treat bacterial infection Topical Benzoyl Peroxide – used to treat acne Paracetamol – used to relieve pain Phenytoin – used to prevent and control fits/seizures  B. Drug-Food interaction:  The interaction of foods with ACNEWAR PLUS is not known. Consult your doctor for diet advice.  Overdosage:  In case of using ACNEWAR PLUS in excess than recommended, you may experience dryness, scaling, redness and discomfort of the skin. Contact your doctor immediately if the symptoms are worsening or persists.

Dapsone helps to fight against bacterial skin infections.  Can ACNEWAR PLUS cause peeling of skin?  Yes. The side effects of using ACNEWAR PLUS may include dryness of the skin, burning, itching, redness of the skin, skin irritation, scaling or peeling of the skin  Can ACNEWAR PLUS cause dryness of the skin?  Yes. ACNEWAR PLUS can cause dryness of your skin. Stay hydrated and apply the moisturizer recommended by your doctor.  Can I use moisturizer while using ACNEWAR PLUS?   Yes. ACNEWAR PLUS should be used with caution in children less than 12 years of age, Consult your doctor for advice.

name: ACNEYCL AZ Spray 50ml
ingredients: Allantoin+Aloe barbadensis Leaf Extract+Aqua+Propylene Glycol+Salicylic Acid
about: INTRODUCTION  ACNEYCL AZ Spray is a gentle anti-acne spray that is used to get rid of acne breakouts. It unclogs clogged pores, removes blackheads and whiteheads and fights acne. It contains strong exfoliating agents like salicylic acid, azelaic acid and tea tree oil that gently exfoliates dead skin cells, unclogs clogged pores, removes excess oil, blackheads and white heads and makes your skin clear and fresh.  It also contains skin soothing and conditioning agents like aloe vera, chamomile extract, tocopherol acetate, panthenol, niacinamide and allantoin that soothes skin irritation, nourishes and hydrates your skin and makes it soft, smooth and supple.  Other ingredients like sodium ascorbate and niacinamide has skin lightening properties which helps in fading away acne scars and hyperpigmentation. The sodium shale oil sulphonate present in the spray contains antimicrobial properties which helps in fighting against the acne-causing bacteria.  The combination of sodium ascorbate, vitamin E and retinol protects your skin from damage caused due to external pollutants and prevents signs of aging like wrinkles, fine lines and age spots.  Spray ACNEYCL AZ Spray on the affected skin areas (including face and body). It is for external use only. For best results, use 1-3 times a day. If it causes excessive skin dryness, reduce the application as once per day. Avoid contact of this spray with eyes, ears, nose or mouth. In case of accidental contact, rinse it with water.

Drug-Food interaction:  The interaction of foods with ACNICIN GEL is not known. Consult your doctor for diet advice.  Overdosage:  In case of using ACNICIN GEL in excess than recommended, you may experience dryness, scaling, redness and discomfort of the skin. Contact your doctor immediately for advice.
synopsis: SYNOPSIS Drug	:  	Adapalene, Clindamycin Pharmacological Category	:  	Topical retinoids and Antibiotics Therapeutic Indication	:  	Treat acne Dosage Forms	:  	Gel (topical), Gel, Cream, Ointment
moreInfo: MORE INFORMATION Keep out of reach from children Store at room temperature Keep away from sunlight
faqs: FAQs ABOUT ACNICIN GEL  Can ACNICIN GEL be used to treat scars on the skin?  Yes. Adapalene is a kind of vitamin A that reduces swelling and inflammation while also treating acne scars. Azithromycin is used to treat infections that cause skin infections to worsen.  Can ACNICIN GEL result in skin peeling?  Yes. Dryness of the skin, burning, itching, redness of the skin, skin irritation, scaling, and possibly peeling of the skin are all possible side effects of using this medicine.  Can [GBBNKEYWORD] cause skin dryness?  Yes. Your skin may get dry as a result of taking this medication. Maintain hydration and use the moisturiser that your doctor has prescribed.  How long can I use ACNICIN GEL?  Use ACNICIN GEL as advised by your doctor. Generally, it’s recommended for use depending on the severity of the existing skin condition.  Can I stop using ACNICIN GEL on my own?  No. It is not recommended to stop using ACNICIN GEL on your own as it may worsen the existing skin condition. Consult your doctor for advice.

name: ACNILITE Body Wash 150ml
ingredients: Allantoin+D Panthenol+Green Tea Extract+Zinc Pyrrolidone Carboxylic Acid
about: INTRODUCTION  Acnilite Body Wash is a gentle, yet effective body wash designed to cleanse, exfoliate and soothen your skin and to protect skin from acne and acne breakouts. It contains zinc PCA, allantoin, D-panthenol and green tea extract as active ingredients that helps to express antibacterial properties that reduces excess sebum production to prevent acne breakage and to deeply cleanse acne prone skin on the back, chest, shoulder, groin areas and buttocks.  Zinc PCA has antibacterial properties and it help to reduce excess sebum secretion that prevents pore blockage and acne formation, provides skin hydration, soothens the skin and reduces body odour. Green tea extract helps to reduce inflammations in skin and to minimise sebum production.  Allantoin reduces skin inflammation, increases skin smoothness and enhances natural regeneration of skin. D-panthenol decreases skin irritation, improves skin softness and smoothness by its hydrating and moisturizing properties.  Always use Acnilite Body Wash as advised by your doctor. It is for external use only. Wet your body and take sufficient amount of Acnilite Body Wash and apply on the desired area. Gently rub to form a lather and rinse off. Avoid Acnilite Body Wash in direct contact with your eyes.
authorDetails: AUTHOR DETAILS  Written By Dr. R. Dinesh John Rajkumar, Pharm.D Last updated on 27 Jun 2023 | 05:22 PM(IST)

name: ACNILITE Bar 75gm
about: INTRODUCTION  Acnelite Bar is a non-comedogenic, gentle cleansing bar that deep cleans the skin and remove excess, dirt, oil, and bacteria. Acnelite Bar contains Triclosan, Tea tree oil, Allantoin, and Vitamin E as the active ingredients that are effective in acne and other oily skin conditions.  Allantoin elevates cell proliferation, enhances the healing process, cleanse away dead tissue, softens, and moisturizes the skin. Tea Tree Oil acts as an anti-bacterial and anti-septic, dries and cleans acne blemishes, blackheads, and whiteheads. It also clears excess sebum from the skin. Vitamin E softens the skin, preventing wrinkling, and protects the skin against harmful UV damage. Triclosan also acts as an antiseptic.  Always use Acnelite Bar as advised by the physician/dermatologist. It is for external use only. Avoid contact with eyes. Flush with water if excess lather of Acnelite Bar enters the eyes.
authorDetails: AUTHOR DETAILS  Written By Dr. Priyanka Goel, BDS Last updated on 02 Jun 2023 | 02:13 PM(IST)

name: ACNIN ACNE PRONE SKIN Face Pack 50gm
about: INTRODUCTION  Acnin Face Pack is a dermatological preparation used for the treatment of acne. It contains Glycerine, Zinc Oxide, Aqua, Kaolin, Bentonite (Fuller`s Earth) as the active ingredients which hydrates the skin, removes excess sebum, and improves the appearance of facial skin by exfoliating the dead skin and tightens the pores and treats acne.   Glycerine is a humectant and moisturizing agent that pulls water into the outer layer of skin from deeper levels of the skin and keeps it moisturised. Zinc has anti-inflammatory effects and is beneficial for inflammatory acne and related scarring. Bentonite and Kaolin suppress the sebum secretion and enhances anti-bacterial activity.  Use Acnin Face Pack as advised by your doctor. It is for external use only. You can apply Acnin Face Pack twice a week, preferably in the evening, using the fingertips, all over the face for at least 6-8 weeks. Before applying this, ensure that the face is clean and dry. Gently apply a small amount of Acnin Face Pack all over the face uniformly. Once applied leave Acnin Face Pack for 15-20 minutes and then wash the face with clean water. Do not use Acnin Face Pack if you are allergic to any of its components.
authorDetails: AUTHOR DETAILS  Written By Dr. Priyanka Goel, BDS Last updated on 29 Apr 2023 | 06:12 PM(IST)

name: Acnin Pimple Care Face Pack 50gm
about: INTRODUCTION  Acnin Pimple Care Face Pack is an anti-acne face pack that supports to alleviate the acne and aids in skin rejuvenation. It hydrates the skin and makes the skin soft, supple, and silky. It contains Keoliene, Bentonite (fuller`s earth), Glycerine and Zinc oxide as active ingredients that improves overall appearance of skin.  Bentonite and Kaolin decrease the sebum secretion. It also exfoliates the dead skin and tightens the pores. Quarternium-73 provides enhanced anti-bacterial activity. Aloe and Glycerine hydrates and rejuvenates the facial skin.  Apply the Acnin Pimple Care Face Pack to your entire face using your fingertips twice weekly, especially in the evening, for six to eight weeks for the best effects. Before applying Acnin face pack, make sure the face is clean and dry. Apply a small amount of the Acnin Pimple Care Face Pack evenly all over your face. After application, it should be left on for 15 to 12 minutes. If irritation occurs, discontinue using Acnin Pimple Care Face Pack and consult a healthcare professional.
authorDetails: AUTHOR DETAILS  Written By Dr. Janet.C, Pharm.D Last updated on 16 May 2023 | 04:22 PM(IST)

name: Acnorm Lotion 180ml
about: INTRODUCTION  Acnorm Lotion is a dermatological preparation used for treating acne. It contains Calamine, Zinc oxide, Glycerin, and Precipitated Sulphur as active ingredients.  Calamine and Zinc oxide soothes skin irritation, itching, inflammation and redness caused due to acne and any other skin conditions like skin allergies and insect bites. Additionally, calamine also removes excess oil from the skin and fades away dark spots, scars and marks.  Glycerin is an excellent moisturizer. It hydrates your skin, prevents water loss and makes your skin soft and supple. Precipitated Sulphur absorbs all the excess oil produced by the skin and dries it out, which helps in prevention of further acne breakouts.  Acnorm Lotion is suitable for use in oily and acne prone skin. It is for external use only. Apply Acnorm Lotion on the acne affected skin areas including your face, chest and upper back. Leave the lotion to dry on your skin overnight and wash if off next morning. Avoid contact of this lotion with your eyes, ears, nose or mouth. In case of accidental contact, wash it off with plenty of water.
authorDetails: AUTHOR DETAILS  Written By Srilekha. R, B.Pharm Last updated on 11 May 2023 | 06:21 PM(IST)

name: Acnovate Gel 15gm
about: INTRODUCTION  ACNOVATE GEL is a combination of Adapalene, Clindamycin and Zinc acetate which belongs to a group of medicines known as Retinoids, Antibiotics, and Minerals. It is indicated to treat acne vulgaris.  Acne vulgaris is a long-term skin condition that occurs when hair follicles plug with oil and dead skin cells which may be triggered by bacteria. It is characterised by uninflamed blackheads to pus-filled pimples or large, red and tender bumps.  Before using ACNOVATE GEL, inform your doctor if you have areas of cuts, scrapes or sunburned skin or if you have a skin condition called eczema, diarrhoea and inflammatory bowel disease.  ACNOVATE GEL is not recommended for use during pregnancy. It should be used with caution in breastfeeding woman as it is excreted in breastmilk and may pass to the baby consult your doctor for advice.  ACNOVATE GEL is not recommended for use in children and adolescents below 12 years of age. Consult with your physician.  The common side effects are skin dryness, skin irritation, urticaria (skin rash), skin oiliness, skin burning sensation. Consult your doctor if any of the symptoms worsen.
uses: USES OF ACNOVATE GEL Used to treat acne vulgaris
working: HOW ACNOVATE GEL WORKS  ACNOVATE GEL is a combination of adapalene, clindamycin and zinc acetate which treats pimples (acne). Adapalene is a form of vitamin A which prevents accumulation of the sebum (skin’s natural oil), unblocks the pores and allows natural exfoliation of the outer layers of skin. Clindamycin belongs to antibiotic which works by penetrating into the skin and works against acne-causing bacteria. Zinc acetate reduces the sebum production, inhibits the neutrophils and TNF production (substances responsible for inflammation), increases the tissue healing capacity and it also supress the bacterial growth.
directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Use as directed by your physician. It is for external use only. A thin film of ACNOVATE GEL should be applied, with the fingertips, in acne affected areas once a day after washing. Your doctor will decide the right dose depends on your age, body weight and disease condition.
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF ACNOVATE GEL COMMON Skin dryness, irritation Urticaria (skin rash) Skin oiliness Skin burning sensation Erythema (redness of skin) UNCOMMON Signs of contact dermatitis include red rash, itching, peeling or ulcers Skin discomfort Sunburn Pruritus (itchiness that creates an urge to scratch that area) Skin peeling Acne RARE  Stop using ACNOVATE GEL and contact your doctor immediately if you experience any of the following side effects:  Swelling of the face, lips or throat which makes difficulty in swallowing and breathing, rash, itching, hives, and dizziness Diarrhoea with mucus and blood
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY  ACNOVATE GEL is not recommended for use during pregnancy. Consult your doctor for advice.  BREASTFEEDING  ACNOVATE GEL should be used with caution in breastfeeding woman as it is excreted in breastmilk and may pass to the baby. Consult your doctor for advice.  ALLERGY  Do not use ACNOVATE GEL if you are allergic to Adapalene, Clindamycin and Zinc acetate or any other ingredients of this medicine.  OTHERS  Before using ACNOVATE GEL, inform your doctor if you:  Have areas of cuts, scrapes or sunburned skin or if you have a skin condition called eczema Have diarrhoea Have inflammatory bowel disease (Ex. colitis, and pseudomembranous colitis Or crohn’s disease)  Use in pediatrics:  ACNOVATE GEL is not recommended for use in children and adolescents below 12 years of age. Consult your doctor before using the medicine.
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug-Drug interactions:  Before using ACNOVATE GEL inform your doctor if you are taking:  Warfarin, acenocoumarol, fluindione (medicines used to prevent clotting of blood) Retinoids like tretinoin, retinyl palmitate (medicines used to treat acne)  Overdosage:  If you or anyone else accidentally uses too much of ACNOVATE GEL, consult your doctor immediately or visit the nearby hospital.
synopsis: SYNOPSIS Drug	:  	Adapalene, Clindamycin, Zinc acetate Pharmacological Category	:  	Retinoids, Lincomycin antibiotics, Minerals Therapeutic Indication	:  	Acne Vulgaris            Dosage Forms	:  	Gel
moreInfo: MORE INFORMATION Keep ACNOVATE GEL out of reach of children Store at a temperature below 25°C
faqs: FAQs ABOUT ACNOVATE GEL  Q: What is ACNOVATE GEL and why is it given?  A: ACNOVATE GEL is a combination of Adapalene, Clindamycin, and Zinc acetate. It is indicated for treatment of Acne vulgaris characterised by uninflamed blackheads to pus-filled pimples or large, red and tender bumps.  Q: How to use ACNOVATE GEL?  A: A thin film of ACNOVATE GEL should be applied, with the fingertips, in acne affected areas once a day after washing. Dry the areas before applying and avoid contact with eyes and lips. It is for external use only.  Q: Is ACNOVATE GEL safe in pregnant and breastfeeding women?  A: ACNOVATE GEL is not recommended for use during pregnancy. It should be used with caution in breastfeeding woman as it is excreted in breastmilk and may pass to the baby. Consult your doctor for advice.  Q: Is ACNOVATE GEL safe for use in children?  A: ACNOVATE GEL is not recommended for use in children and adolescents below 12 years of age. Consult your doctor for advice before using ACNOVATE GEL.  Q: Does ACNOVATE GEL cause skin rash?  A: Yes, it may cause skin rash in some individuals. Try to avoid hot showers because it may cause skin irritation. Avoid frequent contact and rubbing over the affected area. Use sunscreen and protective clothing when outdoors. If this symptom does not get better, speak to a doctor.

name: Acnovate Trio Gel 15gm
about: INTRODUCTION  ACNOVATE TRIO GEL is a combination of Adapalene and Benzoyl peroxide which belongs to the group of medicines called Antiacne agents. It is used in the treatment of acne.  Acne vulgaris (commonly known as acne) is an inflammatory skin condition that occurs when the hair follicles present in the skin are clogged with excess oil and/or dead skin cells. It can also be aggravated by few bacteria (such as Propionibacterium acnes) and is highly common among on the teenagers and the young adults.  It primarily affects the face, upper arms, trunk or back and is often characterized by pus-filled pimples, red bumps with inflammatory and non-inflammatory lesions. ACNOVATE TRIO GEL is suitable for use both in adults and in children (aged 9 years or older).  Apply a thin layer of ACNOVATE TRIO GEL on the affected skin areas. Avoid contact of this medicine with your eyes, mouth, ears, nose or with open wounds. You must also protect your skin against sun light and against other light sources (such as UV lamps).  Do not use ACNOVATE TRIO GEL if you are pregnant, think you may be pregnant or planning to have a baby. ACNOVATE TRIO GEL can be used in breastfeeding women if required. The most common side effects of using ACNOVATE TRIO GEL are dry skin, mild burning sensation and skin irritation, redness or scaling. Consult your doctor if they trouble you.
uses: USES OF ACNOVATE TRIO GEL  It is used in adults, children and in adolescents (aged 9 years or older) to:  Treat acne
working: HOW ACNOVATE TRIO GEL WORKS  ACNOVATE TRIO GEL is a combination of two medicines namely, adapalene and benzoyl peroxide.  Adapalene is a topical retinoid (a type of vitamin A). It modulates the skin cell cycle and prevents the accumulation of excess sebum (natural oil produced by the skin) and dead skin cells on the hair follicles of the skin. It also reduces inflammation on the skin.  Benzoyl peroxide is a keratolytic agent with antimicrobial properties. It improves skin’s tendency to exfoliate the dead skin cells naturally. It also reduces the number of acne-causing bacteria on the skin which can reduce the further spread of acne.  Collectively, they unclog the hair follicles of the skin and exfoliates dead skin cells which reduces acne breakouts.
directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Apply a thin layer of this medicine on the affected skin areas or as directed by the physician. It is for topical use only. Wash your hands before and after application.  Your doctor will decide the correct dose and duration of therapy for you depending upon your age, body weight and health condition.  Avoid contact of ACNOVATE TRIO GEL with your eyes, mouth, ears, nose, hair or with open wounds (cuts, scrapes or sunburn).
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF ACNOVATE TRIO GEL COMMON Dry skin Skin redness and scaling Burning sensation of the skin Skin irritation UNCOMMON Itching of the skin (pruritus) Sunburn RARE  Stop using ACNOVATE TRIO GEL and consult your doctor immediately if you experience:  Signs of allergic reaction (such as severe skin rash with itching of body parts, swelling of the eyes, face, lips or tongue causing throat tightness and breathing difficulties and feel faint)
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY  ACNOVATE TRIO GEL is not recommended for use in pregnant women. Therefore, inform your doctor before using this medicine if you are pregnant, think you may be pregnant or planning to have a baby. If you became pregnant while using this medicine, stop using it and contact your doctor immediately.  BREASTFEEDING  ACNOVATE TRIO GEL can be used in breastfeeding women. However, do not apply this medicine on your chest to avoid exposing this medicine to the nursing infant.  ALLERGY  Talk to your doctor if you are allergic to Adapalene or Benzoyl peroxide.  OTHERS  ACNOVATE TRIO GEL is not recommended for use if you:  Have any cuts, scrapes, sunburn or eczema at the site of application  Use in Pediatrics:  ACNOVATE TRIO GEL can be used in children and adolescents (aged 9 years or older) if advised by the physician. Therefore, consult your doctor before using it.
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug-Drug interactions:  Before using ACNOVATE TRIO GEL, inform your doctor if you are using any of the following:  Other anti-acne medicines (such as clindamycin) Skin cosmetics (such as hair perming solutions, astringents, toners, shaving lotion, abrasive soaps or cleansers)  Overdosage:  If you or anyone else applied excessive amount of ACNOVATE TRIO GEL, rinse your skin with plenty of cold water. If irritation persists, consult your doctor.
synopsis: SYNOPSIS Drug	:  	Adapalene, Benzoyl peroxide Pharmacological Category	:  	Retinoid-like compounds, Topical Antibiotics Therapeutic Indication	:  	Acne vulgaris Dosage Forms	:  	Topical Gel
moreInfo: MORE INFORMATION Keep ACNOVATE TRIO GEL out of reach of children Store ACNOVATE TRIO GEL at room temperature
faqs: FAQs ABOUT ACNOVATE TRIO GEL  Will ACNOVATE TRIO GEL be more effective if I overuse it?  No. Do not overuse this medicine. If you use more, you will not get rid of acne quicker. Instead, it may make your skin more irritated and red. Therefore, only apply the quantity mentioned by your doctor.  What are the side effects of using ACNOVATE TRIO GEL?  ACNOVATE TRIO GEL is generally safe with limited or no side effects. However, you may experience skin dryness, redness or irritation after applying this medicine. Contact your doctor if it troubles you.  What is the use of ACNOVATE TRIO GEL?  ACNOVATE TRIO GEL is used in the treatment of acne.  How ACNOVATE TRIO GEL works?  ACNOVATE TRIO GEL prevents the accumulation of excess sebum (natural oil produced by the skin) and dead skin cells on the hair follicles of the skin. It also reduces inflammation on the skin and improves skin’s tendency to exfoliate the dead skin cells naturally. It also reduces the number of acne-causing bacteria on the skin which can reduce the further spread of acne.  How to use ACNOVATE TRIO GEL?  ACNOVATE TRIO GEL is for external use only. Take the required quantity of the medicine and apply on the affected skin areas. Avoid contact of this medicine with your eyes, ears, nose or any other mucous membranes.  How long does it take for ACNOVATE TRIO GEL to work?  It may take up to 2-3 weeks for ACNOVATE TRIO GEL to show improvement in your skin condition. However, this period may vary from person-to-person depending upon the skin condition.  How long should I use ACNOVATE TRIO GEL?  Your doctor will decide the correct dose and duration of therapy for you depending upon your age, body weight and health condition. You need to use ACNOVATE TRIO GEL for the stipulated duration prescribed by your doctor. Failing to do so may not result in adequate response.  What to do if I forgot to apply ACNOVATE TRIO GEL?  If you forgot to apply ACNOVATE TRIO GEL, apply it as soon as you remember. However, if it is time for the next application, skip the missed one and apply the next dose. Do not excessively apply ACNOVATE TRIO GEL to compensate the missed doses.  Is ACNOVATE TRIO GEL safe?  ACNOVATE TRIO GEL is safe at doses prescribed by the physician. Therefore, do not alter the dose of ACNOVATE TRIO GEL without consulting your doctor.  Can I stop using ACNOVATE TRIO GEL without consulting your doctor?  No. You should not stop using ACNOVATE TRIO GEL without consulting your doctor as it may reduce its effectiveness. Therefore, apply ACNOVATE TRIO GEL for the stipulated duration recommended by your doctor to achieve maximum results.  Can ACNOVATE TRIO GEL be used in pregnant women?  ACNOVATE TRIO GEL is not recommended for use in pregnant women. Therefore, inform your doctor before using this medicine if you are pregnant, think you may be pregnant or planning to have a baby. If you became pregnant while using this medicine, stop using it and contact your doctor immediately.

name: ACTAME 10 Softgel 10's
about: INTRODUCTION  ACTAME 10 SOFTGEL contains Isotretinoin which belongs to the group of medicines called Retinoids. It is used in adults and children (older than 12 years of age) to treat severe form of acne (such as nodular acne, conglobate acne, and acne that is at risk of permanent scarring), which has not improved after other anti-acne treatments. Acne is an inflammatory skin condition which is characterized by spots, oily skin, nodular lesions etc. on face, back, and chest, which can be painful.  During treatment with ACTAME 10 SOFTGEL your doctor might conduct certain blood tests and pregnancy tests, and you will be supervised by a skin doctor. You will be advised to reduce intensive exercise and physical activity. Before you go out in the sun, use a sunscreen with a high protection factor (SPF 15 or higher).  Avoid too much sun and using a sun-lamp or sun-bed. Avoid consuming alcohol while taking ACTAME 10 SOFTGEL as it may cause side effects. Do not donate blood while consuming ACTAME 10 SOFTGEL and after stopping ACTAME 10 SOFTGEL at least for one month or undergo cosmetic procedures while taking ACTAME 10 SOFTGEL or at least for 6 months after stopping it.  ACTAME 10 SOFTGEL is not recommended for use in patients having liver or kidney disease, hyperlipidaemia (high blood lipid levels), high levels of Vitamin A. ACTAME 10 SOFTGEL should be used with caution in patients who have or had mental illness or family history of mental illness, asthma, diabetes, heart or bone problems like osteoporosis, or eating disorder.  ACTAME 10 SOFTGEL is not recommended for use in pregnant women, women planning a pregnancy, breast feeding women, and in children (below 12 years of age) so, consult your doctor for advice. ACTAME 10 SOFTGEL should be used with caution in elderly patients (65 years and older).  ACTAME 10 SOFTGEL may cause depression, psychosis, suicidal thoughts, or thoughts of self-harm in some patients. Consult your doctor if you experience any such behaviour or thoughts.  Most common side effects of taking ACTAME 10 SOFTGEL are dry skin of face and lips, joint or muscle pain, headache, easy bruising or bleeding, weakness, etc. Consult your doctor if any of the symptoms deteriorate.
uses: USES OF ACTAME 10 SOFTGEL Used in adults and children (older than 12 years of age) to treat severe form of acne which has not improved after other anti-acne treatments
working: HOW ACTAME 10 SOFTGEL WORKS  ACTAME 10 SOFTGEL helps in treating acne by inhibiting the function of sebaceous glands (oil glands in skin) thus, reducing the secretion of oil (sebum) in the skin. ACTAME 10 SOFTGEL also inhibits keratinization (development of a horn-like character by the epithelial tissue), which might be a cause of acne.
directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Take ACTAME 10 SOFTGEL as advised by your physician. Do not crush or chew it. Swallow ACTAME 10 SOFTGEL as whole with a glass of water or a mouthful of food. Take it on a full stomach. Your doctor will decide the right dose and duration of therapy for you according to your age, body weight and disease condition.
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF ACTAME 10 SOFTGEL COMMON Dry skin, especially of the lips and face, inflamed skin, chapped and inflamed lips, rash, mild itching, slight peeling More fragile and red skin than usual, especially of the face Back, muscle or joint pain (particularly in children and teenagers) Inflammation of the eye and eyelid area, dry and irritated eyes Raised liver enzymes Changed blood fat and cholesterol levels Easy bruising, bleeding or clotting Anaemia (weakness, dizziness, pale skin) Headache Protein or blood in the urine Becoming more prone to get infections Dry and crusted inside of the nose causing mild nosebleeds Sore or inflamed throat and nose RARE Hair loss  Stop taking ACTAME 10 SOFTGEL and consult your doctor immediately in case you experience any of the following:  Persistent pain in your lower back or buttocks (signs of sacroiliitis) Severe skin reactions (Ex. erythema multiforme, Stevens-Johnson Syndrome, toxic epidermal necrolysis) (blistering and peeling of skin, severe rashes, fever, multiple lesions especially in mouth, nose, eyes and genitals, conjunctivitis, flu-like symptoms) Depression or related disorders (sad or altered mood, anxiety, emotional discomfort), worsening depression, becoming violent or aggressive Thoughts or feelings about hurting self or ending own lives, suicide attempts or suicide Unusual behaviour Psychosis (loss of contact with reality, like hearing voices or seeing things that are not real) Serious reactions (trouble breathing or swallowing due to sudden swelling of the throat, face, lips and mouth, sudden swelling of the hands, feet and ankles, hives, bruises, eczema, bruising, red patches on hands and legs) Sudden tight chest, breathlessness and wheezing, particularly if you have asthma Rhabdomyolysis (muscle weakness along with trouble moving arms or legs, painful, swollen, bruised areas of the body, dark urine, reduced or no urination, confusion or dehydration) Hepatitis (yellow skin or eyes, tiredness) Kidney inflammation (difficulty urinating, swollen and puffy eyelids, excessive tiredness) Increased intracranial pressure (continuous headache, along with nausea, vomiting and eyesight changes including blurred vision) Serious gut conditions (severe tummy pain, with or without severe bloody diarrhoea, nausea, vomiting) Vision problems like night vision problems, persistent dryness of eyes, intolerance to contact lenses Inflamed pancreas Hearing problems, ringing sound in ears Severe muscle weakness, muscle, joint, back pain, difficulty moving especially after exercise
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY  ACTAME 10 SOFTGEL is not recommended for use in pregnant women and women planning a pregnancy. Inform your doctor if you become pregnant during treatment with ACTAME 10 SOFTGEL. It is not recommended to get pregnant for one month after stopping ACTAME 10 SOFTGEL treatment because some medicine may still be left in your body. Consult your doctor before taking it.  Contraception must be used for a month before taking ACTAME 10 SOFTGEL, during treatment and for a month afterwards. Discuss with your doctor regarding suitable contraceptive methods.  BREASTFEEDING  ACTAME 10 SOFTGEL is not recommended for use in breast feeding women as it may pass through breast milk. Consult your doctor before taking it.  DRIVING AND USING MACHINES  Do not drive or operate machinery if you experience dizziness, drowsiness or decreased night vision after taking ACTAME 10 SOFTGEL.  ALCOHOL  Avoid consuming alcohol while taking ACTAME 10 SOFTGEL as it may increase side effects. Inform your doctor if you are an alcoholic.  KIDNEY  ACTAME 10 SOFTGEL should be used with caution in patients with kidney problems. Consult your doctor before taking it.  LIVER  ACTAME 10 SOFTGEL is not recommended for use in patients with liver disease. Consult your doctor before taking it.  ALLERGY  Do not take ACTAME 10 SOFTGEL if you are allergic to Isotretinoin, soya, peanuts or any of the other ingredients of this medicine.  LUNGS  ACTAME 10 SOFTGEL should be used with caution in patients having asthma. Consult your doctor before taking it.  OTHERS  ACTAME 10 SOFTGEL is not recommended for use if you have:  High blood fat levels High levels of Vitamin A  Before taking ACTAME 10 SOFTGEL inform your doctor if you:  Have or had mental illness or family history of mental illness such as depression, mood disorders, psychosis, aggressive behaviour, or hurting or killing self Have diabetes Are fructose intolerant Are overweight  Use in paediatrics:  ACTAME 10 SOFTGEL is not recommended for use in children below 12 years of age. ACTAME 10 SOFTGEL can be used in adolescents (more than 12 years of age) only after puberty. Consult your child’s doctor for advice.  Use in geriatrics:  There is no proper information about the use of ACTAME 10 SOFTGEL in elderly patients. Consult your doctor before taking it.
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug-Drug interactions:  Before taking ACTAME 10 SOFTGEL, inform your doctor if you are taking any of the following medicines:  Vitamin A supplements Medicines used to treat bacterial infections (Ex. minocycline, doxycycline) Phenytoin (used to treat fits) Medicines used to treat various inflammatory conditions (Ex. betamethasone, prednisolone, dexamethasone) Medicines used to prevent pregnancy (Ex. Norethindrone, ethinyl Oestradiol) St. John’s wort (herbal medicine used to treat mental disorders) Other medicines used to treat acne like keratolytic or exfoliative agents (Ex. salicylic acid, benzoyl peroxide)  Overdosage:  In case you or anybody else accidently take too much of ACTAME 10 SOFTGEL, consult your doctor immediately or visit the nearby hospital. Symptoms of ACTAME 10 SOFTGEL overdose are severe headache, abdominal pain, nausea, dizziness, redness of face, vomiting, somnolence, irritability, and itching.
synopsis: SYNOPSIS Drug	:  	  Isotretinoin   Pharmacological Category	:  	  Retinoids    Therapeutic Indication	:  	  Severe Acne   Dosage Forms	:  	  Tablet, Soft gel Capsule, Capsule
moreInfo: MORE INFORMATION Keep ACTAME 10 SOFTGEL out of reach of children Store ACTAME 10 SOFTGEL between 15-30°C
faqs: FAQs ABOUT ACTAME 10 SOFTGEL  Can ACTAME 10 SOFTGEL cause irregular periods?  According to some studies, menstrual irregularity was observed during treatment follow-ups. Consult your doctor if you experience irregularity in your periods during treatment with ACTAME 10 SOFTGEL.  Is ACTAME 10 SOFTGEL safe to take in pregnancy?  No. ACTAME 10 SOFTGEL is not recommended for use in pregnant women and women planning a pregnancy. Inform your doctor if you become pregnant during treatment with ACTAME 10 SOFTGEL. It is not recommended to get pregnant for one month after stopping ACTAME 10 SOFTGEL treatment because some medicine may still be left in your body. Consult your doctor before taking it. Contraception must be used for a month before taking ACTAME 10 SOFTGEL, during treatment and for a month afterwards. Discuss with your doctor regarding suitable contraceptive methods.  Can I play sports during ACTAME 10 SOFTGEL treatment?  Cut down on extreme exercise and physical activity as ACTAME 10 SOFTGEL can cause muscle and joint pain especially in children and teenagers taking up vigorous physical activity. Consult your doctor if you can play sports during this treatment.  Can I go out in the sun during ACTAME 10 SOFTGEL treatment?  Sensitivity to light may increase during treatment with ACTAME 10 SOFTGEL so, avoid going too much into the sun and don’t use a sun-lamp or sun-bed. Before you go out in the sun, wear sunglasses and use sunscreen with a high protection factor (SPF 15 or higher).  Can undergo cosmetic procedures while taking ACTAME 10 SOFTGEL?  No. Do not undergo cosmetic procedures such as skin waxing, dermabrasion, laser, or artificial UV light detanning while taking ACTAME 10 SOFTGEL or at least for 6 months after stopping it as they could cause scarring, skin irritation, or changes in your skin colour. Consult your doctor before undergoing any cosmetic procedure while taking ACTAME 10 SOFTGEL.

name: ACTAME 20 Softgel 10's
about: INTRODUCTION  ACTAME 20 SOFTGEL contains Isotretinoin which belongs to the group of medicines called Retinoids. It is used in adults and children (older than 12 years of age) to treat severe form of acne (such as nodular acne, conglobate acne, and acne that is at risk of permanent scarring), which has not improved after other anti-acne treatments. Acne is an inflammatory skin condition which is characterized by spots, oily skin, nodular lesions etc. on face, back, and chest, which can be painful.  During treatment with ACTAME 20 SOFTGEL your doctor might conduct certain blood tests and pregnancy tests, and you will be supervised by a skin doctor. You will be advised to reduce intensive exercise and physical activity. Before you go out in the sun, use a sunscreen with a high protection factor (SPF 15 or higher).  Avoid too much sun and using a sun-lamp or sun-bed. Avoid consuming alcohol while taking ACTAME 20 SOFTGEL as it may cause side effects. Do not donate blood while consuming ACTAME 20 SOFTGEL and after stopping ACTAME 20 SOFTGEL at least for one month or undergo cosmetic procedures while taking ACTAME 20 SOFTGEL or at least for 6 months after stopping it.  ACTAME 20 SOFTGEL is not recommended for use in patients having liver or kidney disease, hyperlipidaemia (high blood lipid levels), high levels of Vitamin A. ACTAME 20 SOFTGEL should be used with caution in patients who have or had mental illness or family history of mental illness, asthma, diabetes, heart or bone problems like osteoporosis, or eating disorder.  ACTAME 20 SOFTGEL is not recommended for use in pregnant women, women planning a pregnancy, breast feeding women, and in children (below 12 years of age) so, consult your doctor for advice. ACTAME 20 SOFTGEL should be used with caution in elderly patients (65 years and older).  ACTAME 20 SOFTGEL may cause depression, psychosis, suicidal thoughts, or thoughts of self-harm in some patients. Consult your doctor if you experience any such behaviour or thoughts.  Most common side effects of taking ACTAME 20 SOFTGEL are dry skin of face and lips, joint or muscle pain, headache, easy bruising or bleeding, weakness, etc. Consult your doctor if any of the symptoms deteriorate.

working: HOW ACTAME 20 SOFTGEL WORKS  ACTAME 20 SOFTGEL helps in treating acne by inhibiting the function of sebaceous glands (oil glands in skin) thus, reducing the secretion of oil (sebum) in the skin. ACTAME 20 SOFTGEL also inhibits keratinization (development of a horn-like character by the epithelial tissue), which might be a cause of acne.

Take it on a full stomach. Your doctor will decide the right dose and duration of therapy for you according to your age, body weight and disease condition.

name: ACTREAT Gel(Topical) 20gm
about: INTRODUCTION  ACTREAT GEL(TOPICAL) is a combination of Clindamycin and Nicotinamide which belongs to a group of medicines called Lincomycin antibiotics and Vitamin B3 complex, respectively. ACTREAT GEL(TOPICAL) is used to treat mild to moderate acne which is a skin condition that occurs when hair follicles become plugged with oil and dead skin cells which may occur due to variety of causes such as genetics, fluctuating hormone levels, stress, high humidity or using oily or greasy personal care products which may affect people of all ages.  It is characterized by symptoms such as open or closed plugged pores, small red & tender bumps, pimples, large, solid or painful lumps under the skin and painful & pus-filled lumps under the skin.  Before using ACTREAT GEL(TOPICAL) inform your doctor if you have liver, kidney, lung or heart diseases. Avoid applying ACTREAT GEL(TOPICAL) to a cut, scrapped, sunburnt or eczema affected skin.  ACTREAT GEL(TOPICAL) should be used with caution in pregnant and in breastfeeding women. ACTREAT GEL(TOPICAL) is not recommended for use in children and adolescents (below 12 years). Consult your doctor before applying.  The most common side effects of using ACTREAT GEL(TOPICAL) are skin inflammation, contact dermatitis (red, itchy rash), inflammation of hair follicles, itchy skin, dry skin and peeling of skin. Consult your doctor if any of these symptoms worsen.
uses: USES OF ACTREAT GEL(TOPICAL) Treats mild to moderate acne
working: HOW ACTREAT GEL(TOPICAL) WORKS  ACTREAT GEL(TOPICAL) helps to treat acne, where Clindamycin reduces free fatty acid concentrations on the skin and suppresses the growth of Propionibacterium acnes (Corynebacterium acnes), a bacteria found in sebaceous glands and follicles and Nicotinamide exerts anti-inflammatory effect in acne and interrupts sebum production.
directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Apply ACTREAT GEL(TOPICAL) as advised by your physician. It is for external use only. Before applying the medicine normally wash and dry the affected area and apply a thin layer of this medicine on the affected area. Treated areas on the face need not be covered with a plaster or bandage. Do not apply this medicine beyond the recommended duration. Avoid applying ACTREAT GEL(TOPICAL) around your eyes, including eyelids. Rinse it off with water if you accidentally get it in these areas.
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF ACTREAT GEL(TOPICAL) COMMON Contact dermatitis (red, itchy rash) Inflammation of hair follicles Itchy skin Dry skin Peeling of skin
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY  ACTREAT GEL(TOPICAL) should be used with caution in pregnant women. Consult your doctor before applying.  BREASTFEEDING  ACTREAT GEL(TOPICAL) should be used with caution in breastfeeding women. Consult your doctor before applying.  ALLERGY  ACTREAT GEL(TOPICAL) is not recommended for use if you are allergic to Clindamycin, Nicotinamide or any other ingredients of this medicine.  OTHERS  ACTREAT GEL(TOPICAL) is not recommended for use if you have:  Eczema (skin inflammation) Cut, scrapped, sunburnt skin  Use in Pediatrics:  ACTREAT GEL(TOPICAL) is not recommended for use in children and adolescents (below 12 years). Consult your doctor before using it for your child.  Use in Geriatrics:  There is no information on the use of ACTREAT GEL(TOPICAL) in elderly patients. Consult with your doctor before using.
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug - Drug interactions:  Before using ACTREAT GEL(TOPICAL), inform your doctor if you are taking any of the following medicines:  Acepromazine (used a sedative/tranquilizer) Acetaminophen (used to treat pain and inflammation)  Overdosage:  If you or anyone else accidentally ingests or applies too much of ACTREAT GEL(TOPICAL), consult your doctor immediately or visit the nearby hospital.
synopsis: SYNOPSIS Drug	:  	Clindamycin, Nicotinamide Pharmacological Category	:  	Lincomycin antibiotics, Vitamin B3 complex Therapeutic Indication	:  	Mild to moderate acne Dosage Forms	:  	Gel, Cream, Ointment
moreInfo: MORE INFORMATION Keep ACTREAT GEL(TOPICAL) out of reach of children Store ACTREAT GEL(TOPICAL) at a temperature below 25°C
faqs: FAQs ABOUT ACTREAT GEL(TOPICAL)  What special precautions should I follow while using ACTREAT GEL(TOPICAL)?  Before using ACTREAT GEL(TOPICAL) inform your doctor if you have liver, kidney, lung or heart diseases. Avoid applying ACTREAT GEL(TOPICAL) to a cut, scrapped, sunburnt or eczema affected skin. This medicine is not for oral, ophthalmic or intravaginal use.  What is ACTREAT GEL(TOPICAL) used for?  ACTREAT GEL(TOPICAL) is indicated for the treatment of mild to moderate acne in patients above 12 years of age. Do not use it for any other condition other than that prescribed by your doctor.  How should I use ACTREAT GEL(TOPICAL)?  Always apply ACTREAT GEL(TOPICAL), as directed by your physician. It is for external use only. On the affected area, apply a thin layer of this medicine. Treated areas on the face need not be covered with a plaster or bandage. Do not apply this medicine on your face beyond 5 days. Avoid applying ACTREAT GEL(TOPICAL) around your eyes, including eyelids.  Is ACTREAT GEL(TOPICAL) safe to use in pregnant and breastfeeding women?  ACTREAT GEL(TOPICAL) should be used with caution during pregnancy, women planning for pregnancy and in breastfeeding women. Consult your doctor before applying.  Can ACTREAT GEL(TOPICAL) cause skin irritation or itchy skin?  ACTREAT GEL(TOPICAL) may cause skin irritation or itchy skin. Avoid hot bath because hot water can irritate your skin further. Do not scratch the affected area. Use protective clothing when going outdoors. Regularly moisturize your skin and apply calamine lotion as a coolant. Discuss with your doctor if the symptom worsens.

ACUTRET 10MG CAPSULE is not recommended for use in pregnant women, women planning a pregnancy, breast feeding women, and in children (below 12 years of age) so, consult your doctor for advice. ACUTRET 10MG CAPSULE should be used with caution in elderly patients (65 years and older).  ACUTRET 10MG CAPSULE may cause depression, psychosis, suicidal thoughts, or thoughts of self-harm in some patients. Consult your doctor if you experience any such behaviour or thoughts.  Most common side effects of taking ACUTRET 10MG CAPSULE are dry skin of face and lips, joint or muscle pain, headache, easy bruising or bleeding, weakness, etc. Consult your doctor if any of the symptoms deteriorate.
uses: USES OF ACUTRET 10MG CAPSULE Used in adults and children (older than 12 years of age) to treat severe form of acne which has not improved after other anti-acne treatments
working: HOW ACUTRET 10MG CAPSULE WORKS  ACUTRET 10MG CAPSULE helps in treating acne by inhibiting the function of sebaceous glands (oil glands in skin) thus, reducing the secretion of oil (sebum) in the skin. ACUTRET 10MG CAPSULE also inhibits keratinization (development of a horn-like character by the epithelial tissue), which might be a cause of acne.
directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Take ACUTRET 10MG CAPSULE as advised by your physician. Do not crush or chew it. Swallow ACUTRET 10MG CAPSULE as whole with a glass of water or a mouthful of food. Take it on a full stomach. Your doctor will decide the right dose and duration of therapy for you according to your age, body weight and disease condition.
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF ACUTRET 10MG CAPSULE COMMON Dry skin, especially of the lips and face, inflamed skin, chapped and inflamed lips, rash, mild itching, slight peeling More fragile and red skin than usual, especially of the face Back, muscle or joint pain (particularly in children and teenagers) Inflammation of the eye and eyelid area, dry and irritated eyes Raised liver enzymes Changed blood fat and cholesterol levels Easy bruising, bleeding or clotting Anaemia (weakness, dizziness, pale skin) Headache Protein or blood in the urine Becoming more prone to get infections Dry and crusted inside of the nose causing mild nosebleeds Sore or inflamed throat and nose RARE Hair loss  Stop taking ACUTRET 10MG CAPSULE and consult your doctor immediately in case you experience any of the following:  Persistent pain in your lower back or buttocks (signs of sacroiliitis) Severe skin reactions (Ex. erythema multiforme, Stevens-Johnson Syndrome, toxic epidermal necrolysis) (blistering and peeling of skin, severe rashes, fever, multiple lesions especially in mouth, nose, eyes and genitals, conjunctivitis, flu-like symptoms) Depression or related disorders (sad or altered mood, anxiety, emotional discomfort), worsening depression, becoming violent or aggressive Thoughts or feelings about hurting self or ending own lives, suicide attempts or suicide Unusual behaviour Psychosis (loss of contact with reality, like hearing voices or seeing things that are not real) Serious reactions (trouble breathing or swallowing due to sudden swelling of the throat, face, lips and mouth, sudden swelling of the hands, feet and ankles, hives, bruises, eczema, bruising, red patches on hands and legs) Sudden tight chest, breathlessness and wheezing, particularly if you have asthma Rhabdomyolysis (muscle weakness along with trouble moving arms or legs, painful, swollen, bruised areas of the body, dark urine, reduced or no urination, confusion or dehydration) Hepatitis (yellow skin or eyes, tiredness) Kidney inflammation (difficulty urinating, swollen and puffy eyelids, excessive tiredness) Increased intracranial pressure (continuous headache, along with nausea, vomiting and eyesight changes including blurred vision) Serious gut conditions (severe tummy pain, with or without severe bloody diarrhoea, nausea, vomiting) Vision problems like night vision problems, persistent dryness of eyes, intolerance to contact lenses Inflamed pancreas Hearing problems, ringing sound in ears Severe muscle weakness, muscle, joint, back pain, difficulty moving especially after exercise
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY  ACUTRET 10MG CAPSULE is not recommended for use in pregnant women and women planning a pregnancy. Inform your doctor if you become pregnant during treatment with ACUTRET 10MG CAPSULE. It is not recommended to get pregnant for one month after stopping ACUTRET 10MG CAPSULE treatment because some medicine may still be left in your body. Consult your doctor before taking it.  Contraception must be used for a month before taking ACUTRET 10MG CAPSULE, during treatment and for a month afterwards. Discuss with your doctor regarding suitable contraceptive methods.  BREASTFEEDING  ACUTRET 10MG CAPSULE is not recommended for use in breast feeding women as it may pass through breast milk. Consult your doctor before taking it.  DRIVING AND USING MACHINES  Do not drive or operate machinery if you experience dizziness, drowsiness or decreased night vision after taking ACUTRET 10MG CAPSULE.  ALCOHOL  Avoid consuming alcohol while taking ACUTRET 10MG CAPSULE as it may increase side effects. Inform your doctor if you are an alcoholic.  KIDNEY  ACUTRET 10MG CAPSULE should be used with caution in patients with kidney problems. Consult your doctor before taking it.  LIVER  ACUTRET 10MG CAPSULE is not recommended for use in patients with liver disease. Consult your doctor before taking it.  ALLERGY  Do not take ACUTRET 10MG CAPSULE if you are allergic to Isotretinoin, soya, peanuts or any of the other ingredients of this medicine.  LUNGS  ACUTRET 10MG CAPSULE should be used with caution in patients having asthma. Consult your doctor before taking it.  OTHERS  ACUTRET 10MG CAPSULE is not recommended for use if you have:  High blood fat levels High levels of Vitamin A  Before taking ACUTRET 10MG CAPSULE inform your doctor if you:  Have or had mental illness or family history of mental illness such as depression, mood disorders, psychosis, aggressive behaviour, or hurting or killing self Have diabetes Are fructose intolerant Are overweight  Use in paediatrics:  ACUTRET 10MG CAPSULE is not recommended for use in children below 12 years of age. ACUTRET 10MG CAPSULE can be used in adolescents (more than 12 years of age) only after puberty. Consult your child’s doctor for advice.  Use in geriatrics:  There is no proper information about the use of ACUTRET 10MG CAPSULE in elderly patients. Consult your doctor before taking it.
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug-Drug interactions:  Before taking ACUTRET 10MG CAPSULE, inform your doctor if you are taking any of the following medicines:  Vitamin A supplements Medicines used to treat bacterial infections (Ex. minocycline, doxycycline) Phenytoin (used to treat fits) Medicines used to treat various inflammatory conditions (Ex. betamethasone, prednisolone, dexamethasone) Medicines used to prevent pregnancy (Ex. Norethindrone, ethinyl Oestradiol) St. John’s wort (herbal medicine used to treat mental disorders) Other medicines used to treat acne like keratolytic or exfoliative agents (Ex. salicylic acid, benzoyl peroxide)  Overdosage:  In case you or anybody else accidently take too much of ACUTRET 10MG CAPSULE, consult your doctor immediately or visit the nearby hospital. Symptoms of ACUTRET 10MG CAPSULE overdose are severe headache, abdominal pain, nausea, dizziness, redness of face, vomiting, somnolence, irritability, and itching.
synopsis: SYNOPSIS Drug	:  	  Isotretinoin   Pharmacological Category	:  	  Retinoids    Therapeutic Indication	:  	  Severe Acne   Dosage Forms	:  	  Tablet, Soft gel Capsule, Capsule
moreInfo: MORE INFORMATION Keep ACUTRET 10MG CAPSULE out of reach of children Store ACUTRET 10MG CAPSULE between 15-30°C
faqs: FAQs ABOUT ACUTRET 10MG CAPSULE  Can ACUTRET 10MG CAPSULE cause irregular periods?  According to some studies, menstrual irregularity was observed during treatment follow-ups. Consult your doctor if you experience irregularity in your periods during treatment with ACUTRET 10MG CAPSULE.  Is ACUTRET 10MG CAPSULE safe to take in pregnancy?  No. ACUTRET 10MG CAPSULE is not recommended for use in pregnant women and women planning a pregnancy. Inform your doctor if you become pregnant during treatment with ACUTRET 10MG CAPSULE. It is not recommended to get pregnant for one month after stopping ACUTRET 10MG CAPSULE treatment because some medicine may still be left in your body. Consult your doctor before taking it. Contraception must be used for a month before taking ACUTRET 10MG CAPSULE, during treatment and for a month afterwards. Discuss with your doctor regarding suitable contraceptive methods.  Can I play sports during ACUTRET 10MG CAPSULE treatment?  Cut down on extreme exercise and physical activity as ACUTRET 10MG CAPSULE can cause muscle and joint pain especially in children and teenagers taking up vigorous physical activity. Consult your doctor if you can play sports during this treatment.  Can I go out in the sun during ACUTRET 10MG CAPSULE treatment?  Sensitivity to light may increase during treatment with ACUTRET 10MG CAPSULE so, avoid going too much into the sun and don’t use a sun-lamp or sun-bed. Before you go out in the sun, wear sunglasses and use sunscreen with a high protection factor (SPF 15 or higher).  Can undergo cosmetic procedures while taking ACUTRET 10MG CAPSULE?  No. Do not undergo cosmetic procedures such as skin waxing, dermabrasion, laser, or artificial UV light detanning while taking ACUTRET 10MG CAPSULE or at least for 6 months after stopping it as they could cause scarring, skin irritation, or changes in your skin colour. Consult your doctor before undergoing any cosmetic procedure while taking ACUTRET 10MG CAPSULE.

name: Acutret 20mg Capsule 10'S
about: INTRODUCTION  ACUTRET 20MG CAPSULE contains Isotretinoin which belongs to the group of medicines called Retinoids. It is used in adults and children (older than 12 years of age) to treat severe form of acne (such as nodular acne, conglobate acne, and acne that is at risk of permanent scarring), which has not improved after other anti-acne treatments. Acne is an inflammatory skin condition which is characterized by spots, oily skin, nodular lesions etc. on face, back, and chest, which can be painful.  During treatment with ACUTRET 20MG CAPSULE your doctor might conduct certain blood tests and pregnancy tests, and you will be supervised by a skin doctor. You will be advised to reduce intensive exercise and physical activity. Before you go out in the sun, use a sunscreen with a high protection factor (SPF 15 or higher).  Avoid too much sun and using a sun-lamp or sun-bed. Avoid consuming alcohol while taking ACUTRET 20MG CAPSULE as it may cause side effects. Do not donate blood while consuming ACUTRET 20MG CAPSULE and after stopping ACUTRET 20MG CAPSULE at least for one month or undergo cosmetic procedures while taking ACUTRET 20MG CAPSULE or at least for 6 months after stopping it.  ACUTRET 20MG CAPSULE is not recommended for use in patients having liver or kidney disease, hyperlipidaemia (high blood lipid levels), high levels of Vitamin A. ACUTRET 20MG CAPSULE should be used with caution in patients who have or had mental illness or family history of mental illness, asthma, diabetes, heart or bone problems like osteoporosis, or eating disorder.  ACUTRET 20MG CAPSULE is not recommended for use in pregnant women, women planning a pregnancy, breast feeding women, and in children (below 12 years of age) so, consult your doctor for advice. ACUTRET 20MG CAPSULE should be used with caution in elderly patients (65 years and older).  ACUTRET 20MG CAPSULE may cause depression, psychosis, suicidal thoughts, or thoughts of self-harm in some patients. Consult your doctor if you experience any such behaviour or thoughts.  Most common side effects of taking ACUTRET 20MG CAPSULE are dry skin of face and lips, joint or muscle pain, headache, easy bruising or bleeding, weakness, etc. Consult your doctor if any of the symptoms deteriorate.

Symptoms of ACUTRET 30MG CAPSULE overdose are severe headache, abdominal pain, nausea, dizziness, redness of face, vomiting, somnolence, irritability, and itching.
synopsis: SYNOPSIS Drug	:  	  Isotretinoin   Pharmacological Category	:  	  Retinoids    Therapeutic Indication	:  	  Severe Acne   Dosage Forms	:  	  Tablet, Soft gel Capsule, Capsule
moreInfo: MORE INFORMATION Keep ACUTRET 30MG CAPSULE out of reach of children Store ACUTRET 30MG CAPSULE between 15-30°C
faqs: FAQs ABOUT ACUTRET 30MG CAPSULE  Can ACUTRET 30MG CAPSULE cause irregular periods?  According to some studies, menstrual irregularity was observed during treatment follow-ups. Consult your doctor if you experience irregularity in your periods during treatment with ACUTRET 30MG CAPSULE.  Is ACUTRET 30MG CAPSULE safe to take in pregnancy?  No. ACUTRET 30MG CAPSULE is not recommended for use in pregnant women and women planning a pregnancy. Inform your doctor if you become pregnant during treatment with ACUTRET 30MG CAPSULE. It is not recommended to get pregnant for one month after stopping ACUTRET 30MG CAPSULE treatment because some medicine may still be left in your body. Consult your doctor before taking it. Contraception must be used for a month before taking ACUTRET 30MG CAPSULE, during treatment and for a month afterwards. Discuss with your doctor regarding suitable contraceptive methods.  Can I play sports during ACUTRET 30MG CAPSULE treatment?  Cut down on extreme exercise and physical activity as ACUTRET 30MG CAPSULE can cause muscle and joint pain especially in children and teenagers taking up vigorous physical activity. Consult your doctor if you can play sports during this treatment.  Can I go out in the sun during ACUTRET 30MG CAPSULE treatment?  Sensitivity to light may increase during treatment with ACUTRET 30MG CAPSULE so, avoid going too much into the sun and don’t use a sun-lamp or sun-bed. Before you go out in the sun, wear sunglasses and use sunscreen with a high protection factor (SPF 15 or higher).  Can undergo cosmetic procedures while taking ACUTRET 30MG CAPSULE?  No. Do not undergo cosmetic procedures such as skin waxing, dermabrasion, laser, or artificial UV light detanning while taking ACUTRET 30MG CAPSULE or at least for 6 months after stopping it as they could cause scarring, skin irritation, or changes in your skin colour. Consult your doctor before undergoing any cosmetic procedure while taking ACUTRET 30MG CAPSULE.
