name: Acutret 5mg Capsule 10'S
about: INTRODUCTION  ACUTRET 5MG CAPSULE contains Isotretinoin which belongs to the group of medicines called Retinoids. It is used in adults and children (older than 12 years of age) to treat severe form of acne (such as nodular acne, conglobate acne, and acne that is at risk of permanent scarring), which has not improved after other anti-acne treatments. Acne is an inflammatory skin condition which is characterized by spots, oily skin, nodular lesions etc. on face, back, and chest, which can be painful.  During treatment with ACUTRET 5MG CAPSULE your doctor might conduct certain blood tests and pregnancy tests, and you will be supervised by a skin doctor. You will be advised to reduce intensive exercise and physical activity. Before you go out in the sun, use a sunscreen with a high protection factor (SPF 15 or higher).  Avoid too much sun and using a sun-lamp or sun-bed. Avoid consuming alcohol while taking ACUTRET 5MG CAPSULE as it may cause side effects. Do not donate blood while consuming ACUTRET 5MG CAPSULE and after stopping ACUTRET 5MG CAPSULE at least for one month or undergo cosmetic procedures while taking ACUTRET 5MG CAPSULE or at least for 6 months after stopping it.  ACUTRET 5MG CAPSULE is not recommended for use in patients having liver or kidney disease, hyperlipidaemia (high blood lipid levels), high levels of Vitamin A. ACUTRET 5MG CAPSULE should be used with caution in patients who have or had mental illness or family history of mental illness, asthma, diabetes, heart or bone problems like osteoporosis, or eating disorder.  ACUTRET 5MG CAPSULE is not recommended for use in pregnant women, women planning a pregnancy, breast feeding women, and in children (below 12 years of age) so, consult your doctor for advice. ACUTRET 5MG CAPSULE should be used with caution in elderly patients (65 years and older).  ACUTRET 5MG CAPSULE may cause depression, psychosis, suicidal thoughts, or thoughts of self-harm in some patients. Consult your doctor if you experience any such behaviour or thoughts.  Most common side effects of taking ACUTRET 5MG CAPSULE are dry skin of face and lips, joint or muscle pain, headache, easy bruising or bleeding, weakness, etc. Consult your doctor if any of the symptoms deteriorate.
uses: USES OF ACUTRET 5MG CAPSULE Used in adults and children (older than 12 years of age) to treat severe form of acne which has not improved after other anti-acne treatments
working: HOW ACUTRET 5MG CAPSULE WORKS  ACUTRET 5MG CAPSULE helps in treating acne by inhibiting the function of sebaceous glands (oil glands in skin) thus, reducing the secretion of oil (sebum) in the skin. ACUTRET 5MG CAPSULE also inhibits keratinization (development of a horn-like character by the epithelial tissue), which might be a cause of acne.
directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Take ACUTRET 5MG CAPSULE as advised by your physician. Do not crush or chew it. Swallow ACUTRET 5MG CAPSULE as whole with a glass of water or a mouthful of food. Take it on a full stomach. Your doctor will decide the right dose and duration of therapy for you according to your age, body weight and disease condition.
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF ACUTRET 5MG CAPSULE COMMON Dry skin, especially of the lips and face, inflamed skin, chapped and inflamed lips, rash, mild itching, slight peeling More fragile and red skin than usual, especially of the face Back, muscle or joint pain (particularly in children and teenagers) Inflammation of the eye and eyelid area, dry and irritated eyes Raised liver enzymes Changed blood fat and cholesterol levels Easy bruising, bleeding or clotting Anaemia (weakness, dizziness, pale skin) Headache Protein or blood in the urine Becoming more prone to get infections Dry and crusted inside of the nose causing mild nosebleeds Sore or inflamed throat and nose RARE Hair loss  Stop taking ACUTRET 5MG CAPSULE and consult your doctor immediately in case you experience any of the following:  Persistent pain in your lower back or buttocks (signs of sacroiliitis) Severe skin reactions (Ex. erythema multiforme, Stevens-Johnson Syndrome, toxic epidermal necrolysis) (blistering and peeling of skin, severe rashes, fever, multiple lesions especially in mouth, nose, eyes and genitals, conjunctivitis, flu-like symptoms) Depression or related disorders (sad or altered mood, anxiety, emotional discomfort), worsening depression, becoming violent or aggressive Thoughts or feelings about hurting self or ending own lives, suicide attempts or suicide Unusual behaviour Psychosis (loss of contact with reality, like hearing voices or seeing things that are not real) Serious reactions (trouble breathing or swallowing due to sudden swelling of the throat, face, lips and mouth, sudden swelling of the hands, feet and ankles, hives, bruises, eczema, bruising, red patches on hands and legs) Sudden tight chest, breathlessness and wheezing, particularly if you have asthma Rhabdomyolysis (muscle weakness along with trouble moving arms or legs, painful, swollen, bruised areas of the body, dark urine, reduced or no urination, confusion or dehydration) Hepatitis (yellow skin or eyes, tiredness) Kidney inflammation (difficulty urinating, swollen and puffy eyelids, excessive tiredness) Increased intracranial pressure (continuous headache, along with nausea, vomiting and eyesight changes including blurred vision) Serious gut conditions (severe tummy pain, with or without severe bloody diarrhoea, nausea, vomiting) Vision problems like night vision problems, persistent dryness of eyes, intolerance to contact lenses Inflamed pancreas Hearing problems, ringing sound in ears Severe muscle weakness, muscle, joint, back pain, difficulty moving especially after exercise
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY  ACUTRET 5MG CAPSULE is not recommended for use in pregnant women and women planning a pregnancy. Inform your doctor if you become pregnant during treatment with ACUTRET 5MG CAPSULE. It is not recommended to get pregnant for one month after stopping ACUTRET 5MG CAPSULE treatment because some medicine may still be left in your body. Consult your doctor before taking it.  Contraception must be used for a month before taking ACUTRET 5MG CAPSULE, during treatment and for a month afterwards. Discuss with your doctor regarding suitable contraceptive methods.  BREASTFEEDING  ACUTRET 5MG CAPSULE is not recommended for use in breast feeding women as it may pass through breast milk. Consult your doctor before taking it.  DRIVING AND USING MACHINES  Do not drive or operate machinery if you experience dizziness, drowsiness or decreased night vision after taking ACUTRET 5MG CAPSULE.  ALCOHOL  Avoid consuming alcohol while taking ACUTRET 5MG CAPSULE as it may increase side effects. Inform your doctor if you are an alcoholic.  KIDNEY  ACUTRET 5MG CAPSULE should be used with caution in patients with kidney problems. Consult your doctor before taking it.  LIVER  ACUTRET 5MG CAPSULE is not recommended for use in patients with liver disease. Consult your doctor before taking it.  ALLERGY  Do not take ACUTRET 5MG CAPSULE if you are allergic to Isotretinoin, soya, peanuts or any of the other ingredients of this medicine.  LUNGS  ACUTRET 5MG CAPSULE should be used with caution in patients having asthma. Consult your doctor before taking it.  OTHERS  ACUTRET 5MG CAPSULE is not recommended for use if you have:  High blood fat levels High levels of Vitamin A  Before taking ACUTRET 5MG CAPSULE inform your doctor if you:  Have or had mental illness or family history of mental illness such as depression, mood disorders, psychosis, aggressive behaviour, or hurting or killing self Have diabetes Are fructose intolerant Are overweight  Use in paediatrics:  ACUTRET 5MG CAPSULE is not recommended for use in children below 12 years of age. ACUTRET 5MG CAPSULE can be used in adolescents (more than 12 years of age) only after puberty. Consult your child’s doctor for advice.  Use in geriatrics:  There is no proper information about the use of ACUTRET 5MG CAPSULE in elderly patients. Consult your doctor before taking it.
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug-Drug interactions:  Before taking ACUTRET 5MG CAPSULE, inform your doctor if you are taking any of the following medicines:  Vitamin A supplements Medicines used to treat bacterial infections (Ex. minocycline, doxycycline) Phenytoin (used to treat fits) Medicines used to treat various inflammatory conditions (Ex. betamethasone, prednisolone, dexamethasone) Medicines used to prevent pregnancy (Ex. Norethindrone, ethinyl Oestradiol) St. John’s wort (herbal medicine used to treat mental disorders) Other medicines used to treat acne like keratolytic or exfoliative agents (Ex. salicylic acid, benzoyl peroxide)  Overdosage:  In case you or anybody else accidently take too much of ACUTRET 5MG CAPSULE, consult your doctor immediately or visit the nearby hospital. Symptoms of ACUTRET 5MG CAPSULE overdose are severe headache, abdominal pain, nausea, dizziness, redness of face, vomiting, somnolence, irritability, and itching.

name: Adabor Gel 15gm
about: INTRODUCTION  ADABOR GEL is a combination of Adapalene and Benzoyl peroxide which belongs to the group of medicines called Antiacne agents. It is used in the treatment of acne.  Acne vulgaris (commonly known as acne) is an inflammatory skin condition that occurs when the hair follicles present in the skin are clogged with excess oil and/or dead skin cells. It can also be aggravated by few bacteria (such as Propionibacterium acnes) and is highly common among on the teenagers and the young adults.  It primarily affects the face, upper arms, trunk or back and is often characterized by pus-filled pimples, red bumps with inflammatory and non-inflammatory lesions. ADABOR GEL is suitable for use both in adults and in children (aged 9 years or older).  Apply a thin layer of ADABOR GEL on the affected skin areas. Avoid contact of this medicine with your eyes, mouth, ears, nose or with open wounds. You must also protect your skin against sun light and against other light sources (such as UV lamps).  Do not use ADABOR GEL if you are pregnant, think you may be pregnant or planning to have a baby. ADABOR GEL can be used in breastfeeding women if required. The most common side effects of using ADABOR GEL are dry skin, mild burning sensation and skin irritation, redness or scaling. Consult your doctor if they trouble you.
uses: USES OF ADABOR GEL  It is used in adults, children and in adolescents (aged 9 years or older) to:  Treat acne
working: HOW ADABOR GEL WORKS  ADABOR GEL is a combination of two medicines namely, adapalene and benzoyl peroxide.  Adapalene is a topical retinoid (a type of vitamin A). It modulates the skin cell cycle and prevents the accumulation of excess sebum (natural oil produced by the skin) and dead skin cells on the hair follicles of the skin. It also reduces inflammation on the skin.  Benzoyl peroxide is a keratolytic agent with antimicrobial properties. It improves skin’s tendency to exfoliate the dead skin cells naturally. It also reduces the number of acne-causing bacteria on the skin which can reduce the further spread of acne.  Collectively, they unclog the hair follicles of the skin and exfoliates dead skin cells which reduces acne breakouts.
directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Apply a thin layer of this medicine on the affected skin areas or as directed by the physician. It is for topical use only. Wash your hands before and after application.  Your doctor will decide the correct dose and duration of therapy for you depending upon your age, body weight and health condition.  Avoid contact of ADABOR GEL with your eyes, mouth, ears, nose, hair or with open wounds (cuts, scrapes or sunburn).
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF ADABOR GEL COMMON Dry skin Skin redness and scaling Burning sensation of the skin Skin irritation UNCOMMON Itching of the skin (pruritus) Sunburn RARE  Stop using ADABOR GEL and consult your doctor immediately if you experience:  Signs of allergic reaction (such as severe skin rash with itching of body parts, swelling of the eyes, face, lips or tongue causing throat tightness and breathing difficulties and feel faint)
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY  ADABOR GEL is not recommended for use in pregnant women. Therefore, inform your doctor before using this medicine if you are pregnant, think you may be pregnant or planning to have a baby. If you became pregnant while using this medicine, stop using it and contact your doctor immediately.  BREASTFEEDING  ADABOR GEL can be used in breastfeeding women. However, do not apply this medicine on your chest to avoid exposing this medicine to the nursing infant.  ALLERGY  Talk to your doctor if you are allergic to Adapalene or Benzoyl peroxide.  OTHERS  ADABOR GEL is not recommended for use if you:  Have any cuts, scrapes, sunburn or eczema at the site of application  Use in Pediatrics:  ADABOR GEL can be used in children and adolescents (aged 9 years or older) if advised by the physician. Therefore, consult your doctor before using it.
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug-Drug interactions:  Before using ADABOR GEL, inform your doctor if you are using any of the following:  Other anti-acne medicines (such as clindamycin) Skin cosmetics (such as hair perming solutions, astringents, toners, shaving lotion, abrasive soaps or cleansers)  Overdosage:  If you or anyone else applied excessive amount of ADABOR GEL, rinse your skin with plenty of cold water. If irritation persists, consult your doctor.
synopsis: SYNOPSIS Drug	:  	Adapalene, Benzoyl peroxide Pharmacological Category	:  	Retinoid-like compounds, Topical Antibiotics Therapeutic Indication	:  	Acne vulgaris Dosage Forms	:  	Topical Gel
moreInfo: MORE INFORMATION Keep ADABOR GEL out of reach of children Store ADABOR GEL at room temperature
faqs: FAQs ABOUT ADABOR GEL  Will ADABOR GEL be more effective if I overuse it?  No. Do not overuse this medicine. If you use more, you will not get rid of acne quicker. Instead, it may make your skin more irritated and red. Therefore, only apply the quantity mentioned by your doctor.  What are the side effects of using ADABOR GEL?  ADABOR GEL is generally safe with limited or no side effects. However, you may experience skin dryness, redness or irritation after applying this medicine. Contact your doctor if it troubles you.  What is the use of ADABOR GEL?  ADABOR GEL is used in the treatment of acne.  How ADABOR GEL works?  ADABOR GEL prevents the accumulation of excess sebum (natural oil produced by the skin) and dead skin cells on the hair follicles of the skin. It also reduces inflammation on the skin and improves skin’s tendency to exfoliate the dead skin cells naturally. It also reduces the number of acne-causing bacteria on the skin which can reduce the further spread of acne.  How to use ADABOR GEL?  ADABOR GEL is for external use only. Take the required quantity of the medicine and apply on the affected skin areas. Avoid contact of this medicine with your eyes, ears, nose or any other mucous membranes.  How long does it take for ADABOR GEL to work?  It may take up to 2-3 weeks for ADABOR GEL to show improvement in your skin condition. However, this period may vary from person-to-person depending upon the skin condition.  How long should I use ADABOR GEL?  Your doctor will decide the correct dose and duration of therapy for you depending upon your age, body weight and health condition. You need to use ADABOR GEL for the stipulated duration prescribed by your doctor. Failing to do so may not result in adequate response.  What to do if I forgot to apply ADABOR GEL?  If you forgot to apply ADABOR GEL, apply it as soon as you remember. However, if it is time for the next application, skip the missed one and apply the next dose. Do not excessively apply ADABOR GEL to compensate the missed doses.  Is ADABOR GEL safe?  ADABOR GEL is safe at doses prescribed by the physician. Therefore, do not alter the dose of ADABOR GEL without consulting your doctor.  Can I stop using ADABOR GEL without consulting your doctor?  No. You should not stop using ADABOR GEL without consulting your doctor as it may reduce its effectiveness. Therefore, apply ADABOR GEL for the stipulated duration recommended by your doctor to achieve maximum results.  Can ADABOR GEL be used in pregnant women?  ADABOR GEL is not recommended for use in pregnant women. Therefore, inform your doctor before using this medicine if you are pregnant, think you may be pregnant or planning to have a baby. If you became pregnant while using this medicine, stop using it and contact your doctor immediately.

name: Adaferin Gel 15gm
faqs: FAQs ABOUT ADAFERIN GEL Q: Can ADAFERIN GEL be used in the morning?  A: Apply ADAFERIN GEL as advised by your physician. It is best when applied at night and washed off in the morning since it is sensitive to sunlight. Consult your doctor for further queries.  Q: Can ADAFERIN GEL cause skin irritation?  A: ADAFERIN GEL may cause slight sensation of warmth and stinging after applying it for the initial 2-4 weeks. However, during the long-term usage this side effect usually disappears. Consult your doctor in case of any queries.  Q: Can ADAFERIN GEL be used daily?  A: In many cases, ADAFERIN GEL products are initially used once daily in the evening. However, some individuals may be advised to start with less frequent applications to allow the skin to adjust, and then gradually increase the frequency.  Q: Can ADAFERIN GEL make skin darker?  A: ADAFERIN GEL doesn’t make skin darker. Instead, it can slightly make the skin lighter by healing acne, pimples, blackheads and spots. Consult your doctor for further queries.  Q: Can I go outside after applying ADAFERIN GEL?  A: No, avoid going out after applying ADAFERIN GEL as it can cause local irritation and skin discomfort. It is best used at night. Consult the doctor for further assistance.  Q: Can ADAFERIN GEL be used for other skin conditions?  A: ADAFERIN GEL is primarily indicated for acne, but it may also be used off-label to manage other skin conditions such as keratosis pilaris (a common, harmless skin condition characterized by small, rough bumps on the skin).  Q: Can ADAFERIN GEL be used with other acne medications?  A: It's generally not recommended to use ADAFERIN GEL with other topical acne medications containing benzoyl peroxide, sulphur, resorcinol, or salicylic acid, as they may increase the risk of skin irritation. However, your healthcare provider may prescribe a combination regimen if deemed appropriate.  Q: Can ADAFERIN GEL be applied under makeup or moisturizers?  A: Yes, ADAFERIN GEL can be applied under makeup or moisturizers once it has been fully absorbed into the skin. It's important to allow the gel to dry completely before applying any other skincare products to avoid potential interactions or reduced effectiveness.  Q: Can ADAFERIN GEL be used for acne scars?  A: ADAFERIN GEL is primarily indicated for the management of acne lesions and may help improve the appearance of post-inflammatory hyperpigmentation (dark spots) caused by acne. However, it may have limited efficacy in managing deeper acne scars or pitted scars. Consult your healthcare provider for more information.  Q: Can ADAFERIN GEL be used during pregnancy or breastfeeding?  A: It's important to consult your healthcare provider before using ADAFERIN GEL if you are pregnant, planning to become pregnant, or breastfeeding. While topical retinoids are generally considered safe during pregnancy, it's best to discuss the potential risks and benefits with your doctor.

name: Adalene Nano Gel 15gm
about: INTRODUCTION  ADALENE NANO contains a combination of Adapalene and Clindamycin, which belongs to the group of medicines called topical retinoids and lincomycin antibiotics. It is used in the treatment of skin acne (pimple). Acne is a condition of the skin when the root of your hair (hair follicle) or skin pores gets clogged by oil or dead skin, which becomes prone to bacterial infection and the formation of pimples, blackheads, spots and scars.  Adapalene is a form of vitamin A, that acts as an antiacne agent by binding directly to the receptor of the skin which increases the rate of cell turnover (cell regeneration) and decreases oil secretion preventing clogging of the hair follicles and pores, also decreasing swelling/inflammation. Clindamycin works by binding to the ribosomal unit of the bacteria and disrupts the production of the protein essential for its survival. Before recommending ADALENE NANO, your doctor may advise you to have tests to understand your existing condition for planning effective treatment methods. Stay well hydrated and protect your skin from exposure to sunlight or UV light.  Do not apply ADALENE NANO if you are allergic to adapalene or clindamycin, a disorder of the digestive system (colitis), a disorder of the immune system or have bruises, cuts or burns on the skin. The common side effects of using this medicine may include dry skin, burning, itching, redness or irritative sensation of the skin, scaling peeling of the skin etc.
uses: USES OF ADALENE NANO To treat acne
working: HOW ADALENE NANO WORKS  Adapalene, a form of vitamin A, works as an antiacne medicine by attaching directly to the skin's receptor, which increases cell turnover (cell regeneration) and decreases oil secretion preventing blockage of the hair follicles and pores. It also reduces swelling/inflammation of the skin. Clindamycin works by attaching to the bacteria's ribosomal unit and disrupting the production of a protein required for its very own survival.
directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Apply ADALENE NANO as advised by your doctor. It is for external use on the skin only. Avoid applying ADALENE NANO around or onto your eyes, including eyelids.
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF ADALENE NANO COMMON Dryness of the skin Burning, itching, redness of the skin Scaling and or peeling of the skin UNCOMMON Flaring of acne Sunburns Local skin reaction  Stop using this medicine and contact your doctor immediately if you experience any of the following side effects:  Severe allergic reactions (such as skin rash, itching, swelling of the face, lips, tongue and other parts of the body, difficulty in breathing or wheezing, blisters on the skin, sore throat, fever, headache etc.)
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY  ADALENE NANO is not recommended for use in pregnant women. Consult your doctor for advice if you are pregnant or suspect/planning pregnancy.  BREASTFEEDING  ADALENE NANO is to be used with caution in breastfeeding mothers after consulting your doctor. The safe use of ADALENE NANO in breastfeeding women and breastfed baby is not established.  DRIVING AND USING MACHINES  ADALENE NANO may not interfere with your ability to drive or use the machine. However, protect your skin from sun or UV light while travelling and follow appropriate protective measures recommended by your doctor.  ALCOHOL  The risks associated with consuming alcohol are not known. It’s advised to avoid the consumption of alcohol while using ADALENE NANO, as it could aggravate your existing condition.  ALLERGY  Talk to your doctor if you are allergic to Adapalene and/or Clindamycin.  OTHERS  ADALENE NANO is not recommended for use if you:  Cuts or bruises on the skin Sunburns Skin conditions like eczema (itching, dry and red skin)  Use in pediatrics:  ADALENE NANO is not recommended for use in children less than 12 years of age. Consult your doctor for advice.  Use in geriatrics:  ADALENE NANO should be used with caution in the elderly (above 65 years of age) after consulting your doctor for advice.
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug-Drug interactions:  Inform your physician, if you are taking or using,  Medicated soap for skin, other cosmetic products with a high concentration of alcohol, astringents, sulfur,  Resorcinol – use for itching or irritation of the skin and scalp, loss of hair, dandruff etc. Salicylic acid – used for skin acne, dandruff, etc. Atracurium, cisatracurium, succinylcholine – used to relax muscles  B. name: ADAMYCIN Gel 15gm
about: INTRODUCTION  ADAMYCIN contains a combination of Adapalene and Clindamycin, which belongs to the group of medicines called topical retinoids and lincomycin antibiotics. It is used in the treatment of skin acne (pimple). Acne is a condition of the skin when the root of your hair (hair follicle) or skin pores gets clogged by oil or dead skin, which becomes prone to bacterial infection and the formation of pimples, blackheads, spots and scars.  Adapalene is a form of vitamin A, that acts as an antiacne agent by binding directly to the receptor of the skin which increases the rate of cell turnover (cell regeneration) and decreases oil secretion preventing clogging of the hair follicles and pores, also decreasing swelling/inflammation. Clindamycin works by binding to the ribosomal unit of the bacteria and disrupts the production of the protein essential for its survival. Before recommending ADAMYCIN, your doctor may advise you to have tests to understand your existing condition for planning effective treatment methods. Stay well hydrated and protect your skin from exposure to sunlight or UV light.  Do not apply ADAMYCIN if you are allergic to adapalene or clindamycin, a disorder of the digestive system (colitis), a disorder of the immune system or have bruises, cuts or burns on the skin. The common side effects of using this medicine may include dry skin, burning, itching, redness or irritative sensation of the skin, scaling peeling of the skin etc.
uses: USES OF ADAMYCIN To treat acne

It also reduces swelling/inflammation of the skin. Clindamycin works by attaching to the bacteria's ribosomal unit and disrupting the production of a protein required for its very own survival.

name: Adapen Gel 15gm
faqs: FAQs ABOUT ADAPEN GEL Q: Can ADAPEN GEL be used in the morning?  A: Apply ADAPEN GEL as advised by your physician. It is best when applied at night and washed off in the morning since it is sensitive to sunlight. Consult your doctor for further queries.  Q: Can ADAPEN GEL cause skin irritation?  A: ADAPEN GEL may cause slight sensation of warmth and stinging after applying it for the initial 2-4 weeks. However, during the long-term usage this side effect usually disappears. Consult your doctor in case of any queries.  Q: Can ADAPEN GEL be used daily?  A: In many cases, ADAPEN GEL products are initially used once daily in the evening. However, some individuals may be advised to start with less frequent applications to allow the skin to adjust, and then gradually increase the frequency.  Q: Can ADAPEN GEL make skin darker?  A: ADAPEN GEL doesn’t make skin darker. Instead, it can slightly make the skin lighter by healing acne, pimples, blackheads and spots. Consult your doctor for further queries.  Q: Can I go outside after applying ADAPEN GEL?  A: No, avoid going out after applying ADAPEN GEL as it can cause local irritation and skin discomfort. It is best used at night. Consult the doctor for further assistance.  Q: Can ADAPEN GEL be used for other skin conditions?  A: ADAPEN GEL is primarily indicated for acne, but it may also be used off-label to manage other skin conditions such as keratosis pilaris (a common, harmless skin condition characterized by small, rough bumps on the skin).  Q: Can ADAPEN GEL be used with other acne medications?  A: It's generally not recommended to use ADAPEN GEL with other topical acne medications containing benzoyl peroxide, sulphur, resorcinol, or salicylic acid, as they may increase the risk of skin irritation. However, your healthcare provider may prescribe a combination regimen if deemed appropriate.  Q: Can ADAPEN GEL be applied under makeup or moisturizers?  A: Yes, ADAPEN GEL can be applied under makeup or moisturizers once it has been fully absorbed into the skin. It's important to allow the gel to dry completely before applying any other skincare products to avoid potential interactions or reduced effectiveness.  Q: Can ADAPEN GEL be used for acne scars?  A: ADAPEN GEL is primarily indicated for the management of acne lesions and may help improve the appearance of post-inflammatory hyperpigmentation (dark spots) caused by acne. However, it may have limited efficacy in managing deeper acne scars or pitted scars. Consult your healthcare provider for more information.  Q: Can ADAPEN GEL be used during pregnancy or breastfeeding?  A: It's important to consult your healthcare provider before using ADAPEN GEL if you are pregnant, planning to become pregnant, or breastfeeding. While topical retinoids are generally considered safe during pregnancy, it's best to discuss the potential risks and benefits with your doctor.
authorDetails: AUTHOR DETAILS  Written By Srilekha. R, B.Pharm Last updated on 19 Feb 2024 | 12:19 PM(IST)

name: ADAPERO Gel(Topical) 15gm
about: INTRODUCTION  ADAPERO GEL(TOPICAL) is a combination of Adapalene and Benzoyl peroxide which belongs to the group of medicines called Antiacne agents. It is used in the treatment of acne.  Acne vulgaris (commonly known as acne) is an inflammatory skin condition that occurs when the hair follicles present in the skin are clogged with excess oil and/or dead skin cells. It can also be aggravated by few bacteria (such as Propionibacterium acnes) and is highly common among on the teenagers and the young adults.  It primarily affects the face, upper arms, trunk or back and is often characterized by pus-filled pimples, red bumps with inflammatory and non-inflammatory lesions. ADAPERO GEL(TOPICAL) is suitable for use both in adults and in children (aged 9 years or older).  Apply a thin layer of ADAPERO GEL(TOPICAL) on the affected skin areas. Avoid contact of this medicine with your eyes, mouth, ears, nose or with open wounds. You must also protect your skin against sun light and against other light sources (such as UV lamps).  Do not use ADAPERO GEL(TOPICAL) if you are pregnant, think you may be pregnant or planning to have a baby. ADAPERO GEL(TOPICAL) can be used in breastfeeding women if required. The most common side effects of using ADAPERO GEL(TOPICAL) are dry skin, mild burning sensation and skin irritation, redness or scaling. Consult your doctor if they trouble you.
uses: USES OF ADAPERO GEL(TOPICAL)  It is used in adults, children and in adolescents (aged 9 years or older) to:  Treat acne
working: HOW ADAPERO GEL(TOPICAL) WORKS  ADAPERO GEL(TOPICAL) is a combination of two medicines namely, adapalene and benzoyl peroxide.  Adapalene is a topical retinoid (a type of vitamin A). It modulates the skin cell cycle and prevents the accumulation of excess sebum (natural oil produced by the skin) and dead skin cells on the hair follicles of the skin. It also reduces inflammation on the skin.  Benzoyl peroxide is a keratolytic agent with antimicrobial properties. It improves skin’s tendency to exfoliate the dead skin cells naturally. It also reduces the number of acne-causing bacteria on the skin which can reduce the further spread of acne.  Collectively, they unclog the hair follicles of the skin and exfoliates dead skin cells which reduces acne breakouts.
directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Apply a thin layer of this medicine on the affected skin areas or as directed by the physician. It is for topical use only. Wash your hands before and after application.  Your doctor will decide the correct dose and duration of therapy for you depending upon your age, body weight and health condition.  Avoid contact of ADAPERO GEL(TOPICAL) with your eyes, mouth, ears, nose, hair or with open wounds (cuts, scrapes or sunburn).
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF ADAPERO GEL(TOPICAL) COMMON Dry skin Skin redness and scaling Burning sensation of the skin Skin irritation UNCOMMON Itching of the skin (pruritus) Sunburn RARE  Stop using ADAPERO GEL(TOPICAL) and consult your doctor immediately if you experience:  Signs of allergic reaction (such as severe skin rash with itching of body parts, swelling of the eyes, face, lips or tongue causing throat tightness and breathing difficulties and feel faint)
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY  ADAPERO GEL(TOPICAL) is not recommended for use in pregnant women. Therefore, inform your doctor before using this medicine if you are pregnant, think you may be pregnant or planning to have a baby. If you became pregnant while using this medicine, stop using it and contact your doctor immediately.  BREASTFEEDING  ADAPERO GEL(TOPICAL) can be used in breastfeeding women. However, do not apply this medicine on your chest to avoid exposing this medicine to the nursing infant.  ALLERGY  Talk to your doctor if you are allergic to Adapalene or Benzoyl peroxide.  OTHERS  ADAPERO GEL(TOPICAL) is not recommended for use if you:  Have any cuts, scrapes, sunburn or eczema at the site of application  Use in Pediatrics:  ADAPERO GEL(TOPICAL) can be used in children and adolescents (aged 9 years or older) if advised by the physician. Therefore, consult your doctor before using it.
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug-Drug interactions:  Before using ADAPERO GEL(TOPICAL), inform your doctor if you are using any of the following:  Other anti-acne medicines (such as clindamycin) Skin cosmetics (such as hair perming solutions, astringents, toners, shaving lotion, abrasive soaps or cleansers)  Overdosage:  If you or anyone else applied excessive amount of ADAPERO GEL(TOPICAL), rinse your skin with plenty of cold water. If irritation persists, consult your doctor.
synopsis: SYNOPSIS Drug	:  	Adapalene, Benzoyl peroxide Pharmacological Category	:  	Retinoid-like compounds, Topical Antibiotics Therapeutic Indication	:  	Acne vulgaris Dosage Forms	:  	Topical Gel
moreInfo: MORE INFORMATION Keep ADAPERO GEL(TOPICAL) out of reach of children Store ADAPERO GEL(TOPICAL) at room temperature
faqs: FAQs ABOUT ADAPERO GEL(TOPICAL)  Will ADAPERO GEL(TOPICAL) be more effective if I overuse it?  No. Do not overuse this medicine. If you use more, you will not get rid of acne quicker. Instead, it may make your skin more irritated and red. Therefore, only apply the quantity mentioned by your doctor.  What are the side effects of using ADAPERO GEL(TOPICAL)?  ADAPERO GEL(TOPICAL) is generally safe with limited or no side effects. However, you may experience skin dryness, redness or irritation after applying this medicine. Contact your doctor if it troubles you.  What is the use of ADAPERO GEL(TOPICAL)?  ADAPERO GEL(TOPICAL) is used in the treatment of acne.  How ADAPERO GEL(TOPICAL) works?  ADAPERO GEL(TOPICAL) prevents the accumulation of excess sebum (natural oil produced by the skin) and dead skin cells on the hair follicles of the skin. It also reduces inflammation on the skin and improves skin’s tendency to exfoliate the dead skin cells naturally. It also reduces the number of acne-causing bacteria on the skin which can reduce the further spread of acne.  How to use ADAPERO GEL(TOPICAL)?  ADAPERO GEL(TOPICAL) is for external use only. Take the required quantity of the medicine and apply on the affected skin areas. Avoid contact of this medicine with your eyes, ears, nose or any other mucous membranes.  How long does it take for ADAPERO GEL(TOPICAL) to work?  It may take up to 2-3 weeks for ADAPERO GEL(TOPICAL) to show improvement in your skin condition. However, this period may vary from person-to-person depending upon the skin condition.  How long should I use ADAPERO GEL(TOPICAL)?  Your doctor will decide the correct dose and duration of therapy for you depending upon your age, body weight and health condition. You need to use ADAPERO GEL(TOPICAL) for the stipulated duration prescribed by your doctor. Failing to do so may not result in adequate response.  What to do if I forgot to apply ADAPERO GEL(TOPICAL)?  If you forgot to apply ADAPERO GEL(TOPICAL), apply it as soon as you remember. However, if it is time for the next application, skip the missed one and apply the next dose. Do not excessively apply ADAPERO GEL(TOPICAL) to compensate the missed doses.  Is ADAPERO GEL(TOPICAL) safe?  ADAPERO GEL(TOPICAL) is safe at doses prescribed by the physician. Therefore, do not alter the dose of ADAPERO GEL(TOPICAL) without consulting your doctor.  Can I stop using ADAPERO GEL(TOPICAL) without consulting your doctor?  No. You should not stop using ADAPERO GEL(TOPICAL) without consulting your doctor as it may reduce its effectiveness. Therefore, apply ADAPERO GEL(TOPICAL) for the stipulated duration recommended by your doctor to achieve maximum results.  Can ADAPERO GEL(TOPICAL) be used in pregnant women?  ADAPERO GEL(TOPICAL) is not recommended for use in pregnant women. Therefore, inform your doctor before using this medicine if you are pregnant, think you may be pregnant or planning to have a baby. If you became pregnant while using this medicine, stop using it and contact your doctor immediately.

Consult your doctor for advice.  Use in geriatrics:  ADAPLE C GEL should be used with caution in the elderly (above 65 years of age) after consulting your doctor for advice.
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug-Drug interactions:  Inform your physician, if you are taking or using,  Medicated soap for skin, other cosmetic products with a high concentration of alcohol, astringents, sulfur,  Resorcinol – use for itching or irritation of the skin and scalp, loss of hair, dandruff etc. Salicylic acid – used for skin acne, dandruff, etc. Atracurium, cisatracurium, succinylcholine – used to relax muscles  B. Drug-Food interaction:  The interaction of foods with ADAPLE C GEL is not known. Consult your doctor for diet advice.  Overdosage:  In case of using ADAPLE C GEL in excess than recommended, you may experience dryness, scaling, redness and discomfort of the skin. Contact your doctor immediately for advice.
synopsis: SYNOPSIS Drug	:  	Adapalene, Clindamycin Pharmacological Category	:  	Topical retinoids and Antibiotics Therapeutic Indication	:  	Treat acne Dosage Forms	:  	Gel (topical), Gel, Cream, Ointment
moreInfo: MORE INFORMATION Keep out of reach from children Store at room temperature Keep away from sunlight
faqs: FAQs ABOUT ADAPLE C GEL  Can ADAPLE C GEL be used to treat scars on the skin?  Yes. Adapalene is a kind of vitamin A that reduces swelling and inflammation while also treating acne scars. Azithromycin is used to treat infections that cause skin infections to worsen.  Can ADAPLE C GEL result in skin peeling?  Yes. Dryness of the skin, burning, itching, redness of the skin, skin irritation, scaling, and possibly peeling of the skin are all possible side effects of using this medicine.  Can [GBBNKEYWORD] cause skin dryness?  Yes. Your skin may get dry as a result of taking this medication. Maintain hydration and use the moisturiser that your doctor has prescribed.  How long can I use ADAPLE C GEL?  Use ADAPLE C GEL as advised by your doctor. Generally, it’s recommended for use depending on the severity of the existing skin condition.  Can I stop using ADAPLE C GEL on my own?  No. It is not recommended to stop using ADAPLE C GEL on your own as it may worsen the existing skin condition. Consult your doctor for advice.

name: Adapnil Gel 15gm
faqs: FAQs ABOUT ADAPNIL GEL Q: Can ADAPNIL GEL be used in the morning?  A: Apply ADAPNIL GEL as advised by your physician. It is best when applied at night and washed off in the morning since it is sensitive to sunlight. Consult your doctor for further queries.  Q: Can ADAPNIL GEL cause skin irritation?  A: ADAPNIL GEL may cause slight sensation of warmth and stinging after applying it for the initial 2-4 weeks. However, during the long-term usage this side effect usually disappears. Consult your doctor in case of any queries.  Q: Can ADAPNIL GEL be used daily?  A: In many cases, ADAPNIL GEL products are initially used once daily in the evening. However, some individuals may be advised to start with less frequent applications to allow the skin to adjust, and then gradually increase the frequency.  Q: Can ADAPNIL GEL make skin darker?  A: ADAPNIL GEL doesn’t make skin darker. Instead, it can slightly make the skin lighter by healing acne, pimples, blackheads and spots. Consult your doctor for further queries.  Q: Can I go outside after applying ADAPNIL GEL?  A: No, avoid going out after applying ADAPNIL GEL as it can cause local irritation and skin discomfort. It is best used at night. Consult the doctor for further assistance.  Q: Can ADAPNIL GEL be used for other skin conditions?  A: ADAPNIL GEL is primarily indicated for acne, but it may also be used off-label to manage other skin conditions such as keratosis pilaris (a common, harmless skin condition characterized by small, rough bumps on the skin).  Q: Can ADAPNIL GEL be used with other acne medications?  A: It's generally not recommended to use ADAPNIL GEL with other topical acne medications containing benzoyl peroxide, sulphur, resorcinol, or salicylic acid, as they may increase the risk of skin irritation. However, your healthcare provider may prescribe a combination regimen if deemed appropriate.  Q: Can ADAPNIL GEL be applied under makeup or moisturizers?  A: Yes, ADAPNIL GEL can be applied under makeup or moisturizers once it has been fully absorbed into the skin. It's important to allow the gel to dry completely before applying any other skincare products to avoid potential interactions or reduced effectiveness.  Q: Can ADAPNIL GEL be used for acne scars?  A: ADAPNIL GEL is primarily indicated for the management of acne lesions and may help improve the appearance of post-inflammatory hyperpigmentation (dark spots) caused by acne. However, it may have limited efficacy in managing deeper acne scars or pitted scars. Consult your healthcare provider for more information.  Q: Can ADAPNIL GEL be used during pregnancy or breastfeeding?  A: It's important to consult your healthcare provider before using ADAPNIL GEL if you are pregnant, planning to become pregnant, or breastfeeding. While topical retinoids are generally considered safe during pregnancy, it's best to discuss the potential risks and benefits with your doctor.
authorDetails: AUTHOR DETAILS  Written By Srilekha. R, B.Pharm Last updated on 19 Feb 2024 | 12:19 PM(IST)

name: Aknaybar Bathing Bar 100gm
about: INTRODUCTION  Aknaybar Bathing Bar helps to prevent and manage acne or pimples. It contains Syndet base, Benzoyl peroxide, Zinc PCA and Azelaic acid as active ingredients.  Syndet base contains surfactants that help in cleansing out dirt and impurities. Benzoyl peroxide exhibits antibacterial activity by inhibiting bacteria on the skin surface that are responsible for causing acne. Zinc PCA exhibits anti-inflammatory action on the acne and helping to reduce the associated swelling and redness accompanying breakouts. Azelaic acid has both anti-inflammatory and antibacterial properties that stops the progression of the breakouts.  Use Aknaybar Bathing Bar as advised by your doctor. It is for external use only. Avoid contact with eyes. Do not use if you are allergic to any of its ingredients.
authorDetails: AUTHOR DETAILS  Written By Dr. Janet.C, Pharm.D Last updated on 06 Sep 2023 | 04:21 PM(IST)

name: AKNEGATE CN Gel 20gm
about: INTRODUCTION  AKNEGATE CN GEL is a combination of Clindamycin and Nicotinamide which belongs to a group of medicines called Lincomycin antibiotics and Vitamin B3 complex, respectively. AKNEGATE CN GEL is used to treat mild to moderate acne which is a skin condition that occurs when hair follicles become plugged with oil and dead skin cells which may occur due to variety of causes such as genetics, fluctuating hormone levels, stress, high humidity or using oily or greasy personal care products which may affect people of all ages.  It is characterized by symptoms such as open or closed plugged pores, small red & tender bumps, pimples, large, solid or painful lumps under the skin and painful & pus-filled lumps under the skin.  Before using AKNEGATE CN GEL inform your doctor if you have liver, kidney, lung or heart diseases. Avoid applying AKNEGATE CN GEL to a cut, scrapped, sunburnt or eczema affected skin.  AKNEGATE CN GEL should be used with caution in pregnant and in breastfeeding women. AKNEGATE CN GEL is not recommended for use in children and adolescents (below 12 years). Consult your doctor before applying.  The most common side effects of using AKNEGATE CN GEL are skin inflammation, contact dermatitis (red, itchy rash), inflammation of hair follicles, itchy skin, dry skin and peeling of skin. Consult your doctor if any of these symptoms worsen.
uses: USES OF AKNEGATE CN GEL Treats mild to moderate acne
working: HOW AKNEGATE CN GEL WORKS  AKNEGATE CN GEL helps to treat acne, where Clindamycin reduces free fatty acid concentrations on the skin and suppresses the growth of Propionibacterium acnes (Corynebacterium acnes), a bacteria found in sebaceous glands and follicles and Nicotinamide exerts anti-inflammatory effect in acne and interrupts sebum production.
directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Apply AKNEGATE CN GEL as advised by your physician. It is for external use only. Before applying the medicine normally wash and dry the affected area and apply a thin layer of this medicine on the affected area. Treated areas on the face need not be covered with a plaster or bandage. Do not apply this medicine beyond the recommended duration. Avoid applying AKNEGATE CN GEL around your eyes, including eyelids. Rinse it off with water if you accidentally get it in these areas.
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF AKNEGATE CN GEL COMMON Contact dermatitis (red, itchy rash) Inflammation of hair follicles Itchy skin Dry skin Peeling of skin
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY  AKNEGATE CN GEL should be used with caution in pregnant women. Consult your doctor before applying.  BREASTFEEDING  AKNEGATE CN GEL should be used with caution in breastfeeding women. Consult your doctor before applying.  ALLERGY  AKNEGATE CN GEL is not recommended for use if you are allergic to Clindamycin, Nicotinamide or any other ingredients of this medicine.  OTHERS  AKNEGATE CN GEL is not recommended for use if you have:  Eczema (skin inflammation) Cut, scrapped, sunburnt skin  Use in Pediatrics:  AKNEGATE CN GEL is not recommended for use in children and adolescents (below 12 years). Consult your doctor before using it for your child.  Use in Geriatrics:  There is no information on the use of AKNEGATE CN GEL in elderly patients. Consult with your doctor before using.
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug - Drug interactions:  Before using AKNEGATE CN GEL, inform your doctor if you are taking any of the following medicines:  Acepromazine (used a sedative/tranquilizer) Acetaminophen (used to treat pain and inflammation)  Overdosage:  If you or anyone else accidentally ingests or applies too much of AKNEGATE CN GEL, consult your doctor immediately or visit the nearby hospital.
synopsis: SYNOPSIS Drug	:  	Clindamycin, Nicotinamide Pharmacological Category	:  	Lincomycin antibiotics, Vitamin B3 complex Therapeutic Indication	:  	Mild to moderate acne Dosage Forms	:  	Gel, Cream, Ointment
moreInfo: MORE INFORMATION Keep AKNEGATE CN GEL out of reach of children Store AKNEGATE CN GEL at a temperature below 25°C
faqs: FAQs ABOUT AKNEGATE CN GEL  What special precautions should I follow while using AKNEGATE CN GEL?  Before using AKNEGATE CN GEL inform your doctor if you have liver, kidney, lung or heart diseases. Avoid applying AKNEGATE CN GEL to a cut, scrapped, sunburnt or eczema affected skin. This medicine is not for oral, ophthalmic or intravaginal use.  What is AKNEGATE CN GEL used for?  AKNEGATE CN GEL is indicated for the treatment of mild to moderate acne in patients above 12 years of age. Do not use it for any other condition other than that prescribed by your doctor.  How should I use AKNEGATE CN GEL?  Always apply AKNEGATE CN GEL, as directed by your physician. It is for external use only. On the affected area, apply a thin layer of this medicine. Treated areas on the face need not be covered with a plaster or bandage. Do not apply this medicine on your face beyond 5 days. Avoid applying AKNEGATE CN GEL around your eyes, including eyelids.  Is AKNEGATE CN GEL safe to use in pregnant and breastfeeding women?  AKNEGATE CN GEL should be used with caution during pregnancy, women planning for pregnancy and in breastfeeding women. Consult your doctor before applying.  Can AKNEGATE CN GEL cause skin irritation or itchy skin?  AKNEGATE CN GEL may cause skin irritation or itchy skin. Avoid hot bath because hot water can irritate your skin further. Do not scratch the affected area. Use protective clothing when going outdoors. Regularly moisturize your skin and apply calamine lotion as a coolant. Discuss with your doctor if the symptom worsens.

name: AKRALIC 6% Ointment 30gm
about: INTRODUCTION  AKRALIC 6% contains Salicylic acid which belongs to the group of medicines called keratolytic agents. It is used to treat hyperkeratotic lesions like corns, warts, psoriasis, chronic dermatitis, keratosis pilaris, ringworm and athlete’s foot etc. It can also be used to treat acne, dark spots, pigments and sun damage by peeling the superficial skin layers of the face.  Salicylic acid is a potent keratolytic agent. It allows the epidermal cells to slough off which dissolves corns, warts, dark spots and pigmentation. It clears the clogged follicles and reduces pimples formation. It helps in the resolution of psoriatic lesions either alone or in combination with other drugs and re-establishes the growth of a normal skin.  AKRALIC 6% is highly flammable in nature, and therefore avoid smoking or going near naked flames, as it may increase the risk of serious burns. Avoid contact of this medicine with fabrics (such as clothing, bedding and dressing), as they may burn more easily when comes in contact with fire. Use this medicine as directed by your physician. It is for external use only. Take the required quantity of the medicine and gently apply it on the affected area twice daily. The most common side effects of this medicine are dry skin and skin irritation. Contact your doctor if these symptom bothers you. Before taking this medicine, inform your doctor if you are pregnant or breastfeeding.
uses: USES OF AKRALIC 6% Treats hyperkeratotic lesions (such as psoriasis, chronic dermatitis, keratosis pilaris) Treats corns and warts Treats acne, dark spots and sun damage
working: HOW AKRALIC 6% WORKS  Salicylic acid is a potent keratolytic agent, which dissolve the intercellular substance in the horny layer of skin. It encourages the peeling of the top layer of the skin (epidermis), which helps in the dissolution of corns and warts and reduces dark spots, pigmentation and sun damage.  It also opens up the clogged follicles, which reduces pimples, pustules and helps in the resolution of psoriatic lesions either alone or in combination with other drugs and re-establishes the growth of a normal skin.
directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Use this medicine as directed by your physician. It is for external use only. Take the required quantity of the medicine and gently apply it on the affected area twice daily. Avoid contact of this medicine with eyes, ears, nose and mucous membranes. If contact happens rinse it thoroughly with water.  Do not apply this medicine on wounded, damaged or cut skin. Your doctor will decide the correct dose and duration for you depending upon your condition. Continue to take this medicine, as long as your doctor tells you to do so, to obtain better results.
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF AKRALIC 6% COMMON Dry skin Skin irritation Dizziness Deafness or hearing disturbances
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY  AKRALIC 6% is not recommended for use in pregnant women unless necessary. Discuss the risks and benefits with your doctor.  BREASTFEEDING  AKRALIC 6% is not recommended for use in breastfeeding women unless necessary. Discuss the risks and benefits with your doctor.  ALLERGY  Do not take this medicine if you are allergic (hypersensitive) to Salicylic acid.
interactions: INTERACTIONS  Talk to your doctor, if you are using,  Other skin medications containing sulfur, resorcinol, benzoyl peroxide or topical retinoids Cosmetics containing alcohol, lime and spices (e.g. after-shave lotions, soaps, shampoos or perfumes)
synopsis: SYNOPSIS Drug	:  	Salicylic acid Pharmacological Category	:  	Keratolytic agent Therapeutic Indication	:  	Acne, Warts, Hyperkeratotic lesions Dosage Forms	:  	Ointment, Cream, Gel, Face wash, Lotion
moreInfo: MORE INFORMATION  Store below 20-25°C and keep out of reach of children.
faqs: FAQs ABOUT AKRALIC 6%  Can AKRALIC 6% be used during pregnancy?  No. This medicine is not recommended for use in pregnant women unless clearly necessary. Consult your doctor for advice before taking.  Can AKRALIC 6% reduce dark spots?  Yes. This medicine encourages the peeling of the top layer of the skin (epidermis), which helps in the dissolution of corns and warts and reduces dark spots, pigmentation and sun damage  Can AKRALIC 6% be used for psoriasis?  Yes. This medicine can be used to treat psoriasis. It helps in the resolution of psoriatic lesions either alone or in combination with other drugs and re-establishes the growth of a normal skin.

name: Allyte 1% Gel 20gm
about: INTRODUCTION  ALLYTE 1% GEL contains Clindamycin, which belongs to the group of medicines called Antibiotics. It is used in the treatment of acne vulgaris. Acne vulgaris is a common skin condition that occurs when hair follicles get blocked with oil and dead skin cells. Symptoms include whiteheads, blackheads, small red, tender bumps, pimples, and pus-filled lumps on the skin.  Before applying ALLYTE 1% GEL, inform your doctor if you have or ever had diarrhea, bloody diarrhea and pseudomembranous colitis. ALLYTE 1% GEL is not recommended for use if you have a history of regional enteritis (inflammation of the small intestine), ulcerative colitis (inflammation of the large intestine) or antibiotic-associated colitis.  ALLYTE 1% GEL should be used with caution during pregnancy or by breastfeeding women only if clearly needed. The safety and effectiveness of ALLYTE 1% GEL in children under the age of 12 has not been established. The most common side effects of applying ALLYTE 1% GEL are burning, itching, and redness of the skin. Consult your doctor if symptoms worsen.
uses: USES OF ALLYTE 1% GEL Treats acne vulgaris
working: HOW ALLYTE 1% GEL WORKS  ALLYTE 1% GEL acts against the bacteria by binding to the 50S subunit of the bacterial ribosome (site of protein synthesis), which in turn prevents protein synthesis and kills the infection-causing bacteria.
directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Apply ALLYTE 1% GEL as advised by your physician. It is for external use only. Wash your hands before use. Wash and dry the whole area, apply a thin film once daily to the skin where acne lesions appear and use enough to cover the entire affected area. In case of contact with the eyes, mouth or nostrils, rinse it off immediately and thoroughly with water. Your doctor will decide the correct dose and duration for you depending on your age, body weight and disease condition.
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF ALLYTE 1% GEL COMMON Burning, itching or abnormal redness of the skin at the application site Scaling, pain, dryness and skin irritation at the application site UNCOMMON Abdominal pain Diarrhea Oily skin RARE Antibiotic-associated colitis  Stop applying ALLYTE 1% GEL and contact your doctor immediately if you experience any of the following side effects:  Allergic symptoms (e.g., rashes, itchiness, difficulty in breathing or eye swelling) Severe or bloody diarrhea. (a sign of bowel inflammation, pseudomembranous colitis)
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY  The safety and effectiveness of ALLYTE 1% GEL in pregnant women or women planning to have a baby have not been established yet. It will be given to you by the doctor only if clearly needed. Consult your doctor before applying ALLYTE 1% GEL.  BREASTFEEDING  ALLYTE 1% GEL should be used with caution in breastfeeding women as it is not known if the medicine is excreted in human milk. Your doctor will decide whether to discontinue nursing or the medicine, considering the benefits to the mother and baby. If it is applied to the chest, care should be taken to avoid accidental ingestion by the infant. Consult your doctor before applying ALLYTE 1% GEL.  ALLERGY  Do not apply ALLYTE 1% GEL if you are allergic to Clindamycin or any other ingredients of this medicine.  OTHERS  ALLYTE 1% GEL is not recommended for use if you:  Have regional enteritis (inflammation of the small intestine) or ulcerative colitis (inflammation of the large intestine) Have a history of antibiotic-associated colitis  Before applying ALLYTE 1% GEL inform your doctor if you:  Diarrhea, bloody diarrhea Pseudomembranous colitis (inflammation of colon) Atopic individuals (more prone to allergies)  Use in pediatrics:  Safety and effectiveness of ALLYTE 1% GEL in children under the age of 12 have not been established. Consult your doctor before applying ALLYTE 1% GEL.
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug-Drug interactions:  Before applying ALLYTE 1% GEL, inform your doctor if you are taking any of the following medicine:  Neuromuscular blocking agents (Ex. rocuronium, vecuronium) Other anti-acne, topical agents  Overdosage:  If you or anyone else accidentally applied too much of ALLYTE 1% GEL, consult your doctor immediately or visit the nearby hospital.

moreInfo: MORE INFORMATION Keep ALLYTE 1% GEL out of reach from children Store at room temperature
faqs: FAQs ABOUT ALLYTE 1% GEL  What is ALLYTE 1% GEL used for?  ALLYTE 1% GEL is used in the treatment of acne vulgaris. Acne vulgaris is a common skin condition that occurs when hair follicles get blocked with oil and dead skin cells. Symptoms include whiteheads, blackheads, small red, tender bumps, pimples, and pus-filled lumps on the skin.  How to use ALLYTE 1% GEL?  Apply ALLYTE 1% GEL as advised by your physician. It is for external use only. Wash your hands before use. Wash and dry the whole area, apply a thin film once daily to the skin where acne lesions appear and use enough to cover the entire affected area. In case of contact with the eyes, mouth or nostrils, rinse it off immediately with plenty of water.  How does ALLYTE 1% GEL work?  ALLYTE 1% GEL acts against the bacteria by binding to the 50S subunit of the bacterial ribosome (site of protein synthesis), which in turn prevents protein synthesis and kills the infection-causing bacteria.  Can ALLYTE 1% GEL be used in pregnancy?  The safety and effectiveness of ALLYTE 1% GEL in pregnant women or women planning to have a baby have not been established yet. It will be given to you by the doctor only if clearly needed. Consult your doctor before applying ALLYTE 1% GEL.  Can ALLYTE 1% GEL be used in breastfeeding women?  ALLYTE 1% GEL should be used with caution in breastfeeding women as it is not known if the medicine is excreted in human milk. Your doctor will decide whether to discontinue nursing or the medicine, considering the benefits to the mother and baby. If it is applied to the chest, care should be taken to avoid accidental ingestion by the infant. Consult your doctor before applying ALLYTE 1% GEL.

name: AP Gel 10gm
faqs: FAQs ABOUT AP GEL Q: Can AP GEL be used in the morning?  A: Apply AP GEL as advised by your physician. It is best when applied at night and washed off in the morning since it is sensitive to sunlight. Consult your doctor for further queries.  Q: Can AP GEL cause skin irritation?  A: AP GEL may cause slight sensation of warmth and stinging after applying it for the initial 2-4 weeks. However, during the long-term usage this side effect usually disappears. Consult your doctor in case of any queries.  Q: Can AP GEL be used daily?  A: In many cases, AP GEL products are initially used once daily in the evening. However, some individuals may be advised to start with less frequent applications to allow the skin to adjust, and then gradually increase the frequency.  Q: Can AP GEL make skin darker?  A: AP GEL doesn’t make skin darker. Instead, it can slightly make the skin lighter by healing acne, pimples, blackheads and spots. Consult your doctor for further queries.  Q: Can I go outside after applying AP GEL?  A: No, avoid going out after applying AP GEL as it can cause local irritation and skin discomfort. It is best used at night. Consult the doctor for further assistance.  Q: Can AP GEL be used for other skin conditions?  A: AP GEL is primarily indicated for acne, but it may also be used off-label to manage other skin conditions such as keratosis pilaris (a common, harmless skin condition characterized by small, rough bumps on the skin).  Q: Can AP GEL be used with other acne medications?  A: It's generally not recommended to use AP GEL with other topical acne medications containing benzoyl peroxide, sulphur, resorcinol, or salicylic acid, as they may increase the risk of skin irritation. However, your healthcare provider may prescribe a combination regimen if deemed appropriate.  Q: Can AP GEL be applied under makeup or moisturizers?  A: Yes, AP GEL can be applied under makeup or moisturizers once it has been fully absorbed into the skin. It's important to allow the gel to dry completely before applying any other skincare products to avoid potential interactions or reduced effectiveness.  Q: Can AP GEL be used for acne scars?  A: AP GEL is primarily indicated for the management of acne lesions and may help improve the appearance of post-inflammatory hyperpigmentation (dark spots) caused by acne. However, it may have limited efficacy in managing deeper acne scars or pitted scars. Consult your healthcare provider for more information.  Q: Can AP GEL be used during pregnancy or breastfeeding?  A: It's important to consult your healthcare provider before using AP GEL if you are pregnant, planning to become pregnant, or breastfeeding. While topical retinoids are generally considered safe during pregnancy, it's best to discuss the potential risks and benefits with your doctor.

name: ATM A Gel 15gm
about: INTRODUCTION  ATM A 0.02+2 is a combination of Adapalene and Azithromycin which belongs to the group of medicines called retinoids and macrolide antibiotics respectively. It is used to treat acne.  Acne is a skin condition that occurs when your hair follicles become plugged with oil and dead skin cells. It causes whiteheads, blackheads, or pimples. It is most common among teenagers, though it affects people of all ages. Adapalene is a form of vitamin A, acts as an antiacne agent by binding directly to the receptor of the skin which increases the rate of cell regeneration and decreases oil secretion preventing clogging of the hair follicles and pores. It also reduces swelling/inflammation. Azithromycin works by binding to the ribosomal unit of the bacteria and disrupting the production of the protein essential for its survival.  The most common side effects are dry skin, irritation of the skin, burning sensation of the skin and redness of the skin (erythema). Avoid unnecessary sun exposure and cover the treated areas with clothing or use a sunscreen before stepping out in the sun. It is advised not to have any cosmetic procedures during this treatment.
uses: USES OF ATM A 0.02+2 Treats acne
working: HOW ATM A 0.02+2 WORKS  Adapalene is a form of vitamin A which acts as an antiacne agent by binding directly to the receptors of the skin. It increases the rate of cell regeneration and decreases oil secretion preventing clogging of the hair follicles and pores. It also reduces swelling/inflammation. Azithromycin works by binding to the ribosomal unit of the bacteria and disrupting the production of the protein essential for its survival.
directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Always use this medicine as directed by your physician. Check the label for directions before use. Avoid contact of this medicine in or on your mouth, eyes, or vagina. For external use only.
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF ATM A 0.02+2 COMMON Dry skin Irritation of the skin Burning sensation of the skin Redness of the skin (erythema) UNCOMMON Local skin reaction (contact dermatitis) Skin discomfort Sunburn Itching of the skin (pruritus) Peeling skin (exfoliation)  Contact your doctor immediately, if you have,  Angioedema or severe allergic reaction symptoms such as swelling of the face, lips or throat which makes it difficult to swallow or breathe, rash, itching, hives and dizziness
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY  ATM A 0.02+2 is not recommended for use in pregnant women unless necessary. Consult your doctor before using this medicine.  BREASTFEEDING  ATM A 0.02+2 is safe to use during breastfeeding. Consult your doctor before using this medicine.  DRIVING AND USING MACHINES  ATM A 0.02+2 may not interfere with your ability to drive or use the machine. However, protect your skin from sun or UV light while travelling and follow appropriate protective measures recommended by your doctor.  ALCOHOL  Interaction with alcohol is unknown. It is advisable to consult your doctor before consumption.  ALLERGY  Do not use this medicine if you are allergic (hypersensitive) to Adapalene or Azithromycin.  OTHERS  Do not use this medicine, inform your doctor if have cuts or scrapes or skin condition called eczema.  Use in pediatrics:  ATM A 0.02+2 is not recommended for use in children and adolescents below 12 years Consult your doctor before using this medicine.  Use in geriatrics:  ATM A 0.02+2 should be used with caution in elderly patients. Consult your doctor before using this medicine.
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug-Drug interactions:  Inform your doctor about all the medicines you use, including prescription and non-prescription medicines and herbal supplements.  Inform to your physician, if you are taking,  Other acne products such as benzoyl peroxide, erythromycin or clindamycin Cosmetics  Overdosage:  If you or anyone else accidentally take excess of this medicine, contact your doctor immediately or go to a hospital straight away. Symptoms of overdose includes skin irritation, skin redness, skin peeling or discomfort.

moreInfo: MORE INFORMATION Keep out of reach of children Do not store above 25°C Do not freeze
faqs: FAQs ABOUT ATM A 0.02+2  Can I use [GBBNKEYWORD] during pregnancy?  No, it is not recommended for use in pregnant women unless necessary. Consult your doctor before using this medicine.  Can I use ATM A 0.02+2 during breast Feeding?  Yes, it is safe to use during breastfeeding. Consult your doctor before using this medicine.  How long does ATM A 0.02+2 take to work?  It may take up to 2-3 weeks before your symptoms improve. It may take some time to deliver significant results. Use this medicine as directed and tell your doctor if your symptoms do not improve or if they get worse.  Can I use [GBBNKEYWORD] for skin burn?  No, it is not recommended to use ATM A 0.02+2 on areas with skin burns, cut injury or bruising.  Will ATM A 0.02+2 be more effective if I overuse it?  No, do not overuse ATM A 0.02+2. It can result in excess medicine being absorbed into the body and may cause some side effects. If you are experiencing increased severity of your side effects, please consult your doctor for re-evaluation.

name: AZALEA ACNE FACE WASH 100ml
about: INTRODUCTION  Azalea Acne Face Wash is an ultra gentle anti-acne face wash for severe acne, oily skin and pimple spots and marks. It contains aqua, glycerin, lactic acid, quaternium-73, hydrolyzed soya protein as active ingredients to significantly reduce acne spots, marks and scars, blackheads and whiteheads reduction with deep pore cleansing and controls oil.     Quartium-73 efficiently kills P. acnes and prevents acne marks by acting as an antibacterial and anti-melanin agent. Lactic acid exfoliates the comedones and removes dead skin cells to unclog the pores resulting in prevention of acne breakouts. Glycerin heals acne by accelerating the cell turnover and helps to slough off the layer of dead skin cells, impurities and dirt. Hydrolyzed soya protein helps to reduce acne and ensures smooth and firm skin appearance.  Always use Azalea Acne Face Wash as advised by the doctor. It is for external use only. Moisten the face and apply a small quantity of Azalea Acne Face Wash and gently work up lather with a circular motion. Then, wash off completely and pat dry, use twice daily. Avoid contact with eyes and mucous membranes. Do not use on the denuded, inflamed or irritated skin.
authorDetails: AUTHOR DETAILS  Written By Dr. R. Dinesh John Rajkumar, Pharm.D Last updated on 23 Jun 2023 | 06:24 PM(IST)

name: Aziderm 10% Cream 15gm
about: INTRODUCTION  AZIDERM 10% CREAM contains Azelaic acid which belongs to the group of medicines called Dicarboxylic acids. It is used to treat common acne (acne vulgaris). It is also used for the treatment of mild to moderate papulopustular rosacea.  Acne is a skin condition that occurs when the hair follicles become plugged with oil and dead skin cells. It causes whiteheads, blackheads or pimples. Rosacea is a skin condition that causes blushing or redness, pus-filled bumps and small visible blood vessels in the face.  AZIDERM 10% CREAM should be applied with caution in patients with lung problems such as asthma. Consult your doctor before applying it.  Inform your doctor if you are pregnant or breastfeeding before applying this medicine. Your doctor will decide whether you can use this medicine.  AZIDERM 10% CREAM is generally not recommended for use in children under 12 years of age for the treatment of acne and also not recommended for use in children under 18 years of age for the treatment of rosacea. Consult your doctor before applying it.  The most common side effects of applying AZIDERM 10% CREAM are burning, itching or redness of the skin (erythema) at the application site, scaling, pain, dryness, skin discolouration or irritation at the application site. Contact your doctor if any of the symptoms worsen.
uses: USES OF AZIDERM 10% CREAM Common acne (acne vulgaris) Mild to moderate papulopustular rosacea
working: HOW AZIDERM 10% CREAM WORKS  AZIDERM 10% CREAM attacks the bacteria called propionibacterium acnes, which plays an essential part in causing acne. It also reduces growth of the harder outermost skin cells (keratin surface cells) that block the pores of the skin to cause blackheads and whiteheads.
directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Apply AZIDERM 10% CREAM as directed by your physician. It is for external use only. Wash your hands with soap and water before and after using AZIDERM 10% CREAM. Apply a thin layer of this medicine on the affected area and rub it gently into the skin.  Avoid applying this medicine around your eyes, mouth and other mucous membranes or open wounds. If it does, wash the eyes, mouth or other mucous membranes immediately with large amounts of cool water.
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF AZIDERM 10% CREAM COMMON Burning, itching or redness of the skin (erythema) at the application site Scaling, pain, dryness, skin discolouration or irritation at the application site UNCOMMON Greasy skin Acne or loss of skin colour Tingling Dermatitis Discomfort or swelling at the application site RARE Cracking of the lips, small blisters Eczema, ulceration Warmth at the site of application Allergic reaction such as urticaria or hives, rash at the site of application Worsening of asthma  Stop applying AZIDERM 10% CREAM and contact your doctor immediately if you experience any of the following side effects:  Allergic reaction such as rash, angioedema (swelling under the skin), swelling of face, eyes and dyspnoea (shortness of breath)
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY  Inform your doctor if you are pregnant or are planning to have a baby before applying this medicine. Your doctor will decide whether you can use AZIDERM 10% CREAM.  BREASTFEEDING  AZIDERM 10% CREAM should be used with caution in breastfeeding women. Consult your doctor before applying it. Infants must not come into contact with treated skin or breasts.  DRIVING AND USING MACHINES  AZIDERM 10% CREAM has no influence on the ability to drive and use machines.  ALLERGY  Do not apply AZIDERM 10% CREAM if you are allergic to Azelaic acid or any of the other ingredients of this medicine.  LUNGS  AZIDERM 10% CREAM should be applied with caution in patients with lung problems such as asthma. Consult your doctor before applying it.  OTHERS  Use in pediatrics:  AZIDERM 10% CREAM is generally not recommended for use in children under 12 years of age for the treatment of acne. It is also not recommended for use in children under 18 years of age for the treatment of rosacea due to a lack of data on safety and efficacy. Consult your doctor before applying it.  Use in geriatrics:  There is limited information available on the use of AZIDERM 10% CREAM in elderly patients. Consult your doctor before applying it.
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug - Drug interactions:  Tell your doctor if you are taking or have recently taken any other medicines, including medicines obtained without a prescription, vitamin supplement or herbal products.  Overdosage:  If you or anyone else accidentally used too much of AZIDERM 10% CREAM or if you or a child accidentally swallow the medicine, consult your doctor immediately or visit the nearby hospital.
synopsis: SYNOPSIS Drug	:  	Azelaic acid Pharmacological Category	:  	Dicarboxylic acids Therapeutic Indication	:  	Common acne, Papulopustular rosacea Dosage Forms	:  	Cream, Gel, Gel (Topical)
moreInfo: MORE INFORMATION Keep AZIDERM 10% CREAM out of the sight and reach of children Store AZIDERM 10% CREAM below 30°C
faqs: FAQs ABOUT AZIDERM 10% CREAM  How long can I use AZIDERM 10% CREAM?  How long AZIDERM 10% CREAM has to be used varies from person to person. It depends upon how bad your acne is when you start treatment. In general, you may notice a distinct improvement after 4 weeks. In case of no improvement after 1 month or if the acne or rosacea becomes worse, you should discontinue AZIDERM 10% CREAM and consult your doctor.  How long does it take AZIDERM 10% CREAM to lighten skin?  AZIDERM 10% CREAM when applied twice daily for several (up to 8 months), skin lightening starts after 1 to 2 months of using it. But when AZIDERM 10% CREAM is used in combination with a medicine called tretinoin causes more skin lightening after 3 months than AZIDERM 10% CREAM alone. Consult your doctor for advice.  Can I use AZIDERM 10% CREAM for hair growth?  Yes. AZIDERM 10% CREAM may promote hair growth via induction of proteins in hair follicles, when used in combination with minoxidil. Contact your doctor before applying it.  Does AZIDERM 10% CREAM cause redness of skin?  Yes. AZIDERM 10% CREAM may cause burning, itching or redness of the skin (erythema) at the application site. Contact your doctor if any of the symptoms worsen.  Is AZIDERM 10% CREAM safe in pregnancy?  Inform your doctor if you are pregnant or are planning to have a baby before applying this medicine. Your doctor will decide whether you can use AZIDERM 10% CREAM.  Can I apply face creams while using AZIDERM 10% CREAM?  Yes, you may apply cosmetics after the AZIDERM 10% CREAM has dried. Do not wrap or bandage the skin unless your doctor has instructed to do so. Talk to your doctor for advice before using this medicine.

Your doctor will decide whether you can use AZIDERM 10% GEL.  Can I apply face creams while using AZIDERM 10% GEL?  Yes, you may apply cosmetics after the AZIDERM 10% GEL has dried. Do not wrap or bandage the skin unless your doctor has instructed to do so. Talk to your doctor for advice before using this medicine.
