name: Aziderm 15% Gel 15gm
about: INTRODUCTION  AZIDERM 15% GEL contains Azelaic acid which belongs to the group of medicines called Dicarboxylic acids. It is used to treat common acne (acne vulgaris). It is also used for the treatment of mild to moderate papulopustular rosacea.  Acne is a skin condition that occurs when the hair follicles become plugged with oil and dead skin cells. It causes whiteheads, blackheads or pimples. Rosacea is a skin condition that causes blushing or redness, pus-filled bumps and small visible blood vessels in the face.  AZIDERM 15% GEL should be applied with caution in patients with lung problems such as asthma. Consult your doctor before applying it.  Inform your doctor if you are pregnant or breastfeeding before applying this medicine. Your doctor will decide whether you can use this medicine.  AZIDERM 15% GEL is generally not recommended for use in children under 12 years of age for the treatment of acne and also not recommended for use in children under 18 years of age for the treatment of rosacea. Consult your doctor before applying it.  The most common side effects of applying AZIDERM 15% GEL are burning, itching or redness of the skin (erythema) at the application site, scaling, pain, dryness, skin discolouration or irritation at the application site. Contact your doctor if any of the symptoms worsen.
uses: USES OF AZIDERM 15% GEL Common acne (acne vulgaris) Mild to moderate papulopustular rosacea
working: HOW AZIDERM 15% GEL WORKS  AZIDERM 15% GEL attacks the bacteria called propionibacterium acnes, which plays an essential part in causing acne. It also reduces growth of the harder outermost skin cells (keratin surface cells) that block the pores of the skin to cause blackheads and whiteheads.
directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Apply AZIDERM 15% GEL as directed by your physician. It is for external use only. Wash your hands with soap and water before and after using AZIDERM 15% GEL. Apply a thin layer of this medicine on the affected area and rub it gently into the skin.  Avoid applying this medicine around your eyes, mouth and other mucous membranes or open wounds. If it does, wash the eyes, mouth or other mucous membranes immediately with large amounts of cool water.
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF AZIDERM 15% GEL COMMON Burning, itching or redness of the skin (erythema) at the application site Scaling, pain, dryness, skin discolouration or irritation at the application site UNCOMMON Greasy skin Acne or loss of skin colour Tingling Dermatitis Discomfort or swelling at the application site RARE Cracking of the lips, small blisters Eczema, ulceration Warmth at the site of application Allergic reaction such as urticaria or hives, rash at the site of application Worsening of asthma  Stop applying AZIDERM 15% GEL and contact your doctor immediately if you experience any of the following side effects:  Allergic reaction such as rash, angioedema (swelling under the skin), swelling of face, eyes and dyspnoea (shortness of breath)
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY  Inform your doctor if you are pregnant or are planning to have a baby before applying this medicine. Your doctor will decide whether you can use AZIDERM 15% GEL.  BREASTFEEDING  AZIDERM 15% GEL should be used with caution in breastfeeding women. Consult your doctor before applying it. Infants must not come into contact with treated skin or breasts.  DRIVING AND USING MACHINES  AZIDERM 15% GEL has no influence on the ability to drive and use machines.  ALLERGY  Do not apply AZIDERM 15% GEL if you are allergic to Azelaic acid or any of the other ingredients of this medicine.  LUNGS  AZIDERM 15% GEL should be applied with caution in patients with lung problems such as asthma. Consult your doctor before applying it.  OTHERS  Use in pediatrics:  AZIDERM 15% GEL is generally not recommended for use in children under 12 years of age for the treatment of acne. It is also not recommended for use in children under 18 years of age for the treatment of rosacea due to a lack of data on safety and efficacy. Consult your doctor before applying it.  Use in geriatrics:  There is limited information available on the use of AZIDERM 15% GEL in elderly patients. Consult your doctor before applying it.
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug - Drug interactions:  Tell your doctor if you are taking or have recently taken any other medicines, including medicines obtained without a prescription, vitamin supplement or herbal products.  Overdosage:  If you or anyone else accidentally used too much of AZIDERM 15% GEL or if you or a child accidentally swallow the medicine, consult your doctor immediately or visit the nearby hospital.
synopsis: SYNOPSIS Drug	:  	Azelaic acid Pharmacological Category	:  	Dicarboxylic acids Therapeutic Indication	:  	Common acne, Papulopustular rosacea Dosage Forms	:  	Cream, Gel, Gel (Topical)
moreInfo: MORE INFORMATION Keep AZIDERM 15% GEL out of the sight and reach of children Store AZIDERM 15% GEL below 30°C
faqs: FAQs ABOUT AZIDERM 15% GEL  How long can I use AZIDERM 15% GEL?  How long AZIDERM 15% GEL has to be used varies from person to person. It depends upon how bad your acne is when you start treatment. In general, you may notice a distinct improvement after 4 weeks. In case of no improvement after 1 month or if the acne or rosacea becomes worse, you should discontinue AZIDERM 15% GEL and consult your doctor.  How long does it take AZIDERM 15% GEL to lighten skin?  AZIDERM 15% GEL when applied twice daily for several (up to 8 months), skin lightening starts after 1 to 2 months of using it. But when AZIDERM 15% GEL is used in combination with a medicine called tretinoin causes more skin lightening after 3 months than AZIDERM 15% GEL alone. Consult your doctor for advice.  Can I use AZIDERM 15% GEL for hair growth?  Yes. AZIDERM 15% GEL may promote hair growth via induction of proteins in hair follicles, when used in combination with minoxidil. Contact your doctor before applying it.  Does AZIDERM 15% GEL cause redness of skin?  Yes. AZIDERM 15% GEL may cause burning, itching or redness of the skin (erythema) at the application site. Contact your doctor if any of the symptoms worsen.  Is AZIDERM 15% GEL safe in pregnancy?  Inform your doctor if you are pregnant or are planning to have a baby before applying this medicine. Your doctor will decide whether you can use AZIDERM 15% GEL.  Can I apply face creams while using AZIDERM 15% GEL?  Yes, you may apply cosmetics after the AZIDERM 15% GEL has dried. Do not wrap or bandage the skin unless your doctor has instructed to do so. Talk to your doctor for advice before using this medicine.

sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF AZOBRIL 15% CREAM COMMON Burning, itching or redness of the skin (erythema) at the application site Scaling, pain, dryness, skin discolouration or irritation at the application site UNCOMMON Greasy skin Acne or loss of skin colour Tingling Dermatitis Discomfort or swelling at the application site RARE Cracking of the lips, small blisters Eczema, ulceration Warmth at the site of application Allergic reaction such as urticaria or hives, rash at the site of application Worsening of asthma  Stop applying AZOBRIL 15% CREAM and contact your doctor immediately if you experience any of the following side effects:  Allergic reaction such as rash, angioedema (swelling under the skin), swelling of face, eyes and dyspnoea (shortness of breath)
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY  Inform your doctor if you are pregnant or are planning to have a baby before applying this medicine. Your doctor will decide whether you can use AZOBRIL 15% CREAM.  BREASTFEEDING  AZOBRIL 15% CREAM should be used with caution in breastfeeding women. Consult your doctor before applying it. Infants must not come into contact with treated skin or breasts.  DRIVING AND USING MACHINES  AZOBRIL 15% CREAM has no influence on the ability to drive and use machines.  ALLERGY  Do not apply AZOBRIL 15% CREAM if you are allergic to Azelaic acid or any of the other ingredients of this medicine.  LUNGS  AZOBRIL 15% CREAM should be applied with caution in patients with lung problems such as asthma. Consult your doctor before applying it.  OTHERS  Use in pediatrics:  AZOBRIL 15% CREAM is generally not recommended for use in children under 12 years of age for the treatment of acne. It is also not recommended for use in children under 18 years of age for the treatment of rosacea due to a lack of data on safety and efficacy. Consult your doctor before applying it.  Use in geriatrics:  There is limited information available on the use of AZOBRIL 15% CREAM in elderly patients. Consult your doctor before applying it.
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug - Drug interactions:  Tell your doctor if you are taking or have recently taken any other medicines, including medicines obtained without a prescription, vitamin supplement or herbal products.  Overdosage:  If you or anyone else accidentally used too much of AZOBRIL 15% CREAM or if you or a child accidentally swallow the medicine, consult your doctor immediately or visit the nearby hospital.
synopsis: SYNOPSIS Drug	:  	Azelaic acid Pharmacological Category	:  	Dicarboxylic acids Therapeutic Indication	:  	Common acne, Papulopustular rosacea Dosage Forms	:  	Cream, Gel, Gel (Topical)
moreInfo: MORE INFORMATION Keep AZOBRIL 15% CREAM out of the sight and reach of children Store AZOBRIL 15% CREAM below 30°C
faqs: FAQs ABOUT AZOBRIL 15% CREAM  How long can I use AZOBRIL 15% CREAM?  How long AZOBRIL 15% CREAM has to be used varies from person to person. It depends upon how bad your acne is when you start treatment. In general, you may notice a distinct improvement after 4 weeks. In case of no improvement after 1 month or if the acne or rosacea becomes worse, you should discontinue AZOBRIL 15% CREAM and consult your doctor.  How long does it take AZOBRIL 15% CREAM to lighten skin?  AZOBRIL 15% CREAM when applied twice daily for several (up to 8 months), skin lightening starts after 1 to 2 months of using it. But when AZOBRIL 15% CREAM is used in combination with a medicine called tretinoin causes more skin lightening after 3 months than AZOBRIL 15% CREAM alone. Consult your doctor for advice.  Can I use AZOBRIL 15% CREAM for hair growth?  Yes. AZOBRIL 15% CREAM may promote hair growth via induction of proteins in hair follicles, when used in combination with minoxidil. Contact your doctor before applying it.  Does AZOBRIL 15% CREAM cause redness of skin?  Yes. AZOBRIL 15% CREAM may cause burning, itching or redness of the skin (erythema) at the application site. Contact your doctor if any of the symptoms worsen.  Is AZOBRIL 15% CREAM safe in pregnancy?  Inform your doctor if you are pregnant or are planning to have a baby before applying this medicine. Your doctor will decide whether you can use AZOBRIL 15% CREAM.  Can I apply face creams while using AZOBRIL 15% CREAM?  Yes, you may apply cosmetics after the AZOBRIL 15% CREAM has dried. Do not wrap or bandage the skin unless your doctor has instructed to do so. Talk to your doctor for advice before using this medicine.

name: AZOBRIL FORTE Cream 20gm
about: INTRODUCTION  AZOBRIL FORTE CREAM contains Azelaic acid which belongs to the group of medicines called Dicarboxylic acids. It is used to treat common acne (acne vulgaris). It is also used for the treatment of mild to moderate papulopustular rosacea.  Acne is a skin condition that occurs when the hair follicles become plugged with oil and dead skin cells. It causes whiteheads, blackheads or pimples. Rosacea is a skin condition that causes blushing or redness, pus-filled bumps and small visible blood vessels in the face.  AZOBRIL FORTE CREAM should be applied with caution in patients with lung problems such as asthma. Consult your doctor before applying it.  Inform your doctor if you are pregnant or breastfeeding before applying this medicine. Your doctor will decide whether you can use this medicine.  AZOBRIL FORTE CREAM is generally not recommended for use in children under 12 years of age for the treatment of acne and also not recommended for use in children under 18 years of age for the treatment of rosacea. Consult your doctor before applying it.  The most common side effects of applying AZOBRIL FORTE CREAM are burning, itching or redness of the skin (erythema) at the application site, scaling, pain, dryness, skin discolouration or irritation at the application site. Contact your doctor if any of the symptoms worsen.
uses: USES OF AZOBRIL FORTE CREAM Common acne (acne vulgaris) Mild to moderate papulopustular rosacea
working: HOW AZOBRIL FORTE CREAM WORKS  AZOBRIL FORTE CREAM attacks the bacteria called propionibacterium acnes, which plays an essential part in causing acne. It also reduces growth of the harder outermost skin cells (keratin surface cells) that block the pores of the skin to cause blackheads and whiteheads.
directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Apply AZOBRIL FORTE CREAM as directed by your physician. It is for external use only. Wash your hands with soap and water before and after using AZOBRIL FORTE CREAM. Apply a thin layer of this medicine on the affected area and rub it gently into the skin.  Avoid applying this medicine around your eyes, mouth and other mucous membranes or open wounds. If it does, wash the eyes, mouth or other mucous membranes immediately with large amounts of cool water.

name: ACNE BRIGHT Soap 75gm
about: INTRODUCTION  Acne Bright Soap is an anti-acne pimple care that deals with pimples and marks and gives clear skin. It contains Triclosan, Tea tree oil, Zinc oxide, Vitamin E, and Allantoin as the active ingredients that kill the acne-causing bacteria and protects the skin from damage.  Triclosan has antibacterial properties that prevent bacterial contamination. Tea tree oil has antimicrobial, anti-inflammatory, and antifungal action that soothes the redness and swelling caused by acne.  Zinc oxide acts by adding a physical barrier to the skin that prevents skin irritation and helps heal damaged skin. Vitamin E is a potent antioxidant that protects the skin from sun and environmental damage. Allantoin relieves irritation.  Always use Acne Bright Soap as advised by your physician/dermatologist. It is for external use only. Wet the affected surfaces of the body and apply Acne Bright Soap. Massage thoroughly to form a rich lather. Leave the lather for a few minutes and rinse it off with water. Avoid contact with eyes.
authorDetails: AUTHOR DETAILS  Written By Dr. Priyanka Goel, BDS Last updated on 26 May 2023 | 05:06 PM(IST)

name: AD C Nanogel 15gm
about: INTRODUCTION  AD C NANOGEL contains a combination of Adapalene and Clindamycin, which belongs to the group of medicines called topical retinoids and lincomycin antibiotics. It is used in the treatment of skin acne (pimple). Acne is a condition of the skin when the root of your hair (hair follicle) or skin pores gets clogged by oil or dead skin, which becomes prone to bacterial infection and the formation of pimples, blackheads, spots and scars.  Adapalene is a form of vitamin A, that acts as an antiacne agent by binding directly to the receptor of the skin which increases the rate of cell turnover (cell regeneration) and decreases oil secretion preventing clogging of the hair follicles and pores, also decreasing swelling/inflammation. Clindamycin works by binding to the ribosomal unit of the bacteria and disrupts the production of the protein essential for its survival. Before recommending AD C NANOGEL, your doctor may advise you to have tests to understand your existing condition for planning effective treatment methods. Stay well hydrated and protect your skin from exposure to sunlight or UV light.  Do not apply AD C NANOGEL if you are allergic to adapalene or clindamycin, a disorder of the digestive system (colitis), a disorder of the immune system or have bruises, cuts or burns on the skin. The common side effects of using this medicine may include dry skin, burning, itching, redness or irritative sensation of the skin, scaling peeling of the skin etc.
uses: USES OF AD C NANOGEL To treat acne
working: HOW AD C NANOGEL WORKS  Adapalene, a form of vitamin A, works as an antiacne medicine by attaching directly to the skin's receptor, which increases cell turnover (cell regeneration) and decreases oil secretion preventing blockage of the hair follicles and pores. It also reduces swelling/inflammation of the skin. Clindamycin works by attaching to the bacteria's ribosomal unit and disrupting the production of a protein required for its very own survival.
directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Apply AD C NANOGEL as advised by your doctor. It is for external use on the skin only. Avoid applying AD C NANOGEL around or onto your eyes, including eyelids.
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF AD C NANOGEL COMMON Dryness of the skin Burning, itching, redness of the skin Scaling and or peeling of the skin UNCOMMON Flaring of acne Sunburns Local skin reaction RARE  Stop using this medicine and contact your doctor immediately if you experience any of the following side effects:  Severe allergic reactions (such as skin rash, itching, swelling of the face, lips, tongue and other parts of the body, difficulty in breathing or wheezing, blisters on the skin, sore throat, fever, headache etc.)
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY CONTRAINDICATED  AD C NANOGEL is not recommended for use in pregnant women. Consult your doctor for advice if you are pregnant or suspect/planning pregnancy.  BREASTFEEDING CONSULT YOUR DOCTOR  AD C NANOGEL is to be used with caution in breastfeeding mothers after consulting your doctor. The safe use of AD C NANOGEL in breastfeeding women and breastfed baby is not established.  DRIVING AND USING MACHINES USE WITH CAUTION  AD C NANOGEL may not interfere with your ability to drive or use the machine. However, protect your skin from sun or UV light while travelling and follow appropriate protective measures recommended by your doctor.  ALCOHOL MONITORING REQUIRED  The risks associated with consuming alcohol are not known. It’s advised to avoid the consumption of alcohol while using AD C NANOGEL, as it could aggravate your existing condition.  ALLERGY CONSULT YOUR DOCTOR  Talk to your doctor if you are allergic to Adapalene and/or Clindamycin.  OTHERS  AD C NANOGEL is not recommended for use if you:  Cuts or bruises on the skin Sunburns Skin conditions like eczema (itching, dry and red skin)  Use in pediatrics:  AD C NANOGEL is not recommended for use in children less than 12 years of age. Consult your doctor for advice.  Use in geriatrics:  AD C NANOGEL should be used with caution in the elderly (above 65 years of age) after consulting your doctor for advice.
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug-Drug interactions:  Inform your physician, if you are taking or using,  Medicated soap for skin, other cosmetic products with a high concentration of alcohol, astringents, sulfur,  Resorcinol – use for itching or irritation of the skin and scalp, loss of hair, dandruff etc. Salicylic acid – used for skin acne, dandruff, etc. Atracurium, cisatracurium, succinylcholine – used to relax muscles  B. Drug-Food interaction:  The interaction of foods with AD C NANOGEL is not known. Consult your doctor for diet advice.  Overdosage:  In case of using AD C NANOGEL in excess, than recommended, you may experience dryness, scaling, redness and discomfort of the skin. Contact your doctor immediately for advice.
synopsis: SYNOPSIS Drug	:  	Adapalene, Clindamycin Pharmacological Category	:  	Topical Retinoids, Antibiotics Therapeutic Indication	:  	Treat acne        Dosage Forms	:  	Gel (topical), Gel, Cream, Ointment
moreInfo: MORE INFORMATION Keep out of reach from children Store at room temperature. Keep away from sunlight
faqs: FAQs ABOUT AD C NANOGEL  Can AD C NANOGEL be used to treat scars on the skin?  Yes. Adapalene is a kind of vitamin A that reduces swelling and inflammation while also treating acne scars. Azithromycin is used to treat infections that cause skin infections to worsen.  Can AD C NANOGEL result in skin peeling?  Yes. Dryness of the skin, burning, itching, redness of the skin, skin irritation, scaling, and possibly peeling of the skin are all possible side effects of using this medicine.  Can [GBBNKEYWORD] cause skin dryness?  Yes. Your skin may get dry as a result of taking this medication. Maintain hydration and use the moisturiser that your doctor has prescribed.  How long can I use AD C NANOGEL?  Use AD C NANOGEL as advised by your doctor. Generally, it’s recommended for use depending on the severity of the existing skin condition.  Can I stop using AD C NANOGEL on my own?  No. It is not recommended to stop using AD C NANOGEL on your own as it may worsen the existing skin condition. Consult your doctor for advice.

name: Bdiff A Gel 15gm
about: INTRODUCTION  BDIFF A GEL is a combination of Adapalene and Benzoyl peroxide which belongs to the group of medicines called Antiacne agents. It is used in the treatment of acne.  Acne vulgaris (commonly known as acne) is an inflammatory skin condition that occurs when the hair follicles present in the skin are clogged with excess oil and/or dead skin cells. It can also be aggravated by few bacteria (such as Propionibacterium acnes) and is highly common among on the teenagers and the young adults.  It primarily affects the face, upper arms, trunk or back and is often characterized by pus-filled pimples, red bumps with inflammatory and non-inflammatory lesions. BDIFF A GEL is suitable for use both in adults and in children (aged 9 years or older).  Apply a thin layer of BDIFF A GEL on the affected skin areas. Avoid contact of this medicine with your eyes, mouth, ears, nose or with open wounds. You must also protect your skin against sun light and against other light sources (such as UV lamps).  Do not use BDIFF A GEL if you are pregnant, think you may be pregnant or planning to have a baby. BDIFF A GEL can be used in breastfeeding women if required. The most common side effects of using BDIFF A GEL are dry skin, mild burning sensation and skin irritation, redness or scaling. Consult your doctor if they trouble you.
uses: USES OF BDIFF A GEL  It is used in adults, children and in adolescents (aged 9 years or older) to:  Treat acne
working: HOW BDIFF A GEL WORKS  BDIFF A GEL is a combination of two medicines namely, adapalene and benzoyl peroxide.  Adapalene is a topical retinoid (a type of vitamin A). It modulates the skin cell cycle and prevents the accumulation of excess sebum (natural oil produced by the skin) and dead skin cells on the hair follicles of the skin. It also reduces inflammation on the skin.  Benzoyl peroxide is a keratolytic agent with antimicrobial properties. It improves skin’s tendency to exfoliate the dead skin cells naturally. It also reduces the number of acne-causing bacteria on the skin which can reduce the further spread of acne.  Collectively, they unclog the hair follicles of the skin and exfoliates dead skin cells which reduces acne breakouts.
directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Apply a thin layer of this medicine on the affected skin areas or as directed by the physician. It is for topical use only. Wash your hands before and after application.  Your doctor will decide the correct dose and duration of therapy for you depending upon your age, body weight and health condition.  Avoid contact of BDIFF A GEL with your eyes, mouth, ears, nose, hair or with open wounds (cuts, scrapes or sunburn).
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF BDIFF A GEL COMMON Dry skin Skin redness and scaling Burning sensation of the skin Skin irritation UNCOMMON Itching of the skin (pruritus) Sunburn RARE  Stop using BDIFF A GEL and consult your doctor immediately if you experience:  Signs of allergic reaction (such as severe skin rash with itching of body parts, swelling of the eyes, face, lips or tongue causing throat tightness and breathing difficulties and feel faint)
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY  BDIFF A GEL is not recommended for use in pregnant women. Therefore, inform your doctor before using this medicine if you are pregnant, think you may be pregnant or planning to have a baby. If you became pregnant while using this medicine, stop using it and contact your doctor immediately.  BREASTFEEDING  BDIFF A GEL can be used in breastfeeding women. However, do not apply this medicine on your chest to avoid exposing this medicine to the nursing infant.  ALLERGY  Talk to your doctor if you are allergic to Adapalene or Benzoyl peroxide.  OTHERS  BDIFF A GEL is not recommended for use if you:  Have any cuts, scrapes, sunburn or eczema at the site of application  Use in Pediatrics:  BDIFF A GEL can be used in children and adolescents (aged 9 years or older) if advised by the physician. Therefore, consult your doctor before using it.
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug-Drug interactions:  Before using BDIFF A GEL, inform your doctor if you are using any of the following:  Other anti-acne medicines (such as clindamycin) Skin cosmetics (such as hair perming solutions, astringents, toners, shaving lotion, abrasive soaps or cleansers)  Overdosage:  If you or anyone else applied excessive amount of BDIFF A GEL, rinse your skin with plenty of cold water. If irritation persists, consult your doctor.
synopsis: SYNOPSIS Drug	:  	Adapalene, Benzoyl peroxide Pharmacological Category	:  	Retinoid-like compounds, Topical Antibiotics Therapeutic Indication	:  	Acne vulgaris Dosage Forms	:  	Topical Gel
moreInfo: MORE INFORMATION Keep BDIFF A GEL out of reach of children Store BDIFF A GEL at room temperature
faqs: FAQs ABOUT BDIFF A GEL  Will BDIFF A GEL be more effective if I overuse it?  No. Do not overuse this medicine. If you use more, you will not get rid of acne quicker. Instead, it may make your skin more irritated and red. Therefore, only apply the quantity mentioned by your doctor.  What are the side effects of using BDIFF A GEL?  BDIFF A GEL is generally safe with limited or no side effects. However, you may experience skin dryness, redness or irritation after applying this medicine. Contact your doctor if it troubles you.  What is the use of BDIFF A GEL?  BDIFF A GEL is used in the treatment of acne.  How BDIFF A GEL works?  BDIFF A GEL prevents the accumulation of excess sebum (natural oil produced by the skin) and dead skin cells on the hair follicles of the skin. It also reduces inflammation on the skin and improves skin’s tendency to exfoliate the dead skin cells naturally. It also reduces the number of acne-causing bacteria on the skin which can reduce the further spread of acne.  How to use BDIFF A GEL?  BDIFF A GEL is for external use only. Take the required quantity of the medicine and apply on the affected skin areas. Avoid contact of this medicine with your eyes, ears, nose or any other mucous membranes.  How long does it take for BDIFF A GEL to work?  It may take up to 2-3 weeks for BDIFF A GEL to show improvement in your skin condition. However, this period may vary from person-to-person depending upon the skin condition.  How long should I use BDIFF A GEL?  Your doctor will decide the correct dose and duration of therapy for you depending upon your age, body weight and health condition. You need to use BDIFF A GEL for the stipulated duration prescribed by your doctor. Failing to do so may not result in adequate response.  What to do if I forgot to apply BDIFF A GEL?  If you forgot to apply BDIFF A GEL, apply it as soon as you remember. However, if it is time for the next application, skip the missed one and apply the next dose. Do not excessively apply BDIFF A GEL to compensate the missed doses.  Is BDIFF A GEL safe?  BDIFF A GEL is safe at doses prescribed by the physician. Therefore, do not alter the dose of BDIFF A GEL without consulting your doctor.  Can I stop using BDIFF A GEL without consulting your doctor?  No. You should not stop using BDIFF A GEL without consulting your doctor as it may reduce its effectiveness. Therefore, apply BDIFF A GEL for the stipulated duration recommended by your doctor to achieve maximum results.  Can BDIFF A GEL be used in pregnant women?  BDIFF A GEL is not recommended for use in pregnant women. Therefore, inform your doctor before using this medicine if you are pregnant, think you may be pregnant or planning to have a baby. If you became pregnant while using this medicine, stop using it and contact your doctor immediately.

name: BELCLIN A Gel 15gm
about: INTRODUCTION  BELCLIN A contains a combination of Adapalene and Clindamycin, which belongs to the group of medicines called topical retinoids and lincomycin antibiotics. It is used in the treatment of skin acne (pimple). Acne is a condition of the skin when the root of your hair (hair follicle) or skin pores gets clogged by oil or dead skin, which becomes prone to bacterial infection and the formation of pimples, blackheads, spots and scars.  Adapalene is a form of vitamin A, that acts as an antiacne agent by binding directly to the receptor of the skin which increases the rate of cell turnover (cell regeneration) and decreases oil secretion preventing clogging of the hair follicles and pores, also decreasing swelling/inflammation. Clindamycin works by binding to the ribosomal unit of the bacteria and disrupts the production of the protein essential for its survival. Before recommending BELCLIN A, your doctor may advise you to have tests to understand your existing condition for planning effective treatment methods. Stay well hydrated and protect your skin from exposure to sunlight or UV light.  Do not apply BELCLIN A if you are allergic to adapalene or clindamycin, a disorder of the digestive system (colitis), a disorder of the immune system or have bruises, cuts or burns on the skin. The common side effects of using this medicine may include dry skin, burning, itching, redness or irritative sensation of the skin, scaling peeling of the skin etc.
uses: USES OF BELCLIN A To treat acne
working: HOW BELCLIN A WORKS  Adapalene, a form of vitamin A, works as an antiacne medicine by attaching directly to the skin's receptor, which increases cell turnover (cell regeneration) and decreases oil secretion preventing blockage of the hair follicles and pores. It also reduces swelling/inflammation of the skin. Clindamycin works by attaching to the bacteria's ribosomal unit and disrupting the production of a protein required for its very own survival.
directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Apply BELCLIN A as advised by your doctor. It is for external use on the skin only. Avoid applying BELCLIN A around or onto your eyes, including eyelids.
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF BELCLIN A COMMON Dryness of the skin Burning, itching, redness of the skin Scaling and or peeling of the skin UNCOMMON Flaring of acne Sunburns Local skin reaction  Stop using this medicine and contact your doctor immediately if you experience any of the following side effects:  Severe allergic reactions (such as skin rash, itching, swelling of the face, lips, tongue and other parts of the body, difficulty in breathing or wheezing, blisters on the skin, sore throat, fever, headache etc.)
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY  BELCLIN A is not recommended for use in pregnant women. Consult your doctor for advice if you are pregnant or suspect/planning pregnancy.  BREASTFEEDING  BELCLIN A is to be used with caution in breastfeeding mothers after consulting your doctor. The safe use of BELCLIN A in breastfeeding women and breastfed baby is not established.  DRIVING AND USING MACHINES  BELCLIN A may not interfere with your ability to drive or use the machine. However, protect your skin from sun or UV light while travelling and follow appropriate protective measures recommended by your doctor.  ALCOHOL  The risks associated with consuming alcohol are not known. It’s advised to avoid the consumption of alcohol while using BELCLIN A, as it could aggravate your existing condition.  ALLERGY  Talk to your doctor if you are allergic to Adapalene and/or Clindamycin.  OTHERS  BELCLIN A is not recommended for use if you:  Cuts or bruises on the skin Sunburns Skin conditions like eczema (itching, dry and red skin)  Use in pediatrics:  BELCLIN A is not recommended for use in children less than 12 years of age. Consult your doctor for advice.  Use in geriatrics:  BELCLIN A should be used with caution in the elderly (above 65 years of age) after consulting your doctor for advice.
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug-Drug interactions:  Inform your physician, if you are taking or using,  Medicated soap for skin, other cosmetic products with a high concentration of alcohol, astringents, sulfur,  Resorcinol – use for itching or irritation of the skin and scalp, loss of hair, dandruff etc. Salicylic acid – used for skin acne, dandruff, etc. Atracurium, cisatracurium, succinylcholine – used to relax muscles  B. Drug-Food interaction:  The interaction of foods with BELCLIN A is not known. Consult your doctor for diet advice.  Overdosage:  In case of using BELCLIN A in excess than recommended, you may experience dryness, scaling, redness and discomfort of the skin. Contact your doctor immediately for advice.
synopsis: SYNOPSIS Drug	:  	Adapalene, Clindamycin Pharmacological Category	:  	Topical retinoids and Antibiotics Therapeutic Indication	:  	Treat acne Dosage Forms	:  	Gel (topical), Gel, Cream, Ointment
moreInfo: MORE INFORMATION Keep out of reach from children Store at room temperature Keep away from sunlight
faqs: FAQs ABOUT BELCLIN A  Can BELCLIN A be used to treat scars on the skin?  Yes. Adapalene is a kind of vitamin A that reduces swelling and inflammation while also treating acne scars. Azithromycin is used to treat infections that cause skin infections to worsen.  Can BELCLIN A result in skin peeling?  Yes. Dryness of the skin, burning, itching, redness of the skin, skin irritation, scaling, and possibly peeling of the skin are all possible side effects of using this medicine.  Can [GBBNKEYWORD] cause skin dryness?  Yes. Your skin may get dry as a result of taking this medication. Maintain hydration and use the moisturiser that your doctor has prescribed.  How long can I use BELCLIN A?  Use BELCLIN A as advised by your doctor. Generally, it’s recommended for use depending on the severity of the existing skin condition.  Can I stop using BELCLIN A on my own?  No. It is not recommended to stop using BELCLIN A on your own as it may worsen the existing skin condition. Consult your doctor for advice.

name: BELLISSA ACNE Soap 75gm
ingredients: Aloe barbadensis Leaf Extract+Glycerin+Olive Oil+Salicylic Acid+Tea Tree Oil+Triclosan
about: INTRODUCTION  Bellissa Acne Soap is a gentle skin cleanser with excellent moisturizers, emollients, and natural skin nourishers used to minimize the appearance of Acne. It contains Aloe extract, Olive extract, Tea tree oil, Glycerine, Triclosan, Willow extract, and Manuka extract as active ingredients that helps to cleanse, moisturize, and nourish the skin and to provide antimicrobial, anti-inflammatory and antiseptic properties to reduce acne and acne breakouts.  Aloe vera has anti-inflammatory, antioxidant, and anti-pigmentation effects, which help in treating acne and other skin lesions. Triclosan exhibits antimicrobial activity against the causative agents behind acne. Glycerine tends to improve skin hydration in dry skin conditions. Olive oil increases skin moisturization by replenishing triglycerides of the skin. Triclosan and tea tree oil work as an antibacterial and an antiseptic to destroy microorganisms that leads to acne formation. Willow extract, and Manuka extract have antioxidant and antibacterial properties that helps to protect the skin.  Always use Bellissa Acne Soap as advised by your doctor. It is for external use only. Wet your skin and apply Bellissa Acne soap. Make a lather and rinse off. Read the label within the packet carefully before using Bellissa Acne Soap.
authorDetails: AUTHOR DETAILS  Written By Dr. Haritha C K, BDS Last updated on 02 Aug 2023 | 05:33 PM(IST)

name: Bengel AC 2.5% Gel 30gm
about: INTRODUCTION  BENGEL AC 2.5% GEL contains Benzoyl peroxide which belongs to the group of medicines called Anti-bacterial and Anti-inflammatory agents. It is used in the treatment and prevention of acne (pimples) in the face, chest and back. It is also used to unplug the blocked pores (blackheads and whiteheads) and absorb excess oil from the skin.  Before using BENGEL AC 2.5% GEL, inform your doctor if you are having any allergy to foods, preservatives or dyes or if you are already under any medication for acne.  It is not recommended to use hard cleansers, scrubs, medicated soap or cosmetic products containing alcohol while using this medicine.  BENGEL AC 2.5% GEL is generally not recommended for use in pregnant women unless clearly needed. Consult your doctor before using the medicine.  Avoid repeated exposure to sunlight or other sources of UV light (such as sun bed). In case of accidental contact, rinse thoroughly with warm water and pat dry.  Most common side effects of BENGEL AC 2.5% GEL are skin redness and irriation, burning, stinging sensation in the skin. Consult your doctor if any of above symptoms worsens.
uses: USES OF BENGEL AC 2.5% GEL  Used to:  Treat acne (pimples) formation Remove excessive oil from the skin Unplug blocked pores
working: HOW BENGEL AC 2.5% GEL WORKS  BENGEL AC 2.5% GEL works against the acne-causing bacteria. This medicine after applying on the affected skin gets absorbed and is converted to benzoic acid. This benzoic acid gets metabolized by skin proteins and releases active free-radical oxygen species that results in the alteration of bacterial proteins. This helps to treat acne or pimples. BENGEL AC 2.5% GEL also acts as a keratolytic agent which promotes peeling of the skin and absorb excess oil from the skin further preventing acne formation and skin irritation.
directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Always apply BENGEL AC 2.5% GEL as directed by your physician. It is for external use only. Apply a thin layer of this medicine on the affected area as instructed by the doctor. Avoid contact with eyes, lips, mouth, nose, mucous membranes and sensitive areas of the neck. Your doctor will decide the correct dose and duration for you depending your age, body weight and disease condition.
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF BENGEL AC 2.5% GEL COMMON Dry skin Skin redness Peeling of the skin Burning sensation of the skin Itching of the skin (pruritus) Pain of the skin (pain, stinging) Skin irritation Allergic contact dermatitis  Stop applying BENGEL AC 2.5% GEL and contact your doctor immediately if you experience any of the following side effects:  Allergic reactions, including application site hypersensitivity, face swelling and anaphylaxis Severe skin irritation, redness and peeling of the skin, swelling of the face Fainting
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY MONITORING REQUIRED  BENGEL AC 2.5% GEL is generally not recommended for use in pregnant women unless clearly necessary. Consult your doctor before using it.  BREASTFEEDING USE WITH CAUTION  BENGEL AC 2.5% GEL should be used with caution in breast feeding mothers. Consult your doctor before using the medicine.  ALLERGY CONTRAINDICATED  Do not apply BENGEL AC 2.5% GEL if you are allergic to Benzyl peroxide or to any other ingredients of this medicine.  USE IN PEDIATRICS CONSULT YOUR DOCTOR  Your doctor will decide the right dose depends on your child’s age, body weight and disease condition. Consult your doctor before using BENGEL AC 2.5% GEL.  OTHERS  BENGEL AC 2.5% GEL is not recommended for use if you:  Have damaged skin or broken skin Are using hard cleansers, scrubs, medicated soap or cosmetic products containing alcohol
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug-Drug interactions:  Before applying BENGEL AC 2.5% GEL, inform your doctor if you are taking or using any of the following medicine:  Medicines used to treat various skin diseases (Ex. dapsone) Topical hydroquinone (medicine used to remove dark patches of the skin) Isotretinoin, topical tretinoin (used to treat acne) Topical anaesthetics (used to relieve pain and itching) Ex. benzocaine, lignocaine  B. Drug-Food interactions:  Before applying BENGEL AC 2.5% GEL inform your doctor if you are having any allergies to any other medicines, foods, preservatives or dyes.  Overdosage:  If you or anyone else accidentally applies more of BENGEL AC 2.5% GEL or accidently ingested BENGEL AC 2.5% GEL, consult your doctor immediately or visit the nearby hospital. Symptoms of overuse of this medicine is severe skin irritation.
synopsis: SYNOPSIS Drug	:  	Benzoyl Peroxide Pharmacological Category	:  	Topical Antibiotics Therapeutic Indication	:  	Acne Dosage Forms	:  	Gel, Lotion, Ointment, Facewash, Soap, Gelwash
moreInfo: MORE INFORMATION Keep out of sight and reach of children Store at room temperature
faqs: FAQs ABOUT BENGEL AC 2.5% GEL  Q: What is BENGEL AC 2.5% GEL used for?  A: BENGEL AC 2.5% GEL is used in the treatment and prevention of acne (pimples) in the face, chest and back. It can also be used to unplug the blocked pores (blackheads and whiteheads) and absorb excess oil from the skin. Consult your doctor before using BENGEL AC 2.5% GEL.  Q: How to use BENGEL AC 2.5% GEL?  A: Always apply BENGEL AC 2.5% GEL as directed by your physician. It is for external use only. Wash and dry your hands before applying this medicine. Wash the affected area with a mild cleanser and water and allow the skin to dry. Apply a thin layer of this medicine on the affected area leaving it for 2 hours and then wash it off with water and pat skin dry.  Q: What are the precautions to be followed while using BENGEL AC 2.5% GEL?  A: While using BENGEL AC 2.5% GEL avoid contact with the eyes, lips, mouth, nose, mucous membranes and sensitive areas of the neck. In case of accidental contact rinse thoroughly with warm water and pat dry. You should not use any other acne products along with this medicine without taking advise from your doctor because they may cause skin to become red and sore.  Q: How long should I use BENGEL AC 2.5% GEL?  A: You should use BENGEL AC 2.5% GEL as long as advised by your physician or how quickly your condition improves. Sometimes acne may take time to clear completely. You should see your doctor if you feel your acne is not improving while using this medicine.  Q: Can BENGEL AC 2.5% GEL be used in pregnant women?  A: BENGEL AC 2.5% GEL is generally not recommended for use in pregnant women or women who are planning to become pregnant unless clearly necessary. Consult your doctor before using the medicine.  Q: What are the common side effects of using BENGEL AC 2.5% GEL?  A: Most common side effects of BENGEL AC 2.5% GEL are skin redness and irriation, burning, stinging sensation in the skin. Sudden increase in peeling may occur during the first weeks in most of the patients. This is usually not harmful and may subside once the treatment is discontinued temporarily. Consult your doctor if any of above symptoms worsens.

name: BENIGLO 2.5% Gel(topical) 20gm
about: INTRODUCTION  BENIGLO 2.5% Gel(topical) is a topical gel used for acne. It contains Benzoyl Peroxide as an active ingredient which is bactericidal in action. It works against the bacteria causing acne, unplugs the blocked pores and removes blackheads and whiteheads.  Benzoyl peroxide works against the acne causing bacteria and reduces occurrence of acne. It prevents absorption of excess oil and reduces irritation.  Always use BENIGLO 2.5% Gel(topical) as advised by your physician. It is for external use only. Wash and pat your skin dry. Take necessary amount and apply a thin layer over the affected area once or twice daily.
authorDetails: AUTHOR DETAILS  Written By Dr. Janet.C, Pharm.D Last updated on 09 Jun 2023 | 05:56 PM(IST)

name: BENXOP Face Wash 50gm
about: INTRODUCTION  [GBKEYWORD] contains Benzoyl peroxide which belongs to the group of medicines called Anti-bacterial and Anti-inflammatory agents. It is used to treat mild acne on face visible as whiteheads and blackheads on face as well as acne vulgaris (pimples occurring in the hair follicles). It is also used to prevent formation of new blemishes on skin and unclog the pores of skin.  BENXOP FACE WASH is not recommended for severe acne and/or on the skin having deeper pits and dents, broken and/or damaged skin and in people who are allergic to benzoyl peroxide and/or any other ingredient found in BENXOP FACE WASH.  It is not recommended for use in pregnant and breastfeeding women unless necessary. Consult your doctor before using BENXOP FACE WASH.  It is recommended to use only those products, that are labelled as non-comedogenic to prevent clogging of pores.  Avoid applying BENXOP FACE WASH around your eyes, including eyelids and other mucous membranes. Also, care must be taken not to apply BENXOP FACE WASH on broken/ damaged skin or the skin having dents or scars.  Most common side effects of using BENXOP FACE WASH are skin tension, burning stinging, itching, peeling and reddening of the skin. Consult your doctor if any of these above reactions bothers you.
uses: USES OF BENXOP FACE WASH Used to treat and prevent mild acne, blackheads, whiteheads and acne vulgaris
working: HOW BENXOP FACE WASH WORKS  BENXOP FACE WASH works against the acne-causing bacteria. This medicine after applying on the affected skin gets absorbed and is converted to benzoic acid. This benzoic acid gets metabolized by skin proteins and releases active free-radical oxygen species that results in the alteration of bacterial proteins. This helps to treat acne or pimples. BENXOP FACE WASH also acts as a keratolytic agent which promotes peeling of the skin and absorb excess oil from the skin further preventing acne formation and skin irritation.
directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Always use BENXOP FACE WASH as directed by your physician. It is for external use only. Your doctor will decide the correct dose and duration for you depending upon your disease condition.  Wet the area to be treated. Wash hands before use and place a small amount of BENXOP FACE WASH on to the hands to wash the affected area. Wash and rinse thoroughly with water after application.
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF BENXOP FACE WASH COMMON Dryness, redness, peeling of the skin Burning sensation of skin Itching of skin (pruritis) Stinging and/or pain on the skin Skin irritation when in contact with foreign objects (irritant contact dermatitis) RARE  Stop using BENXOP FACE WASH and consult your doctor immediately if you experience any of the following:  Swelling of the skin Development of blisters on skin (blistering) Severe allergic reactions of skin such as development of hives (raise and itchy rash), swelling of face, throat, lips, mouth and tongue leading to difficulty in breathing Fainting
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY  BENXOP FACE WASH should be used with caution in pregnant women unless clearly necessary. Consult your doctor before using the medicine.  BREASTFEEDING  BENXOP FACE WASH is generally not recommended to be used in nursing women. Consult your doctor before using this medicine.  ALLERGY  Do not use BENXOP FACE WASH if you are allergic to Benzyl peroxide or to any other ingredients of this medicine.  OTHERS  BENXOP FACE WASH is not recommended for use if you have:  Severe acne on face visible as inflamed spots and/or large lumps on face Scars from previous acne A shallow dent and/or deeper pit on the skin Acne on shoulders, back and/or chest Damaged or broken skin  Use in pediatrics:  Your doctor will decide the right dose depends on your child’s age, body weight and disease condition. Consult your doctor before using BENXOP FACE WASH.
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug-Drug interactions:  Before using BENXOP FACE WASH, inform your doctor if you are using or taking any of the following medicine:  Medicines used to treat acne (Ex. isotretinoin) Medicines used to treat leprosy and other skin conditions (Ex. dapsone) Medicines used to treat hyperpigmentation (dark spots, melasma) (Ex. hydroquinone) Medicines used to cause anesthesia (Ex. lidocaine, bupivacaine)  B. Drug-Food interactions:  Before applying BENXOP FACE WASH inform your doctor if you are having any allergies to any other medicines, foods, preservatives or dyes.  Overdosage:  If you or anyone else accidentally uses too much of BENXOP FACE WASH or accidentally ingested it, consult your doctor immediately or visit the nearby hospital.
synopsis: SYNOPSIS Drug	:  	  Benzoyl peroxide   Pharmacological Category	:  	  Topical Antibiotics   Therapeutic Indication	:  	  Acne   Dosage Forms	:  	Gel, Lotion, Ointment, Facewash, Soap, Gelwash
moreInfo: MORE INFORMATION Keep BENXOP FACE WASH out of reach of children Store at room temperature
faqs: FAQs ABOUT BENXOP FACE WASH  What is BENXOP FACE WASH used for?  BENXOP FACE WASH is used to treat mild acne on face visible as whiteheads and blackheads on face as well as acne vulgaris (pimples occurring in the hair follicles). It is also used to prevent formation of new blemishes on skin and unclog the pores of skin.  Can I take BENXOP FACE WASH in pregnancy?  BENXOP FACE WASH should be used with caution in pregnant women unless clearly necessary. Consult your doctor before using the medicine.  How to use BENXOP FACE WASH?  Always use BENXOP FACE WASH as directed by your physician. It is for external use only. Your doctor will decide the correct dose and duration for you depending upon your disease condition. Wet the area to be treated. Wash hands before use and place a small amount of BENXOP FACE WASH on to the hands to wash the affected area. Wash and rinse thoroughly with water after application.  Can BENXOP FACE WASH be used in nursing women?  BENXOP FACE WASH is generally not recommended to be used in nursing women. Consult your doctor before using this medicine.  Can BENXOP FACE WASH be used for severe acne?  No, it is not recommended to use BENXOP FACE WASH if you have severe acne as BENXOP FACE WASH is used to treat only mild-moderate acne. Also, it is not recommended to use it on the scars, pits and dents from previous acne and on skin that is damaged and broken.

name: BENZ ADP Gel 15gm
faqs: FAQs ABOUT BENZ ADP GEL Q: Can BENZ ADP GEL be used in the morning?  A: Apply BENZ ADP GEL as advised by your physician. It is best when applied at night and washed off in the morning since it is sensitive to sunlight. Consult your doctor for further queries.  Q: Can BENZ ADP GEL cause skin irritation?  A: BENZ ADP GEL may cause slight sensation of warmth and stinging after applying it for the initial 2-4 weeks. However, during the long-term usage this side effect usually disappears. Consult your doctor in case of any queries.  Q: Can BENZ ADP GEL be used daily?  A: In many cases, BENZ ADP GEL products are initially used once daily in the evening. However, some individuals may be advised to start with less frequent applications to allow the skin to adjust, and then gradually increase the frequency.  Q: Can BENZ ADP GEL make skin darker?  A: BENZ ADP GEL doesn’t make skin darker. Instead, it can slightly make the skin lighter by healing acne, pimples, blackheads and spots. Consult your doctor for further queries.  Q: Can I go outside after applying BENZ ADP GEL?  A: No, avoid going out after applying BENZ ADP GEL as it can cause local irritation and skin discomfort. It is best used at night. Consult the doctor for further assistance.  Q: Can BENZ ADP GEL be used for other skin conditions?  A: BENZ ADP GEL is primarily indicated for acne, but it may also be used off-label to manage other skin conditions such as keratosis pilaris (a common, harmless skin condition characterized by small, rough bumps on the skin).  Q: Can BENZ ADP GEL be used with other acne medications?  A: It's generally not recommended to use BENZ ADP GEL with other topical acne medications containing benzoyl peroxide, sulphur, resorcinol, or salicylic acid, as they may increase the risk of skin irritation. However, your healthcare provider may prescribe a combination regimen if deemed appropriate.  Q: Can BENZ ADP GEL be applied under makeup or moisturizers?  A: Yes, BENZ ADP GEL can be applied under makeup or moisturizers once it has been fully absorbed into the skin. It's important to allow the gel to dry completely before applying any other skincare products to avoid potential interactions or reduced effectiveness.  Q: Can BENZ ADP GEL be used for acne scars?  A: BENZ ADP GEL is primarily indicated for the management of acne lesions and may help improve the appearance of post-inflammatory hyperpigmentation (dark spots) caused by acne. However, it may have limited efficacy in managing deeper acne scars or pitted scars. Consult your healthcare provider for more information.  Q: Can BENZ ADP GEL be used during pregnancy or breastfeeding?  A: It's important to consult your healthcare provider before using BENZ ADP GEL if you are pregnant, planning to become pregnant, or breastfeeding. While topical retinoids are generally considered safe during pregnancy, it's best to discuss the potential risks and benefits with your doctor.

name: BENZAC AC 2.5% Gel 30gm
about: INTRODUCTION  Benzac AC 2.5 Gel is an antibacterial and anti-inflammatory gel, which is used for the treatment of mild acne on the face, chest or back in adults and adolescents 12 years and over. It contains Benzoyl Peroxide as an active ingredient which kills the acne causing bacteria.  Benzoyl Peroxide gets converted into benzoic acid which releases active free-radical oxygen. These free radicals interfere with important bacterial function and survival, hence killing them. It also increases the turnover rate of skin cells which helps in treating acne.  Always apply Benzac AC 2.5 Gel as advised by your physician. It is external use only. Wash the affected area with a mild cleanser pat your skin dry. Apply a thin layer over the affected area once or twice daily. If you have sensitive skin, apply once at night. Consult your doctor if you experience any allergic reactions while taking it.
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF BENZAC AC 2.5% GEL  Benzac AC 2.5 Gel may cause dry skin, skin redness, peeling of the skin, burning sensation of the skin, itching, pain, stinging, or skin irritation in some individuals. Consult your doctor if you notice any such side effects while applying Benzac AC 2.5 Gel.
moreInfo: MORE INFORMATION Keep Benzac AC 2.5 Gel out of the reach and sight of children Store at room temperature at below 25°C
faqs: FAQs ABOUT BENZAC AC 2.5% GEL  Q: What is Benzac AC 2.5 Gel used for?  A: Benzac AC 2.5 Gel is an antibacterial and anti-inflammatory gel, which is used for the treatment of mild acne on the face, chest or back in adults and adolescents 12 years and over. It contains Benzoyl Peroxide as an active ingredient which kills the acne causing bacteria.  Q: How to you use Benzac AC 2.5 Gel?  A: Always apply Benzac AC 2.5 Gel as advised by your physician. It is external use only. Wash the affected area with a mild cleanser pat your skin dry. Apply a thin layer over the affected area once or twice daily. If you have sensitive skin, apply once at night.  Q: How long should I use Benzac AC 2.5 Gel?  A. Benzac AC 2.5 Gel should be used for as long as it is recommended by your doctor. It might start showing up results by third week and reach its maximum efficiency in eight to twelve weeks. Do not use it for a prolonged period rather than as recommended by your doctor.  Q: Is Benzac AC 2.5 Gel safe in breastfeeding?  A: Benzac AC 2.5 Gel is not recommended in breastfeeding women, unless considered necessary. If your doctor advice you to use Benzac AC 2.5 Gel during breastfeeding, it should not be applied to chest, as it may affect your child.  Q. What precautions do I need to follow while using Benzac AC 2.5 Gel?  A. While you are using Benzac AC 2.5 Gel, avoid unnecessary exposure to sun. You should always use sunscreens while using this product. It may cause swelling and blistering of the skin, if any of these symptoms occur, use of the Benzac AC 2.5 Gel should be discontinued  Q: Can I leave Benzac AC 2.5 Gel overnight?  Yes. When you first start using Benzac AC 2.5 Gel, it’s recommended to only leave the treatment on for a couple of hours for the first three days. This ensures that your skin is getting used to the active ingredient benzoyl peroxide. After three days of no redness, you can then apply this gel and leave it on overnight. Make sure to apply a moisturiser after this gel to prevent any dryness from occurring.
references: REFERENCES  1. https://www.medicines.org.uk/emc/files/pil.2225.pdf  2. https://www.benzac.com/au/product/mild-strength-acne-gel  3. https://www.benzac.com/au/faq

name: BENZADAF Gel 15gm
about: INTRODUCTION  BENZADAF GEL is a combination of Adapalene and Benzoyl peroxide which belongs to the group of medicines called Antiacne agents. It is used in the treatment of acne.  Acne vulgaris (commonly known as acne) is an inflammatory skin condition that occurs when the hair follicles present in the skin are clogged with excess oil and/or dead skin cells. It can also be aggravated by few bacteria (such as Propionibacterium acnes) and is highly common among on the teenagers and the young adults.  It primarily affects the face, upper arms, trunk or back and is often characterized by pus-filled pimples, red bumps with inflammatory and non-inflammatory lesions. BENZADAF GEL is suitable for use both in adults and in children (aged 9 years or older).  Apply a thin layer of BENZADAF GEL on the affected skin areas. Avoid contact of this medicine with your eyes, mouth, ears, nose or with open wounds. You must also protect your skin against sun light and against other light sources (such as UV lamps).  Do not use BENZADAF GEL if you are pregnant, think you may be pregnant or planning to have a baby. BENZADAF GEL can be used in breastfeeding women if required. The most common side effects of using BENZADAF GEL are dry skin, mild burning sensation and skin irritation, redness or scaling. Consult your doctor if they trouble you.
uses: USES OF BENZADAF GEL  It is used in adults, children and in adolescents (aged 9 years or older) to:  Treat acne
working: HOW BENZADAF GEL WORKS  BENZADAF GEL is a combination of two medicines namely, adapalene and benzoyl peroxide.  Adapalene is a topical retinoid (a type of vitamin A). It modulates the skin cell cycle and prevents the accumulation of excess sebum (natural oil produced by the skin) and dead skin cells on the hair follicles of the skin. It also reduces inflammation on the skin.  Benzoyl peroxide is a keratolytic agent with antimicrobial properties. It improves skin’s tendency to exfoliate the dead skin cells naturally. It also reduces the number of acne-causing bacteria on the skin which can reduce the further spread of acne.  Collectively, they unclog the hair follicles of the skin and exfoliates dead skin cells which reduces acne breakouts.
directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Apply a thin layer of this medicine on the affected skin areas or as directed by the physician. It is for topical use only. Wash your hands before and after application.  Your doctor will decide the correct dose and duration of therapy for you depending upon your age, body weight and health condition.  Avoid contact of BENZADAF GEL with your eyes, mouth, ears, nose, hair or with open wounds (cuts, scrapes or sunburn).
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF BENZADAF GEL COMMON Dry skin Skin redness and scaling Burning sensation of the skin Skin irritation UNCOMMON Itching of the skin (pruritus) Sunburn RARE  Stop using BENZADAF GEL and consult your doctor immediately if you experience:  Signs of allergic reaction (such as severe skin rash with itching of body parts, swelling of the eyes, face, lips or tongue causing throat tightness and breathing difficulties and feel faint)
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY  BENZADAF GEL is not recommended for use in pregnant women. Therefore, inform your doctor before using this medicine if you are pregnant, think you may be pregnant or planning to have a baby. If you became pregnant while using this medicine, stop using it and contact your doctor immediately.  BREASTFEEDING  BENZADAF GEL can be used in breastfeeding women. However, do not apply this medicine on your chest to avoid exposing this medicine to the nursing infant.  ALLERGY  Talk to your doctor if you are allergic to Adapalene or Benzoyl peroxide.  OTHERS  BENZADAF GEL is not recommended for use if you:  Have any cuts, scrapes, sunburn or eczema at the site of application  Use in Pediatrics:  BENZADAF GEL can be used in children and adolescents (aged 9 years or older) if advised by the physician. Therefore, consult your doctor before using it.
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug-Drug interactions:  Before using BENZADAF GEL, inform your doctor if you are using any of the following:  Other anti-acne medicines (such as clindamycin) Skin cosmetics (such as hair perming solutions, astringents, toners, shaving lotion, abrasive soaps or cleansers)  Overdosage:  If you or anyone else applied excessive amount of BENZADAF GEL, rinse your skin with plenty of cold water. If irritation persists, consult your doctor.
synopsis: SYNOPSIS Drug	:  	Adapalene, Benzoyl peroxide Pharmacological Category	:  	Retinoid-like compounds, Topical Antibiotics Therapeutic Indication	:  	Acne vulgaris Dosage Forms	:  	Topical Gel
moreInfo: MORE INFORMATION Keep BENZADAF GEL out of reach of children Store BENZADAF GEL at room temperature
faqs: FAQs ABOUT BENZADAF GEL  Will BENZADAF GEL be more effective if I overuse it?  No. Do not overuse this medicine. If you use more, you will not get rid of acne quicker. Instead, it may make your skin more irritated and red. Therefore, only apply the quantity mentioned by your doctor.  What are the side effects of using BENZADAF GEL?  BENZADAF GEL is generally safe with limited or no side effects. However, you may experience skin dryness, redness or irritation after applying this medicine. Contact your doctor if it troubles you.  What is the use of BENZADAF GEL?  BENZADAF GEL is used in the treatment of acne.  How BENZADAF GEL works?  BENZADAF GEL prevents the accumulation of excess sebum (natural oil produced by the skin) and dead skin cells on the hair follicles of the skin. It also reduces inflammation on the skin and improves skin’s tendency to exfoliate the dead skin cells naturally. It also reduces the number of acne-causing bacteria on the skin which can reduce the further spread of acne.  How to use BENZADAF GEL?  BENZADAF GEL is for external use only. Take the required quantity of the medicine and apply on the affected skin areas. Avoid contact of this medicine with your eyes, ears, nose or any other mucous membranes.  How long does it take for BENZADAF GEL to work?  It may take up to 2-3 weeks for BENZADAF GEL to show improvement in your skin condition. However, this period may vary from person-to-person depending upon the skin condition.  How long should I use BENZADAF GEL?  Your doctor will decide the correct dose and duration of therapy for you depending upon your age, body weight and health condition. You need to use BENZADAF GEL for the stipulated duration prescribed by your doctor. Failing to do so may not result in adequate response.  What to do if I forgot to apply BENZADAF GEL?  If you forgot to apply BENZADAF GEL, apply it as soon as you remember. However, if it is time for the next application, skip the missed one and apply the next dose. Do not excessively apply BENZADAF GEL to compensate the missed doses.  Is BENZADAF GEL safe?  BENZADAF GEL is safe at doses prescribed by the physician. Therefore, do not alter the dose of BENZADAF GEL without consulting your doctor.  Can I stop using BENZADAF GEL without consulting your doctor?  No. You should not stop using BENZADAF GEL without consulting your doctor as it may reduce its effectiveness. Therefore, apply BENZADAF GEL for the stipulated duration recommended by your doctor to achieve maximum results.  Can BENZADAF GEL be used in pregnant women?  BENZADAF GEL is not recommended for use in pregnant women. Therefore, inform your doctor before using this medicine if you are pregnant, think you may be pregnant or planning to have a baby. If you became pregnant while using this medicine, stop using it and contact your doctor immediately.

name: BENZONAK 5% Lotion 50ml
about: INTRODUCTION  BENZONAK 5% LOTION contains Benzoyl peroxide which belongs to the group of medicines called Anti-bacterial and Anti-inflammatory agents. It is used in the treatment and prevention of acne (pimples) in the face, chest and back. It is also used to unplug the blocked pores (blackheads and whiteheads) and absorb excess oil from the skin.  Before using BENZONAK 5% LOTION, inform your doctor if you are having any allergy to foods, preservatives or dyes or if you are already under any medication for acne.  It is not recommended to use hard cleansers, scrubs, medicated soap or cosmetic products containing alcohol while using this medicine.  BENZONAK 5% LOTION is generally not recommended for use in pregnant women unless clearly needed. Consult your doctor before using the medicine.  Avoid repeated exposure to sunlight or other sources of UV light (such as sun bed). In case of accidental contact, rinse thoroughly with warm water and pat dry.  Most common side effects of BENZONAK 5% LOTION are skin redness and irriation, burning, stinging sensation in the skin. Consult your doctor if any of above symptoms worsens.
uses: USES OF BENZONAK 5% LOTION  Used to:  Treat acne (pimples) formation Remove excessive oil from the skin Unplug blocked pores
working: HOW BENZONAK 5% LOTION WORKS  BENZONAK 5% LOTION works against the acne-causing bacteria. This medicine after applying on the affected skin gets absorbed and is converted to benzoic acid. This benzoic acid gets metabolized by skin proteins and releases active free-radical oxygen species that results in the alteration of bacterial proteins. This helps to treat acne or pimples. BENZONAK 5% LOTION also acts as a keratolytic agent which promotes peeling of the skin and absorb excess oil from the skin further preventing acne formation and skin irritation.
directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Always apply BENZONAK 5% LOTION as directed by your physician. It is for external use only. Apply a thin layer of this medicine on the affected area as instructed by the doctor.  Avoid contact with eyes, lips, mouth, nose, mucous membranes and sensitive areas of the neck. Your doctor will decide the correct dose and duration for you depending you’re your age, body weight and disease condition.
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF BENZONAK 5% LOTION COMMON Dry skin Skin redness Peeling of the skin Burning sensation of the skin Itching of the skin (pruritus) Pain of the skin (pain, stinging) Skin irritation Allergic contact dermatitis RARE  Stop applying BENZONAK 5% LOTION and contact your doctor immediately if you experience any of the following side effects:  Allergic reactions, including application site hypersensitivity, face swelling and anaphylaxis Severe skin irritation, redness and peeling of the skin, swelling of the face Fainting
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY  BENZONAK 5% LOTION is generally not recommended for use in pregnant women unless clearly necessary. Consult your doctor before using it.  BREASTFEEDING  BENZONAK 5% LOTION should be used with caution in breast feeding mothers. Consult your doctor before using the medicine.  ALLERGY  Do not apply BENZONAK 5% LOTION if you are allergic to Benzyl peroxide or to any other ingredients of this medicine.  OTHERS  BENZONAK 5% LOTION is not recommended for use if you:  Have damaged skin or broken skin Are using hard cleansers, scrubs, medicated soap or cosmetic products containing alcohol  Use in paediatrics:  Your doctor will decide the right dose depends on your child’s age, body weight and disease condition. Consult your doctor before using BENZONAK 5% LOTION.
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug-Drug interactions:  Before applying BENZONAK 5% LOTION, inform your doctor if you are taking or using any of the following medicine:  Medicines used to treat various skin diseases (Ex. dapsone) Topical hydroquinone (medicine used to remove dark patches of the skin) Isotretinoin, topical tretinoin (used to treat acne) Topical anaesthetics (used to relieve pain and itching) Ex. benzocaine, lignocaine  B. Drug-Food interactions:  Before applying BENZONAK 5% LOTION inform your doctor if you are having any allergies to any other medicines, foods, preservatives or dyes.  Overdosage:  If you or anyone else accidentally applies more of BENZONAK 5% LOTION or accidently ingested BENZONAK 5% LOTION, consult your doctor immediately or visit the nearby hospital. Symptoms of overuse of this medicine is severe skin irritation.
synopsis: SYNOPSIS Drug	:  	Benzoyl Peroxide Pharmacological Category	:  	Topical Antibiotics Therapeutic Indication	:  	Acne Dosage Forms	:  	Gel, Lotion, Ointment, Facewash, Soap, Gelwash
moreInfo: MORE INFORMATION Keep out of sight and reach of children Store at room temperature
faqs: FAQs ABOUT BENZONAK 5% LOTION  What is BENZONAK 5% LOTION used for?  BENZONAK 5% LOTION is used in the treatment and prevention of acne (pimples) in the face, chest and back. It can also be used to unplug the blocked pores (blackheads and whiteheads) and absorb excess oil from the skin. Consult your doctor before using BENZONAK 5% LOTION.  How to use BENZONAK 5% LOTION?  Always apply BENZONAK 5% LOTION as directed by your physician. It is for external use only. Wash and dry your hands before applying this medicine. Wash the affected area with a mild cleanser and water and allow the skin to dry. Apply a thin layer of this medicine on the affected area leaving it for 2 hours and then wash it off with water and pat skin dry.  What are the precautions to be followed while using BENZONAK 5% LOTION?  While using BENZONAK 5% LOTION avoid contact with the eyes, lips, mouth, nose, mucous membranes and sensitive areas of the neck. In case of accidental contact rinse thoroughly with warm water and pat dry. You should not use any other acne products along with this medicine without taking advise from your doctor because they may cause skin to become red and sore.  How long should I use BENZONAK 5% LOTION  You should use BENZONAK 5% LOTION as long as advised by your physician or how quickly your condition improves. Sometimes acne may take time to clear completely. You should see your doctor if you feel your acne is not improving while using this medicine.  Can BENZONAK 5% LOTION be used in pregnant women?  BENZONAK 5% LOTION is generally not recommended for use in pregnant women or women who are planning to become pregnant unless clearly necessary. Consult your doctor before using the medicine.  What are the common side effects of using BENZONAK 5% LOTION?  Most common side effects of BENZONAK 5% LOTION are skin redness and irriation, burning, stinging sensation in the skin. Sudden increase in peeling may occur during the first weeks in most of the patients. This is usually not harmful and may subside once the treatment is discontinued temporarily. Consult your doctor if any of above symptoms worsens.

name: BENZONAK 2.5% Lotion 50ml
about: INTRODUCTION  BENZONAK 2.5% LOTION contains Benzoyl peroxide which belongs to the group of medicines called Anti-bacterial and Anti-inflammatory agents. It is used in the treatment and prevention of acne (pimples) in the face, chest and back. It is also used to unplug the blocked pores (blackheads and whiteheads) and absorb excess oil from the skin.  Before using BENZONAK 2.5% LOTION, inform your doctor if you are having any allergy to foods, preservatives or dyes or if you are already under any medication for acne.  It is not recommended to use hard cleansers, scrubs, medicated soap or cosmetic products containing alcohol while using this medicine.  BENZONAK 2.5% LOTION is generally not recommended for use in pregnant women unless clearly needed. Consult your doctor before using the medicine.  Avoid repeated exposure to sunlight or other sources of UV light (such as sun bed). In case of accidental contact, rinse thoroughly with warm water and pat dry.  Most common side effects of BENZONAK 2.5% LOTION are skin redness and irriation, burning, stinging sensation in the skin. Consult your doctor if any of above symptoms worsens.
uses: USES OF BENZONAK 2.5% LOTION  Used to:  Treat acne (pimples) formation Remove excessive oil from the skin Unplug blocked pores
working: HOW BENZONAK 2.5% LOTION WORKS  BENZONAK 2.5% LOTION works against the acne-causing bacteria. This medicine after applying on the affected skin gets absorbed and is converted to benzoic acid. This benzoic acid gets metabolized by skin proteins and releases active free-radical oxygen species that results in the alteration of bacterial proteins. This helps to treat acne or pimples. BENZONAK 2.5% LOTION also acts as a keratolytic agent which promotes peeling of the skin and absorb excess oil from the skin further preventing acne formation and skin irritation.
directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Always apply BENZONAK 2.5% LOTION as directed by your physician. It is for external use only. Apply a thin layer of this medicine on the affected area as instructed by the doctor.  Avoid contact with eyes, lips, mouth, nose, mucous membranes and sensitive areas of the neck. Your doctor will decide the correct dose and duration for you depending you’re your age, body weight and disease condition.
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF BENZONAK 2.5% LOTION COMMON Dry skin Skin redness Peeling of the skin Burning sensation of the skin Itching of the skin (pruritus) Pain of the skin (pain, stinging) Skin irritation Allergic contact dermatitis RARE  Stop applying BENZONAK 2.5% LOTION and contact your doctor immediately if you experience any of the following side effects:  Allergic reactions, including application site hypersensitivity, face swelling and anaphylaxis Severe skin irritation, redness and peeling of the skin, swelling of the face Fainting
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY  BENZONAK 2.5% LOTION is generally not recommended for use in pregnant women unless clearly necessary. Consult your doctor before using it.  BREASTFEEDING  BENZONAK 2.5% LOTION should be used with caution in breast feeding mothers. Consult your doctor before using the medicine.  ALLERGY  Do not apply BENZONAK 2.5% LOTION if you are allergic to Benzyl peroxide or to any other ingredients of this medicine.  OTHERS  BENZONAK 2.5% LOTION is not recommended for use if you:  Have damaged skin or broken skin Are using hard cleansers, scrubs, medicated soap or cosmetic products containing alcohol  Use in paediatrics:  Your doctor will decide the right dose depends on your child’s age, body weight and disease condition. Consult your doctor before using BENZONAK 2.5% LOTION.
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug-Drug interactions:  Before applying BENZONAK 2.5% LOTION, inform your doctor if you are taking or using any of the following medicine:  Medicines used to treat various skin diseases (Ex. dapsone) Topical hydroquinone (medicine used to remove dark patches of the skin) Isotretinoin, topical tretinoin (used to treat acne) Topical anaesthetics (used to relieve pain and itching) Ex. benzocaine, lignocaine  B. Drug-Food interactions:  Before applying BENZONAK 2.5% LOTION inform your doctor if you are having any allergies to any other medicines, foods, preservatives or dyes.  Overdosage:  If you or anyone else accidentally applies more of BENZONAK 2.5% LOTION or accidently ingested BENZONAK 2.5% LOTION, consult your doctor immediately or visit the nearby hospital. Symptoms of overuse of this medicine is severe skin irritation.

Sudden increase in peeling may occur during the first weeks in most of the patients. This is usually not harmful and may subside once the treatment is discontinued temporarily. Consult your doctor if any of above symptoms worsens.
