name: BENZONIX Gel Wash 50gm
about: INTRODUCTION  [GBKEYWORD] contains Benzoyl peroxide which belongs to the group of medicines called Anti-bacterial and Anti-inflammatory agents. It is used to treat mild acne on face visible as whiteheads and blackheads on face as well as acne vulgaris (pimples occurring in the hair follicles). It is also used to prevent formation of new blemishes on skin and unclog the pores of skin.  BENZONIX GEL WASH is not recommended for severe acne and/or on the skin having deeper pits and dents, broken and/or damaged skin and in people who are allergic to benzoyl peroxide and/or any other ingredient found in BENZONIX GEL WASH.  It is not recommended for use in pregnant and breastfeeding women unless necessary. Consult your doctor before using BENZONIX GEL WASH.  It is recommended to use only those products, that are labelled as non-comedogenic to prevent clogging of pores.  Avoid applying BENZONIX GEL WASH around your eyes, including eyelids and other mucous membranes. Also, care must be taken not to apply BENZONIX GEL WASH on broken/ damaged skin or the skin having dents or scars.  Most common side effects of using BENZONIX GEL WASH are skin tension, burning stinging, itching, peeling and reddening of the skin. Consult your doctor if any of these above reactions bothers you.
uses: USES OF BENZONIX GEL WASH Used to treat and prevent mild acne, blackheads, whiteheads and acne vulgaris
working: HOW BENZONIX GEL WASH WORKS  BENZONIX GEL WASH works against the acne-causing bacteria. This medicine after applying on the affected skin gets absorbed and is converted to benzoic acid. This benzoic acid gets metabolized by skin proteins and releases active free-radical oxygen species that results in the alteration of bacterial proteins. This helps to treat acne or pimples. BENZONIX GEL WASH also acts as a keratolytic agent which promotes peeling of the skin and absorb excess oil from the skin further preventing acne formation and skin irritation.
directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Always use BENZONIX GEL WASH as directed by your physician. It is for external use only. Your doctor will decide the correct dose and duration for you depending upon your disease condition.  Wet the area to be treated. Wash hands before use and place a small amount of BENZONIX GEL WASH on to the hands to wash the affected area. Wash and rinse thoroughly with water after application.
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF BENZONIX GEL WASH COMMON Dryness, redness, peeling of the skin Burning sensation of skin Itching of skin (pruritis) Stinging and/or pain on the skin Skin irritation when in contact with foreign objects (irritant contact dermatitis) RARE  Stop using BENZONIX GEL WASH and consult your doctor immediately if you experience any of the following:  Swelling of the skin Development of blisters on skin (blistering) Severe allergic reactions of skin such as development of hives (raise and itchy rash), swelling of face, throat, lips, mouth and tongue leading to difficulty in breathing Fainting
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY  BENZONIX GEL WASH should be used with caution in pregnant women unless clearly necessary. Consult your doctor before using the medicine.  BREASTFEEDING  BENZONIX GEL WASH is generally not recommended to be used in nursing women. Consult your doctor before using this medicine.  ALLERGY  Do not use BENZONIX GEL WASH if you are allergic to Benzyl peroxide or to any other ingredients of this medicine.  OTHERS  BENZONIX GEL WASH is not recommended for use if you have:  Severe acne on face visible as inflamed spots and/or large lumps on face Scars from previous acne A shallow dent and/or deeper pit on the skin Acne on shoulders, back and/or chest Damaged or broken skin  Use in pediatrics:  Your doctor will decide the right dose depends on your child’s age, body weight and disease condition. Consult your doctor before using BENZONIX GEL WASH.
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug-Drug interactions:  Before using BENZONIX GEL WASH, inform your doctor if you are using or taking any of the following medicine:  Medicines used to treat acne (Ex. isotretinoin) Medicines used to treat leprosy and other skin conditions (Ex. dapsone) Medicines used to treat hyperpigmentation (dark spots, melasma) (Ex. hydroquinone) Medicines used to cause anesthesia (Ex. lidocaine, bupivacaine)  B. Drug-Food interactions:  Before applying BENZONIX GEL WASH inform your doctor if you are having any allergies to any other medicines, foods, preservatives or dyes.  Overdosage:  If you or anyone else accidentally uses too much of BENZONIX GEL WASH or accidentally ingested it, consult your doctor immediately or visit the nearby hospital.
synopsis: SYNOPSIS Drug	:  	  Benzoyl peroxide   Pharmacological Category	:  	  Topical Antibiotics   Therapeutic Indication	:  	  Acne   Dosage Forms	:  	Gel, Lotion, Ointment, Facewash, Soap, Gelwash
moreInfo: MORE INFORMATION Keep BENZONIX GEL WASH out of reach of children Store at room temperature
faqs: FAQs ABOUT BENZONIX GEL WASH  What is BENZONIX GEL WASH used for?  BENZONIX GEL WASH is used to treat mild acne on face visible as whiteheads and blackheads on face as well as acne vulgaris (pimples occurring in the hair follicles). It is also used to prevent formation of new blemishes on skin and unclog the pores of skin.  Can I take BENZONIX GEL WASH in pregnancy?  BENZONIX GEL WASH should be used with caution in pregnant women unless clearly necessary. Consult your doctor before using the medicine.  How to use BENZONIX GEL WASH?  Always use BENZONIX GEL WASH as directed by your physician. It is for external use only. Your doctor will decide the correct dose and duration for you depending upon your disease condition. Wet the area to be treated. Wash hands before use and place a small amount of BENZONIX GEL WASH on to the hands to wash the affected area. Wash and rinse thoroughly with water after application.  Can BENZONIX GEL WASH be used in nursing women?  BENZONIX GEL WASH is generally not recommended to be used in nursing women. Consult your doctor before using this medicine.  Can BENZONIX GEL WASH be used for severe acne?  No, it is not recommended to use BENZONIX GEL WASH if you have severe acne as BENZONIX GEL WASH is used to treat only mild-moderate acne. Also, it is not recommended to use it on the scars, pits and dents from previous acne and on skin that is damaged and broken.

name: BENZOYL PEROXIDE (NANZ) Gel 20gm
manufacturer: Nanz Med Science Pharma Pvt Ltd
about: INTRODUCTION  BENZOYL PEROXIDE (NANZ) GEL contains Benzoyl peroxide which belongs to the group of medicines called Anti-bacterial and Anti-inflammatory agents. It is used in the treatment and prevention of acne (pimples) in the face, chest and back. It is also used to unplug the blocked pores (blackheads and whiteheads) and absorb excess oil from the skin.  Before using BENZOYL PEROXIDE (NANZ) GEL, inform your doctor if you are having any allergy to foods, preservatives or dyes or if you are already under any medication for acne.  It is not recommended to use hard cleansers, scrubs, medicated soap or cosmetic products containing alcohol while using this medicine.  BENZOYL PEROXIDE (NANZ) GEL is generally not recommended for use in pregnant women unless clearly needed. Consult your doctor before using the medicine.  Avoid repeated exposure to sunlight or other sources of UV light (such as sun bed). In case of accidental contact, rinse thoroughly with warm water and pat dry.  Most common side effects of BENZOYL PEROXIDE (NANZ) GEL are skin redness and irriation, burning, stinging sensation in the skin. Consult your doctor if any of above symptoms worsens.
uses: USES OF BENZOYL PEROXIDE (NANZ) GEL  Used to:  Treat acne (pimples) formation Remove excessive oil from the skin Unplug blocked pores
working: HOW BENZOYL PEROXIDE (NANZ) GEL WORKS  BENZOYL PEROXIDE (NANZ) GEL works against the acne-causing bacteria. This medicine after applying on the affected skin gets absorbed and is converted to benzoic acid. This benzoic acid gets metabolized by skin proteins and releases active free-radical oxygen species that results in the alteration of bacterial proteins. This helps to treat acne or pimples. BENZOYL PEROXIDE (NANZ) GEL also acts as a keratolytic agent which promotes peeling of the skin and absorb excess oil from the skin further preventing acne formation and skin irritation.
directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Always apply BENZOYL PEROXIDE (NANZ) GEL as directed by your physician. It is for external use only. Apply a thin layer of this medicine on the affected area as instructed by the doctor. Avoid contact with eyes, lips, mouth, nose, mucous membranes and sensitive areas of the neck. Your doctor will decide the correct dose and duration for you depending your age, body weight and disease condition.
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF BENZOYL PEROXIDE (NANZ) GEL COMMON Dry skin Skin redness Peeling of the skin Burning sensation of the skin Itching of the skin (pruritus) Pain of the skin (pain, stinging) Skin irritation Allergic contact dermatitis  Stop applying BENZOYL PEROXIDE (NANZ) GEL and contact your doctor immediately if you experience any of the following side effects:  Allergic reactions, including application site hypersensitivity, face swelling and anaphylaxis Severe skin irritation, redness and peeling of the skin, swelling of the face Fainting
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY MONITORING REQUIRED  BENZOYL PEROXIDE (NANZ) GEL is generally not recommended for use in pregnant women unless clearly necessary. Consult your doctor before using it.  BREASTFEEDING USE WITH CAUTION  BENZOYL PEROXIDE (NANZ) GEL should be used with caution in breast feeding mothers. Consult your doctor before using the medicine.  ALLERGY CONTRAINDICATED  Do not apply BENZOYL PEROXIDE (NANZ) GEL if you are allergic to Benzyl peroxide or to any other ingredients of this medicine.  USE IN PEDIATRICS CONSULT YOUR DOCTOR  Your doctor will decide the right dose depends on your child’s age, body weight and disease condition. Consult your doctor before using BENZOYL PEROXIDE (NANZ) GEL.  OTHERS  BENZOYL PEROXIDE (NANZ) GEL is not recommended for use if you:  Have damaged skin or broken skin Are using hard cleansers, scrubs, medicated soap or cosmetic products containing alcohol
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug-Drug interactions:  Before applying BENZOYL PEROXIDE (NANZ) GEL, inform your doctor if you are taking or using any of the following medicine:  Medicines used to treat various skin diseases (Ex. dapsone) Topical hydroquinone (medicine used to remove dark patches of the skin) Isotretinoin, topical tretinoin (used to treat acne) Topical anaesthetics (used to relieve pain and itching) Ex. benzocaine, lignocaine  B. Drug-Food interactions:  Before applying BENZOYL PEROXIDE (NANZ) GEL inform your doctor if you are having any allergies to any other medicines, foods, preservatives or dyes.  Overdosage:  If you or anyone else accidentally applies more of BENZOYL PEROXIDE (NANZ) GEL or accidently ingested BENZOYL PEROXIDE (NANZ) GEL, consult your doctor immediately or visit the nearby hospital. Symptoms of overuse of this medicine is severe skin irritation.
synopsis: SYNOPSIS Drug	:  	Benzoyl Peroxide Pharmacological Category	:  	Topical Antibiotics Therapeutic Indication	:  	Acne Dosage Forms	:  	Gel, Lotion, Ointment, Facewash, Soap, Gelwash
moreInfo: MORE INFORMATION Keep out of sight and reach of children Store at room temperature
faqs: FAQs ABOUT BENZOYL PEROXIDE (NANZ) GEL  Q: What is BENZOYL PEROXIDE (NANZ) GEL used for?  A: BENZOYL PEROXIDE (NANZ) GEL is used in the treatment and prevention of acne (pimples) in the face, chest and back. It can also be used to unplug the blocked pores (blackheads and whiteheads) and absorb excess oil from the skin. Consult your doctor before using BENZOYL PEROXIDE (NANZ) GEL.  Q: How to use BENZOYL PEROXIDE (NANZ) GEL?  A: Always apply BENZOYL PEROXIDE (NANZ) GEL as directed by your physician. It is for external use only. Wash and dry your hands before applying this medicine. Wash the affected area with a mild cleanser and water and allow the skin to dry. Apply a thin layer of this medicine on the affected area leaving it for 2 hours and then wash it off with water and pat skin dry.  Q: What are the precautions to be followed while using BENZOYL PEROXIDE (NANZ) GEL?  A: While using BENZOYL PEROXIDE (NANZ) GEL avoid contact with the eyes, lips, mouth, nose, mucous membranes and sensitive areas of the neck. In case of accidental contact rinse thoroughly with warm water and pat dry. You should not use any other acne products along with this medicine without taking advise from your doctor because they may cause skin to become red and sore.  Q: How long should I use BENZOYL PEROXIDE (NANZ) GEL?  A: You should use BENZOYL PEROXIDE (NANZ) GEL as long as advised by your physician or how quickly your condition improves. Sometimes acne may take time to clear completely. You should see your doctor if you feel your acne is not improving while using this medicine.  Q: Can BENZOYL PEROXIDE (NANZ) GEL be used in pregnant women?  A: BENZOYL PEROXIDE (NANZ) GEL is generally not recommended for use in pregnant women or women who are planning to become pregnant unless clearly necessary. Consult your doctor before using the medicine.  Q: What are the common side effects of using BENZOYL PEROXIDE (NANZ) GEL?  A: Most common side effects of BENZOYL PEROXIDE (NANZ) GEL are skin redness and irriation, burning, stinging sensation in the skin. Sudden increase in peeling may occur during the first weeks in most of the patients. This is usually not harmful and may subside once the treatment is discontinued temporarily. Consult your doctor if any of above symptoms worsens.

Avoid repeated exposure to sunlight or other sources of UV light (such as sun bed). In case of accidental contact, rinse thoroughly with warm water and pat dry.  Most common side effects of BEROX GEL are skin redness and irriation, burning, stinging sensation in the skin. Consult your doctor if any of above symptoms worsens.
uses: USES OF BEROX GEL  Used to:  Treat acne (pimples) formation Remove excessive oil from the skin Unplug blocked pores
working: HOW BEROX GEL WORKS  BEROX GEL works against the acne-causing bacteria. This medicine after applying on the affected skin gets absorbed and is converted to benzoic acid. This benzoic acid gets metabolized by skin proteins and releases active free-radical oxygen species that results in the alteration of bacterial proteins. This helps to treat acne or pimples. BEROX GEL also acts as a keratolytic agent which promotes peeling of the skin and absorb excess oil from the skin further preventing acne formation and skin irritation.
directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Always apply BEROX GEL as directed by your physician. It is for external use only. Apply a thin layer of this medicine on the affected area as instructed by the doctor. Avoid contact with eyes, lips, mouth, nose, mucous membranes and sensitive areas of the neck. Your doctor will decide the correct dose and duration for you depending your age, body weight and disease condition.
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF BEROX GEL COMMON Dry skin Skin redness Peeling of the skin Burning sensation of the skin Itching of the skin (pruritus) Pain of the skin (pain, stinging) Skin irritation Allergic contact dermatitis  Stop applying BEROX GEL and contact your doctor immediately if you experience any of the following side effects:  Allergic reactions, including application site hypersensitivity, face swelling and anaphylaxis Severe skin irritation, redness and peeling of the skin, swelling of the face Fainting
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY MONITORING REQUIRED  BEROX GEL is generally not recommended for use in pregnant women unless clearly necessary. Consult your doctor before using it.  BREASTFEEDING USE WITH CAUTION  BEROX GEL should be used with caution in breast feeding mothers. Consult your doctor before using the medicine.  ALLERGY CONTRAINDICATED  Do not apply BEROX GEL if you are allergic to Benzyl peroxide or to any other ingredients of this medicine.  USE IN PEDIATRICS CONSULT YOUR DOCTOR  Your doctor will decide the right dose depends on your child’s age, body weight and disease condition. Consult your doctor before using BEROX GEL.  OTHERS  BEROX GEL is not recommended for use if you:  Have damaged skin or broken skin Are using hard cleansers, scrubs, medicated soap or cosmetic products containing alcohol
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug-Drug interactions:  Before applying BEROX GEL, inform your doctor if you are taking or using any of the following medicine:  Medicines used to treat various skin diseases (Ex. dapsone) Topical hydroquinone (medicine used to remove dark patches of the skin) Isotretinoin, topical tretinoin (used to treat acne) Topical anaesthetics (used to relieve pain and itching) Ex. benzocaine, lignocaine  B. Drug-Food interactions:  Before applying BEROX GEL inform your doctor if you are having any allergies to any other medicines, foods, preservatives or dyes.  Overdosage:  If you or anyone else accidentally applies more of BEROX GEL or accidently ingested BEROX GEL, consult your doctor immediately or visit the nearby hospital. Symptoms of overuse of this medicine is severe skin irritation.
synopsis: SYNOPSIS Drug	:  	Benzoyl Peroxide Pharmacological Category	:  	Topical Antibiotics Therapeutic Indication	:  	Acne Dosage Forms	:  	Gel, Lotion, Ointment, Facewash, Soap, Gelwash
moreInfo: MORE INFORMATION Keep out of sight and reach of children Store at room temperature
faqs: FAQs ABOUT BEROX GEL  Q: What is BEROX GEL used for?  A: BEROX GEL is used in the treatment and prevention of acne (pimples) in the face, chest and back. It can also be used to unplug the blocked pores (blackheads and whiteheads) and absorb excess oil from the skin. Consult your doctor before using BEROX GEL.  Q: How to use BEROX GEL?  A: Always apply BEROX GEL as directed by your physician. It is for external use only. Wash and dry your hands before applying this medicine. Wash the affected area with a mild cleanser and water and allow the skin to dry. Apply a thin layer of this medicine on the affected area leaving it for 2 hours and then wash it off with water and pat skin dry.  Q: What are the precautions to be followed while using BEROX GEL?  A: While using BEROX GEL avoid contact with the eyes, lips, mouth, nose, mucous membranes and sensitive areas of the neck. In case of accidental contact rinse thoroughly with warm water and pat dry. You should not use any other acne products along with this medicine without taking advise from your doctor because they may cause skin to become red and sore.  Q: How long should I use BEROX GEL?  A: You should use BEROX GEL as long as advised by your physician or how quickly your condition improves. Sometimes acne may take time to clear completely. You should see your doctor if you feel your acne is not improving while using this medicine.  Q: Can BEROX GEL be used in pregnant women?  A: BEROX GEL is generally not recommended for use in pregnant women or women who are planning to become pregnant unless clearly necessary. Consult your doctor before using the medicine.  Q: What are the common side effects of using BEROX GEL?  A: Most common side effects of BEROX GEL are skin redness and irriation, burning, stinging sensation in the skin. Sudden increase in peeling may occur during the first weeks in most of the patients. This is usually not harmful and may subside once the treatment is discontinued temporarily. Consult your doctor if any of above symptoms worsens.

name: BEROX AD Gel 20gm
about: INTRODUCTION  BEROX AD GEL is a combination of Adapalene and Benzoyl peroxide which belongs to the group of medicines called Antiacne agents. It is used in the treatment of acne.  Acne vulgaris (commonly known as acne) is an inflammatory skin condition that occurs when the hair follicles present in the skin are clogged with excess oil and/or dead skin cells. It can also be aggravated by few bacteria (such as Propionibacterium acnes) and is highly common among on the teenagers and the young adults.  It primarily affects the face, upper arms, trunk or back and is often characterized by pus-filled pimples, red bumps with inflammatory and non-inflammatory lesions. BEROX AD GEL is suitable for use both in adults and in children (aged 9 years or older).  Apply a thin layer of BEROX AD GEL on the affected skin areas. Avoid contact of this medicine with your eyes, mouth, ears, nose or with open wounds. You must also protect your skin against sun light and against other light sources (such as UV lamps).  Do not use BEROX AD GEL if you are pregnant, think you may be pregnant or planning to have a baby. BEROX AD GEL can be used in breastfeeding women if required. The most common side effects of using BEROX AD GEL are dry skin, mild burning sensation and skin irritation, redness or scaling. Consult your doctor if they trouble you.
uses: USES OF BEROX AD GEL  It is used in adults, children and in adolescents (aged 9 years or older) to:  Treat acne
working: HOW BEROX AD GEL WORKS  BEROX AD GEL is a combination of two medicines namely, adapalene and benzoyl peroxide.  Adapalene is a topical retinoid (a type of vitamin A). It modulates the skin cell cycle and prevents the accumulation of excess sebum (natural oil produced by the skin) and dead skin cells on the hair follicles of the skin. It also reduces inflammation on the skin.  Benzoyl peroxide is a keratolytic agent with antimicrobial properties. It improves skin’s tendency to exfoliate the dead skin cells naturally. It also reduces the number of acne-causing bacteria on the skin which can reduce the further spread of acne.  Collectively, they unclog the hair follicles of the skin and exfoliates dead skin cells which reduces acne breakouts.
directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Apply a thin layer of this medicine on the affected skin areas or as directed by the physician. It is for topical use only. Wash your hands before and after application.  Your doctor will decide the correct dose and duration of therapy for you depending upon your age, body weight and health condition.  Avoid contact of BEROX AD GEL with your eyes, mouth, ears, nose, hair or with open wounds (cuts, scrapes or sunburn).
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF BEROX AD GEL COMMON Dry skin Skin redness and scaling Burning sensation of the skin Skin irritation UNCOMMON Itching of the skin (pruritus) Sunburn RARE  Stop using BEROX AD GEL and consult your doctor immediately if you experience:  Signs of allergic reaction (such as severe skin rash with itching of body parts, swelling of the eyes, face, lips or tongue causing throat tightness and breathing difficulties and feel faint)
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY  BEROX AD GEL is not recommended for use in pregnant women. Therefore, inform your doctor before using this medicine if you are pregnant, think you may be pregnant or planning to have a baby. If you became pregnant while using this medicine, stop using it and contact your doctor immediately.  BREASTFEEDING  BEROX AD GEL can be used in breastfeeding women. However, do not apply this medicine on your chest to avoid exposing this medicine to the nursing infant.  ALLERGY  Talk to your doctor if you are allergic to Adapalene or Benzoyl peroxide.  OTHERS  BEROX AD GEL is not recommended for use if you:  Have any cuts, scrapes, sunburn or eczema at the site of application  Use in Pediatrics:  BEROX AD GEL can be used in children and adolescents (aged 9 years or older) if advised by the physician. Therefore, consult your doctor before using it.
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug-Drug interactions:  Before using BEROX AD GEL, inform your doctor if you are using any of the following:  Other anti-acne medicines (such as clindamycin) Skin cosmetics (such as hair perming solutions, astringents, toners, shaving lotion, abrasive soaps or cleansers)  Overdosage:  If you or anyone else applied excessive amount of BEROX AD GEL, rinse your skin with plenty of cold water. If irritation persists, consult your doctor.
synopsis: SYNOPSIS Drug	:  	Adapalene, Benzoyl peroxide Pharmacological Category	:  	Retinoid-like compounds, Topical Antibiotics Therapeutic Indication	:  	Acne vulgaris Dosage Forms	:  	Topical Gel
moreInfo: MORE INFORMATION Keep BEROX AD GEL out of reach of children Store BEROX AD GEL at room temperature
faqs: FAQs ABOUT BEROX AD GEL  Will BEROX AD GEL be more effective if I overuse it?  No. Do not overuse this medicine. If you use more, you will not get rid of acne quicker. Instead, it may make your skin more irritated and red. Therefore, only apply the quantity mentioned by your doctor.  What are the side effects of using BEROX AD GEL?  BEROX AD GEL is generally safe with limited or no side effects. However, you may experience skin dryness, redness or irritation after applying this medicine. Contact your doctor if it troubles you.  What is the use of BEROX AD GEL?  BEROX AD GEL is used in the treatment of acne.  How BEROX AD GEL works?  BEROX AD GEL prevents the accumulation of excess sebum (natural oil produced by the skin) and dead skin cells on the hair follicles of the skin. It also reduces inflammation on the skin and improves skin’s tendency to exfoliate the dead skin cells naturally. It also reduces the number of acne-causing bacteria on the skin which can reduce the further spread of acne.  How to use BEROX AD GEL?  BEROX AD GEL is for external use only. Take the required quantity of the medicine and apply on the affected skin areas. Avoid contact of this medicine with your eyes, ears, nose or any other mucous membranes.  How long does it take for BEROX AD GEL to work?  It may take up to 2-3 weeks for BEROX AD GEL to show improvement in your skin condition. However, this period may vary from person-to-person depending upon the skin condition.  How long should I use BEROX AD GEL?  Your doctor will decide the correct dose and duration of therapy for you depending upon your age, body weight and health condition. You need to use BEROX AD GEL for the stipulated duration prescribed by your doctor. Failing to do so may not result in adequate response.  What to do if I forgot to apply BEROX AD GEL?  If you forgot to apply BEROX AD GEL, apply it as soon as you remember. However, if it is time for the next application, skip the missed one and apply the next dose. Do not excessively apply BEROX AD GEL to compensate the missed doses.  Is BEROX AD GEL safe?  BEROX AD GEL is safe at doses prescribed by the physician. Therefore, do not alter the dose of BEROX AD GEL without consulting your doctor.  Can I stop using BEROX AD GEL without consulting your doctor?  No. You should not stop using BEROX AD GEL without consulting your doctor as it may reduce its effectiveness. Therefore, apply BEROX AD GEL for the stipulated duration recommended by your doctor to achieve maximum results.  Can BEROX AD GEL be used in pregnant women?  BEROX AD GEL is not recommended for use in pregnant women. Therefore, inform your doctor before using this medicine if you are pregnant, think you may be pregnant or planning to have a baby. If you became pregnant while using this medicine, stop using it and contact your doctor immediately.

name: BIOMYCIN Gel 15gm
about: INTRODUCTION  BIOMYCIN GEL contains Clarithromycin which belongs to the group of medicines called Macrolide Antibiotics. It is used to treat acne vulgaris. It also treats blackheads, whiteheads, more severe forms of acne.  Acne is caused due to blockage and the inflammation of the skin pores or hair follicles. When oil is trapped in the hair follicles, the normal skin bacteria P.acnes (gram-positive commensal bacterium) will grow in the blocked pore. The bacteria produce chemicals that alter the composition of the oil, which makes it more irritating to the skin and causes inflammation of the skin pore. This results in superficial skin eruptions.  BIOMYCIN GEL is not recommended for patients who are allergic (hypersensitive) to clarithromycin, or to any other ingredients present in it.  This medicine should be used with caution in pregnant women and breastfeeding mothers. Consult your doctor before using BIOMYCIN GEL.  The most common side effects include skin dryness and possible irritation. Consult a doctor immediately if any of the symptoms worsen.
uses: USES OF BIOMYCIN GEL Treats pimples, blackheads, whiteheads and more severe forms of acne
working: HOW BIOMYCIN GEL WORKS  BIOMYCIN GEL prevents the growth of bacteria by interfering with its protein synthesis and binds specific proteins present in the bacterial ribosomes, thus stopping the growth of the bacteria inside the body, which helps to reduce the infection and its symptoms.
directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Always use BIOMYCIN GEL as directed by your physician. It is for external use only. Apply a thin layer of BIOMYCIN GEL to the affected area. Your doctor will give the right dose depending on your age, body weight and severity of the infection.
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF BIOMYCIN GEL COMMON Skin dryness Possible irritation
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY  BIOMYCIN GEL is not recommended for use during pregnancy. However, consult your doctor before using the medicine.  BREASTFEEDING  It is unknown that BIOMYCIN GEL pass into the breast milk, hence it should be used with caution during breastfeeding. However, consult your doctor before using the medicine.  ALLERGY  Do not use BIOMYCIN GEL if you are allergic (hypersensitive) to Clarithromycin and other macrolide antibiotics or to any other constituents of this medicine.
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug-Drug interactions:  Before using BIOMYCIN GEL, inform your doctor if you are taking prescription, non-prescription medicines or applying for any medicated soap, herbal or ayurvedic medicine on the skin for acne.  Overdosage:  BIOMYCIN GEL rarely can cause any effect on applying excess. However, if you or anyone else accidentally applied too much of BIOMYCIN GEL, consult your doctor immediately or visit the nearby hospital.
synopsis: SYNOPSIS Drug	:  	Clarithromycin Pharmacological Category	:  	Macrolide antibiotics Therapeutic Indication	:  	Acne Vulgaris Dosage Forms	:  	  Tablet, Injection, Dry syrup, Oral suspensions, Gel, Granules, Lotion, Solution
moreInfo: MORE INFORMATION Keep BIOMYCIN GEL out of reach of children Store at room temperature
faqs: FAQs ABOUT BIOMYCIN GEL  How to use BIOMYCIN GEL for treating acne?  Apply a thin layer of BIOMYCIN GEL to the affected area of the skin. Wash your hands before applying BIOMYCIN GEL to avoid infection. Initially apply for a limited time and then gradually increase the time of exposure of the medicine to the skin. Consult your doctor for advice.  When should I call a doctor immediately?  Consult a doctor immediately if you show symptoms such as allergic reactions like skin redness, rash, hives, itching, blisters, and swelling of the face, lips, or tongue.  What BIOMYCIN GEL is used for?  BIOMYCIN GEL is used to treat bacterial acne, pimples, blackheads, whiteheads and some severe forms of acne. Consult your doctor for advice before using.  Can I use BIOMYCIN GEL with any other face cream or moisturizer?  It is advisable not to use BIOMYCIN GEL with other topical anti-acne medicines unless prescribed by your doctor. It can increase the risk of side effects such as skin peeling, irritation, or dryness. However, consult your doctor for advice before using.  What are the side effects of applying BIOMYCIN GEL on my skin?  Skin dryness and possible irritation are the few side effects that can happen while using BIOMYCIN GEL. Consult your doctor if it becomes worse and unmanageable.

name: BENCLEAR 2.5% Gel 20gm

It is used in the treatment and prevention of acne (pimples) in the face, chest and back. It is also used to unplug the blocked pores (blackheads and whiteheads) and absorb excess oil from the skin.  Before using BENCLEAR 2.5% GEL, inform your doctor if you are having any allergy to foods, preservatives or dyes or if you are already under any medication for acne.  It is not recommended to use hard cleansers, scrubs, medicated soap or cosmetic products containing alcohol while using this medicine.  BENCLEAR 2.5% GEL is generally not recommended for use in pregnant women unless clearly needed. Consult your doctor before using the medicine.  Avoid repeated exposure to sunlight or other sources of UV light (such as sun bed). In case of accidental contact, rinse thoroughly with warm water and pat dry. name: BENCLEAR 5% Gel 20gm
about: INTRODUCTION  BENCLEAR 5% GEL contains Benzoyl peroxide which belongs to the group of medicines called Anti-bacterial and Anti-inflammatory agents. It is used in the treatment and prevention of acne (pimples) in the face, chest and back. It is also used to unplug the blocked pores (blackheads and whiteheads) and absorb excess oil from the skin.  Before using BENCLEAR 5% GEL, inform your doctor if you are having any allergy to foods, preservatives or dyes or if you are already under any medication for acne.  It is not recommended to use hard cleansers, scrubs, medicated soap or cosmetic products containing alcohol while using this medicine.  BENCLEAR 5% GEL is generally not recommended for use in pregnant women unless clearly needed. Consult your doctor before using the medicine.  Avoid repeated exposure to sunlight or other sources of UV light (such as sun bed). In case of accidental contact, rinse thoroughly with warm water and pat dry.  Most common side effects of BENCLEAR 5% GEL are skin redness and irriation, burning, stinging sensation in the skin. Consult your doctor if any of above symptoms worsens.
uses: USES OF BENCLEAR 5% GEL  Used to:  Treat acne (pimples) formation Remove excessive oil from the skin Unplug blocked pores
working: HOW BENCLEAR 5% GEL WORKS  BENCLEAR 5% GEL works against the acne-causing bacteria. This medicine after applying on the affected skin gets absorbed and is converted to benzoic acid. This benzoic acid gets metabolized by skin proteins and releases active free-radical oxygen species that results in the alteration of bacterial proteins. This helps to treat acne or pimples. BENCLEAR 5% GEL also acts as a keratolytic agent which promotes peeling of the skin and absorb excess oil from the skin further preventing acne formation and skin irritation.
directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Always apply BENCLEAR 5% GEL as directed by your physician. It is for external use only. Apply a thin layer of this medicine on the affected area as instructed by the doctor.  Avoid contact with eyes, lips, mouth, nose, mucous membranes and sensitive areas of the neck. Your doctor will decide the correct dose and duration for you depending you’re your age, body weight and disease condition.
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF BENCLEAR 5% GEL COMMON Dry skin Skin redness Peeling of the skin Burning sensation of the skin Itching of the skin (pruritus) Pain of the skin (pain, stinging) Skin irritation Allergic contact dermatitis RARE  Stop applying BENCLEAR 5% GEL and contact your doctor immediately if you experience any of the following side effects:  Allergic reactions, including application site hypersensitivity, face swelling and anaphylaxis Severe skin irritation, redness and peeling of the skin, swelling of the face Fainting
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY  BENCLEAR 5% GEL is generally not recommended for use in pregnant women unless clearly necessary. Consult your doctor before using it.  BREASTFEEDING  BENCLEAR 5% GEL should be used with caution in breast feeding mothers. Consult your doctor before using the medicine.  ALLERGY  Do not apply BENCLEAR 5% GEL if you are allergic to Benzyl peroxide or to any other ingredients of this medicine.  OTHERS  BENCLEAR 5% GEL is not recommended for use if you:  Have damaged skin or broken skin Are using hard cleansers, scrubs, medicated soap or cosmetic products containing alcohol  Use in paediatrics:  Your doctor will decide the right dose depends on your child’s age, body weight and disease condition. Consult your doctor before using BENCLEAR 5% GEL.
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug-Drug interactions:  Before applying BENCLEAR 5% GEL, inform your doctor if you are taking or using any of the following medicine:  Medicines used to treat various skin diseases (Ex. dapsone) Topical hydroquinone (medicine used to remove dark patches of the skin) Isotretinoin, topical tretinoin (used to treat acne) Topical anaesthetics (used to relieve pain and itching) Ex. benzocaine, lignocaine  B. Drug-Food interactions:  Before applying BENCLEAR 5% GEL inform your doctor if you are having any allergies to any other medicines, foods, preservatives or dyes.  Overdosage:  If you or anyone else accidentally applies more of BENCLEAR 5% GEL or accidently ingested BENCLEAR 5% GEL, consult your doctor immediately or visit the nearby hospital. Symptoms of overuse of this medicine is severe skin irritation.
synopsis: SYNOPSIS Drug	:  	Benzoyl Peroxide Pharmacological Category	:  	Topical Antibiotics Therapeutic Indication	:  	Acne Dosage Forms	:  	Gel, Lotion, Ointment, Facewash, Soap, Gelwash
moreInfo: MORE INFORMATION Keep out of sight and reach of children Store at room temperature
faqs: FAQs ABOUT BENCLEAR 5% GEL  What is BENCLEAR 5% GEL used for?  BENCLEAR 5% GEL is used in the treatment and prevention of acne (pimples) in the face, chest and back. It can also be used to unplug the blocked pores (blackheads and whiteheads) and absorb excess oil from the skin. Consult your doctor before using BENCLEAR 5% GEL.  How to use BENCLEAR 5% GEL?  Always apply BENCLEAR 5% GEL as directed by your physician. It is for external use only. Wash and dry your hands before applying this medicine. Wash the affected area with a mild cleanser and water and allow the skin to dry. Apply a thin layer of this medicine on the affected area leaving it for 2 hours and then wash it off with water and pat skin dry.  What are the precautions to be followed while using BENCLEAR 5% GEL?  While using BENCLEAR 5% GEL avoid contact with the eyes, lips, mouth, nose, mucous membranes and sensitive areas of the neck. In case of accidental contact rinse thoroughly with warm water and pat dry. You should not use any other acne products along with this medicine without taking advise from your doctor because they may cause skin to become red and sore.  How long should I use BENCLEAR 5% GEL  You should use BENCLEAR 5% GEL as long as advised by your physician or how quickly your condition improves. Sometimes acne may take time to clear completely. You should see your doctor if you feel your acne is not improving while using this medicine.  Can BENCLEAR 5% GEL be used in pregnant women?  BENCLEAR 5% GEL is generally not recommended for use in pregnant women or women who are planning to become pregnant unless clearly necessary. Consult your doctor before using the medicine.  What are the common side effects of using BENCLEAR 5% GEL?  Most common side effects of BENCLEAR 5% GEL are skin redness and irriation, burning, stinging sensation in the skin. Sudden increase in peeling may occur during the first weeks in most of the patients. This is usually not harmful and may subside once the treatment is discontinued temporarily. Consult your doctor if any of above symptoms worsens.

name: BENCLEAR A Gel 15gm
about: INTRODUCTION  BENCLEAR A GEL is a combination of Adapalene and Benzoyl peroxide which belongs to the group of medicines called Antiacne agents. It is used in the treatment of acne.  Acne vulgaris (commonly known as acne) is an inflammatory skin condition that occurs when the hair follicles present in the skin are clogged with excess oil and/or dead skin cells. It can also be aggravated by few bacteria (such as Propionibacterium acnes) and is highly common among on the teenagers and the young adults.  It primarily affects the face, upper arms, trunk or back and is often characterized by pus-filled pimples, red bumps with inflammatory and non-inflammatory lesions. BENCLEAR A GEL is suitable for use both in adults and in children (aged 9 years or older).  Apply a thin layer of BENCLEAR A GEL on the affected skin areas. Avoid contact of this medicine with your eyes, mouth, ears, nose or with open wounds. You must also protect your skin against sun light and against other light sources (such as UV lamps).  Do not use BENCLEAR A GEL if you are pregnant, think you may be pregnant or planning to have a baby. BENCLEAR A GEL can be used in breastfeeding women if required. The most common side effects of using BENCLEAR A GEL are dry skin, mild burning sensation and skin irritation, redness or scaling. Consult your doctor if they trouble you.
uses: USES OF BENCLEAR A GEL  It is used in adults, children and in adolescents (aged 9 years or older) to:  Treat acne
working: HOW BENCLEAR A GEL WORKS  BENCLEAR A GEL is a combination of two medicines namely, adapalene and benzoyl peroxide.  Adapalene is a topical retinoid (a type of vitamin A). It modulates the skin cell cycle and prevents the accumulation of excess sebum (natural oil produced by the skin) and dead skin cells on the hair follicles of the skin. It also reduces inflammation on the skin.  Benzoyl peroxide is a keratolytic agent with antimicrobial properties. It improves skin’s tendency to exfoliate the dead skin cells naturally. It also reduces the number of acne-causing bacteria on the skin which can reduce the further spread of acne.  Collectively, they unclog the hair follicles of the skin and exfoliates dead skin cells which reduces acne breakouts.
directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Apply a thin layer of this medicine on the affected skin areas or as directed by the physician. It is for topical use only. Wash your hands before and after application.  Your doctor will decide the correct dose and duration of therapy for you depending upon your age, body weight and health condition.  Avoid contact of BENCLEAR A GEL with your eyes, mouth, ears, nose, hair or with open wounds (cuts, scrapes or sunburn).
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF BENCLEAR A GEL COMMON Dry skin Skin redness and scaling Burning sensation of the skin Skin irritation UNCOMMON Itching of the skin (pruritus) Sunburn RARE  Stop using BENCLEAR A GEL and consult your doctor immediately if you experience:  Signs of allergic reaction (such as severe skin rash with itching of body parts, swelling of the eyes, face, lips or tongue causing throat tightness and breathing difficulties and feel faint)
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY  BENCLEAR A GEL is not recommended for use in pregnant women. Therefore, inform your doctor before using this medicine if you are pregnant, think you may be pregnant or planning to have a baby. If you became pregnant while using this medicine, stop using it and contact your doctor immediately.  BREASTFEEDING  BENCLEAR A GEL can be used in breastfeeding women. However, do not apply this medicine on your chest to avoid exposing this medicine to the nursing infant.  ALLERGY  Talk to your doctor if you are allergic to Adapalene or Benzoyl peroxide.  OTHERS  BENCLEAR A GEL is not recommended for use if you:  Have any cuts, scrapes, sunburn or eczema at the site of application  Use in Pediatrics:  BENCLEAR A GEL can be used in children and adolescents (aged 9 years or older) if advised by the physician. Therefore, consult your doctor before using it.
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug-Drug interactions:  Before using BENCLEAR A GEL, inform your doctor if you are using any of the following:  Other anti-acne medicines (such as clindamycin) Skin cosmetics (such as hair perming solutions, astringents, toners, shaving lotion, abrasive soaps or cleansers)  Overdosage:  If you or anyone else applied excessive amount of BENCLEAR A GEL, rinse your skin with plenty of cold water. If irritation persists, consult your doctor.
synopsis: SYNOPSIS Drug	:  	Adapalene, Benzoyl peroxide Pharmacological Category	:  	Retinoid-like compounds, Topical Antibiotics Therapeutic Indication	:  	Acne vulgaris Dosage Forms	:  	Topical Gel
moreInfo: MORE INFORMATION Keep BENCLEAR A GEL out of reach of children Store BENCLEAR A GEL at room temperature
faqs: FAQs ABOUT BENCLEAR A GEL  Will BENCLEAR A GEL be more effective if I overuse it?  No. Do not overuse this medicine. If you use more, you will not get rid of acne quicker. Instead, it may make your skin more irritated and red. Therefore, only apply the quantity mentioned by your doctor.  What are the side effects of using BENCLEAR A GEL?  BENCLEAR A GEL is generally safe with limited or no side effects. However, you may experience skin dryness, redness or irritation after applying this medicine. Contact your doctor if it troubles you.  What is the use of BENCLEAR A GEL?  BENCLEAR A GEL is used in the treatment of acne.  How BENCLEAR A GEL works?  BENCLEAR A GEL prevents the accumulation of excess sebum (natural oil produced by the skin) and dead skin cells on the hair follicles of the skin. It also reduces inflammation on the skin and improves skin’s tendency to exfoliate the dead skin cells naturally. It also reduces the number of acne-causing bacteria on the skin which can reduce the further spread of acne.  How to use BENCLEAR A GEL?  BENCLEAR A GEL is for external use only. Take the required quantity of the medicine and apply on the affected skin areas. Avoid contact of this medicine with your eyes, ears, nose or any other mucous membranes.  How long does it take for BENCLEAR A GEL to work?  It may take up to 2-3 weeks for BENCLEAR A GEL to show improvement in your skin condition. However, this period may vary from person-to-person depending upon the skin condition.  How long should I use BENCLEAR A GEL?  Your doctor will decide the correct dose and duration of therapy for you depending upon your age, body weight and health condition. You need to use BENCLEAR A GEL for the stipulated duration prescribed by your doctor. Failing to do so may not result in adequate response.  What to do if I forgot to apply BENCLEAR A GEL?  If you forgot to apply BENCLEAR A GEL, apply it as soon as you remember. However, if it is time for the next application, skip the missed one and apply the next dose. Do not excessively apply BENCLEAR A GEL to compensate the missed doses.  Is BENCLEAR A GEL safe?  BENCLEAR A GEL is safe at doses prescribed by the physician. Therefore, do not alter the dose of BENCLEAR A GEL without consulting your doctor.  Can I stop using BENCLEAR A GEL without consulting your doctor?  No. You should not stop using BENCLEAR A GEL without consulting your doctor as it may reduce its effectiveness. Therefore, apply BENCLEAR A GEL for the stipulated duration recommended by your doctor to achieve maximum results.  Can BENCLEAR A GEL be used in pregnant women?  BENCLEAR A GEL is not recommended for use in pregnant women. Therefore, inform your doctor before using this medicine if you are pregnant, think you may be pregnant or planning to have a baby. If you became pregnant while using this medicine, stop using it and contact your doctor immediately.

Drug-Drug interactions:  Before using BENLITE A GEL, inform your doctor if you are using any of the following:  Other anti-acne medicines (such as clindamycin) Skin cosmetics (such as hair perming solutions, astringents, toners, shaving lotion, abrasive soaps or cleansers)  Overdosage:  If you or anyone else applied excessive amount of BENLITE A GEL, rinse your skin with plenty of cold water. If irritation persists, consult your doctor.
synopsis: SYNOPSIS Drug	:  	Adapalene, Benzoyl peroxide Pharmacological Category	:  	Retinoid-like compounds, Topical Antibiotics Therapeutic Indication	:  	Acne vulgaris Dosage Forms	:  	Topical Gel
moreInfo: MORE INFORMATION Keep BENLITE A GEL out of reach of children Store BENLITE A GEL at room temperature
faqs: FAQs ABOUT BENLITE A GEL  Will BENLITE A GEL be more effective if I overuse it?  No. Do not overuse this medicine. If you use more, you will not get rid of acne quicker. Instead, it may make your skin more irritated and red. Therefore, only apply the quantity mentioned by your doctor.  What are the side effects of using BENLITE A GEL?  BENLITE A GEL is generally safe with limited or no side effects. However, you may experience skin dryness, redness or irritation after applying this medicine. Contact your doctor if it troubles you.  What is the use of BENLITE A GEL?  BENLITE A GEL is used in the treatment of acne.  How BENLITE A GEL works?  BENLITE A GEL prevents the accumulation of excess sebum (natural oil produced by the skin) and dead skin cells on the hair follicles of the skin. It also reduces inflammation on the skin and improves skin’s tendency to exfoliate the dead skin cells naturally. It also reduces the number of acne-causing bacteria on the skin which can reduce the further spread of acne.  How to use BENLITE A GEL?  BENLITE A GEL is for external use only. Take the required quantity of the medicine and apply on the affected skin areas. Avoid contact of this medicine with your eyes, ears, nose or any other mucous membranes.  How long does it take for BENLITE A GEL to work?  It may take up to 2-3 weeks for BENLITE A GEL to show improvement in your skin condition. However, this period may vary from person-to-person depending upon the skin condition.  How long should I use BENLITE A GEL?  Your doctor will decide the correct dose and duration of therapy for you depending upon your age, body weight and health condition. You need to use BENLITE A GEL for the stipulated duration prescribed by your doctor. Failing to do so may not result in adequate response.  What to do if I forgot to apply BENLITE A GEL?  If you forgot to apply BENLITE A GEL, apply it as soon as you remember. However, if it is time for the next application, skip the missed one and apply the next dose. Do not excessively apply BENLITE A GEL to compensate the missed doses.  Is BENLITE A GEL safe?  BENLITE A GEL is safe at doses prescribed by the physician. Therefore, do not alter the dose of BENLITE A GEL without consulting your doctor.  Can I stop using BENLITE A GEL without consulting your doctor?  No. You should not stop using BENLITE A GEL without consulting your doctor as it may reduce its effectiveness. Therefore, apply BENLITE A GEL for the stipulated duration recommended by your doctor to achieve maximum results.  Can BENLITE A GEL be used in pregnant women?  BENLITE A GEL is not recommended for use in pregnant women. Therefore, inform your doctor before using this medicine if you are pregnant, think you may be pregnant or planning to have a baby. If you became pregnant while using this medicine, stop using it and contact your doctor immediately.

name: BENZOL 10% Lotion 60ml
about: INTRODUCTION  BENZOL 10% LOTION contains Benzoyl peroxide which belongs to the group of medicines called Anti-bacterial and Anti-inflammatory agents. It is used in the treatment and prevention of acne (pimples) in the face, chest and back. It is also used to unplug the blocked pores (blackheads and whiteheads) and absorb excess oil from the skin.  Before using BENZOL 10% LOTION, inform your doctor if you are having any allergy to foods, preservatives or dyes or if you are already under any medication for acne.  It is not recommended to use hard cleansers, scrubs, medicated soap or cosmetic products containing alcohol while using this medicine.  BENZOL 10% LOTION is generally not recommended for use in pregnant women unless clearly needed. Consult your doctor before using the medicine.  Avoid repeated exposure to sunlight or other sources of UV light (such as sun bed). In case of accidental contact, rinse thoroughly with warm water and pat dry.  Most common side effects of BENZOL 10% LOTION are skin redness and irriation, burning, stinging sensation in the skin. Consult your doctor if any of above symptoms worsens.
uses: USES OF BENZOL 10% LOTION  Used to:  Treat acne (pimples) formation Remove excessive oil from the skin Unplug blocked pores
working: HOW BENZOL 10% LOTION WORKS  BENZOL 10% LOTION works against the acne-causing bacteria. This medicine after applying on the affected skin gets absorbed and is converted to benzoic acid. This benzoic acid gets metabolized by skin proteins and releases active free-radical oxygen species that results in the alteration of bacterial proteins. This helps to treat acne or pimples. BENZOL 10% LOTION also acts as a keratolytic agent which promotes peeling of the skin and absorb excess oil from the skin further preventing acne formation and skin irritation.
directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Always apply BENZOL 10% LOTION as directed by your physician. It is for external use only. Apply a thin layer of this medicine on the affected area as instructed by the doctor.  Avoid contact with eyes, lips, mouth, nose, mucous membranes and sensitive areas of the neck. Your doctor will decide the correct dose and duration for you depending you’re your age, body weight and disease condition.
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF BENZOL 10% LOTION COMMON Dry skin Skin redness Peeling of the skin Burning sensation of the skin Itching of the skin (pruritus) Pain of the skin (pain, stinging) Skin irritation Allergic contact dermatitis RARE  Stop applying BENZOL 10% LOTION and contact your doctor immediately if you experience any of the following side effects:  Allergic reactions, including application site hypersensitivity, face swelling and anaphylaxis Severe skin irritation, redness and peeling of the skin, swelling of the face Fainting
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY  BENZOL 10% LOTION is generally not recommended for use in pregnant women unless clearly necessary. Consult your doctor before using it.  BREASTFEEDING  BENZOL 10% LOTION should be used with caution in breast feeding mothers. Consult your doctor before using the medicine.  ALLERGY  Do not apply BENZOL 10% LOTION if you are allergic to Benzyl peroxide or to any other ingredients of this medicine.  OTHERS  BENZOL 10% LOTION is not recommended for use if you:  Have damaged skin or broken skin Are using hard cleansers, scrubs, medicated soap or cosmetic products containing alcohol  Use in paediatrics:  Your doctor will decide the right dose depends on your child’s age, body weight and disease condition. Consult your doctor before using BENZOL 10% LOTION.
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug-Drug interactions:  Before applying BENZOL 10% LOTION, inform your doctor if you are taking or using any of the following medicine:  Medicines used to treat various skin diseases (Ex. dapsone) Topical hydroquinone (medicine used to remove dark patches of the skin) Isotretinoin, topical tretinoin (used to treat acne) Topical anaesthetics (used to relieve pain and itching) Ex. benzocaine, lignocaine  B. Drug-Food interactions:  Before applying BENZOL 10% LOTION inform your doctor if you are having any allergies to any other medicines, foods, preservatives or dyes.  Overdosage:  If you or anyone else accidentally applies more of BENZOL 10% LOTION or accidently ingested BENZOL 10% LOTION, consult your doctor immediately or visit the nearby hospital. Symptoms of overuse of this medicine is severe skin irritation.
synopsis: SYNOPSIS Drug	:  	Benzoyl Peroxide Pharmacological Category	:  	Topical Antibiotics Therapeutic Indication	:  	Acne Dosage Forms	:  	Gel, Lotion, Ointment, Facewash, Soap, Gelwash
moreInfo: MORE INFORMATION Keep out of sight and reach of children Store at room temperature
faqs: FAQs ABOUT BENZOL 10% LOTION  What is BENZOL 10% LOTION used for?  BENZOL 10% LOTION is used in the treatment and prevention of acne (pimples) in the face, chest and back. It can also be used to unplug the blocked pores (blackheads and whiteheads) and absorb excess oil from the skin. Consult your doctor before using BENZOL 10% LOTION.  How to use BENZOL 10% LOTION?  Always apply BENZOL 10% LOTION as directed by your physician. It is for external use only. Wash and dry your hands before applying this medicine. Wash the affected area with a mild cleanser and water and allow the skin to dry. Apply a thin layer of this medicine on the affected area leaving it for 2 hours and then wash it off with water and pat skin dry.  What are the precautions to be followed while using BENZOL 10% LOTION?  While using BENZOL 10% LOTION avoid contact with the eyes, lips, mouth, nose, mucous membranes and sensitive areas of the neck. In case of accidental contact rinse thoroughly with warm water and pat dry. You should not use any other acne products along with this medicine without taking advise from your doctor because they may cause skin to become red and sore.  How long should I use BENZOL 10% LOTION  You should use BENZOL 10% LOTION as long as advised by your physician or how quickly your condition improves. Sometimes acne may take time to clear completely. You should see your doctor if you feel your acne is not improving while using this medicine.  Can BENZOL 10% LOTION be used in pregnant women?  BENZOL 10% LOTION is generally not recommended for use in pregnant women or women who are planning to become pregnant unless clearly necessary. Consult your doctor before using the medicine.  What are the common side effects of using BENZOL 10% LOTION?  Most common side effects of BENZOL 10% LOTION are skin redness and irriation, burning, stinging sensation in the skin. Sudden increase in peeling may occur during the first weeks in most of the patients. This is usually not harmful and may subside once the treatment is discontinued temporarily. Consult your doctor if any of above symptoms worsens.

name: Cleargel Gel 20gm
about: INTRODUCTION  CLEARGEL GEL contains Clindamycin, which belongs to the group of medicines called Antibiotics. It is used in the treatment of acne vulgaris. Acne vulgaris is a common skin condition that occurs when hair follicles get blocked with oil and dead skin cells. Symptoms include whiteheads, blackheads, small red, tender bumps, pimples, and pus-filled lumps on the skin.  Before applying CLEARGEL GEL, inform your doctor if you have or ever had diarrhea, bloody diarrhea and pseudomembranous colitis. CLEARGEL GEL is not recommended for use if you have a history of regional enteritis (inflammation of the small intestine), ulcerative colitis (inflammation of the large intestine) or antibiotic-associated colitis.  CLEARGEL GEL should be used with caution during pregnancy or by breastfeeding women only if clearly needed. The safety and effectiveness of CLEARGEL GEL in children under the age of 12 has not been established. The most common side effects of applying CLEARGEL GEL are burning, itching, and redness of the skin. Consult your doctor if symptoms worsen.
uses: USES OF CLEARGEL GEL Treats acne vulgaris
working: HOW CLEARGEL GEL WORKS  CLEARGEL GEL acts against the bacteria by binding to the 50S subunit of the bacterial ribosome (site of protein synthesis), which in turn prevents protein synthesis and kills the infection-causing bacteria.
directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Apply CLEARGEL GEL as advised by your physician. It is for external use only. Wash your hands before use. Wash and dry the whole area, apply a thin film once daily to the skin where acne lesions appear and use enough to cover the entire affected area. In case of contact with the eyes, mouth or nostrils, rinse it off immediately and thoroughly with water. Your doctor will decide the correct dose and duration for you depending on your age, body weight and disease condition.
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF CLEARGEL GEL COMMON Burning, itching or abnormal redness of the skin at the application site Scaling, pain, dryness and skin irritation at the application site UNCOMMON Abdominal pain Diarrhea Oily skin RARE Antibiotic-associated colitis  Stop applying CLEARGEL GEL and contact your doctor immediately if you experience any of the following side effects:  Allergic symptoms (e.g., rashes, itchiness, difficulty in breathing or eye swelling) Severe or bloody diarrhea. (a sign of bowel inflammation, pseudomembranous colitis)
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY  The safety and effectiveness of CLEARGEL GEL in pregnant women or women planning to have a baby have not been established yet. It will be given to you by the doctor only if clearly needed. Consult your doctor before applying CLEARGEL GEL.  BREASTFEEDING  CLEARGEL GEL should be used with caution in breastfeeding women as it is not known if the medicine is excreted in human milk. Your doctor will decide whether to discontinue nursing or the medicine, considering the benefits to the mother and baby. If it is applied to the chest, care should be taken to avoid accidental ingestion by the infant. Consult your doctor before applying CLEARGEL GEL.  ALLERGY  Do not apply CLEARGEL GEL if you are allergic to Clindamycin or any other ingredients of this medicine.  OTHERS  CLEARGEL GEL is not recommended for use if you:  Have regional enteritis (inflammation of the small intestine) or ulcerative colitis (inflammation of the large intestine) Have a history of antibiotic-associated colitis  Before applying CLEARGEL GEL inform your doctor if you:  Diarrhea, bloody diarrhea Pseudomembranous colitis (inflammation of colon) Atopic individuals (more prone to allergies)  Use in pediatrics:  Safety and effectiveness of CLEARGEL GEL in children under the age of 12 have not been established. Consult your doctor before applying CLEARGEL GEL.
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug-Drug interactions:  Before applying CLEARGEL GEL, inform your doctor if you are taking any of the following medicine:  Neuromuscular blocking agents (Ex. rocuronium, vecuronium) Other anti-acne, topical agents  Overdosage:  If you or anyone else accidentally applied too much of CLEARGEL GEL, consult your doctor immediately or visit the nearby hospital.

name: Cleargel AP Gel 15gm
about: INTRODUCTION  CLEAR AP contains a combination of Adapalene and Clindamycin, which belongs to the group of medicines called topical retinoids and lincomycin antibiotics. It is used in the treatment of skin acne (pimple). Acne is a condition of the skin when the root of your hair (hair follicle) or skin pores gets clogged by oil or dead skin, which becomes prone to bacterial infection and the formation of pimples, blackheads, spots and scars.  Adapalene is a form of vitamin A, that acts as an antiacne agent by binding directly to the receptor of the skin which increases the rate of cell turnover (cell regeneration) and decreases oil secretion preventing clogging of the hair follicles and pores, also decreasing swelling/inflammation. Clindamycin works by binding to the ribosomal unit of the bacteria and disrupts the production of the protein essential for its survival. Before recommending CLEAR AP, your doctor may advise you to have tests to understand your existing condition for planning effective treatment methods. Stay well hydrated and protect your skin from exposure to sunlight or UV light.  Do not apply CLEAR AP if you are allergic to adapalene or clindamycin, a disorder of the digestive system (colitis), a disorder of the immune system or have bruises, cuts or burns on the skin. The common side effects of using this medicine may include dry skin, burning, itching, redness or irritative sensation of the skin, scaling peeling of the skin etc.
uses: USES OF CLEAR AP To treat acne
working: HOW CLEAR AP WORKS  Adapalene, a form of vitamin A, works as an antiacne medicine by attaching directly to the skin's receptor, which increases cell turnover (cell regeneration) and decreases oil secretion preventing blockage of the hair follicles and pores. It also reduces swelling/inflammation of the skin. Clindamycin works by attaching to the bacteria's ribosomal unit and disrupting the production of a protein required for its very own survival.
directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Apply CLEAR AP as advised by your doctor. It is for external use on the skin only. Avoid applying CLEAR AP around or onto your eyes, including eyelids.
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF CLEAR AP COMMON Dryness of the skin Burning, itching, redness of the skin Scaling and or peeling of the skin UNCOMMON Flaring of acne Sunburns Local skin reaction  Stop using this medicine and contact your doctor immediately if you experience any of the following side effects:  Severe allergic reactions (such as skin rash, itching, swelling of the face, lips, tongue and other parts of the body, difficulty in breathing or wheezing, blisters on the skin, sore throat, fever, headache etc.)
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY  CLEAR AP is not recommended for use in pregnant women. Consult your doctor for advice if you are pregnant or suspect/planning pregnancy.  BREASTFEEDING  CLEAR AP is to be used with caution in breastfeeding mothers after consulting your doctor. The safe use of CLEAR AP in breastfeeding women and breastfed baby is not established.  DRIVING AND USING MACHINES  CLEAR AP may not interfere with your ability to drive or use the machine. However, protect your skin from sun or UV light while travelling and follow appropriate protective measures recommended by your doctor.  ALCOHOL  The risks associated with consuming alcohol are not known. It’s advised to avoid the consumption of alcohol while using CLEAR AP, as it could aggravate your existing condition.  ALLERGY  Talk to your doctor if you are allergic to Adapalene and/or Clindamycin.  OTHERS  CLEAR AP is not recommended for use if you:  Cuts or bruises on the skin Sunburns Skin conditions like eczema (itching, dry and red skin)  Use in pediatrics:  CLEAR AP is not recommended for use in children less than 12 years of age. Consult your doctor for advice.  Use in geriatrics:  CLEAR AP should be used with caution in the elderly (above 65 years of age) after consulting your doctor for advice.
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug-Drug interactions:  Inform your physician, if you are taking or using,  Medicated soap for skin, other cosmetic products with a high concentration of alcohol, astringents, sulfur,  Resorcinol – use for itching or irritation of the skin and scalp, loss of hair, dandruff etc. Salicylic acid – used for skin acne, dandruff, etc. Atracurium, cisatracurium, succinylcholine – used to relax muscles  B. Drug-Food interaction:  The interaction of foods with CLEAR AP is not known. Consult your doctor for diet advice.  Overdosage:  In case of using CLEAR AP in excess than recommended, you may experience dryness, scaling, redness and discomfort of the skin. Contact your doctor immediately for advice.
synopsis: SYNOPSIS Drug	:  	Adapalene, Clindamycin Pharmacological Category	:  	Topical retinoids and Antibiotics Therapeutic Indication	:  	Treat acne Dosage Forms	:  	Gel (topical), Gel, Cream, Ointment
moreInfo: MORE INFORMATION Keep out of reach from children Store at room temperature Keep away from sunlight
faqs: FAQs ABOUT CLEAR AP  Can CLEAR AP be used to treat scars on the skin?  Yes. Adapalene is a kind of vitamin A that reduces swelling and inflammation while also treating acne scars. Azithromycin is used to treat infections that cause skin infections to worsen.  Can CLEAR AP result in skin peeling?  Yes. Dryness of the skin, burning, itching, redness of the skin, skin irritation, scaling, and possibly peeling of the skin are all possible side effects of using this medicine.  Can [GBBNKEYWORD] cause skin dryness?  Yes. Your skin may get dry as a result of taking this medication. Maintain hydration and use the moisturiser that your doctor has prescribed.  How long can I use CLEAR AP?  Use CLEAR AP as advised by your doctor. Generally, it’s recommended for use depending on the severity of the existing skin condition.  Can I stop using CLEAR AP on my own?  No. It is not recommended to stop using CLEAR AP on your own as it may worsen the existing skin condition. Consult your doctor for advice.

name: CLEARGEL NICO Gel 20gm
about: INTRODUCTION  CLEARGEL NICO GEL is a combination of Clindamycin and Nicotinamide which belongs to a group of medicines called Lincomycin antibiotics and Vitamin B3 complex, respectively. CLEARGEL NICO GEL is used to treat mild to moderate acne which is a skin condition that occurs when hair follicles become plugged with oil and dead skin cells which may occur due to variety of causes such as genetics, fluctuating hormone levels, stress, high humidity or using oily or greasy personal care products which may affect people of all ages.  It is characterized by symptoms such as open or closed plugged pores, small red & tender bumps, pimples, large, solid or painful lumps under the skin and painful & pus-filled lumps under the skin.  Before using CLEARGEL NICO GEL inform your doctor if you have liver, kidney, lung or heart diseases. Avoid applying CLEARGEL NICO GEL to a cut, scrapped, sunburnt or eczema affected skin.  CLEARGEL NICO GEL should be used with caution in pregnant and in breastfeeding women. CLEARGEL NICO GEL is not recommended for use in children and adolescents (below 12 years). Consult your doctor before applying.  The most common side effects of using CLEARGEL NICO GEL are skin inflammation, contact dermatitis (red, itchy rash), inflammation of hair follicles, itchy skin, dry skin and peeling of skin. Consult your doctor if any of these symptoms worsen.
uses: USES OF CLEARGEL NICO GEL Treats mild to moderate acne
working: HOW CLEARGEL NICO GEL WORKS  CLEARGEL NICO GEL helps to treat acne, where Clindamycin reduces free fatty acid concentrations on the skin and suppresses the growth of Propionibacterium acnes (Corynebacterium acnes), a bacteria found in sebaceous glands and follicles and Nicotinamide exerts anti-inflammatory effect in acne and interrupts sebum production.
directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Apply CLEARGEL NICO GEL as advised by your physician. It is for external use only. Before applying the medicine normally wash and dry the affected area and apply a thin layer of this medicine on the affected area. Treated areas on the face need not be covered with a plaster or bandage. Do not apply this medicine beyond the recommended duration. Avoid applying CLEARGEL NICO GEL around your eyes, including eyelids. Rinse it off with water if you accidentally get it in these areas.
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF CLEARGEL NICO GEL COMMON Contact dermatitis (red, itchy rash) Inflammation of hair follicles Itchy skin Dry skin Peeling of skin
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY  CLEARGEL NICO GEL should be used with caution in pregnant women. Consult your doctor before applying.  BREASTFEEDING  CLEARGEL NICO GEL should be used with caution in breastfeeding women. Consult your doctor before applying.  ALLERGY  CLEARGEL NICO GEL is not recommended for use if you are allergic to Clindamycin, Nicotinamide or any other ingredients of this medicine.  OTHERS  CLEARGEL NICO GEL is not recommended for use if you have:  Eczema (skin inflammation) Cut, scrapped, sunburnt skin  Use in Pediatrics:  CLEARGEL NICO GEL is not recommended for use in children and adolescents (below 12 years). Consult your doctor before using it for your child.  Use in Geriatrics:  There is no information on the use of CLEARGEL NICO GEL in elderly patients. Consult with your doctor before using.
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug - Drug interactions:  Before using CLEARGEL NICO GEL, inform your doctor if you are taking any of the following medicines:  Acepromazine (used a sedative/tranquilizer) Acetaminophen (used to treat pain and inflammation)  Overdosage:  If you or anyone else accidentally ingests or applies too much of CLEARGEL NICO GEL, consult your doctor immediately or visit the nearby hospital.
synopsis: SYNOPSIS Drug	:  	Clindamycin, Nicotinamide Pharmacological Category	:  	Lincomycin antibiotics, Vitamin B3 complex Therapeutic Indication	:  	Mild to moderate acne Dosage Forms	:  	Gel, Cream, Ointment
moreInfo: MORE INFORMATION Keep CLEARGEL NICO GEL out of reach of children Store CLEARGEL NICO GEL at a temperature below 25°C
faqs: FAQs ABOUT CLEARGEL NICO GEL  What special precautions should I follow while using CLEARGEL NICO GEL?  Before using CLEARGEL NICO GEL inform your doctor if you have liver, kidney, lung or heart diseases. Avoid applying CLEARGEL NICO GEL to a cut, scrapped, sunburnt or eczema affected skin. This medicine is not for oral, ophthalmic or intravaginal use.  What is CLEARGEL NICO GEL used for?  CLEARGEL NICO GEL is indicated for the treatment of mild to moderate acne in patients above 12 years of age. Do not use it for any other condition other than that prescribed by your doctor.  How should I use CLEARGEL NICO GEL?  Always apply CLEARGEL NICO GEL, as directed by your physician. It is for external use only. On the affected area, apply a thin layer of this medicine. Treated areas on the face need not be covered with a plaster or bandage. Do not apply this medicine on your face beyond 5 days. Avoid applying CLEARGEL NICO GEL around your eyes, including eyelids.  Is CLEARGEL NICO GEL safe to use in pregnant and breastfeeding women?  CLEARGEL NICO GEL should be used with caution during pregnancy, women planning for pregnancy and in breastfeeding women. Consult your doctor before applying.  Can CLEARGEL NICO GEL cause skin irritation or itchy skin?  CLEARGEL NICO GEL may cause skin irritation or itchy skin. Avoid hot bath because hot water can irritate your skin further. Do not scratch the affected area. Use protective clothing when going outdoors. Regularly moisturize your skin and apply calamine lotion as a coolant. Discuss with your doctor if the symptom worsens.

name: Cliac Gel 15gm
manufacturer: KAIZEN RESEARCH LABS INDIA PVT LTD
about: INTRODUCTION  CLIAC GEL contains Clindamycin, which belongs to the group of medicines called Antibiotics. It is used in the treatment of acne vulgaris. Acne vulgaris is a common skin condition that occurs when hair follicles get blocked with oil and dead skin cells. Symptoms include whiteheads, blackheads, small red, tender bumps, pimples, and pus-filled lumps on the skin.  Before applying CLIAC GEL, inform your doctor if you have or ever had diarrhea, bloody diarrhea and pseudomembranous colitis. CLIAC GEL is not recommended for use if you have a history of regional enteritis (inflammation of the small intestine), ulcerative colitis (inflammation of the large intestine) or antibiotic-associated colitis.  CLIAC GEL should be used with caution during pregnancy or by breastfeeding women only if clearly needed. The safety and effectiveness of CLIAC GEL in children under the age of 12 has not been established. The most common side effects of applying CLIAC GEL are burning, itching, and redness of the skin. Consult your doctor if symptoms worsen.
uses: USES OF CLIAC GEL Treats acne vulgaris
working: HOW CLIAC GEL WORKS  CLIAC GEL acts against the bacteria by binding to the 50S subunit of the bacterial ribosome (site of protein synthesis), which in turn prevents protein synthesis and kills the infection-causing bacteria.
directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Apply CLIAC GEL as advised by your physician. It is for external use only. Wash your hands before use. Wash and dry the whole area, apply a thin film once daily to the skin where acne lesions appear and use enough to cover the entire affected area. In case of contact with the eyes, mouth or nostrils, rinse it off immediately and thoroughly with water. Your doctor will decide the correct dose and duration for you depending on your age, body weight and disease condition.
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF CLIAC GEL COMMON Burning, itching or abnormal redness of the skin at the application site Scaling, pain, dryness and skin irritation at the application site UNCOMMON Abdominal pain Diarrhea Oily skin RARE Antibiotic-associated colitis  Stop applying CLIAC GEL and contact your doctor immediately if you experience any of the following side effects:  Allergic symptoms (e.g., rashes, itchiness, difficulty in breathing or eye swelling) Severe or bloody diarrhea. (a sign of bowel inflammation, pseudomembranous colitis)
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY  The safety and effectiveness of CLIAC GEL in pregnant women or women planning to have a baby have not been established yet. It will be given to you by the doctor only if clearly needed. Consult your doctor before applying CLIAC GEL.  BREASTFEEDING  CLIAC GEL should be used with caution in breastfeeding women as it is not known if the medicine is excreted in human milk. Your doctor will decide whether to discontinue nursing or the medicine, considering the benefits to the mother and baby. If it is applied to the chest, care should be taken to avoid accidental ingestion by the infant. Consult your doctor before applying CLIAC GEL.  ALLERGY  Do not apply CLIAC GEL if you are allergic to Clindamycin or any other ingredients of this medicine.  OTHERS  CLIAC GEL is not recommended for use if you:  Have regional enteritis (inflammation of the small intestine) or ulcerative colitis (inflammation of the large intestine) Have a history of antibiotic-associated colitis  Before applying CLIAC GEL inform your doctor if you:  Diarrhea, bloody diarrhea Pseudomembranous colitis (inflammation of colon) Atopic individuals (more prone to allergies)  Use in pediatrics:  Safety and effectiveness of CLIAC GEL in children under the age of 12 have not been established. Consult your doctor before applying CLIAC GEL.
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug-Drug interactions:  Before applying CLIAC GEL, inform your doctor if you are taking any of the following medicine:  Neuromuscular blocking agents (Ex. rocuronium, vecuronium) Other anti-acne, topical agents  Overdosage:  If you or anyone else accidentally applied too much of CLIAC GEL, consult your doctor immediately or visit the nearby hospital.

Symptoms include whiteheads, blackheads, small red, tender bumps, pimples, and pus-filled lumps on the skin.  How to use CLIAC GEL?  Apply CLIAC GEL as advised by your physician. Wash and dry the whole area, apply a thin film once daily to the skin where acne lesions appear and use enough to cover the entire affected area. CLIAC GEL should be used with caution in breastfeeding women as it is not known if the medicine is excreted in human milk. Your doctor will decide whether to discontinue nursing or the medicine, considering the benefits to the mother and baby. If it is applied to the chest, care should be taken to avoid accidental ingestion by the infant. Consult your doctor before applying CLIAC GEL.
