name: Click Gel 20gm
about: INTRODUCTION  CLICK GEL contains Clindamycin which belongs to the group of medicines called Topical antibiotics. It is used for the topical treatment of acne vulgaris. Acne vulgaris is a common skin condition that occurs in teens when hair follicles of the skin plug with oil and dead skin cells. Symptoms includes inflammation, large, reddish pus-filled pimples and formation of comedones.  Clindamycin deeply penetrates into the skin and kills the pimple-causing bacteria by inhibiting the bacterial protein synthesis. It is for external use only. Apply a thin layer of this medicine on the affected area as required. Topical application of clindamycin may also result in systemic absorption of the antibiotic from the skin surface and can cause diarrhea, bloody diarrhea or colitis (including pseudomembranous colitis) in patients. In such cases, contact your doctor immediately.  The most common side effects of this medicine are application site reactions such as itching, redness, peeling of skin or skin rash.  Do not touch, rub or scratch the affected area. Regularly use moisturizers to soothe and hydrate the affected area. If it does not get better, contact your doctor. Before applying this medicine, inform your doctor if you have or ever had any GI disorders. CLICK GEL is strictly not recommended for use in children under 12 years of age. Consult your doctor before application.
uses: USES OF CLICK GEL Treats acne vulgaris
working: HOW CLICK GEL WORKS  Topically applied clindamycin penetrates deep into the skin and kills the acne-producing bacteria by inhibiting the bacterial protein synthesis. It acts by reversibly binding to the 50S ribosomal subunits of the bacteria, which prevents peptide bond formation thus inhibiting bacterial protein synthesis. Inhibition of protein synthesis stops the growth of acne-producing bacteria leading to prevention of acne outbreaks.
directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Apply this medicine as directed by your physician. It is for external use only. Before application, wash your face with mild soap and warm water. Apply a thin film of the medicine to the affected skin surface once or twice daily. Avoid contact of this medicine with eyes, ears, nose or mouth. If this happens, rinse it thoroughly with water. Continue to apply this medicine, as long as your doctor tells you to do so, to obtain better results.
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF CLICK GEL SERIOUS Severe persistent diarrhea with or without stomach pain or fever COMMON Itching and peeling of skin Change in skin pigmentation Skin rash Photosensitivity
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY  CLICK GEL is found to be safe for use in pregnant women. However, consult your doctor before application.  BREASTFEEDING  CLICK GEL should be used with caution in breastfeeding women. Consult your doctor before taking.  ALLERGY  Do not use this medicine if you are allergic to clindamycin, lincomycin or to any of the ingredients of this medicine.  OTHERS  Before applying CLICK GEL, inform your doctor if you:  Have atopic dermatitis or eczema (skin reaction)
interactions: INTERACTIONS  Tell your healthcare provider if you are using any other topical preparations.
synopsis: SYNOPSIS Drug	:  	Clindamycin Pharmacological Category	:  	Antibiotics Therapeutic Indication	:  	Acne vulgaris Dosage Forms	:  	Tablet, Capsule, Injection, Gel, Topical solution, Lotion, Spray, Soap
moreInfo: MORE INFORMATION  Store below 20-25°C and keep out of reach of children.
faqs: FAQs ABOUT CLICK GEL  Can I apply CLICK GEL on my face?  Yes. This medicine is intended for application on the face to cure acne outbreaks.  How to use CLICK GEL?  Wash your face with mild soap and warm water. Pat it dry. Apply a thin film of the medicine to the affected skin surface once or twice daily. If your skin feels too dry, you can apply this medicine once daily. Continue to apply this medicine, as long as your doctor tells you to do so, to obtain better results.  Can I use CLICK GEL when I’m pregnant?  Yes. This medicine is considered safe for use in pregnant women. However, consult your doctor before application.  Can I apply moisturizer after applying CLICK GEL?  Yes. If your skin feels too dry after using this medicine, you can apply a moisturizer to soothe and hydrate the affected area.

name: Cliface Gel 20gm
about: INTRODUCTION  CLIFACE GEL is a combination of Clindamycin and Nicotinamide which belongs to a group of medicines called Lincomycin antibiotics and Vitamin B3 complex, respectively. CLIFACE GEL is used to treat mild to moderate acne which is a skin condition that occurs when hair follicles become plugged with oil and dead skin cells which may occur due to variety of causes such as genetics, fluctuating hormone levels, stress, high humidity or using oily or greasy personal care products which may affect people of all ages.  It is characterized by symptoms such as open or closed plugged pores, small red & tender bumps, pimples, large, solid or painful lumps under the skin and painful & pus-filled lumps under the skin.  Before using CLIFACE GEL inform your doctor if you have liver, kidney, lung or heart diseases. Avoid applying CLIFACE GEL to a cut, scrapped, sunburnt or eczema affected skin.  CLIFACE GEL should be used with caution in pregnant and in breastfeeding women. CLIFACE GEL is not recommended for use in children and adolescents (below 12 years). Consult your doctor before applying.  The most common side effects of using CLIFACE GEL are skin inflammation, contact dermatitis (red, itchy rash), inflammation of hair follicles, itchy skin, dry skin and peeling of skin. Consult your doctor if any of these symptoms worsen.
uses: USES OF CLIFACE GEL Treats mild to moderate acne
working: HOW CLIFACE GEL WORKS  CLIFACE GEL helps to treat acne, where Clindamycin reduces free fatty acid concentrations on the skin and suppresses the growth of Propionibacterium acnes (Corynebacterium acnes), a bacteria found in sebaceous glands and follicles and Nicotinamide exerts anti-inflammatory effect in acne and interrupts sebum production.
directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Apply CLIFACE GEL as advised by your physician. It is for external use only. Before applying the medicine normally wash and dry the affected area and apply a thin layer of this medicine on the affected area. Treated areas on the face need not be covered with a plaster or bandage. Do not apply this medicine beyond the recommended duration. Avoid applying CLIFACE GEL around your eyes, including eyelids. Rinse it off with water if you accidentally get it in these areas.
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF CLIFACE GEL COMMON Contact dermatitis (red, itchy rash) Inflammation of hair follicles Itchy skin Dry skin Peeling of skin
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY  CLIFACE GEL should be used with caution in pregnant women. Consult your doctor before applying.  BREASTFEEDING  CLIFACE GEL should be used with caution in breastfeeding women. Consult your doctor before applying.  ALLERGY  CLIFACE GEL is not recommended for use if you are allergic to Clindamycin, Nicotinamide or any other ingredients of this medicine.  OTHERS  CLIFACE GEL is not recommended for use if you have:  Eczema (skin inflammation) Cut, scrapped, sunburnt skin  Use in Pediatrics:  CLIFACE GEL is not recommended for use in children and adolescents (below 12 years). Consult your doctor before using it for your child.  Use in Geriatrics:  There is no information on the use of CLIFACE GEL in elderly patients. Consult with your doctor before using.
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug - Drug interactions:  Before using CLIFACE GEL, inform your doctor if you are taking any of the following medicines:  Acepromazine (used a sedative/tranquilizer) Acetaminophen (used to treat pain and inflammation)  Overdosage:  If you or anyone else accidentally ingests or applies too much of CLIFACE GEL, consult your doctor immediately or visit the nearby hospital.
synopsis: SYNOPSIS Drug	:  	Clindamycin, Nicotinamide Pharmacological Category	:  	Lincomycin antibiotics, Vitamin B3 complex Therapeutic Indication	:  	Mild to moderate acne Dosage Forms	:  	Gel, Cream, Ointment
moreInfo: MORE INFORMATION Keep CLIFACE GEL out of reach of children Store CLIFACE GEL at a temperature below 25°C
faqs: FAQs ABOUT CLIFACE GEL  What special precautions should I follow while using CLIFACE GEL?  Before using CLIFACE GEL inform your doctor if you have liver, kidney, lung or heart diseases. Avoid applying CLIFACE GEL to a cut, scrapped, sunburnt or eczema affected skin. This medicine is not for oral, ophthalmic or intravaginal use.  What is CLIFACE GEL used for?  CLIFACE GEL is indicated for the treatment of mild to moderate acne in patients above 12 years of age. Do not use it for any other condition other than that prescribed by your doctor.  How should I use CLIFACE GEL?  Always apply CLIFACE GEL, as directed by your physician. It is for external use only. On the affected area, apply a thin layer of this medicine. Treated areas on the face need not be covered with a plaster or bandage. Do not apply this medicine on your face beyond 5 days. Avoid applying CLIFACE GEL around your eyes, including eyelids.  Is CLIFACE GEL safe to use in pregnant and breastfeeding women?  CLIFACE GEL should be used with caution during pregnancy, women planning for pregnancy and in breastfeeding women. Consult your doctor before applying.  Can CLIFACE GEL cause skin irritation or itchy skin?  CLIFACE GEL may cause skin irritation or itchy skin. Avoid hot bath because hot water can irritate your skin further. Do not scratch the affected area. Use protective clothing when going outdoors. Regularly moisturize your skin and apply calamine lotion as a coolant. Discuss with your doctor if the symptom worsens.

name: Cligel Gel 15gm
about: INTRODUCTION  CLIGEL GEL contains Clindamycin, which belongs to the group of medicines called Antibiotics. It is used in the treatment of acne vulgaris. Acne vulgaris is a common skin condition that occurs when hair follicles get blocked with oil and dead skin cells. Symptoms include whiteheads, blackheads, small red, tender bumps, pimples, and pus-filled lumps on the skin.  Before applying CLIGEL GEL, inform your doctor if you have or ever had diarrhea, bloody diarrhea and pseudomembranous colitis. CLIGEL GEL is not recommended for use if you have a history of regional enteritis (inflammation of the small intestine), ulcerative colitis (inflammation of the large intestine) or antibiotic-associated colitis.  CLIGEL GEL should be used with caution during pregnancy or by breastfeeding women only if clearly needed. The safety and effectiveness of CLIGEL GEL in children under the age of 12 has not been established. The most common side effects of applying CLIGEL GEL are burning, itching, and redness of the skin. Consult your doctor if symptoms worsen.
uses: USES OF CLIGEL GEL Treats acne vulgaris
working: HOW CLIGEL GEL WORKS  CLIGEL GEL acts against the bacteria by binding to the 50S subunit of the bacterial ribosome (site of protein synthesis), which in turn prevents protein synthesis and kills the infection-causing bacteria.
directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Apply CLIGEL GEL as advised by your physician. It is for external use only. Wash your hands before use. Wash and dry the whole area, apply a thin film once daily to the skin where acne lesions appear and use enough to cover the entire affected area. In case of contact with the eyes, mouth or nostrils, rinse it off immediately and thoroughly with water. Your doctor will decide the correct dose and duration for you depending on your age, body weight and disease condition.
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF CLIGEL GEL COMMON Burning, itching or abnormal redness of the skin at the application site Scaling, pain, dryness and skin irritation at the application site UNCOMMON Abdominal pain Diarrhea Oily skin RARE Antibiotic-associated colitis  Stop applying CLIGEL GEL and contact your doctor immediately if you experience any of the following side effects:  Allergic symptoms (e.g., rashes, itchiness, difficulty in breathing or eye swelling) Severe or bloody diarrhea. (a sign of bowel inflammation, pseudomembranous colitis)
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY  The safety and effectiveness of CLIGEL GEL in pregnant women or women planning to have a baby have not been established yet. It will be given to you by the doctor only if clearly needed. Consult your doctor before applying CLIGEL GEL.  BREASTFEEDING  CLIGEL GEL should be used with caution in breastfeeding women as it is not known if the medicine is excreted in human milk. Your doctor will decide whether to discontinue nursing or the medicine, considering the benefits to the mother and baby. If it is applied to the chest, care should be taken to avoid accidental ingestion by the infant. Consult your doctor before applying CLIGEL GEL.  ALLERGY  Do not apply CLIGEL GEL if you are allergic to Clindamycin or any other ingredients of this medicine.  OTHERS  CLIGEL GEL is not recommended for use if you:  Have regional enteritis (inflammation of the small intestine) or ulcerative colitis (inflammation of the large intestine) Have a history of antibiotic-associated colitis  Before applying CLIGEL GEL inform your doctor if you:  Diarrhea, bloody diarrhea Pseudomembranous colitis (inflammation of colon) Atopic individuals (more prone to allergies)  Use in pediatrics:  Safety and effectiveness of CLIGEL GEL in children under the age of 12 have not been established. Consult your doctor before applying CLIGEL GEL.
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug-Drug interactions:  Before applying CLIGEL GEL, inform your doctor if you are taking any of the following medicine:  Neuromuscular blocking agents (Ex. rocuronium, vecuronium) Other anti-acne, topical agents  Overdosage:  If you or anyone else accidentally applied too much of CLIGEL GEL, consult your doctor immediately or visit the nearby hospital.

It is for external use only. Wash your hands before use. Wash and dry the whole area, apply a thin film once daily to the skin where acne lesions appear and use enough to cover the entire affected area. In case of contact with the eyes, mouth or nostrils, rinse it off immediately with plenty of water.  How does CLIGEL GEL work?  CLIGEL GEL acts against the bacteria by binding to the 50S subunit of the bacterial ribosome (site of protein synthesis), which in turn prevents protein synthesis and kills the infection-causing bacteria.  Can CLIGEL GEL be used in pregnancy?  The safety and effectiveness of CLIGEL GEL in pregnant women or women planning to have a baby have not been established yet. It will be given to you by the doctor only if clearly needed. Consult your doctor before applying CLIGEL GEL.  Can CLIGEL GEL be used in breastfeeding women?  CLIGEL GEL should be used with caution in breastfeeding women as it is not known if the medicine is excreted in human milk. Your doctor will decide whether to discontinue nursing or the medicine, considering the benefits to the mother and baby. If it is applied to the chest, care should be taken to avoid accidental ingestion by the infant. Consult your doctor before applying CLIGEL GEL.

name: Cligel A Gel 15gm
about: INTRODUCTION  CLIGEL A contains a combination of Adapalene and Clindamycin, which belongs to the group of medicines called topical retinoids and lincomycin antibiotics. It is used in the treatment of skin acne (pimple). Acne is a condition of the skin when the root of your hair (hair follicle) or skin pores gets clogged by oil or dead skin, which becomes prone to bacterial infection and the formation of pimples, blackheads, spots and scars.  Adapalene is a form of vitamin A, that acts as an antiacne agent by binding directly to the receptor of the skin which increases the rate of cell turnover (cell regeneration) and decreases oil secretion preventing clogging of the hair follicles and pores, also decreasing swelling/inflammation. Clindamycin works by binding to the ribosomal unit of the bacteria and disrupts the production of the protein essential for its survival. Before recommending CLIGEL A, your doctor may advise you to have tests to understand your existing condition for planning effective treatment methods. Stay well hydrated and protect your skin from exposure to sunlight or UV light.  Do not apply CLIGEL A if you are allergic to adapalene or clindamycin, a disorder of the digestive system (colitis), a disorder of the immune system or have bruises, cuts or burns on the skin. The common side effects of using this medicine may include dry skin, burning, itching, redness or irritative sensation of the skin, scaling peeling of the skin etc.
uses: USES OF CLIGEL A To treat acne
working: HOW CLIGEL A WORKS  Adapalene, a form of vitamin A, works as an antiacne medicine by attaching directly to the skin's receptor, which increases cell turnover (cell regeneration) and decreases oil secretion preventing blockage of the hair follicles and pores. It also reduces swelling/inflammation of the skin. Clindamycin works by attaching to the bacteria's ribosomal unit and disrupting the production of a protein required for its very own survival.
directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Apply CLIGEL A as advised by your doctor. It is for external use on the skin only. Avoid applying CLIGEL A around or onto your eyes, including eyelids.
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF CLIGEL A COMMON Dryness of the skin Burning, itching, redness of the skin Scaling and or peeling of the skin UNCOMMON Flaring of acne Sunburns Local skin reaction  Stop using this medicine and contact your doctor immediately if you experience any of the following side effects:  Severe allergic reactions (such as skin rash, itching, swelling of the face, lips, tongue and other parts of the body, difficulty in breathing or wheezing, blisters on the skin, sore throat, fever, headache etc.)
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY  CLIGEL A is not recommended for use in pregnant women. Consult your doctor for advice if you are pregnant or suspect/planning pregnancy.  BREASTFEEDING  CLIGEL A is to be used with caution in breastfeeding mothers after consulting your doctor. The safe use of CLIGEL A in breastfeeding women and breastfed baby is not established.  DRIVING AND USING MACHINES  CLIGEL A may not interfere with your ability to drive or use the machine. However, protect your skin from sun or UV light while travelling and follow appropriate protective measures recommended by your doctor.  ALCOHOL  The risks associated with consuming alcohol are not known. It’s advised to avoid the consumption of alcohol while using CLIGEL A, as it could aggravate your existing condition.  ALLERGY  Talk to your doctor if you are allergic to Adapalene and/or Clindamycin.  OTHERS  CLIGEL A is not recommended for use if you:  Cuts or bruises on the skin Sunburns Skin conditions like eczema (itching, dry and red skin)  Use in pediatrics:  CLIGEL A is not recommended for use in children less than 12 years of age. Consult your doctor for advice.  Use in geriatrics:  CLIGEL A should be used with caution in the elderly (above 65 years of age) after consulting your doctor for advice.
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug-Drug interactions:  Inform your physician, if you are taking or using,  Medicated soap for skin, other cosmetic products with a high concentration of alcohol, astringents, sulfur,  Resorcinol – use for itching or irritation of the skin and scalp, loss of hair, dandruff etc. Salicylic acid – used for skin acne, dandruff, etc. Atracurium, cisatracurium, succinylcholine – used to relax muscles  B. Drug-Food interaction:  The interaction of foods with CLIGEL A is not known. Consult your doctor for diet advice.  Overdosage:  In case of using CLIGEL A in excess than recommended, you may experience dryness, scaling, redness and discomfort of the skin. Contact your doctor immediately for advice.
synopsis: SYNOPSIS Drug	:  	Adapalene, Clindamycin Pharmacological Category	:  	Topical retinoids and Antibiotics Therapeutic Indication	:  	Treat acne Dosage Forms	:  	Gel (topical), Gel, Cream, Ointment
moreInfo: MORE INFORMATION Keep out of reach from children Store at room temperature Keep away from sunlight
faqs: FAQs ABOUT CLIGEL A  Can CLIGEL A be used to treat scars on the skin?  Yes. Adapalene is a kind of vitamin A that reduces swelling and inflammation while also treating acne scars. Azithromycin is used to treat infections that cause skin infections to worsen.  Can CLIGEL A result in skin peeling?  Yes. Dryness of the skin, burning, itching, redness of the skin, skin irritation, scaling, and possibly peeling of the skin are all possible side effects of using this medicine.  Can [GBBNKEYWORD] cause skin dryness?  Yes. Your skin may get dry as a result of taking this medication. Maintain hydration and use the moisturiser that your doctor has prescribed.  How long can I use CLIGEL A?  Use CLIGEL A as advised by your doctor. Generally, it’s recommended for use depending on the severity of the existing skin condition.  Can I stop using CLIGEL A on my own?  No. It is not recommended to stop using CLIGEL A on your own as it may worsen the existing skin condition. Consult your doctor for advice.

name: Cligel T Gel 15gm
about: INTRODUCTION  CLI T is a combination of Clindamycin and Tretinoin which belongs to the group of medicines called Topical Antibiotics and Retinoids respectively. It is used on the skin to treat acne in adults and in adolescents (aged 12 years or older).  Clindamycin is a topical antibiotic. It acts by stopping the growth and multiplication of the acne-causing bacteria on the skin. Tretinoin is a synthetic derivative of vitamin A. It controls acne breakouts by preventing the skin pores from getting clogged with sebum (oil produced in the skin) and dead skin cells. It also removes the dead skin cells that clogs the hair follicles in areas affected with acne and helps your skin renew itself more quickly.  CLI T is for topical use only. Avoid using CLI T on inflamed, irritated, or sensitive skin areas. Do not use any cosmetics or make-up products before applying CLI T.  CLI T may make your skin more sensitive to sunlight. Therefore, use sunscreen and wear protective clothing while going outdoors.  Before using CLI T inform your doctor if you have any other skin conditions (such as rosacea, eczema) apart from acne. You must also inform your doctor if you have any problems in your gut (ulcerative colitis) or have a family history of skin cancer.  CLI T is not recommended for use in pregnant or breastfeeding women. Women of childbearing age must use a suitable contraceptive method to avoid pregnancy while undergoing therapy with CLI T.  CLI T may cause skin redness, dryness, itching, stinging, or burning sensation and peeling at the site of application. If you experience them, stop using CLI T for a while until your skin recovers. Consult your doctor if they worsen.
uses: USES OF CLI T Treats acne in adults and in adolescents (aged 12 years or older)
working: HOW CLI T WORKS  CLI T effectively controls acne breakouts. It contains two medicines namely, clindamycin and tretinoin. Clindamycin prevents the growth and multiplication of acne-causing bacteria on the skin. Tretinoin controls acne breakouts by preventing the skin pores from getting clogged with sebum (oil) and dead skin cells. It regulates the growth of skin cells and sheds the excessive dead skin cells that clogs the hair follicles in areas affected with acne and helps your skin renew itself more quickly.
directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Always use CLI T as directed by your physician. It is for external use only. Wash the affected area of the skin with warm water before application. Pat it dry. Apply a thin layer of CLI T on the affected area. Let the medicine completely dry on your skin before applying any make-up products or cosmetics.  Do not use any cosmetics or make-up products before applying CLI T. Check the label of the medicine or consult your doctor regarding the quantity of the medicine that needs to be applied.  Avoid contact of CLI T with eyes, ears, mouth, or vagina. Your doctor will decide the duration of therapy for you depending upon your skin condition.
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF CLI T COMMON Skin redness, irritation, itching, burning or stinging sensation at the site of application Skin dryness, peeling of the skin, sensitivity to sunlight UNCOMMON Increased sebum production Skin rash, scaling, sunburn Skin discoloration RARE Stomach pain, nausea Headache, eye irritation Skin infections (cold sore) Loss of skin pigmentation  Stop using CLI T and contact your doctor immediately if you experience any of the following side effects:  Signs of allergic reactions (such as swelling of your face, eyes, lips, tongue, or throat, trouble breathing, nettle rash, severe dizziness, collapse) Severe or prolonged diarrhea with stomach cramps Severe itching, or burning or peeling of the skin
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY  CLI T is not recommended for use in pregnant women. Therefore, inform your doctor before using CLI T if you are pregnant or think you may be pregnant. Women of childbearing age must use a suitable contraceptive method to avoid pregnancy while undergoing therapy with CLI T.  BREASTFEEDING  CLI T is not recommended for use in breast feeding women. Therefore, consult your doctor before using it.  ALLERGY  Do not use CLI T if you are allergic to Tretinoin, Clindamycin or Lincomycin.  OTHERS  CLI T is not recommended for use if you:  Have a chronic inflammatory bowel disease (Ex. Ulcerative colitis, Crohn’s disease) Have a previous history of colitis while taking any antibiotics (signs include prolonged diarrhea with stomach cramps) Have a family history of skin cancer Have acute eczema (allergic skin reaction causing skin inflammation, redness, dryness, and scaly skin) Have rosacea (skin redness, peeling and warmth with pimples) Have folliculitis (a type of skin inflammation) Have perioral dermatitis (skin rash surrounding the mouth) Have severe forms of acne such as nodular acne (deep cystic nodular acne lesions with pimples)  Before using CLI T inform your doctor if you:  Have any skin inflammation, irritation, or photosensitivity Have an upcoming surgery  Use in pediatrics:  CLI T should be used in children and in adolescents (aged 12 years or older) only if prescribed by the physician. It is not recommended for use in children aged below12 years due to lack of safety data. Therefore, consult your doctor before using it.  Use in geriatrics:  CLI T should be used with caution in elderly patients. Therefore, consult your doctor before using it.
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug-Drug Interaction:  Before using CLI T inform your doctor if you are using any:  Skin care preparations that contain sulfur, salicylic acid, benzoyl peroxide, high amount of alcohol, astringents, spices, or lime Chemical abrasives (used for chemical peeling of skin) Ex. glycolic acid, salicylic acid, alpha hydroxy acids, beta-hydroxy acids Medicated soaps, cleansers or scrubbing solutions Anti-infectives (used to treat infections) Ex. erythromycin, metronidazole, streptomycin, gentamicin, kanamycin Corticosteroids (used to treat inflammation) Ex. betamethasone, beclomethasone Muscle relaxants (used for relaxing muscles prior to surgeries) Ex. vecuronium, rocuronium Warfarin (a medicine used for blood thinning)  Overdosage:  Excessive application of CLI T may cause skin irritation, redness, and dryness. If this happened, rinse your skin with warm water. If irritation persists, stop using CLI T for a few days or until irritation subsides or consult your doctor if necessary. Sometimes, excessive use may also cause stomach pain, diarrhea, nausea or vomiting. If this happens, contact your doctor immediately.
synopsis: SYNOPSIS Drug	:  	Clindamycin, Tretinoin Pharmacological Category	:  	  Lincosamide Antibiotics, Synthetic Retinoids   Therapeutic Indication	:  	  Acne   Dosage Forms	:  	  Gel, Gel (Topical), Oinment
moreInfo: MORE INFORMATION Keep CLI T out of reach of children Store CLI T at room temperature Avoid contact of CLI T with eyes, ears, nose, or mouth. If contact happens accidentally, rinse it off with warm water
faqs: FAQs ABOUT CLI T  How long does it take for CLI T to show the results?  It may take up to 12 weeks for CLI T to show the results. However, this period may vary from patient-to-patient depending upon the severity of acne. Therefore, regularly use CLI T for the stipulated duration mentioned by your doctor.  Will CLI T be more effective if I overuse it?  Do not overuse CLI T. Excessive application of CLI T may cause skin irritation and dryness. Therefore, use CLI T only directed by your physician.  What precautions do I need to follow while using CLI T?  Use CLI T as directed by the physician. Avoid using CLI T on inflamed, irritated, or sensitive skin areas. Do not use any cosmetics or make-up products before applying CLI T. Use sunscreen and wear protective clothing while going outdoors. Before using CLI T inform your doctor if you have any other skin problems apart from acne. Consult your doctor before using CLI T if you are pregnant or breastfeeding as a precaution. Contact your doctor if your skin condition worsens.  Can the use of CLI T make my skin sensitive to sunlight?  Yes. CLI T may make your skin more sensitive to sunlight. Therefore, use protective clothing while going outdoors. Do not exposure the affected part of the skin to the direct sunlight. Consult your doctor if you require any sunscreen to protect your skin while going outdoors. Consult your doctor if your skin condition worsens.  What are the common side effects of using CLI T?  CLI T may cause skin redness, dryness, itching, stinging, or burning sensation and peeling at the site of application. If you experience them, stop using CLI T for a while until your skin recovers. Consult your doctor if they worsen.  Can CLI T be used in children?  CLI T should be used in children and in adolescents (aged 12 years or older) only if prescribed by the physician. It is not recommended for use in children aged below12 years due to lack of safety data. Therefore, consult your doctor before using it.  How does CLI T works?  CLI T acts by preventing the growth and multiplication of acne-causing bacteria. It can also open the skin pores and removes the accumulated dead skin cells and excess oil that triggers acne breakouts.  Can I use CLI T to treat acne during pregnancy?  No. CLI T should not be used to treat acne in pregnant women. Therefore, inform your doctor before using CLI T if you are pregnant or think you may be pregnant. Women of childbearing age must use a suitable contraceptive method to avoid pregnancy while undergoing therapy with CLI T.

name: Clin AD Gel 15gm
about: INTRODUCTION  CLIN AD contains a combination of Adapalene and Clindamycin, which belongs to the group of medicines called topical retinoids and lincomycin antibiotics. It is used in the treatment of skin acne (pimple). Acne is a condition of the skin when the root of your hair (hair follicle) or skin pores gets clogged by oil or dead skin, which becomes prone to bacterial infection and the formation of pimples, blackheads, spots and scars.  Adapalene is a form of vitamin A, that acts as an antiacne agent by binding directly to the receptor of the skin which increases the rate of cell turnover (cell regeneration) and decreases oil secretion preventing clogging of the hair follicles and pores, also decreasing swelling/inflammation. Clindamycin works by binding to the ribosomal unit of the bacteria and disrupts the production of the protein essential for its survival. Before recommending CLIN AD, your doctor may advise you to have tests to understand your existing condition for planning effective treatment methods. Stay well hydrated and protect your skin from exposure to sunlight or UV light.  Do not apply CLIN AD if you are allergic to adapalene or clindamycin, a disorder of the digestive system (colitis), a disorder of the immune system or have bruises, cuts or burns on the skin. The common side effects of using this medicine may include dry skin, burning, itching, redness or irritative sensation of the skin, scaling peeling of the skin etc.
uses: USES OF CLIN AD To treat acne
working: HOW CLIN AD WORKS  Adapalene, a form of vitamin A, works as an antiacne medicine by attaching directly to the skin's receptor, which increases cell turnover (cell regeneration) and decreases oil secretion preventing blockage of the hair follicles and pores. It also reduces swelling/inflammation of the skin. Clindamycin works by attaching to the bacteria's ribosomal unit and disrupting the production of a protein required for its very own survival.
directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Apply CLIN AD as advised by your doctor. It is for external use on the skin only. Avoid applying CLIN AD around or onto your eyes, including eyelids.
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF CLIN AD COMMON Dryness of the skin Burning, itching, redness of the skin Scaling and or peeling of the skin UNCOMMON Flaring of acne Sunburns Local skin reaction  Stop using this medicine and contact your doctor immediately if you experience any of the following side effects:  Severe allergic reactions (such as skin rash, itching, swelling of the face, lips, tongue and other parts of the body, difficulty in breathing or wheezing, blisters on the skin, sore throat, fever, headache etc.)
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY  CLIN AD is not recommended for use in pregnant women. Consult your doctor for advice if you are pregnant or suspect/planning pregnancy.  BREASTFEEDING  CLIN AD is to be used with caution in breastfeeding mothers after consulting your doctor. The safe use of CLIN AD in breastfeeding women and breastfed baby is not established.  DRIVING AND USING MACHINES  CLIN AD may not interfere with your ability to drive or use the machine. However, protect your skin from sun or UV light while travelling and follow appropriate protective measures recommended by your doctor.  ALCOHOL  The risks associated with consuming alcohol are not known. It’s advised to avoid the consumption of alcohol while using CLIN AD, as it could aggravate your existing condition.  ALLERGY  Talk to your doctor if you are allergic to Adapalene and/or Clindamycin.  OTHERS  CLIN AD is not recommended for use if you:  Cuts or bruises on the skin Sunburns Skin conditions like eczema (itching, dry and red skin)  Use in pediatrics:  CLIN AD is not recommended for use in children less than 12 years of age. Consult your doctor for advice.  Use in geriatrics:  CLIN AD should be used with caution in the elderly (above 65 years of age) after consulting your doctor for advice.
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug-Drug interactions:  Inform your physician, if you are taking or using,  Medicated soap for skin, other cosmetic products with a high concentration of alcohol, astringents, sulfur,  Resorcinol – use for itching or irritation of the skin and scalp, loss of hair, dandruff etc. Salicylic acid – used for skin acne, dandruff, etc. Atracurium, cisatracurium, succinylcholine – used to relax muscles  B. Drug-Food interaction:  The interaction of foods with CLIN AD is not known. Consult your doctor for diet advice.  Overdosage:  In case of using CLIN AD in excess than recommended, you may experience dryness, scaling, redness and discomfort of the skin. Contact your doctor immediately for advice.
synopsis: SYNOPSIS Drug	:  	Adapalene, Clindamycin Pharmacological Category	:  	Topical retinoids and Antibiotics Therapeutic Indication	:  	Treat acne Dosage Forms	:  	Gel (topical), Gel, Cream, Ointment
moreInfo: MORE INFORMATION Keep out of reach from children Store at room temperature Keep away from sunlight
faqs: FAQs ABOUT CLIN AD  Can CLIN AD be used to treat scars on the skin?  Yes. Adapalene is a kind of vitamin A that reduces swelling and inflammation while also treating acne scars. Azithromycin is used to treat infections that cause skin infections to worsen.  Can CLIN AD result in skin peeling?  Yes. Dryness of the skin, burning, itching, redness of the skin, skin irritation, scaling, and possibly peeling of the skin are all possible side effects of using this medicine.  Can [GBBNKEYWORD] cause skin dryness?  Yes. Your skin may get dry as a result of taking this medication. Maintain hydration and use the moisturiser that your doctor has prescribed.  How long can I use CLIN AD?  Use CLIN AD as advised by your doctor. Generally, it’s recommended for use depending on the severity of the existing skin condition.  Can I stop using CLIN AD on my own?  No. It is not recommended to stop using CLIN AD on your own as it may worsen the existing skin condition. Consult your doctor for advice.

name: CLINBID 1.0% Gel 20gm
about: INTRODUCTION  CLINBID 1.0% GEL contains Clindamycin, which belongs to the group of medicines called Antibiotics. It is used in the treatment of acne vulgaris. Acne vulgaris is a common skin condition that occurs when hair follicles get blocked with oil and dead skin cells. Symptoms include whiteheads, blackheads, small red, tender bumps, pimples, and pus-filled lumps on the skin.  Before applying CLINBID 1.0% GEL, inform your doctor if you have or ever had diarrhea, bloody diarrhea and pseudomembranous colitis. CLINBID 1.0% GEL is not recommended for use if you have a history of regional enteritis (inflammation of the small intestine), ulcerative colitis (inflammation of the large intestine) or antibiotic-associated colitis.  CLINBID 1.0% GEL should be used with caution during pregnancy or by breastfeeding women only if clearly needed. The safety and effectiveness of CLINBID 1.0% GEL in children under the age of 12 has not been established. The most common side effects of applying CLINBID 1.0% GEL are burning, itching, and redness of the skin. Consult your doctor if symptoms worsen.
uses: USES OF CLINBID 1.0% GEL Treats acne vulgaris
working: HOW CLINBID 1.0% GEL WORKS  CLINBID 1.0% GEL acts against the bacteria by binding to the 50S subunit of the bacterial ribosome (site of protein synthesis), which in turn prevents protein synthesis and kills the infection-causing bacteria.
directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Apply CLINBID 1.0% GEL as advised by your physician. It is for external use only. Wash your hands before use. Wash and dry the whole area, apply a thin film once daily to the skin where acne lesions appear and use enough to cover the entire affected area. In case of contact with the eyes, mouth or nostrils, rinse it off immediately and thoroughly with water. Your doctor will decide the correct dose and duration for you depending on your age, body weight and disease condition.
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF CLINBID 1.0% GEL COMMON Burning, itching or abnormal redness of the skin at the application site Scaling, pain, dryness and skin irritation at the application site UNCOMMON Abdominal pain Diarrhea Oily skin RARE Antibiotic-associated colitis  Stop applying CLINBID 1.0% GEL and contact your doctor immediately if you experience any of the following side effects:  Allergic symptoms (e.g., rashes, itchiness, difficulty in breathing or eye swelling) Severe or bloody diarrhea. (a sign of bowel inflammation, pseudomembranous colitis)
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY  The safety and effectiveness of CLINBID 1.0% GEL in pregnant women or women planning to have a baby have not been established yet. It will be given to you by the doctor only if clearly needed. Consult your doctor before applying CLINBID 1.0% GEL.  BREASTFEEDING  CLINBID 1.0% GEL should be used with caution in breastfeeding women as it is not known if the medicine is excreted in human milk. Your doctor will decide whether to discontinue nursing or the medicine, considering the benefits to the mother and baby. If it is applied to the chest, care should be taken to avoid accidental ingestion by the infant. Consult your doctor before applying CLINBID 1.0% GEL.  ALLERGY  Do not apply CLINBID 1.0% GEL if you are allergic to Clindamycin or any other ingredients of this medicine.  OTHERS  CLINBID 1.0% GEL is not recommended for use if you:  Have regional enteritis (inflammation of the small intestine) or ulcerative colitis (inflammation of the large intestine) Have a history of antibiotic-associated colitis  Before applying CLINBID 1.0% GEL inform your doctor if you:  Diarrhea, bloody diarrhea Pseudomembranous colitis (inflammation of colon) Atopic individuals (more prone to allergies)  Use in pediatrics:  Safety and effectiveness of CLINBID 1.0% GEL in children under the age of 12 have not been established. Consult your doctor before applying CLINBID 1.0% GEL.
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug-Drug interactions:  Before applying CLINBID 1.0% GEL, inform your doctor if you are taking any of the following medicine:  Neuromuscular blocking agents (Ex. rocuronium, vecuronium) Other anti-acne, topical agents  Overdosage:  If you or anyone else accidentally applied too much of CLINBID 1.0% GEL, consult your doctor immediately or visit the nearby hospital.

sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF CLINBID A GEL COMMON Dryness of the skin Burning, itching, redness of the skin Scaling and or peeling of the skin UNCOMMON Flaring of acne Sunburns Local skin reaction RARE  Stop using this medicine and contact your doctor immediately if you experience any of the following side effects:  Severe allergic reactions (such as skin rash, itching, swelling of the face, lips, tongue and other parts of the body, difficulty in breathing or wheezing, blisters on the skin, sore throat, fever, headache etc.)
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY CONTRAINDICATED  CLINBID A GEL is not recommended for use in pregnant women. Consult your doctor for advice if you are pregnant or suspect/planning pregnancy.  BREASTFEEDING CONSULT YOUR DOCTOR  CLINBID A GEL is to be used with caution in breastfeeding mothers after consulting your doctor. The safe use of CLINBID A GEL in breastfeeding women and breastfed baby is not established.  DRIVING AND USING MACHINES USE WITH CAUTION  CLINBID A GEL may not interfere with your ability to drive or use the machine. However, protect your skin from sun or UV light while travelling and follow appropriate protective measures recommended by your doctor.  ALCOHOL CONSULT YOUR DOCTOR  The risks associated with consuming alcohol are not known. It’s advised to avoid the consumption of alcohol while using CLINBID A GEL, as it could aggravate your existing condition.  ALLERGY CONTRAINDICATED  Talk to your doctor if you are allergic to Adapalene and/or Clindamycin.  OTHERS  CLINBID A GEL is not recommended for use if you:  Cuts or bruises on the skin Sunburns Skin conditions like eczema (itching, dry and red skin)  Use in pediatrics:  CLINBID A GEL is not recommended for use in children less than 12 years of age. Consult your doctor for advice.  Use in geriatrics:  CLINBID A GEL should be used with caution in the elderly (above 65 years of age) after consulting your doctor for advice.
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug-Drug interactions:  Inform your physician, if you are taking or using,  Medicated soap for skin, other cosmetic products with a high concentration of alcohol, astringents, sulfur,  Resorcinol – use for itching or irritation of the skin and scalp, loss of hair, dandruff etc. Salicylic acid – used for skin acne, dandruff, etc. Atracurium, cisatracurium, succinylcholine – used to relax muscles  B. Drug-Food interaction:  The interaction of foods with CLINBID A GEL is not known. Consult your doctor for diet advice.  Overdosage:  In case of using CLINBID A GEL in excess, than recommended, you may experience dryness, scaling, redness and discomfort of the skin. Contact your doctor immediately for advice.
synopsis: SYNOPSIS Drug	:  	Adapalene, Clindamycin Pharmacological Category	:  	Topical Retinoids, Antibiotics Therapeutic Indication	:  	Treat acne        Dosage Forms	:  	Gel (topical), Gel, Cream, Ointment
moreInfo: MORE INFORMATION Keep out of reach from children Store at room temperature. Keep away from sunlight
faqs: FAQs ABOUT CLINBID A GEL  Q: Can CLINBID A GEL be used to treat scars on the skin?  A: Yes. Adapalene is a kind of vitamin A that reduces swelling and inflammation while also treating acne scars. Azithromycin is used to treat infections that cause skin infections to worsen.  Q: Can CLINBID A GEL result in skin peeling?  A: Yes. Dryness of the skin, burning, itching, redness of the skin, skin irritation, scaling, and possibly peeling of the skin are all possible side effects of using this medicine.  Q: Can [GBBNKEYWORD] cause skin dryness?  A: Yes. Your skin may get dry as a result of taking this medication. Maintain hydration and use the moisturiser that your doctor has prescribed.  Q: How long can I use CLINBID A GEL?  A: Use CLINBID A GEL as advised by your doctor. Generally, it’s recommended for use depending on the severity of the existing skin condition.  Q: Can I stop using CLINBID A GEL on my own?  A: No. It is not recommended to stop using CLINBID A GEL on your own as it may worsen the existing skin condition. Consult your doctor for advice.

name: Clincitop Gel 20gm
about: INTRODUCTION  CLINCITOP GEL contains Clindamycin, which belongs to the group of medicines called Antibiotics. It is used in the treatment of acne vulgaris. Acne vulgaris is a common skin condition that occurs when hair follicles get blocked with oil and dead skin cells. Symptoms include whiteheads, blackheads, small red, tender bumps, pimples, and pus-filled lumps on the skin.  Before applying CLINCITOP GEL, inform your doctor if you have or ever had diarrhea, bloody diarrhea and pseudomembranous colitis. CLINCITOP GEL is not recommended for use if you have a history of regional enteritis (inflammation of the small intestine), ulcerative colitis (inflammation of the large intestine) or antibiotic-associated colitis.  CLINCITOP GEL should be used with caution during pregnancy or by breastfeeding women only if clearly needed. The safety and effectiveness of CLINCITOP GEL in children under the age of 12 has not been established. The most common side effects of applying CLINCITOP GEL are burning, itching, and redness of the skin. Consult your doctor if symptoms worsen.
uses: USES OF CLINCITOP GEL Treats acne vulgaris
working: HOW CLINCITOP GEL WORKS  CLINCITOP GEL acts against the bacteria by binding to the 50S subunit of the bacterial ribosome (site of protein synthesis), which in turn prevents protein synthesis and kills the infection-causing bacteria.
directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Apply CLINCITOP GEL as advised by your physician. It is for external use only. Wash your hands before use. Wash and dry the whole area, apply a thin film once daily to the skin where acne lesions appear and use enough to cover the entire affected area. In case of contact with the eyes, mouth or nostrils, rinse it off immediately and thoroughly with water. Your doctor will decide the correct dose and duration for you depending on your age, body weight and disease condition.
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF CLINCITOP GEL COMMON Burning, itching or abnormal redness of the skin at the application site Scaling, pain, dryness and skin irritation at the application site UNCOMMON Abdominal pain Diarrhea Oily skin RARE Antibiotic-associated colitis  Stop applying CLINCITOP GEL and contact your doctor immediately if you experience any of the following side effects:  Allergic symptoms (e.g., rashes, itchiness, difficulty in breathing or eye swelling) Severe or bloody diarrhea. (a sign of bowel inflammation, pseudomembranous colitis)
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY  The safety and effectiveness of CLINCITOP GEL in pregnant women or women planning to have a baby have not been established yet. It will be given to you by the doctor only if clearly needed. Consult your doctor before applying CLINCITOP GEL.  BREASTFEEDING  CLINCITOP GEL should be used with caution in breastfeeding women as it is not known if the medicine is excreted in human milk. Your doctor will decide whether to discontinue nursing or the medicine, considering the benefits to the mother and baby. If it is applied to the chest, care should be taken to avoid accidental ingestion by the infant. Consult your doctor before applying CLINCITOP GEL.  ALLERGY  Do not apply CLINCITOP GEL if you are allergic to Clindamycin or any other ingredients of this medicine.  OTHERS  CLINCITOP GEL is not recommended for use if you:  Have regional enteritis (inflammation of the small intestine) or ulcerative colitis (inflammation of the large intestine) Have a history of antibiotic-associated colitis  Before applying CLINCITOP GEL inform your doctor if you:  Diarrhea, bloody diarrhea Pseudomembranous colitis (inflammation of colon) Atopic individuals (more prone to allergies)  Use in pediatrics:  Safety and effectiveness of CLINCITOP GEL in children under the age of 12 have not been established. Consult your doctor before applying CLINCITOP GEL.
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug-Drug interactions:  Before applying CLINCITOP GEL, inform your doctor if you are taking any of the following medicine:  Neuromuscular blocking agents (Ex. rocuronium, vecuronium) Other anti-acne, topical agents  Overdosage:  If you or anyone else accidentally applied too much of CLINCITOP GEL, consult your doctor immediately or visit the nearby hospital.
synopsis: SYNOPSIS Drug	:  	  Clindamycin   Pharmacological Category	:  	  Lincosamides   Therapeutic Indication	:  	  Acne vulgaris   Dosage Forms	:  	  Injection, Tablet, Capsule, Gel, Cream, Lotion, Solution, Spray, Soap
moreInfo: MORE INFORMATION Keep CLINCITOP GEL out of reach from children Store at room temperature

name: CLINDAC AP Gel 15gm
about: INTRODUCTION  CLINDAC AP contains a combination of Adapalene and Clindamycin, which belongs to the group of medicines called topical retinoids and lincomycin antibiotics. It is used in the treatment of skin acne (pimple). Acne is a condition of the skin when the root of your hair (hair follicle) or skin pores gets clogged by oil or dead skin, which becomes prone to bacterial infection and the formation of pimples, blackheads, spots and scars.  Adapalene is a form of vitamin A, that acts as an antiacne agent by binding directly to the receptor of the skin which increases the rate of cell turnover (cell regeneration) and decreases oil secretion preventing clogging of the hair follicles and pores, also decreasing swelling/inflammation. Clindamycin works by binding to the ribosomal unit of the bacteria and disrupts the production of the protein essential for its survival. Before recommending CLINDAC AP, your doctor may advise you to have tests to understand your existing condition for planning effective treatment methods. Stay well hydrated and protect your skin from exposure to sunlight or UV light.  Do not apply CLINDAC AP if you are allergic to adapalene or clindamycin, a disorder of the digestive system (colitis), a disorder of the immune system or have bruises, cuts or burns on the skin. The common side effects of using this medicine may include dry skin, burning, itching, redness or irritative sensation of the skin, scaling peeling of the skin etc.
uses: USES OF CLINDAC AP To treat acne
working: HOW CLINDAC AP WORKS  Adapalene, a form of vitamin A, works as an antiacne medicine by attaching directly to the skin's receptor, which increases cell turnover (cell regeneration) and decreases oil secretion preventing blockage of the hair follicles and pores. It also reduces swelling/inflammation of the skin. Clindamycin works by attaching to the bacteria's ribosomal unit and disrupting the production of a protein required for its very own survival.
directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Apply CLINDAC AP as advised by your doctor. It is for external use on the skin only. Avoid applying CLINDAC AP around or onto your eyes, including eyelids.
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF CLINDAC AP COMMON Dryness of the skin Burning, itching, redness of the skin Scaling and or peeling of the skin UNCOMMON Flaring of acne Sunburns Local skin reaction  Stop using this medicine and contact your doctor immediately if you experience any of the following side effects:  Severe allergic reactions (such as skin rash, itching, swelling of the face, lips, tongue and other parts of the body, difficulty in breathing or wheezing, blisters on the skin, sore throat, fever, headache etc.)
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY  CLINDAC AP is not recommended for use in pregnant women. Consult your doctor for advice if you are pregnant or suspect/planning pregnancy.  BREASTFEEDING  CLINDAC AP is to be used with caution in breastfeeding mothers after consulting your doctor. The safe use of CLINDAC AP in breastfeeding women and breastfed baby is not established.  DRIVING AND USING MACHINES  CLINDAC AP may not interfere with your ability to drive or use the machine. However, protect your skin from sun or UV light while travelling and follow appropriate protective measures recommended by your doctor.  ALCOHOL  The risks associated with consuming alcohol are not known. It’s advised to avoid the consumption of alcohol while using CLINDAC AP, as it could aggravate your existing condition.  ALLERGY  Talk to your doctor if you are allergic to Adapalene and/or Clindamycin.  OTHERS  CLINDAC AP is not recommended for use if you:  Cuts or bruises on the skin Sunburns Skin conditions like eczema (itching, dry and red skin)  Use in pediatrics:  CLINDAC AP is not recommended for use in children less than 12 years of age. Consult your doctor for advice.  Use in geriatrics:  CLINDAC AP should be used with caution in the elderly (above 65 years of age) after consulting your doctor for advice.
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug-Drug interactions:  Inform your physician, if you are taking or using,  Medicated soap for skin, other cosmetic products with a high concentration of alcohol, astringents, sulfur,  Resorcinol – use for itching or irritation of the skin and scalp, loss of hair, dandruff etc. Salicylic acid – used for skin acne, dandruff, etc. Atracurium, cisatracurium, succinylcholine – used to relax muscles  B. Drug-Food interaction:  The interaction of foods with CLINDAC AP is not known. Consult your doctor for diet advice.  Overdosage:  In case of using CLINDAC AP in excess than recommended, you may experience dryness, scaling, redness and discomfort of the skin. Contact your doctor immediately for advice.
synopsis: SYNOPSIS Drug	:  	Adapalene, Clindamycin Pharmacological Category	:  	Topical retinoids and Antibiotics Therapeutic Indication	:  	Treat acne Dosage Forms	:  	Gel (topical), Gel, Cream, Ointment
moreInfo: MORE INFORMATION Keep out of reach from children Store at room temperature Keep away from sunlight
faqs: FAQs ABOUT CLINDAC AP  Can CLINDAC AP be used to treat scars on the skin?  Yes. Adapalene is a kind of vitamin A that reduces swelling and inflammation while also treating acne scars. Azithromycin is used to treat infections that cause skin infections to worsen.  Can CLINDAC AP result in skin peeling?  Yes. Dryness of the skin, burning, itching, redness of the skin, skin irritation, scaling, and possibly peeling of the skin are all possible side effects of using this medicine.  Can [GBBNKEYWORD] cause skin dryness?  Yes. Your skin may get dry as a result of taking this medication. Maintain hydration and use the moisturiser that your doctor has prescribed.  How long can I use CLINDAC AP?  Use CLINDAC AP as advised by your doctor. Generally, it’s recommended for use depending on the severity of the existing skin condition.  Can I stop using CLINDAC AP on my own?  No. It is not recommended to stop using CLINDAC AP on your own as it may worsen the existing skin condition. Consult your doctor for advice.

name: CLINDAFIN N Gel 20gm
about: INTRODUCTION  CLINDAFIN N GEL is a combination of Clindamycin and Nicotinamide which belongs to a group of medicines called Lincomycin antibiotics and Vitamin B3 complex, respectively. CLINDAFIN N GEL is used to treat mild to moderate acne which is a skin condition that occurs when hair follicles become plugged with oil and dead skin cells which may occur due to variety of causes such as genetics, fluctuating hormone levels, stress, high humidity or using oily or greasy personal care products which may affect people of all ages.  It is characterized by symptoms such as open or closed plugged pores, small red & tender bumps, pimples, large, solid or painful lumps under the skin and painful & pus-filled lumps under the skin.  Before using CLINDAFIN N GEL inform your doctor if you have liver, kidney, lung or heart diseases. Avoid applying CLINDAFIN N GEL to a cut, scrapped, sunburnt or eczema affected skin.  CLINDAFIN N GEL should be used with caution in pregnant and in breastfeeding women. CLINDAFIN N GEL is not recommended for use in children and adolescents (below 12 years). Consult your doctor before applying.  The most common side effects of using CLINDAFIN N GEL are skin inflammation, contact dermatitis (red, itchy rash), inflammation of hair follicles, itchy skin, dry skin and peeling of skin. Consult your doctor if any of these symptoms worsen.
uses: USES OF CLINDAFIN N GEL Treats mild to moderate acne
working: HOW CLINDAFIN N GEL WORKS  CLINDAFIN N GEL helps to treat acne, where Clindamycin reduces free fatty acid concentrations on the skin and suppresses the growth of Propionibacterium acnes (Corynebacterium acnes), a bacteria found in sebaceous glands and follicles and Nicotinamide exerts anti-inflammatory effect in acne and interrupts sebum production.
directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Apply CLINDAFIN N GEL as advised by your physician. It is for external use only. Before applying the medicine normally wash and dry the affected area and apply a thin layer of this medicine on the affected area. Treated areas on the face need not be covered with a plaster or bandage. Do not apply this medicine beyond the recommended duration. Avoid applying CLINDAFIN N GEL around your eyes, including eyelids. Rinse it off with water if you accidentally get it in these areas.
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF CLINDAFIN N GEL COMMON Contact dermatitis (red, itchy rash) Inflammation of hair follicles Itchy skin Dry skin Peeling of skin
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY  CLINDAFIN N GEL should be used with caution in pregnant women. Consult your doctor before applying.  BREASTFEEDING  CLINDAFIN N GEL should be used with caution in breastfeeding women. Consult your doctor before applying.  ALLERGY  CLINDAFIN N GEL is not recommended for use if you are allergic to Clindamycin, Nicotinamide or any other ingredients of this medicine.  OTHERS  CLINDAFIN N GEL is not recommended for use if you have:  Eczema (skin inflammation) Cut, scrapped, sunburnt skin  Use in Pediatrics:  CLINDAFIN N GEL is not recommended for use in children and adolescents (below 12 years). Consult your doctor before using it for your child.  Use in Geriatrics:  There is no information on the use of CLINDAFIN N GEL in elderly patients. Consult with your doctor before using.
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug - Drug interactions:  Before using CLINDAFIN N GEL, inform your doctor if you are taking any of the following medicines:  Acepromazine (used a sedative/tranquilizer) Acetaminophen (used to treat pain and inflammation)  Overdosage:  If you or anyone else accidentally ingests or applies too much of CLINDAFIN N GEL, consult your doctor immediately or visit the nearby hospital.
synopsis: SYNOPSIS Drug	:  	Clindamycin, Nicotinamide Pharmacological Category	:  	Lincomycin antibiotics, Vitamin B3 complex Therapeutic Indication	:  	Mild to moderate acne Dosage Forms	:  	Gel, Cream, Ointment
moreInfo: MORE INFORMATION Keep CLINDAFIN N GEL out of reach of children Store CLINDAFIN N GEL at a temperature below 25°C
faqs: FAQs ABOUT CLINDAFIN N GEL  What special precautions should I follow while using CLINDAFIN N GEL?  Before using CLINDAFIN N GEL inform your doctor if you have liver, kidney, lung or heart diseases. Avoid applying CLINDAFIN N GEL to a cut, scrapped, sunburnt or eczema affected skin. This medicine is not for oral, ophthalmic or intravaginal use.  What is CLINDAFIN N GEL used for?  CLINDAFIN N GEL is indicated for the treatment of mild to moderate acne in patients above 12 years of age. Do not use it for any other condition other than that prescribed by your doctor.  How should I use CLINDAFIN N GEL?  Always apply CLINDAFIN N GEL, as directed by your physician. It is for external use only. On the affected area, apply a thin layer of this medicine. Treated areas on the face need not be covered with a plaster or bandage. Do not apply this medicine on your face beyond 5 days. Avoid applying CLINDAFIN N GEL around your eyes, including eyelids.  Is CLINDAFIN N GEL safe to use in pregnant and breastfeeding women?  CLINDAFIN N GEL should be used with caution during pregnancy, women planning for pregnancy and in breastfeeding women. Consult your doctor before applying.  Can CLINDAFIN N GEL cause skin irritation or itchy skin?  CLINDAFIN N GEL may cause skin irritation or itchy skin. Avoid hot bath because hot water can irritate your skin further. Do not scratch the affected area. Use protective clothing when going outdoors. Regularly moisturize your skin and apply calamine lotion as a coolant. Discuss with your doctor if the symptom worsens.

Is CLINDASIL GEL safe to use in pregnant and breastfeeding women?  CLINDASIL GEL should be used with caution during pregnancy, women planning for pregnancy and in breastfeeding women. Consult your doctor before applying.  Can CLINDASIL GEL cause skin irritation or itchy skin?  CLINDASIL GEL may cause skin irritation or itchy skin. Avoid hot bath because hot water can irritate your skin further. Do not scratch the affected area. Use protective clothing when going outdoors. Regularly moisturize your skin and apply calamine lotion as a coolant. Discuss with your doctor if the symptom worsens.

name: Clindot Gel 20gm
about: INTRODUCTION  CLINDOT GEL contains Clindamycin, which belongs to the group of medicines called Antibiotics. It is used in the treatment of acne vulgaris. Acne vulgaris is a common skin condition that occurs when hair follicles get blocked with oil and dead skin cells. Symptoms include whiteheads, blackheads, small red, tender bumps, pimples, and pus-filled lumps on the skin.  Before applying CLINDOT GEL, inform your doctor if you have or ever had diarrhea, bloody diarrhea and pseudomembranous colitis. CLINDOT GEL is not recommended for use if you have a history of regional enteritis (inflammation of the small intestine), ulcerative colitis (inflammation of the large intestine) or antibiotic-associated colitis.  CLINDOT GEL should be used with caution during pregnancy or by breastfeeding women only if clearly needed. The safety and effectiveness of CLINDOT GEL in children under the age of 12 has not been established. The most common side effects of applying CLINDOT GEL are burning, itching, and redness of the skin. Consult your doctor if symptoms worsen.
uses: USES OF CLINDOT GEL Treats acne vulgaris
working: HOW CLINDOT GEL WORKS  CLINDOT GEL acts against the bacteria by binding to the 50S subunit of the bacterial ribosome (site of protein synthesis), which in turn prevents protein synthesis and kills the infection-causing bacteria.
directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Apply CLINDOT GEL as advised by your physician. It is for external use only. Wash your hands before use. Wash and dry the whole area, apply a thin film once daily to the skin where acne lesions appear and use enough to cover the entire affected area. In case of contact with the eyes, mouth or nostrils, rinse it off immediately and thoroughly with water. Your doctor will decide the correct dose and duration for you depending on your age, body weight and disease condition.
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF CLINDOT GEL COMMON Burning, itching or abnormal redness of the skin at the application site Scaling, pain, dryness and skin irritation at the application site UNCOMMON Abdominal pain Diarrhea Oily skin RARE Antibiotic-associated colitis  Stop applying CLINDOT GEL and contact your doctor immediately if you experience any of the following side effects:  Allergic symptoms (e.g., rashes, itchiness, difficulty in breathing or eye swelling) Severe or bloody diarrhea. (a sign of bowel inflammation, pseudomembranous colitis)
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY  The safety and effectiveness of CLINDOT GEL in pregnant women or women planning to have a baby have not been established yet. It will be given to you by the doctor only if clearly needed. Consult your doctor before applying CLINDOT GEL.  BREASTFEEDING  CLINDOT GEL should be used with caution in breastfeeding women as it is not known if the medicine is excreted in human milk. Your doctor will decide whether to discontinue nursing or the medicine, considering the benefits to the mother and baby. If it is applied to the chest, care should be taken to avoid accidental ingestion by the infant. Consult your doctor before applying CLINDOT GEL.  ALLERGY  Do not apply CLINDOT GEL if you are allergic to Clindamycin or any other ingredients of this medicine.  OTHERS  CLINDOT GEL is not recommended for use if you:  Have regional enteritis (inflammation of the small intestine) or ulcerative colitis (inflammation of the large intestine) Have a history of antibiotic-associated colitis  Before applying CLINDOT GEL inform your doctor if you:  Diarrhea, bloody diarrhea Pseudomembranous colitis (inflammation of colon) Atopic individuals (more prone to allergies)  Use in pediatrics:  Safety and effectiveness of CLINDOT GEL in children under the age of 12 have not been established. Consult your doctor before applying CLINDOT GEL.
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug-Drug interactions:  Before applying CLINDOT GEL, inform your doctor if you are taking any of the following medicine:  Neuromuscular blocking agents (Ex. rocuronium, vecuronium) Other anti-acne, topical agents  Overdosage:  If you or anyone else accidentally applied too much of CLINDOT GEL, consult your doctor immediately or visit the nearby hospital.
synopsis: SYNOPSIS Drug	:  	  Clindamycin   Pharmacological Category	:  	  Lincosamides   Therapeutic Indication	:  	  Acne vulgaris   Dosage Forms	:  	  Injection, Tablet, Capsule, Gel, Cream, Lotion, Solution, Spray, Soap

name: CLINDOT N Gel 20gm
about: INTRODUCTION  CLINDOT N GEL is a combination of Clindamycin and Nicotinamide which belongs to a group of medicines called Lincomycin antibiotics and Vitamin B3 complex, respectively. CLINDOT N GEL is used to treat mild to moderate acne which is a skin condition that occurs when hair follicles become plugged with oil and dead skin cells which may occur due to variety of causes such as genetics, fluctuating hormone levels, stress, high humidity or using oily or greasy personal care products which may affect people of all ages.  It is characterized by symptoms such as open or closed plugged pores, small red & tender bumps, pimples, large, solid or painful lumps under the skin and painful & pus-filled lumps under the skin.  Before using CLINDOT N GEL inform your doctor if you have liver, kidney, lung or heart diseases. Avoid applying CLINDOT N GEL to a cut, scrapped, sunburnt or eczema affected skin.  CLINDOT N GEL should be used with caution in pregnant and in breastfeeding women. CLINDOT N GEL is not recommended for use in children and adolescents (below 12 years). Consult your doctor before applying.  The most common side effects of using CLINDOT N GEL are skin inflammation, contact dermatitis (red, itchy rash), inflammation of hair follicles, itchy skin, dry skin and peeling of skin. Consult your doctor if any of these symptoms worsen.
uses: USES OF CLINDOT N GEL Treats mild to moderate acne
working: HOW CLINDOT N GEL WORKS  CLINDOT N GEL helps to treat acne, where Clindamycin reduces free fatty acid concentrations on the skin and suppresses the growth of Propionibacterium acnes (Corynebacterium acnes), a bacteria found in sebaceous glands and follicles and Nicotinamide exerts anti-inflammatory effect in acne and interrupts sebum production.
directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Apply CLINDOT N GEL as advised by your physician. It is for external use only. Before applying the medicine normally wash and dry the affected area and apply a thin layer of this medicine on the affected area. Treated areas on the face need not be covered with a plaster or bandage. Do not apply this medicine beyond the recommended duration. Avoid applying CLINDOT N GEL around your eyes, including eyelids. Rinse it off with water if you accidentally get it in these areas.
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF CLINDOT N GEL COMMON Contact dermatitis (red, itchy rash) Inflammation of hair follicles Itchy skin Dry skin Peeling of skin
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY  CLINDOT N GEL should be used with caution in pregnant women. Consult your doctor before applying.  BREASTFEEDING  CLINDOT N GEL should be used with caution in breastfeeding women. Consult your doctor before applying.  ALLERGY  CLINDOT N GEL is not recommended for use if you are allergic to Clindamycin, Nicotinamide or any other ingredients of this medicine.  OTHERS  CLINDOT N GEL is not recommended for use if you have:  Eczema (skin inflammation) Cut, scrapped, sunburnt skin  Use in Pediatrics:  CLINDOT N GEL is not recommended for use in children and adolescents (below 12 years). Consult your doctor before using it for your child.  Use in Geriatrics:  There is no information on the use of CLINDOT N GEL in elderly patients. Consult with your doctor before using.
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug - Drug interactions:  Before using CLINDOT N GEL, inform your doctor if you are taking any of the following medicines:  Acepromazine (used a sedative/tranquilizer) Acetaminophen (used to treat pain and inflammation)  Overdosage:  If you or anyone else accidentally ingests or applies too much of CLINDOT N GEL, consult your doctor immediately or visit the nearby hospital.
synopsis: SYNOPSIS Drug	:  	Clindamycin, Nicotinamide Pharmacological Category	:  	Lincomycin antibiotics, Vitamin B3 complex Therapeutic Indication	:  	Mild to moderate acne Dosage Forms	:  	Gel, Cream, Ointment
moreInfo: MORE INFORMATION Keep CLINDOT N GEL out of reach of children Store CLINDOT N GEL at a temperature below 25°C

Avoid applying CLINDOT N GEL to a cut, scrapped, sunburnt or eczema affected skin. This medicine is not for oral, ophthalmic or intravaginal use.  What is CLINDOT N GEL used for?  CLINDOT N GEL is indicated for the treatment of mild to moderate acne in patients above 12 years of age. Do not use it for any other condition other than that prescribed by your doctor.  How should I use CLINDOT N GEL?  Always apply CLINDOT N GEL, as directed by your physician. It is for external use only. On the affected area, apply a thin layer of this medicine. Treated areas on the face need not be covered with a plaster or bandage. Do not apply this medicine on your face beyond 5 days. Avoid applying CLINDOT N GEL around your eyes, including eyelids.  Is CLINDOT N GEL safe to use in pregnant and breastfeeding women?  CLINDOT N GEL should be used with caution during pregnancy, women planning for pregnancy and in breastfeeding women. Consult your doctor before applying.  Can CLINDOT N GEL cause skin irritation or itchy skin?  CLINDOT N GEL may cause skin irritation or itchy skin. Avoid hot bath because hot water can irritate your skin further. Do not scratch the affected area. Use protective clothing when going outdoors. Regularly moisturize your skin and apply calamine lotion as a coolant. Discuss with your doctor if the symptom worsens.

It is for external use only. Wash your hands before use. Wash and dry the whole area, apply a thin film once daily to the skin where acne lesions appear and use enough to cover the entire affected area. In case of contact with the eyes, mouth or nostrils, rinse it off immediately with plenty of water.  How does CLINKA GEL work?  CLINKA GEL acts against the bacteria by binding to the 50S subunit of the bacterial ribosome (site of protein synthesis), which in turn prevents protein synthesis and kills the infection-causing bacteria.  Can CLINKA GEL be used in pregnancy?  The safety and effectiveness of CLINKA GEL in pregnant women or women planning to have a baby have not been established yet. It will be given to you by the doctor only if clearly needed. Consult your doctor before applying CLINKA GEL.  Can CLINKA GEL be used in breastfeeding women?  CLINKA GEL should be used with caution in breastfeeding women as it is not known if the medicine is excreted in human milk. Your doctor will decide whether to discontinue nursing or the medicine, considering the benefits to the mother and baby. If it is applied to the chest, care should be taken to avoid accidental ingestion by the infant. Consult your doctor before applying CLINKA GEL.

name: Clinmiskin Gel 20gm
about: INTRODUCTION  CLINMI SKIN GEL is a combination of Clindamycin and Nicotinamide which belongs to a group of medicines called Lincomycin antibiotics and Vitamin B3 complex, respectively. CLINMI SKIN GEL is used to treat mild to moderate acne which is a skin condition that occurs when hair follicles become plugged with oil and dead skin cells which may occur due to variety of causes such as genetics, fluctuating hormone levels, stress, high humidity or using oily or greasy personal care products which may affect people of all ages.  It is characterized by symptoms such as open or closed plugged pores, small red & tender bumps, pimples, large, solid or painful lumps under the skin and painful & pus-filled lumps under the skin.  Before using CLINMI SKIN GEL inform your doctor if you have liver, kidney, lung or heart diseases. Avoid applying CLINMI SKIN GEL to a cut, scrapped, sunburnt or eczema affected skin.  CLINMI SKIN GEL should be used with caution in pregnant and in breastfeeding women. CLINMI SKIN GEL is not recommended for use in children and adolescents (below 12 years). Consult your doctor before applying.  The most common side effects of using CLINMI SKIN GEL are skin inflammation, contact dermatitis (red, itchy rash), inflammation of hair follicles, itchy skin, dry skin and peeling of skin. Consult your doctor if any of these symptoms worsen.
uses: USES OF CLINMI SKIN GEL Treats mild to moderate acne
working: HOW CLINMI SKIN GEL WORKS  CLINMI SKIN GEL helps to treat acne, where Clindamycin reduces free fatty acid concentrations on the skin and suppresses the growth of Propionibacterium acnes (Corynebacterium acnes), a bacteria found in sebaceous glands and follicles and Nicotinamide exerts anti-inflammatory effect in acne and interrupts sebum production.
directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Apply CLINMI SKIN GEL as advised by your physician. It is for external use only. Before applying the medicine normally wash and dry the affected area and apply a thin layer of this medicine on the affected area. Treated areas on the face need not be covered with a plaster or bandage. Do not apply this medicine beyond the recommended duration. Avoid applying CLINMI SKIN GEL around your eyes, including eyelids. Rinse it off with water if you accidentally get it in these areas.
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF CLINMI SKIN GEL COMMON Contact dermatitis (red, itchy rash) Inflammation of hair follicles Itchy skin Dry skin Peeling of skin
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY  CLINMI SKIN GEL should be used with caution in pregnant women. Consult your doctor before applying.  BREASTFEEDING  CLINMI SKIN GEL should be used with caution in breastfeeding women. Consult your doctor before applying.  ALLERGY  CLINMI SKIN GEL is not recommended for use if you are allergic to Clindamycin, Nicotinamide or any other ingredients of this medicine.  OTHERS  CLINMI SKIN GEL is not recommended for use if you have:  Eczema (skin inflammation) Cut, scrapped, sunburnt skin  Use in Pediatrics:  CLINMI SKIN GEL is not recommended for use in children and adolescents (below 12 years). Consult your doctor before using it for your child.  Use in Geriatrics:  There is no information on the use of CLINMI SKIN GEL in elderly patients. Consult with your doctor before using.
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug - Drug interactions:  Before using CLINMI SKIN GEL, inform your doctor if you are taking any of the following medicines:  Acepromazine (used a sedative/tranquilizer) Acetaminophen (used to treat pain and inflammation)  Overdosage:  If you or anyone else accidentally ingests or applies too much of CLINMI SKIN GEL, consult your doctor immediately or visit the nearby hospital.
synopsis: SYNOPSIS Drug	:  	Clindamycin, Nicotinamide Pharmacological Category	:  	Lincomycin antibiotics, Vitamin B3 complex Therapeutic Indication	:  	Mild to moderate acne Dosage Forms	:  	Gel, Cream, Ointment
moreInfo: MORE INFORMATION Keep CLINMI SKIN GEL out of reach of children Store CLINMI SKIN GEL at a temperature below 25°C
faqs: FAQs ABOUT CLINMI SKIN GEL  What special precautions should I follow while using CLINMI SKIN GEL?  Before using CLINMI SKIN GEL inform your doctor if you have liver, kidney, lung or heart diseases. Avoid applying CLINMI SKIN GEL to a cut, scrapped, sunburnt or eczema affected skin. This medicine is not for oral, ophthalmic or intravaginal use.  What is CLINMI SKIN GEL used for?  CLINMI SKIN GEL is indicated for the treatment of mild to moderate acne in patients above 12 years of age. Do not use it for any other condition other than that prescribed by your doctor.  How should I use CLINMI SKIN GEL?  Always apply CLINMI SKIN GEL, as directed by your physician. It is for external use only. On the affected area, apply a thin layer of this medicine. Treated areas on the face need not be covered with a plaster or bandage. Do not apply this medicine on your face beyond 5 days. Avoid applying CLINMI SKIN GEL around your eyes, including eyelids.  Is CLINMI SKIN GEL safe to use in pregnant and breastfeeding women?  CLINMI SKIN GEL should be used with caution during pregnancy, women planning for pregnancy and in breastfeeding women. Consult your doctor before applying.  Can CLINMI SKIN GEL cause skin irritation or itchy skin?  CLINMI SKIN GEL may cause skin irritation or itchy skin. Avoid hot bath because hot water can irritate your skin further. Do not scratch the affected area. Use protective clothing when going outdoors. Regularly moisturize your skin and apply calamine lotion as a coolant. Discuss with your doctor if the symptom worsens.
