name: Clinmiface A Gel 15gm
about: INTRODUCTION  CLINMIFACE A contains a combination of Adapalene and Clindamycin, which belongs to the group of medicines called topical retinoids and lincomycin antibiotics. It is used in the treatment of skin acne (pimple). Acne is a condition of the skin when the root of your hair (hair follicle) or skin pores gets clogged by oil or dead skin, which becomes prone to bacterial infection and the formation of pimples, blackheads, spots and scars.  Adapalene is a form of vitamin A, that acts as an antiacne agent by binding directly to the receptor of the skin which increases the rate of cell turnover (cell regeneration) and decreases oil secretion preventing clogging of the hair follicles and pores, also decreasing swelling/inflammation. Clindamycin works by binding to the ribosomal unit of the bacteria and disrupts the production of the protein essential for its survival. Before recommending CLINMIFACE A, your doctor may advise you to have tests to understand your existing condition for planning effective treatment methods. Stay well hydrated and protect your skin from exposure to sunlight or UV light.  Do not apply CLINMIFACE A if you are allergic to adapalene or clindamycin, a disorder of the digestive system (colitis), a disorder of the immune system or have bruises, cuts or burns on the skin. The common side effects of using this medicine may include dry skin, burning, itching, redness or irritative sensation of the skin, scaling peeling of the skin etc.
uses: USES OF CLINMIFACE A To treat acne
working: HOW CLINMIFACE A WORKS  Adapalene, a form of vitamin A, works as an antiacne medicine by attaching directly to the skin's receptor, which increases cell turnover (cell regeneration) and decreases oil secretion preventing blockage of the hair follicles and pores. It also reduces swelling/inflammation of the skin. Clindamycin works by attaching to the bacteria's ribosomal unit and disrupting the production of a protein required for its very own survival.
directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Apply CLINMIFACE A as advised by your doctor. It is for external use on the skin only. Avoid applying CLINMIFACE A around or onto your eyes, including eyelids.
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF CLINMIFACE A COMMON Dryness of the skin Burning, itching, redness of the skin Scaling and or peeling of the skin UNCOMMON Flaring of acne Sunburns Local skin reaction  Stop using this medicine and contact your doctor immediately if you experience any of the following side effects:  Severe allergic reactions (such as skin rash, itching, swelling of the face, lips, tongue and other parts of the body, difficulty in breathing or wheezing, blisters on the skin, sore throat, fever, headache etc.)
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY  CLINMIFACE A is not recommended for use in pregnant women. Consult your doctor for advice if you are pregnant or suspect/planning pregnancy.  BREASTFEEDING  CLINMIFACE A is to be used with caution in breastfeeding mothers after consulting your doctor. The safe use of CLINMIFACE A in breastfeeding women and breastfed baby is not established.  DRIVING AND USING MACHINES  CLINMIFACE A may not interfere with your ability to drive or use the machine. However, protect your skin from sun or UV light while travelling and follow appropriate protective measures recommended by your doctor.  ALCOHOL  The risks associated with consuming alcohol are not known. It’s advised to avoid the consumption of alcohol while using CLINMIFACE A, as it could aggravate your existing condition.  ALLERGY  Talk to your doctor if you are allergic to Adapalene and/or Clindamycin.  OTHERS  CLINMIFACE A is not recommended for use if you:  Cuts or bruises on the skin Sunburns Skin conditions like eczema (itching, dry and red skin)  Use in pediatrics:  CLINMIFACE A is not recommended for use in children less than 12 years of age. Consult your doctor for advice.  Use in geriatrics:  CLINMIFACE A should be used with caution in the elderly (above 65 years of age) after consulting your doctor for advice.
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug-Drug interactions:  Inform your physician, if you are taking or using,  Medicated soap for skin, other cosmetic products with a high concentration of alcohol, astringents, sulfur,  Resorcinol – use for itching or irritation of the skin and scalp, loss of hair, dandruff etc. Salicylic acid – used for skin acne, dandruff, etc. Atracurium, cisatracurium, succinylcholine – used to relax muscles  B. Drug-Food interaction:  The interaction of foods with CLINMIFACE A is not known. Consult your doctor for diet advice.  Overdosage:  In case of using CLINMIFACE A in excess than recommended, you may experience dryness, scaling, redness and discomfort of the skin. Contact your doctor immediately for advice.
synopsis: SYNOPSIS Drug	:  	Adapalene, Clindamycin Pharmacological Category	:  	Topical retinoids and Antibiotics Therapeutic Indication	:  	Treat acne Dosage Forms	:  	Gel (topical), Gel, Cream, Ointment
moreInfo: MORE INFORMATION Keep out of reach from children Store at room temperature Keep away from sunlight
faqs: FAQs ABOUT CLINMIFACE A  Can CLINMIFACE A be used to treat scars on the skin?  Yes. Adapalene is a kind of vitamin A that reduces swelling and inflammation while also treating acne scars. Azithromycin is used to treat infections that cause skin infections to worsen.  Can CLINMIFACE A result in skin peeling?  Yes. Dryness of the skin, burning, itching, redness of the skin, skin irritation, scaling, and possibly peeling of the skin are all possible side effects of using this medicine.  Can [GBBNKEYWORD] cause skin dryness?  Yes. Your skin may get dry as a result of taking this medication. Maintain hydration and use the moisturiser that your doctor has prescribed.  How long can I use CLINMIFACE A?  Use CLINMIFACE A as advised by your doctor. Generally, it’s recommended for use depending on the severity of the existing skin condition.  Can I stop using CLINMIFACE A on my own?  No. It is not recommended to stop using CLINMIFACE A on your own as it may worsen the existing skin condition. Consult your doctor for advice.

name: CLINMISKIN Solution 30ml
about: INTRODUCTION  CLINMISKIN SOLUTION contains Clindamycin, which belongs to the group of medicines called Antibiotics. It is used in the treatment of acne vulgaris. Acne vulgaris is a common skin condition that occurs when hair follicles get blocked with oil and dead skin cells. Symptoms include whiteheads, blackheads, small red, tender bumps, pimples, and pus-filled lumps on the skin.  Before applying CLINMISKIN SOLUTION, inform your doctor if you have or ever had diarrhea, bloody diarrhea and pseudomembranous colitis. CLINMISKIN SOLUTION is not recommended for use if you have a history of regional enteritis (inflammation of the small intestine), ulcerative colitis (inflammation of the large intestine) or antibiotic-associated colitis.  CLINMISKIN SOLUTION should be used with caution during pregnancy or by breastfeeding women only if clearly needed. The safety and effectiveness of CLINMISKIN SOLUTION in children under the age of 12 has not been established. The most common side effects of applying CLINMISKIN SOLUTION are burning, itching, and redness of the skin. Consult your doctor if symptoms worsen.
uses: USES OF CLINMISKIN SOLUTION Treats acne vulgaris
working: HOW CLINMISKIN SOLUTION WORKS  CLINMISKIN SOLUTION acts against the bacteria by binding to the 50S subunit of the bacterial ribosome (site of protein synthesis), which in turn prevents protein synthesis and kills the infection-causing bacteria.
directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Apply CLINMISKIN SOLUTION as advised by your physician. It is for external use only. Wash your hands before use. Wash and dry the whole area, apply a thin film once daily to the skin where acne lesions appear and use enough to cover the entire affected area. In case of contact with the eyes, mouth or nostrils, rinse it off immediately and thoroughly with water. Your doctor will decide the correct dose and duration for you depending on your age, body weight and disease condition.
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF CLINMISKIN SOLUTION COMMON Burning, itching or abnormal redness of the skin at the application site Scaling, pain, dryness and skin irritation at the application site UNCOMMON Abdominal pain Diarrhea Oily skin RARE Antibiotic-associated colitis  Stop applying CLINMISKIN SOLUTION and contact your doctor immediately if you experience any of the following side effects:  Allergic symptoms (e.g., rashes, itchiness, difficulty in breathing or eye swelling) Severe or bloody diarrhea. (a sign of bowel inflammation, pseudomembranous colitis)
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY  The safety and effectiveness of CLINMISKIN SOLUTION in pregnant women or women planning to have a baby have not been established yet. It will be given to you by the doctor only if clearly needed. Consult your doctor before applying CLINMISKIN SOLUTION.  BREASTFEEDING  CLINMISKIN SOLUTION should be used with caution in breastfeeding women as it is not known if the medicine is excreted in human milk. Your doctor will decide whether to discontinue nursing or the medicine, considering the benefits to the mother and baby. If it is applied to the chest, care should be taken to avoid accidental ingestion by the infant. Consult your doctor before applying CLINMISKIN SOLUTION.  ALLERGY  Do not apply CLINMISKIN SOLUTION if you are allergic to Clindamycin or any other ingredients of this medicine.  OTHERS  CLINMISKIN SOLUTION is not recommended for use if you:  Have regional enteritis (inflammation of the small intestine) or ulcerative colitis (inflammation of the large intestine) Have a history of antibiotic-associated colitis  Before applying CLINMISKIN SOLUTION inform your doctor if you:  Diarrhea, bloody diarrhea Pseudomembranous colitis (inflammation of colon) Atopic individuals (more prone to allergies)  Use in pediatrics:  Safety and effectiveness of CLINMISKIN SOLUTION in children under the age of 12 have not been established. Consult your doctor before applying CLINMISKIN SOLUTION.
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug-Drug interactions:  Before applying CLINMISKIN SOLUTION, inform your doctor if you are taking any of the following medicine:  Neuromuscular blocking agents (Ex. rocuronium, vecuronium) Other anti-acne, topical agents  Overdosage:  If you or anyone else accidentally applied too much of CLINMISKIN SOLUTION, consult your doctor immediately or visit the nearby hospital.

It also reduces swelling/inflammation of the skin. Clindamycin works by attaching to the bacteria's ribosomal unit and disrupting the production of a protein required for its very own survival.
directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Apply CLINMISKIN AD GEL as advised by your doctor. It is for external use on the skin only. Avoid applying CLINMISKIN AD GEL around or onto your eyes, including eyelids.
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF CLINMISKIN AD GEL COMMON Dryness of the skin Burning, itching, redness of the skin Scaling and or peeling of the skin UNCOMMON Flaring of acne Sunburns Local skin reaction RARE  Stop using this medicine and contact your doctor immediately if you experience any of the following side effects:  Severe allergic reactions (such as skin rash, itching, swelling of the face, lips, tongue and other parts of the body, difficulty in breathing or wheezing, blisters on the skin, sore throat, fever, headache etc.)
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY CONTRAINDICATED  CLINMISKIN AD GEL is not recommended for use in pregnant women. Consult your doctor for advice if you are pregnant or suspect/planning pregnancy.  BREASTFEEDING CONSULT YOUR DOCTOR  CLINMISKIN AD GEL is to be used with caution in breastfeeding mothers after consulting your doctor. The safe use of CLINMISKIN AD GEL in breastfeeding women and breastfed baby is not established.  DRIVING AND USING MACHINES USE WITH CAUTION  CLINMISKIN AD GEL may not interfere with your ability to drive or use the machine. However, protect your skin from sun or UV light while travelling and follow appropriate protective measures recommended by your doctor.  ALCOHOL CONSULT YOUR DOCTOR  The risks associated with consuming alcohol are not known. It’s advised to avoid the consumption of alcohol while using CLINMISKIN AD GEL, as it could aggravate your existing condition.  ALLERGY CONTRAINDICATED  Talk to your doctor if you are allergic to Adapalene and/or Clindamycin.  OTHERS  CLINMISKIN AD GEL is not recommended for use if you:  Cuts or bruises on the skin Sunburns Skin conditions like eczema (itching, dry and red skin)  Use in pediatrics:  CLINMISKIN AD GEL is not recommended for use in children less than 12 years of age. Consult your doctor for advice.  Use in geriatrics:  CLINMISKIN AD GEL should be used with caution in the elderly (above 65 years of age) after consulting your doctor for advice.
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug-Drug interactions:  Inform your physician, if you are taking or using,  Medicated soap for skin, other cosmetic products with a high concentration of alcohol, astringents, sulfur,  Resorcinol – use for itching or irritation of the skin and scalp, loss of hair, dandruff etc. Salicylic acid – used for skin acne, dandruff, etc. Atracurium, cisatracurium, succinylcholine – used to relax muscles  B. Drug-Food interaction:  The interaction of foods with CLINMISKIN AD GEL is not known. Consult your doctor for diet advice.  Overdosage:  In case of using CLINMISKIN AD GEL in excess, than recommended, you may experience dryness, scaling, redness and discomfort of the skin. Contact your doctor immediately for advice.
synopsis: SYNOPSIS Drug	:  	Adapalene, Clindamycin Pharmacological Category	:  	Topical Retinoids, Antibiotics Therapeutic Indication	:  	Treat acne        Dosage Forms	:  	Gel (topical), Gel, Cream, Ointment
moreInfo: MORE INFORMATION Keep out of reach from children Store at room temperature. Keep away from sunlight
faqs: FAQs ABOUT CLINMISKIN AD GEL  Q: Can CLINMISKIN AD GEL be used to treat scars on the skin?  A: Yes. Adapalene is a kind of vitamin A that reduces swelling and inflammation while also treating acne scars. Azithromycin is used to treat infections that cause skin infections to worsen.  Q: Can CLINMISKIN AD GEL result in skin peeling?  A: Yes. Dryness of the skin, burning, itching, redness of the skin, skin irritation, scaling, and possibly peeling of the skin are all possible side effects of using this medicine.  Q: Can [GBBNKEYWORD] cause skin dryness?  A: Yes. Your skin may get dry as a result of taking this medication. Maintain hydration and use the moisturiser that your doctor has prescribed.  Q: How long can I use CLINMISKIN AD GEL?  A: Use CLINMISKIN AD GEL as advised by your doctor. Generally, it’s recommended for use depending on the severity of the existing skin condition.  Q: Can I stop using CLINMISKIN AD GEL on my own?  A: No. It is not recommended to stop using CLINMISKIN AD GEL on your own as it may worsen the existing skin condition. Consult your doctor for advice.

name: CLINOBIT Solution 30ml
about: INTRODUCTION  CLINOBIT SOLUTION contains Clindamycin, which belongs to the group of medicines called Antibiotics. It is used in the treatment of acne vulgaris. Acne vulgaris is a common skin condition that occurs when hair follicles get blocked with oil and dead skin cells. Symptoms include whiteheads, blackheads, small red, tender bumps, pimples, and pus-filled lumps on the skin.  Before applying CLINOBIT SOLUTION, inform your doctor if you have or ever had diarrhea, bloody diarrhea and pseudomembranous colitis. CLINOBIT SOLUTION is not recommended for use if you have a history of regional enteritis (inflammation of the small intestine), ulcerative colitis (inflammation of the large intestine) or antibiotic-associated colitis.  CLINOBIT SOLUTION should be used with caution during pregnancy or by breastfeeding women only if clearly needed. The safety and effectiveness of CLINOBIT SOLUTION in children under the age of 12 has not been established. The most common side effects of applying CLINOBIT SOLUTION are burning, itching, and redness of the skin. Consult your doctor if symptoms worsen.
uses: USES OF CLINOBIT SOLUTION Treats acne vulgaris
working: HOW CLINOBIT SOLUTION WORKS  CLINOBIT SOLUTION acts against the bacteria by binding to the 50S subunit of the bacterial ribosome (site of protein synthesis), which in turn prevents protein synthesis and kills the infection-causing bacteria.
directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Apply CLINOBIT SOLUTION as advised by your physician. It is for external use only. Wash your hands before use. Wash and dry the whole area, apply a thin film once daily to the skin where acne lesions appear and use enough to cover the entire affected area. In case of contact with the eyes, mouth or nostrils, rinse it off immediately and thoroughly with water. Your doctor will decide the correct dose and duration for you depending on your age, body weight and disease condition.
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF CLINOBIT SOLUTION COMMON Burning, itching or abnormal redness of the skin at the application site Scaling, pain, dryness and skin irritation at the application site UNCOMMON Abdominal pain Diarrhea Oily skin RARE Antibiotic-associated colitis  Stop applying CLINOBIT SOLUTION and contact your doctor immediately if you experience any of the following side effects:  Allergic symptoms (e.g., rashes, itchiness, difficulty in breathing or eye swelling) Severe or bloody diarrhea. (a sign of bowel inflammation, pseudomembranous colitis)
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY  The safety and effectiveness of CLINOBIT SOLUTION in pregnant women or women planning to have a baby have not been established yet. It will be given to you by the doctor only if clearly needed. Consult your doctor before applying CLINOBIT SOLUTION.  BREASTFEEDING  CLINOBIT SOLUTION should be used with caution in breastfeeding women as it is not known if the medicine is excreted in human milk. Your doctor will decide whether to discontinue nursing or the medicine, considering the benefits to the mother and baby. If it is applied to the chest, care should be taken to avoid accidental ingestion by the infant. Consult your doctor before applying CLINOBIT SOLUTION.  ALLERGY  Do not apply CLINOBIT SOLUTION if you are allergic to Clindamycin or any other ingredients of this medicine.  OTHERS  CLINOBIT SOLUTION is not recommended for use if you:  Have regional enteritis (inflammation of the small intestine) or ulcerative colitis (inflammation of the large intestine) Have a history of antibiotic-associated colitis  Before applying CLINOBIT SOLUTION inform your doctor if you:  Diarrhea, bloody diarrhea Pseudomembranous colitis (inflammation of colon) Atopic individuals (more prone to allergies)  Use in pediatrics:  Safety and effectiveness of CLINOBIT SOLUTION in children under the age of 12 have not been established. Consult your doctor before applying CLINOBIT SOLUTION.
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug-Drug interactions:  Before applying CLINOBIT SOLUTION, inform your doctor if you are taking any of the following medicine:  Neuromuscular blocking agents (Ex. rocuronium, vecuronium) Other anti-acne, topical agents  Overdosage:  If you or anyone else accidentally applied too much of CLINOBIT SOLUTION, consult your doctor immediately or visit the nearby hospital.
synopsis: SYNOPSIS Drug	:  	  Clindamycin   Pharmacological Category	:  	  Lincosamides   Therapeutic Indication	:  	  Acne vulgaris   Dosage Forms	:  	  Injection, Tablet, Capsule, Gel, Cream, Lotion, Solution, Spray, Soap

In case of contact with the eyes, mouth or nostrils, rinse it off immediately with plenty of water.  How does CLINOBIT SOLUTION work? If it is applied to the chest, care should be taken to avoid accidental ingestion by the infant. Consult your doctor before applying CLINOBIT SOLUTION.

name: Clinsol Gel 15gm
about: INTRODUCTION  CLINSOL GEL is a combination of Clindamycin and Nicotinamide which belongs to a group of medicines called Lincomycin antibiotics and Vitamin B3 complex, respectively. CLINSOL GEL is used to treat mild to moderate acne which is a skin condition that occurs when hair follicles become plugged with oil and dead skin cells which may occur due to variety of causes such as genetics, fluctuating hormone levels, stress, high humidity or using oily or greasy personal care products which may affect people of all ages.  It is characterized by symptoms such as open or closed plugged pores, small red & tender bumps, pimples, large, solid or painful lumps under the skin and painful & pus-filled lumps under the skin.  Before using CLINSOL GEL inform your doctor if you have liver, kidney, lung or heart diseases. Avoid applying CLINSOL GEL to a cut, scrapped, sunburnt or eczema affected skin.  CLINSOL GEL should be used with caution in pregnant and in breastfeeding women. CLINSOL GEL is not recommended for use in children and adolescents (below 12 years). Consult your doctor before applying.  The most common side effects of using CLINSOL GEL are skin inflammation, contact dermatitis (red, itchy rash), inflammation of hair follicles, itchy skin, dry skin and peeling of skin. Consult your doctor if any of these symptoms worsen.
uses: USES OF CLINSOL GEL Treats mild to moderate acne
working: HOW CLINSOL GEL WORKS  CLINSOL GEL helps to treat acne, where Clindamycin reduces free fatty acid concentrations on the skin and suppresses the growth of Propionibacterium acnes (Corynebacterium acnes), a bacteria found in sebaceous glands and follicles and Nicotinamide exerts anti-inflammatory effect in acne and interrupts sebum production.
directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Apply CLINSOL GEL as advised by your physician. It is for external use only. Before applying the medicine normally wash and dry the affected area and apply a thin layer of this medicine on the affected area. Treated areas on the face need not be covered with a plaster or bandage. Do not apply this medicine beyond the recommended duration. Avoid applying CLINSOL GEL around your eyes, including eyelids. Rinse it off with water if you accidentally get it in these areas.
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF CLINSOL GEL COMMON Contact dermatitis (red, itchy rash) Inflammation of hair follicles Itchy skin Dry skin Peeling of skin
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY  CLINSOL GEL should be used with caution in pregnant women. Consult your doctor before applying.  BREASTFEEDING  CLINSOL GEL should be used with caution in breastfeeding women. Consult your doctor before applying.  ALLERGY  CLINSOL GEL is not recommended for use if you are allergic to Clindamycin, Nicotinamide or any other ingredients of this medicine.  OTHERS  CLINSOL GEL is not recommended for use if you have:  Eczema (skin inflammation) Cut, scrapped, sunburnt skin  Use in Pediatrics:  CLINSOL GEL is not recommended for use in children and adolescents (below 12 years). Consult your doctor before using it for your child.  Use in Geriatrics:  There is no information on the use of CLINSOL GEL in elderly patients. Consult with your doctor before using.
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug - Drug interactions:  Before using CLINSOL GEL, inform your doctor if you are taking any of the following medicines:  Acepromazine (used a sedative/tranquilizer) Acetaminophen (used to treat pain and inflammation)  Overdosage:  If you or anyone else accidentally ingests or applies too much of CLINSOL GEL, consult your doctor immediately or visit the nearby hospital.
synopsis: SYNOPSIS Drug	:  	Clindamycin, Nicotinamide Pharmacological Category	:  	Lincomycin antibiotics, Vitamin B3 complex Therapeutic Indication	:  	Mild to moderate acne Dosage Forms	:  	Gel, Cream, Ointment
moreInfo: MORE INFORMATION Keep CLINSOL GEL out of reach of children Store CLINSOL GEL at a temperature below 25°C
faqs: FAQs ABOUT CLINSOL GEL  What special precautions should I follow while using CLINSOL GEL?  Before using CLINSOL GEL inform your doctor if you have liver, kidney, lung or heart diseases. Avoid applying CLINSOL GEL to a cut, scrapped, sunburnt or eczema affected skin. This medicine is not for oral, ophthalmic or intravaginal use.  What is CLINSOL GEL used for?  CLINSOL GEL is indicated for the treatment of mild to moderate acne in patients above 12 years of age. Do not use it for any other condition other than that prescribed by your doctor.  How should I use CLINSOL GEL?  Always apply CLINSOL GEL, as directed by your physician. It is for external use only. On the affected area, apply a thin layer of this medicine. Treated areas on the face need not be covered with a plaster or bandage. Do not apply this medicine on your face beyond 5 days. Avoid applying CLINSOL GEL around your eyes, including eyelids.  Is CLINSOL GEL safe to use in pregnant and breastfeeding women?  CLINSOL GEL should be used with caution during pregnancy, women planning for pregnancy and in breastfeeding women. Consult your doctor before applying.  Can CLINSOL GEL cause skin irritation or itchy skin?  CLINSOL GEL may cause skin irritation or itchy skin. Avoid hot bath because hot water can irritate your skin further. Do not scratch the affected area. Use protective clothing when going outdoors. Regularly moisturize your skin and apply calamine lotion as a coolant. Discuss with your doctor if the symptom worsens.

name: Clinxa Gel 20gm
about: INTRODUCTION  CLINXA GEL contains Clindamycin, which belongs to the group of medicines called Antibiotics. It is used in the treatment of acne vulgaris. Acne vulgaris is a common skin condition that occurs when hair follicles get blocked with oil and dead skin cells. Symptoms include whiteheads, blackheads, small red, tender bumps, pimples, and pus-filled lumps on the skin.  Before applying CLINXA GEL, inform your doctor if you have or ever had diarrhea, bloody diarrhea and pseudomembranous colitis. CLINXA GEL is not recommended for use if you have a history of regional enteritis (inflammation of the small intestine), ulcerative colitis (inflammation of the large intestine) or antibiotic-associated colitis.  CLINXA GEL should be used with caution during pregnancy or by breastfeeding women only if clearly needed. The safety and effectiveness of CLINXA GEL in children under the age of 12 has not been established. The most common side effects of applying CLINXA GEL are burning, itching, and redness of the skin. Consult your doctor if symptoms worsen.
uses: USES OF CLINXA GEL Treats acne vulgaris
working: HOW CLINXA GEL WORKS  CLINXA GEL acts against the bacteria by binding to the 50S subunit of the bacterial ribosome (site of protein synthesis), which in turn prevents protein synthesis and kills the infection-causing bacteria.
directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Apply CLINXA GEL as advised by your physician. It is for external use only. Wash your hands before use. Wash and dry the whole area, apply a thin film once daily to the skin where acne lesions appear and use enough to cover the entire affected area. In case of contact with the eyes, mouth or nostrils, rinse it off immediately and thoroughly with water. Your doctor will decide the correct dose and duration for you depending on your age, body weight and disease condition.
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF CLINXA GEL COMMON Burning, itching or abnormal redness of the skin at the application site Scaling, pain, dryness and skin irritation at the application site UNCOMMON Abdominal pain Diarrhea Oily skin RARE Antibiotic-associated colitis  Stop applying CLINXA GEL and contact your doctor immediately if you experience any of the following side effects:  Allergic symptoms (e.g., rashes, itchiness, difficulty in breathing or eye swelling) Severe or bloody diarrhea. (a sign of bowel inflammation, pseudomembranous colitis)
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY  The safety and effectiveness of CLINXA GEL in pregnant women or women planning to have a baby have not been established yet. It will be given to you by the doctor only if clearly needed. Consult your doctor before applying CLINXA GEL.  BREASTFEEDING  CLINXA GEL should be used with caution in breastfeeding women as it is not known if the medicine is excreted in human milk. Your doctor will decide whether to discontinue nursing or the medicine, considering the benefits to the mother and baby. If it is applied to the chest, care should be taken to avoid accidental ingestion by the infant. Consult your doctor before applying CLINXA GEL.  ALLERGY  Do not apply CLINXA GEL if you are allergic to Clindamycin or any other ingredients of this medicine.  OTHERS  CLINXA GEL is not recommended for use if you:  Have regional enteritis (inflammation of the small intestine) or ulcerative colitis (inflammation of the large intestine) Have a history of antibiotic-associated colitis  Before applying CLINXA GEL inform your doctor if you:  Diarrhea, bloody diarrhea Pseudomembranous colitis (inflammation of colon) Atopic individuals (more prone to allergies)  Use in pediatrics:  Safety and effectiveness of CLINXA GEL in children under the age of 12 have not been established. Consult your doctor before applying CLINXA GEL.
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug-Drug interactions:  Before applying CLINXA GEL, inform your doctor if you are taking any of the following medicine:  Neuromuscular blocking agents (Ex. rocuronium, vecuronium) Other anti-acne, topical agents  Overdosage:  If you or anyone else accidentally applied too much of CLINXA GEL, consult your doctor immediately or visit the nearby hospital.
synopsis: SYNOPSIS Drug	:  	  Clindamycin   Pharmacological Category	:  	  Lincosamides   Therapeutic Indication	:  	  Acne vulgaris   Dosage Forms	:  	  Injection, Tablet, Capsule, Gel, Cream, Lotion, Solution, Spray, Soap

Symptoms include whiteheads, blackheads, small red, tender bumps, pimples, and pus-filled lumps on the skin.  How to use CLINXA GEL?  Apply CLINXA GEL as advised by your physician. It is for external use only. Wash your hands before use. Wash and dry the whole area, apply a thin film once daily to the skin where acne lesions appear and use enough to cover the entire affected area. CLINXA GEL should be used with caution in breastfeeding women as it is not known if the medicine is excreted in human milk. name: Clinxa A Gel 20gm
about: INTRODUCTION  CLINXA A GEL contains a combination of Adapalene and Clindamycin, which belongs to the group of medicines called topical retinoids and lincomycin antibiotics. It is used in the treatment of skin acne (pimple). Acne is a condition of the skin when the root of your hair (hair follicle) or skin pores gets clogged by oil or dead skin, which becomes prone to bacterial infection and the formation of pimples, blackheads, spots and scars.  Adapalene is a form of vitamin A, that acts as an antiacne agent by binding directly to the receptor of the skin which increases the rate of cell turnover (cell regeneration) and decreases oil secretion preventing clogging of the hair follicles and pores, also decreasing swelling/inflammation. Clindamycin works by binding to the ribosomal unit of the bacteria and disrupts the production of the protein essential for its survival. Before recommending CLINXA A GEL, your doctor may advise you to have tests to understand your existing condition for planning effective treatment methods. Stay well hydrated and protect your skin from exposure to sunlight or UV light.  Do not apply CLINXA A GEL if you are allergic to adapalene or clindamycin, a disorder of the digestive system (colitis), a disorder of the immune system or have bruises, cuts or burns on the skin. The common side effects of using this medicine may include dry skin, burning, itching, redness or irritative sensation of the skin, scaling peeling of the skin etc.
uses: USES OF CLINXA A GEL To treat acne
working: HOW CLINXA A GEL WORKS  Adapalene, a form of vitamin A, works as an antiacne medicine by attaching directly to the skin's receptor, which increases cell turnover (cell regeneration) and decreases oil secretion preventing blockage of the hair follicles and pores. It also reduces swelling/inflammation of the skin. Clindamycin works by attaching to the bacteria's ribosomal unit and disrupting the production of a protein required for its very own survival.
directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Apply CLINXA A GEL as advised by your doctor. It is for external use on the skin only. Avoid applying CLINXA A GEL around or onto your eyes, including eyelids.
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF CLINXA A GEL COMMON Dryness of the skin Burning, itching, redness of the skin Scaling and or peeling of the skin UNCOMMON Flaring of acne Sunburns Local skin reaction  Stop using this medicine and contact your doctor immediately if you experience any of the following side effects:  Severe allergic reactions (such as skin rash, itching, swelling of the face, lips, tongue and other parts of the body, difficulty in breathing or wheezing, blisters on the skin, sore throat, fever, headache etc.)
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY  CLINXA A GEL is not recommended for use in pregnant women. Consult your doctor for advice if you are pregnant or suspect/planning pregnancy.  BREASTFEEDING  CLINXA A GEL is to be used with caution in breastfeeding mothers after consulting your doctor. The safe use of CLINXA A GEL in breastfeeding women and breastfed baby is not established.  DRIVING AND USING MACHINES  CLINXA A GEL may not interfere with your ability to drive or use the machine. However, protect your skin from sun or UV light while travelling and follow appropriate protective measures recommended by your doctor.  ALCOHOL  The risks associated with consuming alcohol are not known. It’s advised to avoid the consumption of alcohol while using CLINXA A GEL, as it could aggravate your existing condition.  ALLERGY  Talk to your doctor if you are allergic to Adapalene and/or Clindamycin.  OTHERS  CLINXA A GEL is not recommended for use if you:  Cuts or bruises on the skin Sunburns Skin conditions like eczema (itching, dry and red skin)  Use in pediatrics:  CLINXA A GEL is not recommended for use in children less than 12 years of age. Consult your doctor for advice.  Use in geriatrics:  CLINXA A GEL should be used with caution in the elderly (above 65 years of age) after consulting your doctor for advice.
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug-Drug interactions:  Inform your physician, if you are taking or using,  Medicated soap for skin, other cosmetic products with a high concentration of alcohol, astringents, sulfur,  Resorcinol – use for itching or irritation of the skin and scalp, loss of hair, dandruff etc. Salicylic acid – used for skin acne, dandruff, etc. Atracurium, cisatracurium, succinylcholine – used to relax muscles  B. Drug-Food interaction:  The interaction of foods with CLINXA A GEL is not known. Consult your doctor for diet advice.  Overdosage:  In case of using CLINXA A GEL in excess than recommended, you may experience dryness, scaling, redness and discomfort of the skin. Contact your doctor immediately for advice.
synopsis: SYNOPSIS Drug	:  	Adapalene, Clindamycin Pharmacological Category	:  	Topical retinoids and Antibiotics Therapeutic Indication	:  	Treat acne Dosage Forms	:  	Gel (topical), Gel, Cream, Ointment
moreInfo: MORE INFORMATION Keep out of reach from children Store at room temperature Keep away from sunlight
faqs: FAQs ABOUT CLINXA A GEL  Can CLINXA A GEL be used to treat scars on the skin?  Yes. Adapalene is a kind of vitamin A that reduces swelling and inflammation while also treating acne scars. Azithromycin is used to treat infections that cause skin infections to worsen.  Can CLINXA A GEL result in skin peeling?  Yes. Dryness of the skin, burning, itching, redness of the skin, skin irritation, scaling, and possibly peeling of the skin are all possible side effects of using this medicine.  Can [GBBNKEYWORD] cause skin dryness?  Yes. Your skin may get dry as a result of taking this medication. Maintain hydration and use the moisturiser that your doctor has prescribed.  How long can I use CLINXA A GEL?  Use CLINXA A GEL as advised by your doctor. Generally, it’s recommended for use depending on the severity of the existing skin condition.  Can I stop using CLINXA A GEL on my own?  No. It is not recommended to stop using CLINXA A GEL on your own as it may worsen the existing skin condition. Consult your doctor for advice.

name: CLITINA Gel 15gm
about: INTRODUCTION  CLITINA GEL is a combination of Clindamycin and Nicotinamide which belongs to a group of medicines called Lincomycin antibiotics and Vitamin B3 complex, respectively. CLITINA GEL is used to treat mild to moderate acne which is a skin condition that occurs when hair follicles become plugged with oil and dead skin cells which may occur due to variety of causes such as genetics, fluctuating hormone levels, stress, high humidity or using oily or greasy personal care products which may affect people of all ages.  It is characterized by symptoms such as open or closed plugged pores, small red & tender bumps, pimples, large, solid or painful lumps under the skin and painful & pus-filled lumps under the skin.  Before using CLITINA GEL inform your doctor if you have liver, kidney, lung or heart diseases. Avoid applying CLITINA GEL to a cut, scrapped, sunburnt or eczema affected skin.  CLITINA GEL should be used with caution in pregnant and in breastfeeding women. CLITINA GEL is not recommended for use in children and adolescents (below 12 years). Consult your doctor before applying.  The most common side effects of using CLITINA GEL are skin inflammation, contact dermatitis (red, itchy rash), inflammation of hair follicles, itchy skin, dry skin and peeling of skin. Consult your doctor if any of these symptoms worsen.
uses: USES OF CLITINA GEL Treats mild to moderate acne
working: HOW CLITINA GEL WORKS  CLITINA GEL helps to treat acne, where Clindamycin reduces free fatty acid concentrations on the skin and suppresses the growth of Propionibacterium acnes (Corynebacterium acnes), a bacteria found in sebaceous glands and follicles and Nicotinamide exerts anti-inflammatory effect in acne and interrupts sebum production.
directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Apply CLITINA GEL as advised by your physician. It is for external use only. Before applying the medicine normally wash and dry the affected area and apply a thin layer of this medicine on the affected area. Treated areas on the face need not be covered with a plaster or bandage. Do not apply this medicine beyond the recommended duration. Avoid applying CLITINA GEL around your eyes, including eyelids. Rinse it off with water if you accidentally get it in these areas.
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF CLITINA GEL COMMON Contact dermatitis (red, itchy rash) Inflammation of hair follicles Itchy skin Dry skin Peeling of skin
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY  CLITINA GEL should be used with caution in pregnant women. Consult your doctor before applying.  BREASTFEEDING  CLITINA GEL should be used with caution in breastfeeding women. Consult your doctor before applying.  ALLERGY  CLITINA GEL is not recommended for use if you are allergic to Clindamycin, Nicotinamide or any other ingredients of this medicine.  OTHERS  CLITINA GEL is not recommended for use if you have:  Eczema (skin inflammation) Cut, scrapped, sunburnt skin  Use in Pediatrics:  CLITINA GEL is not recommended for use in children and adolescents (below 12 years). Consult your doctor before using it for your child.  Use in Geriatrics:  There is no information on the use of CLITINA GEL in elderly patients. Consult with your doctor before using.
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug - Drug interactions:  Before using CLITINA GEL, inform your doctor if you are taking any of the following medicines:  Acepromazine (used a sedative/tranquilizer) Acetaminophen (used to treat pain and inflammation)  Overdosage:  If you or anyone else accidentally ingests or applies too much of CLITINA GEL, consult your doctor immediately or visit the nearby hospital.
synopsis: SYNOPSIS Drug	:  	Clindamycin, Nicotinamide Pharmacological Category	:  	Lincomycin antibiotics, Vitamin B3 complex Therapeutic Indication	:  	Mild to moderate acne Dosage Forms	:  	Gel, Cream, Ointment
moreInfo: MORE INFORMATION Keep CLITINA GEL out of reach of children Store CLITINA GEL at a temperature below 25°C
faqs: FAQs ABOUT CLITINA GEL  What special precautions should I follow while using CLITINA GEL?  Before using CLITINA GEL inform your doctor if you have liver, kidney, lung or heart diseases. Avoid applying CLITINA GEL to a cut, scrapped, sunburnt or eczema affected skin. This medicine is not for oral, ophthalmic or intravaginal use.  What is CLITINA GEL used for?  CLITINA GEL is indicated for the treatment of mild to moderate acne in patients above 12 years of age. Do not use it for any other condition other than that prescribed by your doctor.  How should I use CLITINA GEL?  Always apply CLITINA GEL, as directed by your physician. It is for external use only. On the affected area, apply a thin layer of this medicine. Treated areas on the face need not be covered with a plaster or bandage. Do not apply this medicine on your face beyond 5 days. Avoid applying CLITINA GEL around your eyes, including eyelids.  Is CLITINA GEL safe to use in pregnant and breastfeeding women?  CLITINA GEL should be used with caution during pregnancy, women planning for pregnancy and in breastfeeding women. Consult your doctor before applying.  Can CLITINA GEL cause skin irritation or itchy skin?  CLITINA GEL may cause skin irritation or itchy skin. Avoid hot bath because hot water can irritate your skin further. Do not scratch the affected area. Use protective clothing when going outdoors. Regularly moisturize your skin and apply calamine lotion as a coolant. Discuss with your doctor if the symptom worsens.

name: COSMELITE Cream 25gm
about: INTRODUCTION  COSMELITE CREAM is a combination of Hydroquinone, Tretinoin, Mometasone furoate which belongs to the group of medicines called Depigmenting agents, Retinoids and Corticosteroids respectively. It is used in adults for the treatment of moderate to severe melasma (dark spots on the skin) in association with sun-avoidance measures, like using sunscreens and wearing protective clothing.  Melasma is one of the most frequently acquired hyperpigmentation (excess melanin production) disorders with symptoms such as symmetrical brown patches on sun exposed areas mainly on face.  It is advised to avoid exposure to sun during treatment with COSMELITE CREAM for better results. While going out apply sunscreens and wear full covering protective clothes.  Before using COSMELITE CREAM inform your doctor if you have any liver, kidney, lung or heart diseases.  Safety and efficacy of COSMELITE CREAM is not established in pregnant women and in children below 12 years of age. Ask for your doctor’s advice before using. COSMELITE CREAM should be used with caution in breastfeeding women.  The most common side effects of using COSMELITE CREAM are mild burning, stinging, redness and dryness. Consult your doctor if any of the symptoms worsen or doesn’t improve.
uses: USES OF COSMELITE CREAM  It is used in adults to  Treats moderate to severe melasma (dark spots on the skin)
working: HOW COSMELITE CREAM WORKS  COSMELITE CREAM helps in treating melasma where Hydroquinone is a skin bleaching agent that blocks enzyme tyrosinase which is responsible for the production of melanin that cause pigmentation. Thus, it helps for fading of dark spots in skin. Tretinoin helps to recover the damage to the skin caused by sun exposure (photodamage) by thickening skin layer and loss of keratinized cells.it helps to rejuvenate the skin. Mometasone furoate blocks prostaglandin synthesis and reduces redness, swelling and itching caused by tretinoin and other skin infections.
directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Apply COSMELITE CREAM as advised by your physician. It is for external use only. Wash your hands before and after applying COSMELITE CREAM. Wash your face with a mild soap and dry properly. Apply COSMELITE CREAM at night and gently massage it in until it is absorbed. Avoid contact with your eyes, nose, mouth, mucous membrane. Avoid exposure to sunlight while using this medicine. Your doctor will decide the correct dose and duration for you depending upon your age, body weight and disease condition.
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF COSMELITE CREAM COMMON Mild burning Stinging Redness Dryness RARE  Stop using COSMELITE CREAM and consult your doctor immediately if you experience any of the following:  Infraorbital and paranasal fissures
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY  The safety and efficacy of COSMELITE CREAM is not being established in pregnant women. Consult with your doctor before using.  BREASTFEEDING  COSMELITE CREAM should be used with caution in breast feeding women. Consult with your doctor before using.  ALLERGY  Do not use COSMELITE CREAM if you are allergic to Hydroquinone, Tretinoin, Mometasone or any other constituents of this medicine. Consult your doctor before using.  OTHERS  Use in paediatrics:  The safety and efficacy of COSMELITE CREAM is not being established in children below 12 years of age. Consult with your child’s doctor before using it for your child.  Use in geriatrics:  There is no information on the use of COSMELITE CREAM in elderly patients. Consult your doctor before using COSMELITE CREAM.
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug – drug interactions:  Before using COSMELITE CREAM, inform your doctor if you are taking, have taken or might take any other medicine, including prescription, non-prescription or any herbal medicine.  Overdosage:  If you or anyone else accidentally ingests or apply too much of COSMELITE CREAM, consult your doctor immediately.
synopsis: SYNOPSIS Drug	:  	Hydroquinone, Tretinoin, Mometasone Pharmacological Category	:  	Hypopigmenting agents, Retinoids, Corticosteroids Therapeutic Indication	:  	Melasma Dosage Forms	:  	Cream, Gel, Ointment, Soap
moreInfo: MORE INFORMATION Keep COSMELITE CREAM out of reach of children Store COSMELITE CREAM at room temperature not exceeding 25°C
faqs: FAQs ABOUT COSMELITE CREAM  What is COSMELITE CREAM used for?  COSMELITE CREAM is used in adults for the treatment of moderate to severe melasma (dark spots on the skin) in association with sun-avoidance measures, like using sunscreens and wearing protective clothing. Consult doctor before using.  How to use COSMELITE CREAM?  Apply COSMELITE CREAM as advised by your physician. It is for external use only. Wash your hands before and after applying COSMELITE CREAM. Wash your face with a mild soap and dry properly and gently massage the medicine until it is absorbed. Avoid contact with your eyes, nose, mouth, mucous membrane. Your doctor will decide the correct dose and duration for you depending upon your age, body weight and disease condition.  Can I use COSMELITE CREAM to treat wounds?  COSMELITE CREAM is not recommended to use on wounds and  ulcerated skin . Consult doctor before using COSMELITE CREAM.  Do I need to take any precaution while using COSMELITE CREAM?  It is advised to reduce exposure to sun during treatment with COSMELITE CREAM for better results. While going out apply sunscreens and wear full covering protective clothes. Exposure to sunlight or ultra-violet light will cause repigmentation of lightened skin. Do not apply COSMELITE CREAM to broken skin.  What is the best time to use COSMELITE CREAM?  It is advised to use COSMELITE CREAM before bedtime. This will reduce the chances of exposure of the treated skin to sun. However, ask for your doctor’s advice before using.

name: CLEARZIT A Gel 15gm
about: INTRODUCTION  CLEARZIT A GEL contains a combination of Adapalene and Clindamycin, which belongs to the group of medicines called topical retinoids and lincomycin antibiotics. It is used in the treatment of skin acne (pimple). Acne is a condition of the skin when the root of your hair (hair follicle) or skin pores gets clogged by oil or dead skin, which becomes prone to bacterial infection and the formation of pimples, blackheads, spots and scars.  Adapalene is a form of vitamin A, that acts as an antiacne agent by binding directly to the receptor of the skin which increases the rate of cell turnover (cell regeneration) and decreases oil secretion preventing clogging of the hair follicles and pores, also decreasing swelling/inflammation. Clindamycin works by binding to the ribosomal unit of the bacteria and disrupts the production of the protein essential for its survival. Before recommending CLEARZIT A GEL, your doctor may advise you to have tests to understand your existing condition for planning effective treatment methods. Stay well hydrated and protect your skin from exposure to sunlight or UV light.  Do not apply CLEARZIT A GEL if you are allergic to adapalene or clindamycin, a disorder of the digestive system (colitis), a disorder of the immune system or have bruises, cuts or burns on the skin. The common side effects of using this medicine may include dry skin, burning, itching, redness or irritative sensation of the skin, scaling peeling of the skin etc.Consult your doctor if any of these side effect worsens.
uses: USES OF CLEARZIT A GEL To treat acne
working: HOW CLEARZIT A GEL WORKS  Adapalene, a form of vitamin A, works as an antiacne medicine by attaching directly to the skin's receptor, which increases cell turnover (cell regeneration) and decreases oil secretion preventing blockage of the hair follicles and pores. It also reduces swelling/inflammation of the skin. Clindamycin works by attaching to the bacteria's ribosomal unit and disrupting the production of a protein required for its very own survival.
directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Apply CLEARZIT A GEL as advised by your doctor. It is for external use on the skin only. Avoid applying CLEARZIT A GEL around or onto your eyes, including eyelids.
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF CLEARZIT A GEL COMMON Dryness of the skin Burning, itching, redness of the skin Scaling and or peeling of the skin UNCOMMON Flaring of acne Sunburns Local skin reaction RARE  Stop using this medicine and contact your doctor immediately if you experience any of the following side effects:  Severe allergic reactions (such as skin rash, itching, swelling of the face, lips, tongue and other parts of the body, difficulty in breathing or wheezing, blisters on the skin, sore throat, fever, headache etc.)
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY CONTRAINDICATED  CLEARZIT A GEL is not recommended for use in pregnant women. Consult your doctor for advice if you are pregnant or suspect/planning pregnancy.  BREASTFEEDING CONSULT YOUR DOCTOR  CLEARZIT A GEL is to be used with caution in breastfeeding mothers after consulting your doctor. The safe use of CLEARZIT A GEL in breastfeeding women and breastfed baby is not established.  DRIVING AND USING MACHINES USE WITH CAUTION  CLEARZIT A GEL may not interfere with your ability to drive or use the machine. However, protect your skin from sun or UV light while travelling and follow appropriate protective measures recommended by your doctor.  ALCOHOL CONSULT YOUR DOCTOR  The risks associated with consuming alcohol are not known. It’s advised to avoid the consumption of alcohol while using CLEARZIT A GEL, as it could aggravate your existing condition.  ALLERGY CONTRAINDICATED  Talk to your doctor if you are allergic to Adapalene and/or Clindamycin.  OTHERS  CLEARZIT A GEL is not recommended for use if you:  Cuts or bruises on the skin Sunburns Skin conditions like eczema (itching, dry and red skin)  Use in pediatrics:  CLEARZIT A GEL is not recommended for use in children less than 12 years of age. Consult your doctor for advice.  Use in geriatrics:  CLEARZIT A GEL should be used with caution in the elderly (above 65 years of age) after consulting your doctor for advice.
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug-Drug interactions:  Inform your physician, if you are taking or using,  Medicated soap for skin, other cosmetic products with a high concentration of alcohol, astringents, sulfur,  Resorcinol – use for itching or irritation of the skin and scalp, loss of hair, dandruff etc. Salicylic acid – used for skin acne, dandruff, etc. Atracurium, cisatracurium, succinylcholine – used to relax muscles  B. Drug-Food interaction:  The interaction of foods with CLEARZIT A GEL is not known. Consult your doctor for diet advice.  Overdosage:  In case of using CLEARZIT A GEL in excess, than recommended, you may experience dryness, scaling, redness and discomfort of the skin. Contact your doctor immediately for advice.
synopsis: SYNOPSIS Drug	:  	Adapalene, Clindamycin Pharmacological Category	:  	Topical Retinoids, Antibiotics Therapeutic Indication	:  	Treat acne        Dosage Forms	:  	Gel (topical), Gel, Cream, Ointment
moreInfo: MORE INFORMATION Keep out of reach from children Store at room temperature. Keep away from sunlight
faqs: FAQs ABOUT CLEARZIT A GEL  Q: Can CLEARZIT A GEL be used to treat scars on the skin?  A: Yes. Adapalene is a kind of vitamin A that reduces swelling and inflammation while also treating acne scars. Azithromycin is used to treat infections that cause skin infections to worsen.  Q: Can CLEARZIT A GEL result in skin peeling?  A: Yes. Dryness of the skin, burning, itching, redness of the skin, skin irritation, scaling, and possibly peeling of the skin are all possible side effects of using this medicine.  Q: Can [GBBNKEYWORD] cause skin dryness?  A: Yes. Your skin may get dry as a result of taking this medication. Maintain hydration and use the moisturiser that your doctor has prescribed.  Q: How long can I use CLEARZIT A GEL?  A: Use CLEARZIT A GEL as advised by your doctor. Generally, it’s recommended for use depending on the severity of the existing skin condition.  Q: Can I stop using CLEARZIT A GEL on my own?  A: No. It is not recommended to stop using CLEARZIT A GEL on your own as it may worsen the existing skin condition. Consult your doctor for advice.

name: CLINDAMYCIN PHOSPHATE (NANZ) Gel 20gm
manufacturer: Nanz Med Science Pharma Pvt Ltd
about: INTRODUCTION  CLINDAMYCIN PHOSPHATE (NANZ) GEL contains Clindamycin, which belongs to the group of medicines called Antibiotics. It is used in the treatment of acne vulgaris. Acne vulgaris is a common skin condition that occurs when hair follicles get blocked with oil and dead skin cells. Symptoms include whiteheads, blackheads, small red, tender bumps, pimples, and pus-filled lumps on the skin.  Before applying CLINDAMYCIN PHOSPHATE (NANZ) GEL, inform your doctor if you have or ever had diarrhea, bloody diarrhea and pseudomembranous colitis. CLINDAMYCIN PHOSPHATE (NANZ) GEL is not recommended for use if you have a history of regional enteritis (inflammation of the small intestine), ulcerative colitis (inflammation of the large intestine) or antibiotic-associated colitis.  CLINDAMYCIN PHOSPHATE (NANZ) GEL should be used with caution during pregnancy or by breastfeeding women only if clearly needed. The safety and effectiveness of CLINDAMYCIN PHOSPHATE (NANZ) GEL in children under the age of 12 has not been established. The most common side effects of applying CLINDAMYCIN PHOSPHATE (NANZ) GEL are burning, itching, and redness of the skin. Consult your doctor if symptoms worsen.
uses: USES OF CLINDAMYCIN PHOSPHATE (NANZ) GEL Treats acne vulgaris
working: HOW CLINDAMYCIN PHOSPHATE (NANZ) GEL WORKS  CLINDAMYCIN PHOSPHATE (NANZ) GEL acts against the bacteria by binding to the 50S subunit of the bacterial ribosome (site of protein synthesis), which in turn prevents protein synthesis and kills the infection-causing bacteria.
directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Apply CLINDAMYCIN PHOSPHATE (NANZ) GEL as advised by your physician. It is for external use only. Wash your hands before use. Wash and dry the whole area, apply a thin film once daily to the skin where acne lesions appear and use enough to cover the entire affected area. In case of contact with the eyes, mouth or nostrils, rinse it off immediately and thoroughly with water. Your doctor will decide the correct dose and duration for you depending on your age, body weight and disease condition.
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF CLINDAMYCIN PHOSPHATE (NANZ) GEL COMMON Burning, itching or abnormal redness of the skin at the application site Scaling, pain, dryness and skin irritation at the application site UNCOMMON Abdominal pain Diarrhea Oily skin RARE Antibiotic-associated colitis  Stop applying CLINDAMYCIN PHOSPHATE (NANZ) GEL and contact your doctor immediately if you experience any of the following side effects:  Allergic symptoms (e.g., rashes, itchiness, difficulty in breathing or eye swelling) Severe or bloody diarrhea. (a sign of bowel inflammation, pseudomembranous colitis)
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY  The safety and effectiveness of CLINDAMYCIN PHOSPHATE (NANZ) GEL in pregnant women or women planning to have a baby have not been established yet. It will be given to you by the doctor only if clearly needed. Consult your doctor before applying CLINDAMYCIN PHOSPHATE (NANZ) GEL.  BREASTFEEDING  CLINDAMYCIN PHOSPHATE (NANZ) GEL should be used with caution in breastfeeding women as it is not known if the medicine is excreted in human milk. Your doctor will decide whether to discontinue nursing or the medicine, considering the benefits to the mother and baby. If it is applied to the chest, care should be taken to avoid accidental ingestion by the infant. Consult your doctor before applying CLINDAMYCIN PHOSPHATE (NANZ) GEL.  ALLERGY  Do not apply CLINDAMYCIN PHOSPHATE (NANZ) GEL if you are allergic to Clindamycin or any other ingredients of this medicine.  OTHERS  CLINDAMYCIN PHOSPHATE (NANZ) GEL is not recommended for use if you:  Have regional enteritis (inflammation of the small intestine) or ulcerative colitis (inflammation of the large intestine) Have a history of antibiotic-associated colitis  Before applying CLINDAMYCIN PHOSPHATE (NANZ) GEL inform your doctor if you:  Diarrhea, bloody diarrhea Pseudomembranous colitis (inflammation of colon) Atopic individuals (more prone to allergies)  Use in pediatrics:  Safety and effectiveness of CLINDAMYCIN PHOSPHATE (NANZ) GEL in children under the age of 12 have not been established. Consult your doctor before applying CLINDAMYCIN PHOSPHATE (NANZ) GEL.
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug-Drug interactions:  Before applying CLINDAMYCIN PHOSPHATE (NANZ) GEL, inform your doctor if you are taking any of the following medicine:  Neuromuscular blocking agents (Ex. rocuronium, vecuronium) Other anti-acne, topical agents  Overdosage:  If you or anyone else accidentally applied too much of CLINDAMYCIN PHOSPHATE (NANZ) GEL, consult your doctor immediately or visit the nearby hospital.
synopsis: SYNOPSIS Drug	:  	  Clindamycin   Pharmacological Category	:  	  Lincosamides   Therapeutic Indication	:  	  Acne vulgaris   Dosage Forms	:  	  Injection, Tablet, Capsule, Gel, Cream, Lotion, Solution, Spray, Soap
moreInfo: MORE INFORMATION Keep CLINDAMYCIN PHOSPHATE (NANZ) GEL out of reach from children Store at room temperature
faqs: FAQs ABOUT CLINDAMYCIN PHOSPHATE (NANZ) GEL  What is CLINDAMYCIN PHOSPHATE (NANZ) GEL used for?  CLINDAMYCIN PHOSPHATE (NANZ) GEL is used in the treatment of acne vulgaris. Acne vulgaris is a common skin condition that occurs when hair follicles get blocked with oil and dead skin cells. Symptoms include whiteheads, blackheads, small red, tender bumps, pimples, and pus-filled lumps on the skin.  How to use CLINDAMYCIN PHOSPHATE (NANZ) GEL?  Apply CLINDAMYCIN PHOSPHATE (NANZ) GEL as advised by your physician. It is for external use only. Wash your hands before use. Wash and dry the whole area, apply a thin film once daily to the skin where acne lesions appear and use enough to cover the entire affected area. In case of contact with the eyes, mouth or nostrils, rinse it off immediately with plenty of water.  How does CLINDAMYCIN PHOSPHATE (NANZ) GEL work?  CLINDAMYCIN PHOSPHATE (NANZ) GEL acts against the bacteria by binding to the 50S subunit of the bacterial ribosome (site of protein synthesis), which in turn prevents protein synthesis and kills the infection-causing bacteria.  Can CLINDAMYCIN PHOSPHATE (NANZ) GEL be used in pregnancy?  The safety and effectiveness of CLINDAMYCIN PHOSPHATE (NANZ) GEL in pregnant women or women planning to have a baby have not been established yet. It will be given to you by the doctor only if clearly needed. Consult your doctor before applying CLINDAMYCIN PHOSPHATE (NANZ) GEL.  Can CLINDAMYCIN PHOSPHATE (NANZ) GEL be used in breastfeeding women?  CLINDAMYCIN PHOSPHATE (NANZ) GEL should be used with caution in breastfeeding women as it is not known if the medicine is excreted in human milk. Your doctor will decide whether to discontinue nursing or the medicine, considering the benefits to the mother and baby. If it is applied to the chest, care should be taken to avoid accidental ingestion by the infant. Consult your doctor before applying CLINDAMYCIN PHOSPHATE (NANZ) GEL.

warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY  The safety and effectiveness of CLINVIVA GEL in pregnant women or women planning to have a baby have not been established yet. It will be given to you by the doctor only if clearly needed. Consult your doctor before applying CLINVIVA GEL.  BREASTFEEDING  CLINVIVA GEL should be used with caution in breastfeeding women as it is not known if the medicine is excreted in human milk. Your doctor will decide whether to discontinue nursing or the medicine, considering the benefits to the mother and baby. If it is applied to the chest, care should be taken to avoid accidental ingestion by the infant. Consult your doctor before applying CLINVIVA GEL.  ALLERGY  Do not apply CLINVIVA GEL if you are allergic to Clindamycin or any other ingredients of this medicine.  OTHERS  CLINVIVA GEL is not recommended for use if you:  Have regional enteritis (inflammation of the small intestine) or ulcerative colitis (inflammation of the large intestine) Have a history of antibiotic-associated colitis  Before applying CLINVIVA GEL inform your doctor if you:  Diarrhea, bloody diarrhea Pseudomembranous colitis (inflammation of colon) Atopic individuals (more prone to allergies)  Use in pediatrics:  Safety and effectiveness of CLINVIVA GEL in children under the age of 12 have not been established. Consult your doctor before applying CLINVIVA GEL.
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug-Drug interactions:  Before applying CLINVIVA GEL, inform your doctor if you are taking any of the following medicine:  Neuromuscular blocking agents (Ex. rocuronium, vecuronium) Other anti-acne, topical agents  Overdosage:  If you or anyone else accidentally applied too much of CLINVIVA GEL, consult your doctor immediately or visit the nearby hospital.
synopsis: SYNOPSIS Drug	:  	  Clindamycin   Pharmacological Category	:  	  Lincosamides   Therapeutic Indication	:  	  Acne vulgaris   Dosage Forms	:  	  Injection, Tablet, Capsule, Gel, Cream, Lotion, Solution, Spray, Soap
moreInfo: MORE INFORMATION Keep CLINVIVA GEL out of reach from children Store at room temperature
faqs: FAQs ABOUT CLINVIVA GEL  What is CLINVIVA GEL used for?  CLINVIVA GEL is used in the treatment of acne vulgaris. Acne vulgaris is a common skin condition that occurs when hair follicles get blocked with oil and dead skin cells. Symptoms include whiteheads, blackheads, small red, tender bumps, pimples, and pus-filled lumps on the skin.  How to use CLINVIVA GEL?  Apply CLINVIVA GEL as advised by your physician. It is for external use only. Wash your hands before use. Wash and dry the whole area, apply a thin film once daily to the skin where acne lesions appear and use enough to cover the entire affected area. In case of contact with the eyes, mouth or nostrils, rinse it off immediately with plenty of water.  How does CLINVIVA GEL work?  CLINVIVA GEL acts against the bacteria by binding to the 50S subunit of the bacterial ribosome (site of protein synthesis), which in turn prevents protein synthesis and kills the infection-causing bacteria.  Can CLINVIVA GEL be used in pregnancy?  The safety and effectiveness of CLINVIVA GEL in pregnant women or women planning to have a baby have not been established yet. It will be given to you by the doctor only if clearly needed. Consult your doctor before applying CLINVIVA GEL.  Can CLINVIVA GEL be used in breastfeeding women?  CLINVIVA GEL should be used with caution in breastfeeding women as it is not known if the medicine is excreted in human milk. Your doctor will decide whether to discontinue nursing or the medicine, considering the benefits to the mother and baby. If it is applied to the chest, care should be taken to avoid accidental ingestion by the infant. Consult your doctor before applying CLINVIVA GEL.

name: CLINVIVA A Gel 15gm
about: INTRODUCTION  CLINVIVA A GEL contains a combination of Adapalene and Clindamycin, which belongs to the group of medicines called topical retinoids and lincomycin antibiotics. It is used in the treatment of skin acne (pimple). Acne is a condition of the skin when the root of your hair (hair follicle) or skin pores gets clogged by oil or dead skin, which becomes prone to bacterial infection and the formation of pimples, blackheads, spots and scars.  Adapalene is a form of vitamin A, that acts as an antiacne agent by binding directly to the receptor of the skin which increases the rate of cell turnover (cell regeneration) and decreases oil secretion preventing clogging of the hair follicles and pores, also decreasing swelling/inflammation. Clindamycin works by binding to the ribosomal unit of the bacteria and disrupts the production of the protein essential for its survival. Before recommending CLINVIVA A GEL, your doctor may advise you to have tests to understand your existing condition for planning effective treatment methods. Stay well hydrated and protect your skin from exposure to sunlight or UV light.  Do not apply CLINVIVA A GEL if you are allergic to adapalene or clindamycin, a disorder of the digestive system (colitis), a disorder of the immune system or have bruises, cuts or burns on the skin. The common side effects of using this medicine may include dry skin, burning, itching, redness or irritative sensation of the skin, scaling peeling of the skin etc.Consult your doctor if any of these side effect worsens.
uses: USES OF CLINVIVA A GEL To treat acne
working: HOW CLINVIVA A GEL WORKS  Adapalene, a form of vitamin A, works as an antiacne medicine by attaching directly to the skin's receptor, which increases cell turnover (cell regeneration) and decreases oil secretion preventing blockage of the hair follicles and pores. It also reduces swelling/inflammation of the skin. Clindamycin works by attaching to the bacteria's ribosomal unit and disrupting the production of a protein required for its very own survival.
directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Apply CLINVIVA A GEL as advised by your doctor. It is for external use on the skin only. Avoid applying CLINVIVA A GEL around or onto your eyes, including eyelids.
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF CLINVIVA A GEL COMMON Dryness of the skin Burning, itching, redness of the skin Scaling and or peeling of the skin UNCOMMON Flaring of acne Sunburns Local skin reaction RARE  Stop using this medicine and contact your doctor immediately if you experience any of the following side effects:  Severe allergic reactions (such as skin rash, itching, swelling of the face, lips, tongue and other parts of the body, difficulty in breathing or wheezing, blisters on the skin, sore throat, fever, headache etc.)
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY CONTRAINDICATED  CLINVIVA A GEL is not recommended for use in pregnant women. Consult your doctor for advice if you are pregnant or suspect/planning pregnancy.  BREASTFEEDING CONSULT YOUR DOCTOR  CLINVIVA A GEL is to be used with caution in breastfeeding mothers after consulting your doctor. The safe use of CLINVIVA A GEL in breastfeeding women and breastfed baby is not established.  DRIVING AND USING MACHINES USE WITH CAUTION  CLINVIVA A GEL may not interfere with your ability to drive or use the machine. However, protect your skin from sun or UV light while travelling and follow appropriate protective measures recommended by your doctor.  ALCOHOL CONSULT YOUR DOCTOR  The risks associated with consuming alcohol are not known. It’s advised to avoid the consumption of alcohol while using CLINVIVA A GEL, as it could aggravate your existing condition.  ALLERGY CONTRAINDICATED  Talk to your doctor if you are allergic to Adapalene and/or Clindamycin.  OTHERS  CLINVIVA A GEL is not recommended for use if you:  Cuts or bruises on the skin Sunburns Skin conditions like eczema (itching, dry and red skin)  Use in pediatrics:  CLINVIVA A GEL is not recommended for use in children less than 12 years of age. Consult your doctor for advice.  Use in geriatrics:  CLINVIVA A GEL should be used with caution in the elderly (above 65 years of age) after consulting your doctor for advice.
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug-Drug interactions:  Inform your physician, if you are taking or using,  Medicated soap for skin, other cosmetic products with a high concentration of alcohol, astringents, sulfur,  Resorcinol – use for itching or irritation of the skin and scalp, loss of hair, dandruff etc. Salicylic acid – used for skin acne, dandruff, etc. Atracurium, cisatracurium, succinylcholine – used to relax muscles  B. Drug-Food interaction:  The interaction of foods with CLINVIVA A GEL is not known. Consult your doctor for diet advice.  Overdosage:  In case of using CLINVIVA A GEL in excess, than recommended, you may experience dryness, scaling, redness and discomfort of the skin. Contact your doctor immediately for advice.
synopsis: SYNOPSIS Drug	:  	Adapalene, Clindamycin Pharmacological Category	:  	Topical Retinoids, Antibiotics Therapeutic Indication	:  	Treat acne        Dosage Forms	:  	Gel (topical), Gel, Cream, Ointment
moreInfo: MORE INFORMATION Keep out of reach from children Store at room temperature. Keep away from sunlight
faqs: FAQs ABOUT CLINVIVA A GEL  Q: Can CLINVIVA A GEL be used to treat scars on the skin?  A: Yes. Adapalene is a kind of vitamin A that reduces swelling and inflammation while also treating acne scars. Azithromycin is used to treat infections that cause skin infections to worsen.  Q: Can CLINVIVA A GEL result in skin peeling?  A: Yes. Dryness of the skin, burning, itching, redness of the skin, skin irritation, scaling, and possibly peeling of the skin are all possible side effects of using this medicine.  Q: Can [GBBNKEYWORD] cause skin dryness?  A: Yes. Your skin may get dry as a result of taking this medication. Maintain hydration and use the moisturiser that your doctor has prescribed.  Q: How long can I use CLINVIVA A GEL?  A: Use CLINVIVA A GEL as advised by your doctor. Generally, it’s recommended for use depending on the severity of the existing skin condition.  Q: Can I stop using CLINVIVA A GEL on my own?  A: No. It is not recommended to stop using CLINVIVA A GEL on your own as it may worsen the existing skin condition. Consult your doctor for advice.
