name: CLINVIVA B Gel 15gm
about: INTRODUCTION  CLINVIVA B is a combination of Clindamycin and Benzoyl peroxide which belongs to the group of medicines called Anti-acne preparations. It is used in the treatment of mild to moderate acne in adults and in adolescents (aged 12 years or older).  Acne is a common skin problem caused due to clogging off skin pores with dead skin cells or sebum (oil produced by the skin) with or without bacterial infection. It makes the skin inflamed with redness and pustules, along with small bumps on the skin which may be whiteheads or blackheads.  Clindamycin is a topical antibiotic and benzoyl peroxide is an antibacterial agent with sebum controlling properties. Both clindamycin and benzoyl peroxide acts by stopping the growth and multiplication of the acne-causing bacteria. Additionally, benzoyl peroxide can remove the accumulated dead skin cells and excess oil from the skin pores that triggers acne breakouts.  Use CLINVIVA B as directed by the physician. It is for external use only. Avoid using CLINVIVA B on inflamed, irritated, or sensitive skin areas. CLINVIVA B may bleach your clothes, therefore avoid the contact of CLINVIVA B with coloured fabrics.  Before using CLINVIVA B inform your doctor if you have recently used any medicine that contains clindamycin or erythromycin. You must also inform your doctor if you have any problems in your gut (ulcerative colitis) or are pregnant or breastfeeding as a precaution.  CLINVIVA B may cause skin redness and peeling in some individuals during the first few weeks of therapy. If you experience this, stop using CLINVIVA B for a short period until your skin recovers. However, consult your doctor immediately if your skin irritation becomes severe and accompanied with skin redness, dryness, itching, stinging, or burning sensation.
uses: USES OF CLINVIVA B Treats mild to moderate acne in adults and in adolescents (aged 12 years or older)
working: HOW CLINVIVA B WORKS  CLINVIVA B effectively controls acne breakouts both in adults and in adolescents. It contains clindamycin and benzoyl peroxide both which acts by preventing the growth and multiplication of acne-causing bacteria. Additionally, benzoyl peroxide opens the skin pores and removes the accumulated dead skin cells and excess oil that triggers acne breakouts. Over time, it can also reduce oil production in the skin.
directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Always use CLINVIVA B as directed by your physician. It is for external use only. Wash the affected area of the skin with warm water before application. Pat it dry. Apply a thin layer of CLINVIVA B on the affected area. Let the medicine completely dry on your skin before applying any make-up products or cosmetics.  Do not use any cosmetics or make-up products before applying CLINVIVA B. Check the label of the medicine or consult your doctor regarding the quantity of the medicine that needs to be applied.  Contact your doctor if you experience any skin dryness or irritation after using CLINVIVA B. Avoid contact of CLINVIVA B with eyes, ears, nose, or mouth. Your doctor will decide the duration of therapy for you depending upon your disease condition.
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF CLINVIVA B COMMON Skin redness, irritation, itching, burning or stinging sensation at the site of application Skin dryness, peeling of the skin, sensitivity to sunlight Headache UNCOMMON Sensation of numbness Worsening of acne RARE  Stop using CLINVIVA B and contact your doctor immediately if you experience any of the following side effects:  Signs of allergic reactions (such as swelling of your face, eyes, lips, tongue, or throat, trouble breathing, nettle rash, severe dizziness, collapse) Severe or prolonged diarrhea with stomach cramps Severe itching, or burning or peeling of the skin
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY  There are only limited data regarding the use of CLINVIVA B in pregnant women. Therefore, consult your doctor before using CLINVIVA B if you are pregnant or planning to become pregnant. Your doctor may prescribe you with CLINVIVA B based on the risk and benefit ratio.  BREASTFEEDING  There are only limited data regarding the use of CLINVIVA B in breastfeeding women. Therefore, consult your doctor before using.  ALLERGY  Do not use CLINVIVA B if you are allergic to Clindamycin, Benzoyl peroxide or lincomycin.  OTHERS  Before using CLINVIVA B inform your doctor if you:  Have any skin inflammation, irritation, or photosensitivity Have problems in the gut (such as regional enteritis, ulcerative colitis or stomach inflammation caused due to use of antibiotics) Have recently used any medicine that contains clindamycin or erythromycin in it Have an upcoming surgery  Use in pediatrics:  CLINVIVA B should be used in children and in adolescents (aged 12 years or older) only if prescribed by the physician. It is not recommended for use in children aged below12 years due to lack of safety data. Therefore, consult your doctor before using it.  Use in geriatrics:  CLINVIVA B should be used with caution in elderly patients. Therefore, consult your doctor before using it.
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug-Drug Interaction:  Before using CLINVIVA B inform your doctor if you are taking any of the following:  Other medicines used for acne (such as tretinoin, isotretinoin or tazarotene) Erythromycin, sulfacetamide (medicines used to treat bacterial infections) Dapsone (a medicine used to treat leprosy) General anesthetics (used for relaxing skeletal muscles before surgery) Ex. pancuronium, vercuronium Medicated or abrasive soaps and cleansers Products contain large amounts of alcohol or astringents (Ex. skin cleansers or toners)  Overdosage:  Excessive application of CLINVIVA B may cause skin irritation and dryness. If this happened, rinse it off with warm water. If irritation persists, stop using CLINVIVA B for a few days or until irritation subsides or consult your doctor if necessary.
synopsis: SYNOPSIS Drug	:  	  Clindamycin, Benzoyl peroxide   Pharmacological Category	:  	  Lincomycin antibiotics, Antibacterial agents   Therapeutic Indication	:  	Acne Dosage Forms	:  	  Gel, Cream, Gel (Topical)
moreInfo: MORE INFORMATION Keep CLINVIVA B out of reach of children Store CLINVIVA B in a cool, dry place or in a refrigerator (2-8?) depending upon the instructions mentioned in the label Avoid contact of CLINVIVA B with eyes, ears, nose, or mouth. If contact happens accidentally, rinse it off with warm water Avoid contact of CLINVIVA B with coloured fabrics, including clothing, towels, bed linen, furniture or carpeting as it may bleach them
faqs: FAQs ABOUT CLINVIVA B  How long does it take for CLINVIVA B to show the results?  It may take up to 2-3 weeks for CLINVIVA B to improve your acne. However, this period may vary from patient-to-patient depending upon the severity of acne. Therefore, regularly use CLINVIVA B for the stipulated duration mentioned by your doctor.  Will CLINVIVA B be more effective if I overuse it?  Do not overuse CLINVIVA B. Excessive application of CLINVIVA B may cause skin irritation and dryness. Therefore, use CLINVIVA B only directed by your physician.  What precautions do I need to follow while using CLINVIVA B?  Use CLINVIVA B as directed by the physician. Avoid using CLINVIVA B on inflamed, irritated, or sensitive skin areas. CLINVIVA B may bleach your clothes, therefore avoid the contact of CLINVIVA B with coloured fabrics. Before using CLINVIVA B inform your doctor if you are pregnant or breastfeeding as a precaution. Contact your doctor if your skin condition worsens.  Can the use of CLINVIVA B make my skin sensitive to sunlight?  Yes. CLINVIVA B may make your skin more sensitive to sunlight. Therefore, use protective clothing while going outdoors. Do not exposure the affected part of the skin to the direct sunlight. Consult your doctor if you require any sunscreen to protect your skin while going outdoors. Consult your doctor if your skin condition worsens.  What are the common side effects of using CLINVIVA B?  CLINVIVA B may cause skin redness and peeling in some individuals during the first few weeks of therapy. If you experience this, stop using CLINVIVA B for a short period until your skin recovers. However, consult your doctor immediately if your skin irritation becomes severe with redness, dryness, itching, stinging, or burning sensation.  Can CLINVIVA B be used in children?  CLINVIVA B is not recommended for use in children (aged below 12 years). It should be used in children and adolescents (aged 12 years or older) only if prescribed by the physician. Therefore, consult your doctor before using.  How does CLINVIVA B works?  CLINVIVA B acts by preventing the growth and multiplication of acne-causing bacteria. It can also open the skin pores and removes the accumulated dead skin cells and excess oil that triggers acne breakouts. Over time, it can also reduce oil production in the skin.  Can I use CLINVIVA B to treat acne during pregnancy?  Currently, there are only limited data regarding the use of CLINVIVA B in pregnant women. Therefore, consult your doctor before using CLINVIVA B if you are pregnant or planning to become pregnant. Your doctor may prescribe you with CLINVIVA B based on the risk and benefit ratio.

name: D Acne I 10mg Capsule 10'S
about: INTRODUCTION  D ACNE I 10MG CAPSULE contains Isotretinoin which belongs to the group of medicines called Retinoids. It is used in adults and children (older than 12 years of age) to treat severe form of acne (such as nodular acne, conglobate acne, and acne that is at risk of permanent scarring), which has not improved after other anti-acne treatments. Acne is an inflammatory skin condition which is characterized by spots, oily skin, nodular lesions etc. on face, back, and chest, which can be painful.  During treatment with D ACNE I 10MG CAPSULE your doctor might conduct certain blood tests and pregnancy tests, and you will be supervised by a skin doctor. You will be advised to reduce intensive exercise and physical activity. Before you go out in the sun, use a sunscreen with a high protection factor (SPF 15 or higher).  Avoid too much sun and using a sun-lamp or sun-bed. Avoid consuming alcohol while taking D ACNE I 10MG CAPSULE as it may cause side effects. Do not donate blood while consuming D ACNE I 10MG CAPSULE and after stopping D ACNE I 10MG CAPSULE at least for one month or undergo cosmetic procedures while taking D ACNE I 10MG CAPSULE or at least for 6 months after stopping it.  D ACNE I 10MG CAPSULE is not recommended for use in patients having liver or kidney disease, hyperlipidaemia (high blood lipid levels), high levels of Vitamin A. D ACNE I 10MG CAPSULE should be used with caution in patients who have or had mental illness or family history of mental illness, asthma, diabetes, heart or bone problems like osteoporosis, or eating disorder.  D ACNE I 10MG CAPSULE is not recommended for use in pregnant women, women planning a pregnancy, breast feeding women, and in children (below 12 years of age) so, consult your doctor for advice. D ACNE I 10MG CAPSULE should be used with caution in elderly patients (65 years and older).  D ACNE I 10MG CAPSULE may cause depression, psychosis, suicidal thoughts, or thoughts of self-harm in some patients. Consult your doctor if you experience any such behaviour or thoughts.  Most common side effects of taking D ACNE I 10MG CAPSULE are dry skin of face and lips, joint or muscle pain, headache, easy bruising or bleeding, weakness, etc. Consult your doctor if any of the symptoms deteriorate.
uses: USES OF D ACNE I 10MG CAPSULE Used in adults and children (older than 12 years of age) to treat severe form of acne which has not improved after other anti-acne treatments
working: HOW D ACNE I 10MG CAPSULE WORKS  D ACNE I 10MG CAPSULE helps in treating acne by inhibiting the function of sebaceous glands (oil glands in skin) thus, reducing the secretion of oil (sebum) in the skin. D ACNE I 10MG CAPSULE also inhibits keratinization (development of a horn-like character by the epithelial tissue), which might be a cause of acne.
directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Take D ACNE I 10MG CAPSULE as advised by your physician. Do not crush or chew it. Swallow D ACNE I 10MG CAPSULE as whole with a glass of water or a mouthful of food. Take it on a full stomach. Your doctor will decide the right dose and duration of therapy for you according to your age, body weight and disease condition.
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF D ACNE I 10MG CAPSULE COMMON Dry skin, especially of the lips and face, inflamed skin, chapped and inflamed lips, rash, mild itching, slight peeling More fragile and red skin than usual, especially of the face Back, muscle or joint pain (particularly in children and teenagers) Inflammation of the eye and eyelid area, dry and irritated eyes Raised liver enzymes Changed blood fat and cholesterol levels Easy bruising, bleeding or clotting Anaemia (weakness, dizziness, pale skin) Headache Protein or blood in the urine Becoming more prone to get infections Dry and crusted inside of the nose causing mild nosebleeds Sore or inflamed throat and nose RARE Hair loss  Stop taking D ACNE I 10MG CAPSULE and consult your doctor immediately in case you experience any of the following:  Persistent pain in your lower back or buttocks (signs of sacroiliitis) Severe skin reactions (Ex. erythema multiforme, Stevens-Johnson Syndrome, toxic epidermal necrolysis) (blistering and peeling of skin, severe rashes, fever, multiple lesions especially in mouth, nose, eyes and genitals, conjunctivitis, flu-like symptoms) Depression or related disorders (sad or altered mood, anxiety, emotional discomfort), worsening depression, becoming violent or aggressive Thoughts or feelings about hurting self or ending own lives, suicide attempts or suicide Unusual behaviour Psychosis (loss of contact with reality, like hearing voices or seeing things that are not real) Serious reactions (trouble breathing or swallowing due to sudden swelling of the throat, face, lips and mouth, sudden swelling of the hands, feet and ankles, hives, bruises, eczema, bruising, red patches on hands and legs) Sudden tight chest, breathlessness and wheezing, particularly if you have asthma Rhabdomyolysis (muscle weakness along with trouble moving arms or legs, painful, swollen, bruised areas of the body, dark urine, reduced or no urination, confusion or dehydration) Hepatitis (yellow skin or eyes, tiredness) Kidney inflammation (difficulty urinating, swollen and puffy eyelids, excessive tiredness) Increased intracranial pressure (continuous headache, along with nausea, vomiting and eyesight changes including blurred vision) Serious gut conditions (severe tummy pain, with or without severe bloody diarrhoea, nausea, vomiting) Vision problems like night vision problems, persistent dryness of eyes, intolerance to contact lenses Inflamed pancreas Hearing problems, ringing sound in ears Severe muscle weakness, muscle, joint, back pain, difficulty moving especially after exercise
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY  D ACNE I 10MG CAPSULE is not recommended for use in pregnant women and women planning a pregnancy. Inform your doctor if you become pregnant during treatment with D ACNE I 10MG CAPSULE. It is not recommended to get pregnant for one month after stopping D ACNE I 10MG CAPSULE treatment because some medicine may still be left in your body. Consult your doctor before taking it.  Contraception must be used for a month before taking D ACNE I 10MG CAPSULE, during treatment and for a month afterwards. Discuss with your doctor regarding suitable contraceptive methods.  BREASTFEEDING  D ACNE I 10MG CAPSULE is not recommended for use in breast feeding women as it may pass through breast milk. Consult your doctor before taking it.  DRIVING AND USING MACHINES  Do not drive or operate machinery if you experience dizziness, drowsiness or decreased night vision after taking D ACNE I 10MG CAPSULE.  ALCOHOL  Avoid consuming alcohol while taking D ACNE I 10MG CAPSULE as it may increase side effects. Inform your doctor if you are an alcoholic.  KIDNEY  D ACNE I 10MG CAPSULE should be used with caution in patients with kidney problems. Consult your doctor before taking it.  LIVER  D ACNE I 10MG CAPSULE is not recommended for use in patients with liver disease. Consult your doctor before taking it.  ALLERGY  Do not take D ACNE I 10MG CAPSULE if you are allergic to Isotretinoin, soya, peanuts or any of the other ingredients of this medicine.  LUNGS  D ACNE I 10MG CAPSULE should be used with caution in patients having asthma. Consult your doctor before taking it.  OTHERS  D ACNE I 10MG CAPSULE is not recommended for use if you have:  High blood fat levels High levels of Vitamin A  Before taking D ACNE I 10MG CAPSULE inform your doctor if you:  Have or had mental illness or family history of mental illness such as depression, mood disorders, psychosis, aggressive behaviour, or hurting or killing self Have diabetes Are fructose intolerant Are overweight  Use in paediatrics:  D ACNE I 10MG CAPSULE is not recommended for use in children below 12 years of age. D ACNE I 10MG CAPSULE can be used in adolescents (more than 12 years of age) only after puberty. Consult your child’s doctor for advice.  Use in geriatrics:  There is no proper information about the use of D ACNE I 10MG CAPSULE in elderly patients. Consult your doctor before taking it.
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug-Drug interactions:  Before taking D ACNE I 10MG CAPSULE, inform your doctor if you are taking any of the following medicines:  Vitamin A supplements Medicines used to treat bacterial infections (Ex. minocycline, doxycycline) Phenytoin (used to treat fits) Medicines used to treat various inflammatory conditions (Ex. betamethasone, prednisolone, dexamethasone) Medicines used to prevent pregnancy (Ex. Norethindrone, ethinyl Oestradiol) St. John’s wort (herbal medicine used to treat mental disorders) Other medicines used to treat acne like keratolytic or exfoliative agents (Ex. salicylic acid, benzoyl peroxide)  Overdosage:  In case you or anybody else accidently take too much of D ACNE I 10MG CAPSULE, consult your doctor immediately or visit the nearby hospital. Symptoms of D ACNE I 10MG CAPSULE overdose are severe headache, abdominal pain, nausea, dizziness, redness of face, vomiting, somnolence, irritability, and itching.

faqs: FAQs ABOUT D ACNE I 10MG CAPSULE  Can D ACNE I 10MG CAPSULE cause irregular periods?  According to some studies, menstrual irregularity was observed during treatment follow-ups. Consult your doctor if you experience irregularity in your periods during treatment with D ACNE I 10MG CAPSULE.  Is D ACNE I 10MG CAPSULE safe to take in pregnancy?  No. D ACNE I 10MG CAPSULE is not recommended for use in pregnant women and women planning a pregnancy. Inform your doctor if you become pregnant during treatment with D ACNE I 10MG CAPSULE. It is not recommended to get pregnant for one month after stopping D ACNE I 10MG CAPSULE treatment because some medicine may still be left in your body. Consult your doctor before taking it. Contraception must be used for a month before taking D ACNE I 10MG CAPSULE, during treatment and for a month afterwards. Discuss with your doctor regarding suitable contraceptive methods.  Can I play sports during D ACNE I 10MG CAPSULE treatment?  Cut down on extreme exercise and physical activity as D ACNE I 10MG CAPSULE can cause muscle and joint pain especially in children and teenagers taking up vigorous physical activity. Consult your doctor if you can play sports during this treatment.  Can I go out in the sun during D ACNE I 10MG CAPSULE treatment?  Sensitivity to light may increase during treatment with D ACNE I 10MG CAPSULE so, avoid going too much into the sun and don’t use a sun-lamp or sun-bed. Before you go out in the sun, wear sunglasses and use sunscreen with a high protection factor (SPF 15 or higher).  Can undergo cosmetic procedures while taking D ACNE I 10MG CAPSULE?  No. Do not undergo cosmetic procedures such as skin waxing, dermabrasion, laser, or artificial UV light detanning while taking D ACNE I 10MG CAPSULE or at least for 6 months after stopping it as they could cause scarring, skin irritation, or changes in your skin colour. Consult your doctor before undergoing any cosmetic procedure while taking D ACNE I 10MG CAPSULE.

name: D Acne I 20mg Capsule 10'S
about: INTRODUCTION  D ACNE I 20MG CAPSULE contains Isotretinoin which belongs to the group of medicines called Retinoids. It is used in adults and children (older than 12 years of age) to treat severe form of acne (such as nodular acne, conglobate acne, and acne that is at risk of permanent scarring), which has not improved after other anti-acne treatments. Acne is an inflammatory skin condition which is characterized by spots, oily skin, nodular lesions etc. on face, back, and chest, which can be painful.  During treatment with D ACNE I 20MG CAPSULE your doctor might conduct certain blood tests and pregnancy tests, and you will be supervised by a skin doctor. You will be advised to reduce intensive exercise and physical activity. Before you go out in the sun, use a sunscreen with a high protection factor (SPF 15 or higher).  Avoid too much sun and using a sun-lamp or sun-bed. Avoid consuming alcohol while taking D ACNE I 20MG CAPSULE as it may cause side effects. Do not donate blood while consuming D ACNE I 20MG CAPSULE and after stopping D ACNE I 20MG CAPSULE at least for one month or undergo cosmetic procedures while taking D ACNE I 20MG CAPSULE or at least for 6 months after stopping it.  D ACNE I 20MG CAPSULE is not recommended for use in patients having liver or kidney disease, hyperlipidaemia (high blood lipid levels), high levels of Vitamin A. D ACNE I 20MG CAPSULE should be used with caution in patients who have or had mental illness or family history of mental illness, asthma, diabetes, heart or bone problems like osteoporosis, or eating disorder.  D ACNE I 20MG CAPSULE is not recommended for use in pregnant women, women planning a pregnancy, breast feeding women, and in children (below 12 years of age) so, consult your doctor for advice. D ACNE I 20MG CAPSULE should be used with caution in elderly patients (65 years and older).  D ACNE I 20MG CAPSULE may cause depression, psychosis, suicidal thoughts, or thoughts of self-harm in some patients. Consult your doctor if you experience any such behaviour or thoughts.  Most common side effects of taking D ACNE I 20MG CAPSULE are dry skin of face and lips, joint or muscle pain, headache, easy bruising or bleeding, weakness, etc. Consult your doctor if any of the symptoms deteriorate.
uses: USES OF D ACNE I 20MG CAPSULE Used in adults and children (older than 12 years of age) to treat severe form of acne which has not improved after other anti-acne treatments
working: HOW D ACNE I 20MG CAPSULE WORKS  D ACNE I 20MG CAPSULE helps in treating acne by inhibiting the function of sebaceous glands (oil glands in skin) thus, reducing the secretion of oil (sebum) in the skin. D ACNE I 20MG CAPSULE also inhibits keratinization (development of a horn-like character by the epithelial tissue), which might be a cause of acne.
directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Take D ACNE I 20MG CAPSULE as advised by your physician. Do not crush or chew it. Swallow D ACNE I 20MG CAPSULE as whole with a glass of water or a mouthful of food. Take it on a full stomach. Your doctor will decide the right dose and duration of therapy for you according to your age, body weight and disease condition.
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF D ACNE I 20MG CAPSULE COMMON Dry skin, especially of the lips and face, inflamed skin, chapped and inflamed lips, rash, mild itching, slight peeling More fragile and red skin than usual, especially of the face Back, muscle or joint pain (particularly in children and teenagers) Inflammation of the eye and eyelid area, dry and irritated eyes Raised liver enzymes Changed blood fat and cholesterol levels Easy bruising, bleeding or clotting Anaemia (weakness, dizziness, pale skin) Headache Protein or blood in the urine Becoming more prone to get infections Dry and crusted inside of the nose causing mild nosebleeds Sore or inflamed throat and nose RARE Hair loss  Stop taking D ACNE I 20MG CAPSULE and consult your doctor immediately in case you experience any of the following:  Persistent pain in your lower back or buttocks (signs of sacroiliitis) Severe skin reactions (Ex. erythema multiforme, Stevens-Johnson Syndrome, toxic epidermal necrolysis) (blistering and peeling of skin, severe rashes, fever, multiple lesions especially in mouth, nose, eyes and genitals, conjunctivitis, flu-like symptoms) Depression or related disorders (sad or altered mood, anxiety, emotional discomfort), worsening depression, becoming violent or aggressive Thoughts or feelings about hurting self or ending own lives, suicide attempts or suicide Unusual behaviour Psychosis (loss of contact with reality, like hearing voices or seeing things that are not real) Serious reactions (trouble breathing or swallowing due to sudden swelling of the throat, face, lips and mouth, sudden swelling of the hands, feet and ankles, hives, bruises, eczema, bruising, red patches on hands and legs) Sudden tight chest, breathlessness and wheezing, particularly if you have asthma Rhabdomyolysis (muscle weakness along with trouble moving arms or legs, painful, swollen, bruised areas of the body, dark urine, reduced or no urination, confusion or dehydration) Hepatitis (yellow skin or eyes, tiredness) Kidney inflammation (difficulty urinating, swollen and puffy eyelids, excessive tiredness) Increased intracranial pressure (continuous headache, along with nausea, vomiting and eyesight changes including blurred vision) Serious gut conditions (severe tummy pain, with or without severe bloody diarrhoea, nausea, vomiting) Vision problems like night vision problems, persistent dryness of eyes, intolerance to contact lenses Inflamed pancreas Hearing problems, ringing sound in ears Severe muscle weakness, muscle, joint, back pain, difficulty moving especially after exercise

name: D ACNE PLUS Gel 20gm
about: INTRODUCTION  D ACNE PLUS GEL contains Allantoin, Nicotinamide and Clindamycin which belongs to the group of medicines called Dermatologic agent, Vitamin B complex and Antibiotics. It is used to treat acne, skin infections caused due to bacteria and oily skin.  Before using D ACNE PLUS GEL, inform your doctor if you have any kidney, liver, heart, or lung diseases. In pregnant and breast-feeding women, D ACNE PLUS GEL should be used with caution.D ACNE PLUS GEL should not be used by children under the age of 12.  The most common side effects of D ACNE PLUS GEL are skin burning or itching, skin redness, oily skin, skin peeling, skin irritation, and an upset stomach. Contact your doctor if any of these worsen or don’t improve.
uses: USES OF D ACNE PLUS GEL Treats acne Treats skin infections caused due to bacteria Treats oily skin
working: HOW D ACNE PLUS GEL WORKS  D ACNE PLUS GEL helps in the treatment of various skin conditions. Allantoin is a dermatological agent that stimulates wound healing and tissue repair by forming new cells. It also repairs dry, rough, scaly, and itchy skin by increasing the blood flow, forming new blood vessels, and increasing collagen production at the site of application.  Nicotinamide is a vitamin B complex that has an anti-inflammatory effect by blocking various substances that cause redness and swelling, as well as aiding in the reduction of sebum production.   Clindamycin is an Antibacterial agent which acts on the bacterial cell wall and interferes with its important life functions leading to its destruction. Together, they help in the treatment of various skin problems.
directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Always apply D ACNE PLUS GEL as directed by your physician. Clean and dry the affected area before the application. It is for external use only. Wash hands before and after the application D ACNE PLUS GEL. Do not apply D ACNE PLUS GEL on the skin surface that is cut, scraped, sunburned or eczema affected. Avoid applying this medicine around your eyes, including eyelids, nose, and mouth.
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF D ACNE PLUS GEL COMMON Skin burning Itching Skin redness Oily skin Skin peeling Skin irritation Upset stomach
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY USE WITH CAUTION  D ACNE PLUS GEL should be used with caution in pregnant women. Consult your doctor before using it.  BREASTFEEDING USE WITH CAUTION  D ACNE PLUS GEL should be used with caution in breast-feeding women. Consult your doctor before using it.  ALLERGY CONTRAINDICATED  Do not use D ACNE PLUS GEL if you are allergic to Allantoin, Nicotinamide or Clindamycin or any ingredients of this medicine.  USE IN PEDIATRICS CONTRAINDICATED  D ACNE PLUS GEL is not recommended for use in children below 12 years of age. Consult your doctor before using it.  USE IN GERIATRICS CONSULT YOUR DOCTOR  Your doctor will prescribe the right dose of D ACNE PLUS GEL depending on your age, body weight and health condition. Consult your doctor before using it.
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug-Drug Interaction:  Before using D ACNE PLUS GEL, inform your doctor if you are using, have used, or might use any other medicine, including prescription, non-prescription or any herbal medicine.     Overdosage:  In case of overdosage or accidental ingestion of D ACNE PLUS GEL, consult your doctor or visit nearby hospital immediately.
synopsis: SYNOPSIS Drug	:  	Allantoin, Nicotinamide, Clindamycin Pharmacological Category	:  	Dermatologic agent, Vitamin B complex, Antibiotic Therapeutic Indication	:  	Acne, Skin infections caused due to bacteria, Oily skin Dosage Forms	:  	Gel
moreInfo: MORE INFORMATION Keep out of reach from children Store at 15°C - 30°C
faqs: FAQs ABOUT D ACNE PLUS GEL  Q: What is D ACNE PLUS GEL and why is it prescribed?  A. D ACNE PLUS GEL contains allantoin, nicotinamide, and clindamycin, which belong to the group of medicines called dermatologic agents, vitamin B complexes, and antibiotics. It is used to treat acne, skin infections caused by bacteria, and oily skin.  Q: How many times does D ACNE PLUS GEL have to be applied?  A: Always apply D ACNE PLUS GEL as directed by your physician. Before applying, clean and pat dry the affected area.It is for external use only. Do not exceed the recommended usage, and make sure to use D ACNE PLUS GEL every day as recommended by your physician for better and faster results.  Q: Can I use another medicine with D ACNE PLUS GEL to treat my acne faster?  A: Using another medicine with D ACNE PLUS GEL i.e., using two medicines for treatment at a time may lead to unwanted results such as excess dryness, skin peeling, skin irritation, etc. In this case, only one medication should be used, or you must contact your doctor.  Q: Is D ACNE PLUS GEL safe to be used by children?  A: D ACNE PLUS GEL is not recommended for children under the age of 12. You must consult with your physician if your child is below 12 years of age.  Q: Is D ACNE PLUS GEL a spot treatment or does it have to be applied to the whole face?  A: D ACNE PLUS GEL is not a spot treatment and should not be used to treat a single pimple. D ACNE PLUS GEL should be applied to the entire face to treat your acne. Contact your doctor for further questions.  Q: Will D ACNE PLUS GEL be more effective if it is used more frequently?  A: No. Do not overuse D ACNE PLUS GEL as it can cause overabsorption and can lead to severe diarrhoea. Use D ACNE PLUS GEL as directed by your doctor.

D ACNE PLUS GEL contains allantoin, nicotinamide, and clindamycin, which belong to the group of medicines called dermatologic agents, vitamin B complexes, and antibiotics. A: Always apply D ACNE PLUS GEL as directed by your physician. Before applying, clean and pat dry the affected area.It is for external use only. Do not exceed the recommended usage, and make sure to use D ACNE PLUS GEL every day as recommended by your physician for better and faster results.  Q: Can I use another medicine with D ACNE PLUS GEL to treat my acne faster?  A: Using another medicine with D ACNE PLUS GEL i.e., using two medicines for treatment at a time may lead to unwanted results such as excess dryness, skin peeling, skin irritation, etc. In this case, only one medication should be used, or you must contact your doctor.  Q: Is D ACNE PLUS GEL safe to be used by children?  A: D ACNE PLUS GEL is not recommended for children under the age of 12. You must consult with your physician if your child is below 12 years of age.  Q: Is D ACNE PLUS GEL a spot treatment or does it have to be applied to the whole face?  A: D ACNE PLUS GEL is not a spot treatment and should not be used to treat a single pimple. D ACNE PLUS GEL should be applied to the entire face to treat your acne. Contact your doctor for further questions.  Q: Will D ACNE PLUS GEL be more effective if it is used more frequently?  A: No. Do not overuse D ACNE PLUS GEL as it can cause overabsorption and can lead to severe diarrhoea. Use D ACNE PLUS GEL as directed by your doctor.

name: DECOMEDO Gel 25gm
about: INTRODUCTION  DECOMEDO is a combination of Clindamycin and Benzoyl peroxide which belongs to the group of medicines called Anti-acne preparations. It is used in the treatment of mild to moderate acne in adults and in adolescents (aged 12 years or older).  Acne is a common skin problem caused due to clogging off skin pores with dead skin cells or sebum (oil produced by the skin) with or without bacterial infection. It makes the skin inflamed with redness and pustules, along with small bumps on the skin which may be whiteheads or blackheads.  Clindamycin is a topical antibiotic and benzoyl peroxide is an antibacterial agent with sebum controlling properties. Both clindamycin and benzoyl peroxide acts by stopping the growth and multiplication of the acne-causing bacteria. Additionally, benzoyl peroxide can remove the accumulated dead skin cells and excess oil from the skin pores that triggers acne breakouts.  Use DECOMEDO as directed by the physician. It is for external use only. Avoid using DECOMEDO on inflamed, irritated, or sensitive skin areas. DECOMEDO may bleach your clothes, therefore avoid the contact of DECOMEDO with coloured fabrics.  Before using DECOMEDO inform your doctor if you have recently used any medicine that contains clindamycin or erythromycin. You must also inform your doctor if you have any problems in your gut (ulcerative colitis) or are pregnant or breastfeeding as a precaution.  DECOMEDO may cause skin redness and peeling in some individuals during the first few weeks of therapy. If you experience this, stop using DECOMEDO for a short period until your skin recovers. However, consult your doctor immediately if your skin irritation becomes severe and accompanied with skin redness, dryness, itching, stinging, or burning sensation.
uses: USES OF DECOMEDO Treats mild to moderate acne in adults and in adolescents (aged 12 years or older)
working: HOW DECOMEDO WORKS  DECOMEDO effectively controls acne breakouts both in adults and in adolescents. It contains clindamycin and benzoyl peroxide both which acts by preventing the growth and multiplication of acne-causing bacteria. Additionally, benzoyl peroxide opens the skin pores and removes the accumulated dead skin cells and excess oil that triggers acne breakouts. Over time, it can also reduce oil production in the skin.
directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Always use DECOMEDO as directed by your physician. It is for external use only. Wash the affected area of the skin with warm water before application. Pat it dry. Apply a thin layer of DECOMEDO on the affected area. Let the medicine completely dry on your skin before applying any make-up products or cosmetics.  Do not use any cosmetics or make-up products before applying DECOMEDO. Check the label of the medicine or consult your doctor regarding the quantity of the medicine that needs to be applied.  Contact your doctor if you experience any skin dryness or irritation after using DECOMEDO. Avoid contact of DECOMEDO with eyes, ears, nose, or mouth. Your doctor will decide the duration of therapy for you depending upon your disease condition.
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF DECOMEDO COMMON Skin redness, irritation, itching, burning or stinging sensation at the site of application Skin dryness, peeling of the skin, sensitivity to sunlight Headache UNCOMMON Sensation of numbness Worsening of acne RARE  Stop using DECOMEDO and contact your doctor immediately if you experience any of the following side effects:  Signs of allergic reactions (such as swelling of your face, eyes, lips, tongue, or throat, trouble breathing, nettle rash, severe dizziness, collapse) Severe or prolonged diarrhea with stomach cramps Severe itching, or burning or peeling of the skin
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY  There are only limited data regarding the use of DECOMEDO in pregnant women. Therefore, consult your doctor before using DECOMEDO if you are pregnant or planning to become pregnant. Your doctor may prescribe you with DECOMEDO based on the risk and benefit ratio.  BREASTFEEDING  There are only limited data regarding the use of DECOMEDO in breastfeeding women. Therefore, consult your doctor before using.  ALLERGY  Do not use DECOMEDO if you are allergic to Clindamycin, Benzoyl peroxide or lincomycin.  OTHERS  Before using DECOMEDO inform your doctor if you:  Have any skin inflammation, irritation, or photosensitivity Have problems in the gut (such as regional enteritis, ulcerative colitis or stomach inflammation caused due to use of antibiotics) Have recently used any medicine that contains clindamycin or erythromycin in it Have an upcoming surgery  Use in pediatrics:  DECOMEDO should be used in children and in adolescents (aged 12 years or older) only if prescribed by the physician. It is not recommended for use in children aged below12 years due to lack of safety data. Therefore, consult your doctor before using it.  Use in geriatrics:  DECOMEDO should be used with caution in elderly patients. Therefore, consult your doctor before using it.
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug-Drug Interaction:  Before using DECOMEDO inform your doctor if you are taking any of the following:  Other medicines used for acne (such as tretinoin, isotretinoin or tazarotene) Erythromycin, sulfacetamide (medicines used to treat bacterial infections) Dapsone (a medicine used to treat leprosy) General anesthetics (used for relaxing skeletal muscles before surgery) Ex. pancuronium, vercuronium Medicated or abrasive soaps and cleansers Products contain large amounts of alcohol or astringents (Ex. skin cleansers or toners)  Overdosage:  Excessive application of DECOMEDO may cause skin irritation and dryness. If this happened, rinse it off with warm water. If irritation persists, stop using DECOMEDO for a few days or until irritation subsides or consult your doctor if necessary.
synopsis: SYNOPSIS Drug	:  	  Clindamycin, Benzoyl peroxide   Pharmacological Category	:  	  Lincomycin antibiotics, Antibacterial agents   Therapeutic Indication	:  	Acne Dosage Forms	:  	  Gel, Cream, Gel (Topical)
moreInfo: MORE INFORMATION Keep DECOMEDO out of reach of children Store DECOMEDO in a cool, dry place or in a refrigerator (2-8?) depending upon the instructions mentioned in the label Avoid contact of DECOMEDO with eyes, ears, nose, or mouth. If contact happens accidentally, rinse it off with warm water Avoid contact of DECOMEDO with coloured fabrics, including clothing, towels, bed linen, furniture or carpeting as it may bleach them
faqs: FAQs ABOUT DECOMEDO  How long does it take for DECOMEDO to show the results?  It may take up to 2-3 weeks for DECOMEDO to improve your acne. However, this period may vary from patient-to-patient depending upon the severity of acne. Therefore, regularly use DECOMEDO for the stipulated duration mentioned by your doctor.  Will DECOMEDO be more effective if I overuse it?  Do not overuse DECOMEDO. Excessive application of DECOMEDO may cause skin irritation and dryness. Therefore, use DECOMEDO only directed by your physician.  What precautions do I need to follow while using DECOMEDO?  Use DECOMEDO as directed by the physician. Avoid using DECOMEDO on inflamed, irritated, or sensitive skin areas. DECOMEDO may bleach your clothes, therefore avoid the contact of DECOMEDO with coloured fabrics. Before using DECOMEDO inform your doctor if you are pregnant or breastfeeding as a precaution. Contact your doctor if your skin condition worsens.  Can the use of DECOMEDO make my skin sensitive to sunlight?  Yes. DECOMEDO may make your skin more sensitive to sunlight. Therefore, use protective clothing while going outdoors. Do not exposure the affected part of the skin to the direct sunlight. Consult your doctor if you require any sunscreen to protect your skin while going outdoors. Consult your doctor if your skin condition worsens.  What are the common side effects of using DECOMEDO?  DECOMEDO may cause skin redness and peeling in some individuals during the first few weeks of therapy. If you experience this, stop using DECOMEDO for a short period until your skin recovers. However, consult your doctor immediately if your skin irritation becomes severe with redness, dryness, itching, stinging, or burning sensation.  Can DECOMEDO be used in children?  DECOMEDO is not recommended for use in children (aged below 12 years). It should be used in children and adolescents (aged 12 years or older) only if prescribed by the physician. Therefore, consult your doctor before using.  How does DECOMEDO works?  DECOMEDO acts by preventing the growth and multiplication of acne-causing bacteria. It can also open the skin pores and removes the accumulated dead skin cells and excess oil that triggers acne breakouts. Over time, it can also reduce oil production in the skin.  Can I use DECOMEDO to treat acne during pregnancy?  Currently, there are only limited data regarding the use of DECOMEDO in pregnant women. Therefore, consult your doctor before using DECOMEDO if you are pregnant or planning to become pregnant. Your doctor may prescribe you with DECOMEDO based on the risk and benefit ratio.

name: Deriva Bpo Gel 15gm
about: INTRODUCTION  DERIVA BPO GEL is a combination of Adapalene and Benzoyl peroxide which belongs to the group of medicines called Antiacne agents. It is used in the treatment of acne.  Acne vulgaris (commonly known as acne) is an inflammatory skin condition that occurs when the hair follicles present in the skin are clogged with excess oil and/or dead skin cells. It can also be aggravated by few bacteria (such as Propionibacterium acnes) and is highly common among on the teenagers and the young adults.  It primarily affects the face, upper arms, trunk or back and is often characterized by pus-filled pimples, red bumps with inflammatory and non-inflammatory lesions. DERIVA BPO GEL is suitable for use both in adults and in children (aged 9 years or older).  Apply a thin layer of DERIVA BPO GEL on the affected skin areas. Avoid contact of this medicine with your eyes, mouth, ears, nose or with open wounds. You must also protect your skin against sun light and against other light sources (such as UV lamps).  Do not use DERIVA BPO GEL if you are pregnant, think you may be pregnant or planning to have a baby. DERIVA BPO GEL can be used in breastfeeding women if required. The most common side effects of using DERIVA BPO GEL are dry skin, mild burning sensation and skin irritation, redness or scaling. Consult your doctor if they trouble you.
uses: USES OF DERIVA BPO GEL  It is used in adults, children and in adolescents (aged 9 years or older) to:  Treat acne
working: HOW DERIVA BPO GEL WORKS  DERIVA BPO GEL is a combination of two medicines namely, adapalene and benzoyl peroxide.  Adapalene is a topical retinoid (a type of vitamin A). It modulates the skin cell cycle and prevents the accumulation of excess sebum (natural oil produced by the skin) and dead skin cells on the hair follicles of the skin. It also reduces inflammation on the skin.  Benzoyl peroxide is a keratolytic agent with antimicrobial properties. It improves skin’s tendency to exfoliate the dead skin cells naturally. It also reduces the number of acne-causing bacteria on the skin which can reduce the further spread of acne.  Collectively, they unclog the hair follicles of the skin and exfoliates dead skin cells which reduces acne breakouts.
directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Apply a thin layer of this medicine on the affected skin areas or as directed by the physician. It is for topical use only. Wash your hands before and after application.  Your doctor will decide the correct dose and duration of therapy for you depending upon your age, body weight and health condition.  Avoid contact of DERIVA BPO GEL with your eyes, mouth, ears, nose, hair or with open wounds (cuts, scrapes or sunburn).
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF DERIVA BPO GEL COMMON Dry skin Skin redness and scaling Burning sensation of the skin Skin irritation UNCOMMON Itching of the skin (pruritus) Sunburn RARE  Stop using DERIVA BPO GEL and consult your doctor immediately if you experience:  Signs of allergic reaction (such as severe skin rash with itching of body parts, swelling of the eyes, face, lips or tongue causing throat tightness and breathing difficulties and feel faint)
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY  DERIVA BPO GEL is not recommended for use in pregnant women. Therefore, inform your doctor before using this medicine if you are pregnant, think you may be pregnant or planning to have a baby. If you became pregnant while using this medicine, stop using it and contact your doctor immediately.  BREASTFEEDING  DERIVA BPO GEL can be used in breastfeeding women. However, do not apply this medicine on your chest to avoid exposing this medicine to the nursing infant.  ALLERGY  Talk to your doctor if you are allergic to Adapalene or Benzoyl peroxide.  OTHERS  DERIVA BPO GEL is not recommended for use if you:  Have any cuts, scrapes, sunburn or eczema at the site of application  Use in Pediatrics:  DERIVA BPO GEL can be used in children and adolescents (aged 9 years or older) if advised by the physician. Therefore, consult your doctor before using it.
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug-Drug interactions:  Before using DERIVA BPO GEL, inform your doctor if you are using any of the following:  Other anti-acne medicines (such as clindamycin) Skin cosmetics (such as hair perming solutions, astringents, toners, shaving lotion, abrasive soaps or cleansers)  Overdosage:  If you or anyone else applied excessive amount of DERIVA BPO GEL, rinse your skin with plenty of cold water. If irritation persists, consult your doctor.
synopsis: SYNOPSIS Drug	:  	Adapalene, Benzoyl peroxide Pharmacological Category	:  	Retinoid-like compounds, Topical Antibiotics Therapeutic Indication	:  	Acne vulgaris Dosage Forms	:  	Topical Gel
moreInfo: MORE INFORMATION Keep DERIVA BPO GEL out of reach of children Store DERIVA BPO GEL at room temperature
faqs: FAQs ABOUT DERIVA BPO GEL  Will DERIVA BPO GEL be more effective if I overuse it?  No. Do not overuse this medicine. If you use more, you will not get rid of acne quicker. Instead, it may make your skin more irritated and red. Therefore, only apply the quantity mentioned by your doctor.  What are the side effects of using DERIVA BPO GEL?  DERIVA BPO GEL is generally safe with limited or no side effects. However, you may experience skin dryness, redness or irritation after applying this medicine. Contact your doctor if it troubles you.  What is the use of DERIVA BPO GEL?  DERIVA BPO GEL is used in the treatment of acne.  How DERIVA BPO GEL works?  DERIVA BPO GEL prevents the accumulation of excess sebum (natural oil produced by the skin) and dead skin cells on the hair follicles of the skin. It also reduces inflammation on the skin and improves skin’s tendency to exfoliate the dead skin cells naturally. It also reduces the number of acne-causing bacteria on the skin which can reduce the further spread of acne.  How to use DERIVA BPO GEL?  DERIVA BPO GEL is for external use only. Take the required quantity of the medicine and apply on the affected skin areas. Avoid contact of this medicine with your eyes, ears, nose or any other mucous membranes.  How long does it take for DERIVA BPO GEL to work?  It may take up to 2-3 weeks for DERIVA BPO GEL to show improvement in your skin condition. However, this period may vary from person-to-person depending upon the skin condition.  How long should I use DERIVA BPO GEL?  Your doctor will decide the correct dose and duration of therapy for you depending upon your age, body weight and health condition. You need to use DERIVA BPO GEL for the stipulated duration prescribed by your doctor. Failing to do so may not result in adequate response.  What to do if I forgot to apply DERIVA BPO GEL?  If you forgot to apply DERIVA BPO GEL, apply it as soon as you remember. However, if it is time for the next application, skip the missed one and apply the next dose. Do not excessively apply DERIVA BPO GEL to compensate the missed doses.  Is DERIVA BPO GEL safe?  DERIVA BPO GEL is safe at doses prescribed by the physician. Therefore, do not alter the dose of DERIVA BPO GEL without consulting your doctor.  Can I stop using DERIVA BPO GEL without consulting your doctor?  No. You should not stop using DERIVA BPO GEL without consulting your doctor as it may reduce its effectiveness. Therefore, apply DERIVA BPO GEL for the stipulated duration recommended by your doctor to achieve maximum results.  Can DERIVA BPO GEL be used in pregnant women?  DERIVA BPO GEL is not recommended for use in pregnant women. Therefore, inform your doctor before using this medicine if you are pregnant, think you may be pregnant or planning to have a baby. If you became pregnant while using this medicine, stop using it and contact your doctor immediately.

name: Deriva Cms Gel 15gm
about: INTRODUCTION  DERIVA CMS contains a combination of Adapalene and Clindamycin, which belongs to the group of medicines called topical retinoids and lincomycin antibiotics. It is used in the treatment of skin acne (pimple). Acne is a condition of the skin when the root of your hair (hair follicle) or skin pores gets clogged by oil or dead skin, which becomes prone to bacterial infection and the formation of pimples, blackheads, spots and scars.  Adapalene is a form of vitamin A, that acts as an antiacne agent by binding directly to the receptor of the skin which increases the rate of cell turnover (cell regeneration) and decreases oil secretion preventing clogging of the hair follicles and pores, also decreasing swelling/inflammation. Clindamycin works by binding to the ribosomal unit of the bacteria and disrupts the production of the protein essential for its survival. Before recommending DERIVA CMS, your doctor may advise you to have tests to understand your existing condition for planning effective treatment methods. Stay well hydrated and protect your skin from exposure to sunlight or UV light.  Do not apply DERIVA CMS if you are allergic to adapalene or clindamycin, a disorder of the digestive system (colitis), a disorder of the immune system or have bruises, cuts or burns on the skin. The common side effects of using this medicine may include dry skin, burning, itching, redness or irritative sensation of the skin, scaling peeling of the skin etc.
uses: USES OF DERIVA CMS To treat acne
working: HOW DERIVA CMS WORKS  Adapalene, a form of vitamin A, works as an antiacne medicine by attaching directly to the skin's receptor, which increases cell turnover (cell regeneration) and decreases oil secretion preventing blockage of the hair follicles and pores. It also reduces swelling/inflammation of the skin. Clindamycin works by attaching to the bacteria's ribosomal unit and disrupting the production of a protein required for its very own survival.
directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Apply DERIVA CMS as advised by your doctor. It is for external use on the skin only. Avoid applying DERIVA CMS around or onto your eyes, including eyelids.
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF DERIVA CMS COMMON Dryness of the skin Burning, itching, redness of the skin Scaling and or peeling of the skin UNCOMMON Flaring of acne Sunburns Local skin reaction  Stop using this medicine and contact your doctor immediately if you experience any of the following side effects:  Severe allergic reactions (such as skin rash, itching, swelling of the face, lips, tongue and other parts of the body, difficulty in breathing or wheezing, blisters on the skin, sore throat, fever, headache etc.)
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY  DERIVA CMS is not recommended for use in pregnant women. Consult your doctor for advice if you are pregnant or suspect/planning pregnancy.  BREASTFEEDING  DERIVA CMS is to be used with caution in breastfeeding mothers after consulting your doctor. The safe use of DERIVA CMS in breastfeeding women and breastfed baby is not established.  DRIVING AND USING MACHINES  DERIVA CMS may not interfere with your ability to drive or use the machine. However, protect your skin from sun or UV light while travelling and follow appropriate protective measures recommended by your doctor.  ALCOHOL  The risks associated with consuming alcohol are not known. It’s advised to avoid the consumption of alcohol while using DERIVA CMS, as it could aggravate your existing condition.  ALLERGY  Talk to your doctor if you are allergic to Adapalene and/or Clindamycin.  OTHERS  DERIVA CMS is not recommended for use if you:  Cuts or bruises on the skin Sunburns Skin conditions like eczema (itching, dry and red skin)  Use in pediatrics:  DERIVA CMS is not recommended for use in children less than 12 years of age. Consult your doctor for advice.  Use in geriatrics:  DERIVA CMS should be used with caution in the elderly (above 65 years of age) after consulting your doctor for advice.
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug-Drug interactions:  Inform your physician, if you are taking or using,  Medicated soap for skin, other cosmetic products with a high concentration of alcohol, astringents, sulfur,  Resorcinol – use for itching or irritation of the skin and scalp, loss of hair, dandruff etc. Salicylic acid – used for skin acne, dandruff, etc. Atracurium, cisatracurium, succinylcholine – used to relax muscles  B. Drug-Food interaction:  The interaction of foods with DERIVA CMS is not known. Consult your doctor for diet advice.  Overdosage:  In case of using DERIVA CMS in excess than recommended, you may experience dryness, scaling, redness and discomfort of the skin. Contact your doctor immediately for advice.
synopsis: SYNOPSIS Drug	:  	Adapalene, Clindamycin Pharmacological Category	:  	Topical retinoids and Antibiotics Therapeutic Indication	:  	Treat acne Dosage Forms	:  	Gel (topical), Gel, Cream, Ointment
moreInfo: MORE INFORMATION Keep out of reach from children Store at room temperature Keep away from sunlight
faqs: FAQs ABOUT DERIVA CMS  Can DERIVA CMS be used to treat scars on the skin?  Yes. Adapalene is a kind of vitamin A that reduces swelling and inflammation while also treating acne scars. Azithromycin is used to treat infections that cause skin infections to worsen.  Can DERIVA CMS result in skin peeling?  Yes. Dryness of the skin, burning, itching, redness of the skin, skin irritation, scaling, and possibly peeling of the skin are all possible side effects of using this medicine.  Can [GBBNKEYWORD] cause skin dryness?  Yes. Your skin may get dry as a result of taking this medication. Maintain hydration and use the moisturiser that your doctor has prescribed.  How long can I use DERIVA CMS?  Use DERIVA CMS as advised by your doctor. Generally, it’s recommended for use depending on the severity of the existing skin condition.  Can I stop using DERIVA CMS on my own?  No. It is not recommended to stop using DERIVA CMS on your own as it may worsen the existing skin condition. Consult your doctor for advice.

name: DERIVA I 10 Capsule 10's
about: INTRODUCTION  DERIVA I 10 CAPSULE contains Isotretinoin which belongs to the group of medicines called Retinoids. It is used in adults and children (older than 12 years of age) to treat severe form of acne (such as nodular acne, conglobate acne, and acne that is at risk of permanent scarring), which has not improved after other anti-acne treatments. Acne is an inflammatory skin condition which is characterized by spots, oily skin, nodular lesions etc. on face, back, and chest, which can be painful.  During treatment with DERIVA I 10 CAPSULE your doctor might conduct certain blood tests and pregnancy tests, and you will be supervised by a skin doctor. You will be advised to reduce intensive exercise and physical activity. Before you go out in the sun, use a sunscreen with a high protection factor (SPF 15 or higher).  Avoid too much sun and using a sun-lamp or sun-bed. Avoid consuming alcohol while taking DERIVA I 10 CAPSULE as it may cause side effects. Do not donate blood while consuming DERIVA I 10 CAPSULE and after stopping DERIVA I 10 CAPSULE at least for one month or undergo cosmetic procedures while taking DERIVA I 10 CAPSULE or at least for 6 months after stopping it.  DERIVA I 10 CAPSULE is not recommended for use in patients having liver or kidney disease, hyperlipidaemia (high blood lipid levels), high levels of Vitamin A. DERIVA I 10 CAPSULE should be used with caution in patients who have or had mental illness or family history of mental illness, asthma, diabetes, heart or bone problems like osteoporosis, or eating disorder.  DERIVA I 10 CAPSULE is not recommended for use in pregnant women, women planning a pregnancy, breast feeding women, and in children (below 12 years of age) so, consult your doctor for advice. DERIVA I 10 CAPSULE should be used with caution in elderly patients (65 years and older).  DERIVA I 10 CAPSULE may cause depression, psychosis, suicidal thoughts, or thoughts of self-harm in some patients. Consult your doctor if you experience any such behaviour or thoughts.  Most common side effects of taking DERIVA I 10 CAPSULE are dry skin of face and lips, joint or muscle pain, headache, easy bruising or bleeding, weakness, etc. Consult your doctor if any of the symptoms deteriorate.
uses: USES OF DERIVA I 10 CAPSULE Used in adults and children (older than 12 years of age) to treat severe form of acne which has not improved after other anti-acne treatments
working: HOW DERIVA I 10 CAPSULE WORKS  DERIVA I 10 CAPSULE helps in treating acne by inhibiting the function of sebaceous glands (oil glands in skin) thus, reducing the secretion of oil (sebum) in the skin. DERIVA I 10 CAPSULE also inhibits keratinization (development of a horn-like character by the epithelial tissue), which might be a cause of acne.
directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Take DERIVA I 10 CAPSULE as advised by your physician. Do not crush or chew it. Swallow DERIVA I 10 CAPSULE as whole with a glass of water or a mouthful of food. Take it on a full stomach. Your doctor will decide the right dose and duration of therapy for you according to your age, body weight and disease condition.
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF DERIVA I 10 CAPSULE COMMON Dry skin, especially of the lips and face, inflamed skin, chapped and inflamed lips, rash, mild itching, slight peeling More fragile and red skin than usual, especially of the face Back, muscle or joint pain (particularly in children and teenagers) Inflammation of the eye and eyelid area, dry and irritated eyes Raised liver enzymes Changed blood fat and cholesterol levels Easy bruising, bleeding or clotting Anaemia (weakness, dizziness, pale skin) Headache Protein or blood in the urine Becoming more prone to get infections Dry and crusted inside of the nose causing mild nosebleeds Sore or inflamed throat and nose RARE Hair loss  Stop taking DERIVA I 10 CAPSULE and consult your doctor immediately in case you experience any of the following:  Persistent pain in your lower back or buttocks (signs of sacroiliitis) Severe skin reactions (Ex. erythema multiforme, Stevens-Johnson Syndrome, toxic epidermal necrolysis) (blistering and peeling of skin, severe rashes, fever, multiple lesions especially in mouth, nose, eyes and genitals, conjunctivitis, flu-like symptoms) Depression or related disorders (sad or altered mood, anxiety, emotional discomfort), worsening depression, becoming violent or aggressive Thoughts or feelings about hurting self or ending own lives, suicide attempts or suicide Unusual behaviour Psychosis (loss of contact with reality, like hearing voices or seeing things that are not real) Serious reactions (trouble breathing or swallowing due to sudden swelling of the throat, face, lips and mouth, sudden swelling of the hands, feet and ankles, hives, bruises, eczema, bruising, red patches on hands and legs) Sudden tight chest, breathlessness and wheezing, particularly if you have asthma Rhabdomyolysis (muscle weakness along with trouble moving arms or legs, painful, swollen, bruised areas of the body, dark urine, reduced or no urination, confusion or dehydration) Hepatitis (yellow skin or eyes, tiredness) Kidney inflammation (difficulty urinating, swollen and puffy eyelids, excessive tiredness) Increased intracranial pressure (continuous headache, along with nausea, vomiting and eyesight changes including blurred vision) Serious gut conditions (severe tummy pain, with or without severe bloody diarrhoea, nausea, vomiting) Vision problems like night vision problems, persistent dryness of eyes, intolerance to contact lenses Inflamed pancreas Hearing problems, ringing sound in ears Severe muscle weakness, muscle, joint, back pain, difficulty moving especially after exercise
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY  DERIVA I 10 CAPSULE is not recommended for use in pregnant women and women planning a pregnancy. Inform your doctor if you become pregnant during treatment with DERIVA I 10 CAPSULE. It is not recommended to get pregnant for one month after stopping DERIVA I 10 CAPSULE treatment because some medicine may still be left in your body. Consult your doctor before taking it.  Contraception must be used for a month before taking DERIVA I 10 CAPSULE, during treatment and for a month afterwards. Discuss with your doctor regarding suitable contraceptive methods.  BREASTFEEDING  DERIVA I 10 CAPSULE is not recommended for use in breast feeding women as it may pass through breast milk. Consult your doctor before taking it.  DRIVING AND USING MACHINES  Do not drive or operate machinery if you experience dizziness, drowsiness or decreased night vision after taking DERIVA I 10 CAPSULE.  ALCOHOL  Avoid consuming alcohol while taking DERIVA I 10 CAPSULE as it may increase side effects. Inform your doctor if you are an alcoholic.  KIDNEY  DERIVA I 10 CAPSULE should be used with caution in patients with kidney problems. Consult your doctor before taking it.  LIVER  DERIVA I 10 CAPSULE is not recommended for use in patients with liver disease. Consult your doctor before taking it.  ALLERGY  Do not take DERIVA I 10 CAPSULE if you are allergic to Isotretinoin, soya, peanuts or any of the other ingredients of this medicine.  LUNGS  DERIVA I 10 CAPSULE should be used with caution in patients having asthma. Consult your doctor before taking it.  OTHERS  DERIVA I 10 CAPSULE is not recommended for use if you have:  High blood fat levels High levels of Vitamin A  Before taking DERIVA I 10 CAPSULE inform your doctor if you:  Have or had mental illness or family history of mental illness such as depression, mood disorders, psychosis, aggressive behaviour, or hurting or killing self Have diabetes Are fructose intolerant Are overweight  Use in paediatrics:  DERIVA I 10 CAPSULE is not recommended for use in children below 12 years of age. DERIVA I 10 CAPSULE can be used in adolescents (more than 12 years of age) only after puberty. Consult your child’s doctor for advice.  Use in geriatrics:  There is no proper information about the use of DERIVA I 10 CAPSULE in elderly patients. Consult your doctor before taking it.
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug-Drug interactions:  Before taking DERIVA I 10 CAPSULE, inform your doctor if you are taking any of the following medicines:  Vitamin A supplements Medicines used to treat bacterial infections (Ex. minocycline, doxycycline) Phenytoin (used to treat fits) Medicines used to treat various inflammatory conditions (Ex. betamethasone, prednisolone, dexamethasone) Medicines used to prevent pregnancy (Ex. Norethindrone, ethinyl Oestradiol) St. John’s wort (herbal medicine used to treat mental disorders) Other medicines used to treat acne like keratolytic or exfoliative agents (Ex. salicylic acid, benzoyl peroxide)  Overdosage:  In case you or anybody else accidently take too much of DERIVA I 10 CAPSULE, consult your doctor immediately or visit the nearby hospital. Symptoms of DERIVA I 10 CAPSULE overdose are severe headache, abdominal pain, nausea, dizziness, redness of face, vomiting, somnolence, irritability, and itching.
synopsis: SYNOPSIS Drug	:  	  Isotretinoin   Pharmacological Category	:  	  Retinoids    Therapeutic Indication	:  	  Severe Acne   Dosage Forms	:  	  Tablet, Soft gel Capsule, Capsule
moreInfo: MORE INFORMATION Keep DERIVA I 10 CAPSULE out of reach of children Store DERIVA I 10 CAPSULE between 15-30°C
faqs: FAQs ABOUT DERIVA I 10 CAPSULE  Can DERIVA I 10 CAPSULE cause irregular periods?  According to some studies, menstrual irregularity was observed during treatment follow-ups. Consult your doctor if you experience irregularity in your periods during treatment with DERIVA I 10 CAPSULE.  Is DERIVA I 10 CAPSULE safe to take in pregnancy?  No. DERIVA I 10 CAPSULE is not recommended for use in pregnant women and women planning a pregnancy. Inform your doctor if you become pregnant during treatment with DERIVA I 10 CAPSULE. It is not recommended to get pregnant for one month after stopping DERIVA I 10 CAPSULE treatment because some medicine may still be left in your body. Consult your doctor before taking it. Contraception must be used for a month before taking DERIVA I 10 CAPSULE, during treatment and for a month afterwards. Discuss with your doctor regarding suitable contraceptive methods.  Can I play sports during DERIVA I 10 CAPSULE treatment?  Cut down on extreme exercise and physical activity as DERIVA I 10 CAPSULE can cause muscle and joint pain especially in children and teenagers taking up vigorous physical activity. Consult your doctor if you can play sports during this treatment.  Can I go out in the sun during DERIVA I 10 CAPSULE treatment?  Sensitivity to light may increase during treatment with DERIVA I 10 CAPSULE so, avoid going too much into the sun and don’t use a sun-lamp or sun-bed. Before you go out in the sun, wear sunglasses and use sunscreen with a high protection factor (SPF 15 or higher).  Can undergo cosmetic procedures while taking DERIVA I 10 CAPSULE?  No. Do not undergo cosmetic procedures such as skin waxing, dermabrasion, laser, or artificial UV light detanning while taking DERIVA I 10 CAPSULE or at least for 6 months after stopping it as they could cause scarring, skin irritation, or changes in your skin colour. Consult your doctor before undergoing any cosmetic procedure while taking DERIVA I 10 CAPSULE.

name: Deriva MS Gel 15gm
faqs: FAQs ABOUT DERIVA MS GEL Q: Can DERIVA MS GEL be used in the morning?  A: Apply DERIVA MS GEL as advised by your physician. It is best when applied at night and washed off in the morning since it is sensitive to sunlight. Consult your doctor for further queries.  Q: Can DERIVA MS GEL cause skin irritation?  A: DERIVA MS GEL may cause slight sensation of warmth and stinging after applying it for the initial 2-4 weeks. However, during the long-term usage this side effect usually disappears. Consult your doctor in case of any queries.  Q: Can DERIVA MS GEL be used daily?  A: In many cases, DERIVA MS GEL products are initially used once daily in the evening. However, some individuals may be advised to start with less frequent applications to allow the skin to adjust, and then gradually increase the frequency.  Q: Can DERIVA MS GEL make skin darker?  A: DERIVA MS GEL doesn’t make skin darker. Instead, it can slightly make the skin lighter by healing acne, pimples, blackheads and spots. Consult your doctor for further queries.  Q: Can I go outside after applying DERIVA MS GEL?  A: No, avoid going out after applying DERIVA MS GEL as it can cause local irritation and skin discomfort. It is best used at night. Consult the doctor for further assistance.  Q: Can DERIVA MS GEL be used for other skin conditions?  A: DERIVA MS GEL is primarily indicated for acne, but it may also be used off-label to manage other skin conditions such as keratosis pilaris (a common, harmless skin condition characterized by small, rough bumps on the skin).  Q: Can DERIVA MS GEL be used with other acne medications?  A: It's generally not recommended to use DERIVA MS GEL with other topical acne medications containing benzoyl peroxide, sulphur, resorcinol, or salicylic acid, as they may increase the risk of skin irritation. However, your healthcare provider may prescribe a combination regimen if deemed appropriate.  Q: Can DERIVA MS GEL be applied under makeup or moisturizers?  A: Yes, DERIVA MS GEL can be applied under makeup or moisturizers once it has been fully absorbed into the skin. It's important to allow the gel to dry completely before applying any other skincare products to avoid potential interactions or reduced effectiveness.  Q: Can DERIVA MS GEL be used for acne scars?  A: DERIVA MS GEL is primarily indicated for the management of acne lesions and may help improve the appearance of post-inflammatory hyperpigmentation (dark spots) caused by acne. However, it may have limited efficacy in managing deeper acne scars or pitted scars. Consult your healthcare provider for more information.  Q: Can DERIVA MS GEL be used during pregnancy or breastfeeding?  A: It's important to consult your healthcare provider before using DERIVA MS GEL if you are pregnant, planning to become pregnant, or breastfeeding. While topical retinoids are generally considered safe during pregnancy, it's best to discuss the potential risks and benefits with your doctor.

name: DERMADEW B Bar 75gm
about: INTRODUCTION  Dermadew B-Bar is a gentle cleanser used for your baby’s delicate skin to make the skin smooth, soft, supple, and refreshed. It contains SCI and coconut oil, glycerine, vitamin E, shea butter, lanolin and turmeric oil as active ingredients that helps moisturize and soothe the skin.  Shea butter moisturises and makes the skin smooth, and also possesses anti-inflammatory properties which reduces skin inflammation. Vitamin E gives antioxidant effect. Glycerine hydrates the skin and seals the moisture content thereby reducing dryness.  Coconut oil helps in soothing skin and reduces skin irritation without clogging the pores. Turmeric oil contains antioxidant and anti-inflammatory properties that provides glow to the skin. Lanolin acts as a moisturiser that treats dry, scaly, itchy skin and minor skin irritations like diaper rash.  Always use Dermadew B-Bar as advised by your physician. It is for external use only. Stop using it if any skin irritation occurs.
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF DERMADEW B BAR  Consult your doctor if your child experiences any unusual side effects while using Dermadew B-Bar.
moreInfo: MORE INFORMATION Keep Dermadew B-Bar out of reach and sight of children Store in a cool and dry place
faqs: FAQs ABOUT DERMADEW B BAR  Q: Can Dermadew B-Bar be used by adults?  A: Ask your doctor before using Dermadew B-Bar. The doctor will determine a proper amount or recommend a suitable alternative for you.  Q: What if Dermadew B-Bar accidentally gets in my child’s eyes?  A: If Dermadew B-Bar accidentally gets in your child’s eyes, rinse your eyes with large amounts of cool water. Consult your doctor if any discomfort occurs.  Q: Is Dermadew B-Bar suitable for dry skin?  A: Dermadew B-Bar contains ingredients which helps retain moisture, so it can be used to reduce dryness of skin. Consult your doctor for further queries.  Q: Can Dermadew B-Bar cause skin irritation?  A: This soap may cause skin irritation in some children. Consult your doctor if you notice any such effects while using it.  Q: Does Dermadew B-Bar help in skin infection?  A: Dermadew B-Bar contains coconut oil that has antimicrobial and antifungal properties due to its MCT content, specifically, lauric acid. Consult your doctor for further advice.

name: Dersol 12% Ointment 25gm
about: INTRODUCTION  DERSOL 12% OINTMENT contains Salicylic acid which belongs to the group of medicines called Keratolytic agents. DERSOL 12% OINTMENT is used treat and prevent skin conditions such as acne, blemishes (discolored spot-on skin), skin redness, and other skin diseases.  It is also used to treat and prevent dandruff, corn & calluses (thickened layers of skin) in affected individuals.  DERSOL 12% OINTMENT is not recommended for use in patients allergic to salicylic acid. It is also not recommended for use in patients with active inflammation/dermatitis, infection (at the application site), acute viral infection, skin malignancy, and/or tanned skin.  Before applying DERSOL 12% OINTMENT, inform your doctor if you are scheduled for surgery, and/or suffering from any kidney problems.  DERSOL 12% OINTMENT is generally not recommended for use in pregnant women. It is considered to be safe to be used in breastfeeding women. Avoid applying the medicine on skin areas which might come in direct contact with infant’s skin.  DERSOL 12% OINTMENT should be used with caution in children and adolescents (aged 1-15 years). It is also advised to be used with caution in elderly patients (aged above 65 years). Consult your doctor before applying the medicine.  The most common side effects of applying DERSOL 12% OINTMENT are erythema (skin redness), and/or dryness of skin. Consult your doctor if any of these symptoms worsens.
uses: USES OF DERSOL 12% OINTMENT  Treats and Prevents:  Acne, skin diseases, blemishes (discolored spot-on skin), and skin redness Dandruff, corn & calluses (thickened layers of skin) in affected individuals
working: HOW DERSOL 12% OINTMENT WORKS  DERSOL 12% OINTMENT works by penetrating the affected area of skin and causing destruction to the bacteria which also reduces oil production in the skin thus treating and preventing the occurrence of skin conditions such as acne, blemishes, dandruff, and corn & calluses in affected individuals.
directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Always apply DERSOL 12% OINTMENT as directed by your physician. It is for external use only. Wash your hands before use and work into a lather by adding water. Apply a thin layer and massage over wet skin/affected skin area. Avoid applying this medicine around your eyes, including eyelids. Your doctor will decide the correct dose and duration for you depending upon your age, body weight and disease condition.
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF DERSOL 12% OINTMENT COMMON Erythema (skin redness) Dryness of skin RARE Undesirable pigment loss at the site of application Scar  Stop applying DERSOL 12% OINTMENT and contact your doctor immediately if you experience any of the following side effects:  Excessive burning, stinging or peeling at the site of application
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY  DERSOL 12% OINTMENT is generally not recommended for use in pregnant women. Consult your doctor before applying DERSOL 12% OINTMENT.  BREASTFEEDING  DERSOL 12% OINTMENT is considered to be safe to be used in breastfeeding women. Avoid applying the medicine on skin areas which might come in direct contact with infant’s skin. Consult your doctor before applying the medicine.  KIDNEY  DERSOL 12% OINTMENT is used with caution in patients with kidney problems. Consult your doctor before applying the medicine.  ALLERGY  Do not use DERSOL 12% OINTMENT if you are allergic to salicylic acid and/or any other ingredients of this medicine.  OTHERS  DERSOL 12% OINTMENT is not recommended for use if you have :  Active inflammation/dermatitis Infection at the application site Acute viral infection Skin malignancy Tanned skin  Before applying DERSOL 12% OINTMENT, inform your doctor if you:  Are scheduled for surgery  Use in Paediatrics:  DERSOL 12% OINTMENT should be used with caution in children and adolescents (aged 1-15 years). Consult your doctor before applying the medicine.  Use in Geriatrics:  DERSOL 12% OINTMENT should be used with caution in elderly patients (aged above 65 years). Consult your doctor before applying the medicine.
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug - Drug interactions:  Inform your doctor about your current list of medications, over the counter products such as vitamins, herbal supplements. Etc.  Overdosage:  If you or anyone else applied too much of DERSOL 12% OINTMENT or accidentally swallowed the medicine, consult your doctor immediately or visit the nearby hospital to manage the overdose symptoms.
synopsis: SYNOPSIS Drug	:  	Salicylic acid Pharmacological Category	:  	Keratolytic agent Therapeutic Indication	:  	Acne, Skin diseases, Blemishes (discolored spot-on skin), Skin redness, Dandruff, corn & calluses (thickened layers of skin) Dosage Forms	:  	Ointment, Gel, Face Wash, Foam Wash
moreInfo: MORE INFORMATION Keep DERSOL 12% OINTMENT out of reach of children Store DERSOL 12% OINTMENT room temperature
faqs: FAQs ABOUT DERSOL 12% OINTMENT  What is DERSOL 12% OINTMENT used for?  DERSOL 12% OINTMENT is used treat and prevent skin conditions such as acne, blemishes (discolored spot-on skin), skin redness, and other skin diseases. It is also used to treat and prevent dandruff, corn & calluses (thickened layers of skin) in affected individuals.  How to apply DERSOL 12% OINTMENT?  Always apply DERSOL 12% OINTMENT as directed by your physician. It is for external use only. Wash your hands before use and work into a lather by adding water. Apply a thin layer and massage over wet skin/affected skin area. Avoid applying this medicine around your eyes, including eyelids. Your doctor will decide the correct dose and duration for you depending upon your age, body weight and disease condition.  What are the side effects of DERSOL 12% OINTMENT?  The most common side effects of using DERSOL 12% OINTMENT are erythema (skin redness), and/or dryness of skin. Consult your doctor if any of these symptoms worsens.  How DERSOL 12% OINTMENT works?  DERSOL 12% OINTMENT works by penetrating the affected area of skin and causing destruction to the bacteria which also reduces oil production in the skin thus treating and preventing the occurrence of skin conditions such as acne, blemishes, dandruff, and corn & calluses in affected individuals.  Can DERSOL 12% OINTMENT be used in pregnant and breastfeeding women?  DERSOL 12% OINTMENT is advised not to be used in pregnant women as it may cause undesirable effects to the foetus. It is considered safe to be used in breastfeeding women. Consult your doctor before applying DERSOL 12% OINTMENT.
