about: INTRODUCTION  DERSOL 30% OINTMENT contains Salicylic acid which belongs to the group of medicines called Keratolytic agents. DERSOL 30% OINTMENT is used treat and prevent skin conditions such as acne, blemishes (discolored spot-on skin), skin redness, and other skin diseases.  It is also used to treat and prevent dandruff, corn & calluses (thickened layers of skin) in affected individuals.  DERSOL 30% OINTMENT is not recommended for use in patients allergic to salicylic acid. It is also not recommended for use in patients with active inflammation/dermatitis, infection (at the application site), acute viral infection, skin malignancy, and/or tanned skin.  Before applying DERSOL 30% OINTMENT, inform your doctor if you are scheduled for surgery, and/or suffering from any kidney problems.  DERSOL 30% OINTMENT is generally not recommended for use in pregnant women. It is considered to be safe to be used in breastfeeding women. Avoid applying the medicine on skin areas which might come in direct contact with infant’s skin.  DERSOL 30% OINTMENT should be used with caution in children and adolescents (aged 1-15 years). It is also advised to be used with caution in elderly patients (aged above 65 years). Consult your doctor before applying the medicine.  The most common side effects of applying DERSOL 30% OINTMENT are erythema (skin redness), and/or dryness of skin. Consult your doctor if any of these symptoms worsens.
uses: USES OF DERSOL 30% OINTMENT  Treats and Prevents:  Acne, skin diseases, blemishes (discolored spot-on skin), and skin redness Dandruff, corn & calluses (thickened layers of skin) in affected individuals
working: HOW DERSOL 30% OINTMENT WORKS  DERSOL 30% OINTMENT works by penetrating the affected area of skin and causing destruction to the bacteria which also reduces oil production in the skin thus treating and preventing the occurrence of skin conditions such as acne, blemishes, dandruff, and corn & calluses in affected individuals.
directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Always apply DERSOL 30% OINTMENT as directed by your physician. It is for external use only. Wash your hands before use and work into a lather by adding water. Apply a thin layer and massage over wet skin/affected skin area. Avoid applying this medicine around your eyes, including eyelids. Your doctor will decide the correct dose and duration for you depending upon your age, body weight and disease condition.
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF DERSOL 30% OINTMENT COMMON Erythema (skin redness) Dryness of skin RARE Undesirable pigment loss at the site of application Scar  Stop applying DERSOL 30% OINTMENT and contact your doctor immediately if you experience any of the following side effects:  Excessive burning, stinging or peeling at the site of application
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY  DERSOL 30% OINTMENT is generally not recommended for use in pregnant women. Consult your doctor before applying DERSOL 30% OINTMENT.  BREASTFEEDING  DERSOL 30% OINTMENT is considered to be safe to be used in breastfeeding women. Avoid applying the medicine on skin areas which might come in direct contact with infant’s skin. Consult your doctor before applying the medicine.  KIDNEY  DERSOL 30% OINTMENT is used with caution in patients with kidney problems. Consult your doctor before applying the medicine.  ALLERGY  Do not use DERSOL 30% OINTMENT if you are allergic to salicylic acid and/or any other ingredients of this medicine.  OTHERS  DERSOL 30% OINTMENT is not recommended for use if you have :  Active inflammation/dermatitis Infection at the application site Acute viral infection Skin malignancy Tanned skin  Before applying DERSOL 30% OINTMENT, inform your doctor if you:  Are scheduled for surgery  Use in Paediatrics:  DERSOL 30% OINTMENT should be used with caution in children and adolescents (aged 1-15 years). Consult your doctor before applying the medicine.  Use in Geriatrics:  DERSOL 30% OINTMENT should be used with caution in elderly patients (aged above 65 years). Consult your doctor before applying the medicine.
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug - Drug interactions:  Inform your doctor about your current list of medications, over the counter products such as vitamins, herbal supplements. Etc.  Overdosage:  If you or anyone else applied too much of DERSOL 30% OINTMENT or accidentally swallowed the medicine, consult your doctor immediately or visit the nearby hospital to manage the overdose symptoms.
synopsis: SYNOPSIS Drug	:  	Salicylic acid Pharmacological Category	:  	Keratolytic agent Therapeutic Indication	:  	Acne, Skin diseases, Blemishes (discolored spot-on skin), Skin redness, Dandruff, corn & calluses (thickened layers of skin) Dosage Forms	:  	Ointment, Gel, Face Wash, Foam Wash

faqs: FAQs ABOUT DERSOL 30% OINTMENT  What is DERSOL 30% OINTMENT used for?  DERSOL 30% OINTMENT is used treat and prevent skin conditions such as acne, blemishes (discolored spot-on skin), skin redness, and other skin diseases. It is also used to treat and prevent dandruff, corn & calluses (thickened layers of skin) in affected individuals.  How to apply DERSOL 30% OINTMENT?  Always apply DERSOL 30% OINTMENT as directed by your physician. It is for external use only. Wash your hands before use and work into a lather by adding water. Apply a thin layer and massage over wet skin/affected skin area. Avoid applying this medicine around your eyes, including eyelids. Your doctor will decide the correct dose and duration for you depending upon your age, body weight and disease condition.  What are the side effects of DERSOL 30% OINTMENT?  The most common side effects of using DERSOL 30% OINTMENT are erythema (skin redness), and/or dryness of skin. Consult your doctor if any of these symptoms worsens.  How DERSOL 30% OINTMENT works?  DERSOL 30% OINTMENT works by penetrating the affected area of skin and causing destruction to the bacteria which also reduces oil production in the skin thus treating and preventing the occurrence of skin conditions such as acne, blemishes, dandruff, and corn & calluses in affected individuals.  Can DERSOL 30% OINTMENT be used in pregnant and breastfeeding women?  DERSOL 30% OINTMENT is advised not to be used in pregnant women as it may cause undesirable effects to the foetus. It is considered safe to be used in breastfeeding women. Consult your doctor before applying DERSOL 30% OINTMENT.

name: Dremz Cream 20gm
about: INTRODUCTION  DREMZ CREAM is a combination of Hydroquinone, Tretinoin, Mometasone furoate which belongs to the group of medicines called Depigmenting agents, Retinoids and Corticosteroids respectively. It is used in adults for the treatment of moderate to severe melasma (dark spots on the skin) in association with sun-avoidance measures, like using sunscreens and wearing protective clothing.  Melasma is one of the most frequently acquired hyperpigmentation (excess melanin production) disorders with symptoms such as symmetrical brown patches on sun exposed areas mainly on face.  It is advised to avoid exposure to sun during treatment with DREMZ CREAM for better results. While going out apply sunscreens and wear full covering protective clothes.  Before using DREMZ CREAM inform your doctor if you have any liver, kidney, lung or heart diseases.  Safety and efficacy of DREMZ CREAM is not established in pregnant women and in children below 12 years of age. Ask for your doctor’s advice before using. DREMZ CREAM should be used with caution in breastfeeding women.  The most common side effects of using DREMZ CREAM are mild burning, stinging, redness and dryness. Consult your doctor if any of the symptoms worsen or doesn’t improve.
uses: USES OF DREMZ CREAM  It is used in adults to  Treats moderate to severe melasma (dark spots on the skin)
working: HOW DREMZ CREAM WORKS  DREMZ CREAM helps in treating melasma where Hydroquinone is a skin bleaching agent that blocks enzyme tyrosinase which is responsible for the production of melanin that cause pigmentation. Thus, it helps for fading of dark spots in skin. Tretinoin helps to recover the damage to the skin caused by sun exposure (photodamage) by thickening skin layer and loss of keratinized cells.it helps to rejuvenate the skin. Mometasone furoate blocks prostaglandin synthesis and reduces redness, swelling and itching caused by tretinoin and other skin infections.
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF DREMZ CREAM COMMON Mild burning Stinging Redness Dryness RARE  Stop using DREMZ CREAM and consult your doctor immediately if you experience any of the following:  Infraorbital and paranasal fissures
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY  The safety and efficacy of DREMZ CREAM is not being established in pregnant women. Consult with your doctor before using.  BREASTFEEDING  DREMZ CREAM should be used with caution in breast feeding women. Consult with your doctor before using.  ALLERGY  Do not use DREMZ CREAM if you are allergic to Hydroquinone, Tretinoin, Mometasone or any other constituents of this medicine. Consult your doctor before using.  OTHERS  Use in paediatrics:  The safety and efficacy of DREMZ CREAM is not being established in children below 12 years of age. Consult with your child’s doctor before using it for your child.  Use in geriatrics:  There is no information on the use of DREMZ CREAM in elderly patients. Consult your doctor before using DREMZ CREAM.
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug – drug interactions:  Before using DREMZ CREAM, inform your doctor if you are taking, have taken or might take any other medicine, including prescription, non-prescription or any herbal medicine.  Overdosage:  If you or anyone else accidentally ingests or apply too much of DREMZ CREAM, consult your doctor immediately.
synopsis: SYNOPSIS Drug	:  	Hydroquinone, Tretinoin, Mometasone Pharmacological Category	:  	Hypopigmenting agents, Retinoids, Corticosteroids Therapeutic Indication	:  	Melasma Dosage Forms	:  	Cream, Gel, Ointment, Soap
moreInfo: MORE INFORMATION Keep DREMZ CREAM out of reach of children Store DREMZ CREAM at room temperature not exceeding 25°C
faqs: FAQs ABOUT DREMZ CREAM  What is DREMZ CREAM used for?  DREMZ CREAM is used in adults for the treatment of moderate to severe melasma (dark spots on the skin) in association with sun-avoidance measures, like using sunscreens and wearing protective clothing. Consult doctor before using.  How to use DREMZ CREAM?  Apply DREMZ CREAM as advised by your physician. It is for external use only. Wash your hands before and after applying DREMZ CREAM. Wash your face with a mild soap and dry properly and gently massage the medicine until it is absorbed. Avoid contact with your eyes, nose, mouth, mucous membrane. Your doctor will decide the correct dose and duration for you depending upon your age, body weight and disease condition.  Can I use DREMZ CREAM to treat wounds?  DREMZ CREAM is not recommended to use on wounds and  ulcerated skin . Consult doctor before using DREMZ CREAM.  Do I need to take any precaution while using DREMZ CREAM?  It is advised to reduce exposure to sun during treatment with DREMZ CREAM for better results. While going out apply sunscreens and wear full covering protective clothes. Exposure to sunlight or ultra-violet light will cause repigmentation of lightened skin. Do not apply DREMZ CREAM to broken skin.  What is the best time to use DREMZ CREAM?  It is advised to use DREMZ CREAM before bedtime. This will reduce the chances of exposure of the treated skin to sun. However, ask for your doctor’s advice before using.

name: DS ACNE Face Wash 100gm
about: INTRODUCTION  DS Acne Face Wash is an antiacne agent used to treat acne and helps to hydrate and condition your skin as it cleans away and dirt and impurities, for a smooth and fresh feeling. It contains salicylic acid, tocopheryl acetate and dead sea mineral as active ingredients that helps to provide deep cleanse action.  The natural ingredients of DS Acne Face Wash like salicylic acid, tocopheryl acetate and dead sea mineral help to open the pores of the skin, removes the deposition of excess oil and dirt. It helps eliminate acne bacterium and prevents excess sebum production. Together, helps to treat acne effectively.  Use DS Acne Face Wash as advised by the doctor. It is for external use only. Wet face and neck, squeeze a dime size amount into the palm of your hand, rub hands together and gently massage over face and neck. Rinse thoroughly and repeat if necessary. Use twice a day morning and evening or as directed by the doctor. It is not recommended for use in children under 3 years of age.
authorDetails: AUTHOR DETAILS  Written By Dr. N. Sai Swaroop, Pharm.D Last updated on 26 Apr 2023 | 06:05 PM(IST)

name: EGA Night Cream 30gm
about: INTRODUCTION  EGA Night Cream is an advanced formula based on multisal technology which is a double-layered encapsulation of retinol. It mainly contains retinol, phytonadione and hexapeptide-11 as active ingredients to decrease the appearance of fine lines, wrinkles and age spots thereby protecting the elasticity and firmness of the skin.  Retinol helps to promote cell turnover and enhance the appearance of fine lines and wrinkles, skin discoloration and blemishes. Phytonadione (vitamin K) enhances skin elasticity and speeds up the skin healing process. Hexapeptides increase collagen synthesis for improved tone, minimizing the appearance of fine lines and wrinkles and it also enhances cellular oxygen consumption.  Always use EGA Night Cream as advised by your physician. It is for external use only. Do not use EGA Night Cream during the daytime. Wash the face and pat dry. Take enough cream and spread evenly on the face including areas around the eyes and leave it overnight. Do not use EGA Night Cream if you are allergic to any of its ingredients.
authorDetails: AUTHOR DETAILS  Written By Dr. R. Dinesh John Rajkumar, Pharm.D Last updated on 29 Jun 2023 | 05:44 PM(IST)

directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Apply ELOSONE HT CREAM as advised by your physician. It is for external use only. Wash your hands before and after applying ELOSONE HT CREAM. Avoid exposure to sunlight while using this medicine. Your doctor will decide the correct dose and duration for you depending upon your age, body weight and disease condition.
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF ELOSONE HT CREAM COMMON Mild burning Stinging Redness Dryness RARE  Stop using ELOSONE HT CREAM and consult your doctor immediately if you experience any of the following:  Infraorbital and paranasal fissures
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY  The safety and efficacy of ELOSONE HT CREAM is not being established in pregnant women. Consult with your doctor before using.  BREASTFEEDING  ELOSONE HT CREAM should be used with caution in breast feeding women. Consult with your doctor before using.  ALLERGY  Do not use ELOSONE HT CREAM if you are allergic to Hydroquinone, Tretinoin, Mometasone or any other constituents of this medicine. Consult your doctor before using.  OTHERS  Use in paediatrics:  The safety and efficacy of ELOSONE HT CREAM is not being established in children below 12 years of age. Consult with your child’s doctor before using it for your child.  Use in geriatrics:  There is no information on the use of ELOSONE HT CREAM in elderly patients. Consult your doctor before using ELOSONE HT CREAM.
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug – drug interactions:  Before using ELOSONE HT CREAM, inform your doctor if you are taking, have taken or might take any other medicine, including prescription, non-prescription or any herbal medicine.  Overdosage:  If you or anyone else accidentally ingests or apply too much of ELOSONE HT CREAM, consult your doctor immediately.
synopsis: SYNOPSIS Drug	:  	Hydroquinone, Tretinoin, Mometasone Pharmacological Category	:  	Hypopigmenting agents, Retinoids, Corticosteroids Therapeutic Indication	:  	Melasma Dosage Forms	:  	Cream, Gel, Ointment, Soap
moreInfo: MORE INFORMATION Keep ELOSONE HT CREAM out of reach of children Store ELOSONE HT CREAM at room temperature not exceeding 25°C
faqs: FAQs ABOUT ELOSONE HT CREAM  What is ELOSONE HT CREAM used for?  ELOSONE HT CREAM is used in adults for the treatment of moderate to severe melasma (dark spots on the skin) in association with sun-avoidance measures, like using sunscreens and wearing protective clothing. Consult doctor before using.  How to use ELOSONE HT CREAM?  Apply ELOSONE HT CREAM as advised by your physician. It is for external use only. Wash your hands before and after applying ELOSONE HT CREAM. Wash your face with a mild soap and dry properly and gently massage the medicine until it is absorbed. Avoid contact with your eyes, nose, mouth, mucous membrane. Your doctor will decide the correct dose and duration for you depending upon your age, body weight and disease condition.  Can I use ELOSONE HT CREAM to treat wounds?  ELOSONE HT CREAM is not recommended to use on wounds and  ulcerated skin . Consult doctor before using ELOSONE HT CREAM.  Do I need to take any precaution while using ELOSONE HT CREAM?  It is advised to reduce exposure to sun during treatment with ELOSONE HT CREAM for better results. While going out apply sunscreens and wear full covering protective clothes. Exposure to sunlight or ultra-violet light will cause repigmentation of lightened skin. Do not apply ELOSONE HT CREAM to broken skin.  What is the best time to use ELOSONE HT CREAM?  It is advised to use ELOSONE HT CREAM before bedtime. This will reduce the chances of exposure of the treated skin to sun. However, ask for your doctor’s advice before using.

name: Epiduo Gel 30gm
about: INTRODUCTION  EPIDUO GEL is a combination of Adapalene and Benzoyl peroxide which belongs to the group of medicines called Antiacne agents. It is used in the treatment of acne.  Acne vulgaris (commonly known as acne) is an inflammatory skin condition that occurs when the hair follicles present in the skin are clogged with excess oil and/or dead skin cells. It can also be aggravated by few bacteria (such as Propionibacterium acnes) and is highly common among on the teenagers and the young adults.  It primarily affects the face, upper arms, trunk or back and is often characterized by pus-filled pimples, red bumps with inflammatory and non-inflammatory lesions. EPIDUO GEL is suitable for use both in adults and in children (aged 9 years or older).  Apply a thin layer of EPIDUO GEL on the affected skin areas. Avoid contact of this medicine with your eyes, mouth, ears, nose or with open wounds. You must also protect your skin against sun light and against other light sources (such as UV lamps).  Do not use EPIDUO GEL if you are pregnant, think you may be pregnant or planning to have a baby. EPIDUO GEL can be used in breastfeeding women if required. The most common side effects of using EPIDUO GEL are dry skin, mild burning sensation and skin irritation, redness or scaling. Consult your doctor if they trouble you.
uses: USES OF EPIDUO GEL  It is used in adults, children and in adolescents (aged 9 years or older) to:  Treat acne
working: HOW EPIDUO GEL WORKS  EPIDUO GEL is a combination of two medicines namely, adapalene and benzoyl peroxide.  Adapalene is a topical retinoid (a type of vitamin A). It modulates the skin cell cycle and prevents the accumulation of excess sebum (natural oil produced by the skin) and dead skin cells on the hair follicles of the skin. It also reduces inflammation on the skin.  Benzoyl peroxide is a keratolytic agent with antimicrobial properties. It improves skin’s tendency to exfoliate the dead skin cells naturally. It also reduces the number of acne-causing bacteria on the skin which can reduce the further spread of acne.  Collectively, they unclog the hair follicles of the skin and exfoliates dead skin cells which reduces acne breakouts.
directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Apply a thin layer of this medicine on the affected skin areas or as directed by the physician. It is for topical use only. Wash your hands before and after application.  Your doctor will decide the correct dose and duration of therapy for you depending upon your age, body weight and health condition.  Avoid contact of EPIDUO GEL with your eyes, mouth, ears, nose, hair or with open wounds (cuts, scrapes or sunburn).
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF EPIDUO GEL COMMON Dry skin Skin redness and scaling Burning sensation of the skin Skin irritation UNCOMMON Itching of the skin (pruritus) Sunburn RARE  Stop using EPIDUO GEL and consult your doctor immediately if you experience:  Signs of allergic reaction (such as severe skin rash with itching of body parts, swelling of the eyes, face, lips or tongue causing throat tightness and breathing difficulties and feel faint)
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY  EPIDUO GEL is not recommended for use in pregnant women. Therefore, inform your doctor before using this medicine if you are pregnant, think you may be pregnant or planning to have a baby. If you became pregnant while using this medicine, stop using it and contact your doctor immediately.  BREASTFEEDING  EPIDUO GEL can be used in breastfeeding women. However, do not apply this medicine on your chest to avoid exposing this medicine to the nursing infant.  ALLERGY  Talk to your doctor if you are allergic to Adapalene or Benzoyl peroxide.  OTHERS  EPIDUO GEL is not recommended for use if you:  Have any cuts, scrapes, sunburn or eczema at the site of application  Use in Pediatrics:  EPIDUO GEL can be used in children and adolescents (aged 9 years or older) if advised by the physician. Therefore, consult your doctor before using it.
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug-Drug interactions:  Before using EPIDUO GEL, inform your doctor if you are using any of the following:  Other anti-acne medicines (such as clindamycin) Skin cosmetics (such as hair perming solutions, astringents, toners, shaving lotion, abrasive soaps or cleansers)  Overdosage:  If you or anyone else applied excessive amount of EPIDUO GEL, rinse your skin with plenty of cold water. If irritation persists, consult your doctor.
synopsis: SYNOPSIS Drug	:  	Adapalene, Benzoyl peroxide Pharmacological Category	:  	Retinoid-like compounds, Topical Antibiotics Therapeutic Indication	:  	Acne vulgaris Dosage Forms	:  	Topical Gel
moreInfo: MORE INFORMATION Keep EPIDUO GEL out of reach of children Store EPIDUO GEL at room temperature
faqs: FAQs ABOUT EPIDUO GEL  Will EPIDUO GEL be more effective if I overuse it?  No. Do not overuse this medicine. If you use more, you will not get rid of acne quicker. Instead, it may make your skin more irritated and red. Therefore, only apply the quantity mentioned by your doctor.  What are the side effects of using EPIDUO GEL?  EPIDUO GEL is generally safe with limited or no side effects. However, you may experience skin dryness, redness or irritation after applying this medicine. Contact your doctor if it troubles you.  What is the use of EPIDUO GEL?  EPIDUO GEL is used in the treatment of acne.  How EPIDUO GEL works?  EPIDUO GEL prevents the accumulation of excess sebum (natural oil produced by the skin) and dead skin cells on the hair follicles of the skin. It also reduces inflammation on the skin and improves skin’s tendency to exfoliate the dead skin cells naturally. It also reduces the number of acne-causing bacteria on the skin which can reduce the further spread of acne.  How to use EPIDUO GEL?  EPIDUO GEL is for external use only. Take the required quantity of the medicine and apply on the affected skin areas. Avoid contact of this medicine with your eyes, ears, nose or any other mucous membranes.  How long does it take for EPIDUO GEL to work?  It may take up to 2-3 weeks for EPIDUO GEL to show improvement in your skin condition. However, this period may vary from person-to-person depending upon the skin condition.  How long should I use EPIDUO GEL?  Your doctor will decide the correct dose and duration of therapy for you depending upon your age, body weight and health condition. You need to use EPIDUO GEL for the stipulated duration prescribed by your doctor. Failing to do so may not result in adequate response.  What to do if I forgot to apply EPIDUO GEL?  If you forgot to apply EPIDUO GEL, apply it as soon as you remember. However, if it is time for the next application, skip the missed one and apply the next dose. Do not excessively apply EPIDUO GEL to compensate the missed doses.  Is EPIDUO GEL safe?  EPIDUO GEL is safe at doses prescribed by the physician. Therefore, do not alter the dose of EPIDUO GEL without consulting your doctor.  Can I stop using EPIDUO GEL without consulting your doctor?  No. You should not stop using EPIDUO GEL without consulting your doctor as it may reduce its effectiveness. Therefore, apply EPIDUO GEL for the stipulated duration recommended by your doctor to achieve maximum results.  Can EPIDUO GEL be used in pregnant women?  EPIDUO GEL is not recommended for use in pregnant women. Therefore, inform your doctor before using this medicine if you are pregnant, think you may be pregnant or planning to have a baby. If you became pregnant while using this medicine, stop using it and contact your doctor immediately.

name: Erytop Gel 20gm
about: INTRODUCTION  ERYTOP GEL contains Clindamycin, which belongs to the group of medicines called Antibiotics. It is used in the treatment of acne vulgaris. Acne vulgaris is a common skin condition that occurs when hair follicles get blocked with oil and dead skin cells. Symptoms include whiteheads, blackheads, small red, tender bumps, pimples, and pus-filled lumps on the skin.  Before applying ERYTOP GEL, inform your doctor if you have or ever had diarrhea, bloody diarrhea and pseudomembranous colitis. ERYTOP GEL is not recommended for use if you have a history of regional enteritis (inflammation of the small intestine), ulcerative colitis (inflammation of the large intestine) or antibiotic-associated colitis.  ERYTOP GEL should be used with caution during pregnancy or by breastfeeding women only if clearly needed. The safety and effectiveness of ERYTOP GEL in children under the age of 12 has not been established. The most common side effects of applying ERYTOP GEL are burning, itching, and redness of the skin. Consult your doctor if symptoms worsen.
uses: USES OF ERYTOP GEL Treats acne vulgaris
working: HOW ERYTOP GEL WORKS  ERYTOP GEL acts against the bacteria by binding to the 50S subunit of the bacterial ribosome (site of protein synthesis), which in turn prevents protein synthesis and kills the infection-causing bacteria.
directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Apply ERYTOP GEL as advised by your physician. It is for external use only. Wash your hands before use. Wash and dry the whole area, apply a thin film once daily to the skin where acne lesions appear and use enough to cover the entire affected area. In case of contact with the eyes, mouth or nostrils, rinse it off immediately and thoroughly with water. Your doctor will decide the correct dose and duration for you depending on your age, body weight and disease condition.
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF ERYTOP GEL COMMON Burning, itching or abnormal redness of the skin at the application site Scaling, pain, dryness and skin irritation at the application site UNCOMMON Abdominal pain Diarrhea Oily skin RARE Antibiotic-associated colitis  Stop applying ERYTOP GEL and contact your doctor immediately if you experience any of the following side effects:  Allergic symptoms (e.g., rashes, itchiness, difficulty in breathing or eye swelling) Severe or bloody diarrhea. (a sign of bowel inflammation, pseudomembranous colitis)
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY  The safety and effectiveness of ERYTOP GEL in pregnant women or women planning to have a baby have not been established yet. It will be given to you by the doctor only if clearly needed. Consult your doctor before applying ERYTOP GEL.  BREASTFEEDING  ERYTOP GEL should be used with caution in breastfeeding women as it is not known if the medicine is excreted in human milk. Your doctor will decide whether to discontinue nursing or the medicine, considering the benefits to the mother and baby. If it is applied to the chest, care should be taken to avoid accidental ingestion by the infant. Consult your doctor before applying ERYTOP GEL.  ALLERGY  Do not apply ERYTOP GEL if you are allergic to Clindamycin or any other ingredients of this medicine.  OTHERS  ERYTOP GEL is not recommended for use if you:  Have regional enteritis (inflammation of the small intestine) or ulcerative colitis (inflammation of the large intestine) Have a history of antibiotic-associated colitis  Before applying ERYTOP GEL inform your doctor if you:  Diarrhea, bloody diarrhea Pseudomembranous colitis (inflammation of colon) Atopic individuals (more prone to allergies)  Use in pediatrics:  Safety and effectiveness of ERYTOP GEL in children under the age of 12 have not been established. Consult your doctor before applying ERYTOP GEL.
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug-Drug interactions:  Before applying ERYTOP GEL, inform your doctor if you are taking any of the following medicine:  Neuromuscular blocking agents (Ex. rocuronium, vecuronium) Other anti-acne, topical agents  Overdosage:  If you or anyone else accidentally applied too much of ERYTOP GEL, consult your doctor immediately or visit the nearby hospital.
synopsis: SYNOPSIS Drug	:  	  Clindamycin   Pharmacological Category	:  	  Lincosamides   Therapeutic Indication	:  	  Acne vulgaris   Dosage Forms	:  	  Injection, Tablet, Capsule, Gel, Cream, Lotion, Solution, Spray, Soap

name: Erytop Lotion 25ml
about: INTRODUCTION  ERYTOP contains Clindamycin which belongs to the group of medicines called Topical antibiotics. It is indicated in the topical treatment of acne vulgaris. Acne vulgaris is a common skin condition that occurs in teens, when hair follicles of the skin plug with oil and dead skin cells. Symptoms includes inflammation, large, reddish pus-filled pimples and formation of comedones.  Clindamycin deeply penetrates into the skin and kills the pimple-causing bacteria by inhibiting the bacterial protein synthesis. It is for external use only. Apply a thin layer of this medicine on the affected area as required. Topical application of clindamycin may also result in systemic absorption and can cause diarrhea, bloody diarrhea or colitis (including pseudomembranous colitis) in patients. In such cases, contact your doctor immediately.  The most common side effects of this medicine are application site reactions such as itching, burning, peeling of skin, dryness or seborrhoea. Do not touch, rub or scratch the affected area. Regularly use moisturizers to soothe and hydrate the affected area. If it does not get better, contact your doctor. Before applying this medicine, inform your doctor if you have or ever had any GI disorders. ERYTOP should be used with caution in pregnant or breastfeeding women. Consult your doctor before application.
uses: USES OF ERYTOP Treats acne vulgaris
working: HOW ERYTOP WORKS  Topically applied clindamycin penetrates deep into the skin and kills the acne-producing bacteria by inhibiting the bacterial protein synthesis. It acts by reversibly binding to the 50S ribosomal subunits of the bacteria, which prevents peptide bond formation thus inhibiting bacterial protein synthesis. Inhibition of protein synthesis stops the growth of acne-producing bacteria leading to prevention of acne outbreaks.
directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Apply this medicine as directed by your physician. It is for external use only. Shake well before use. Wash the affected area before application. Apply a thin film of the medicine to the affected skin surface once or twice daily. Replace the cap tightly after use. Wash your hands thoroughly after application. Avoid contact of this medicine with eyes, ears, nose or mouth. If this happens, rinse it thoroughly with plenty of cool water. Continue to apply this medicine, as long as your doctor tells you to do so, to obtain better results.
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF ERYTOP SERIOUS Severe persistent diarrhea with or without stomach pain or fever COMMON Skin irritation with burning sensation Itching and peeling of skin Skin dryness Seborrhoea (disease of sebaceous glands resulting in an oily coating and scales on the skin)
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY  ERYTOP is considered safe for use in pregnant women. However, consult your doctor before application.  BREASTFEEDING  ERYTOP is considered safe for use in breastfeeding women. However, consult your doctor before application.  DRIVING AND USING MACHINES        ALLERGY  Do not use this medicine if you are allergic to clindamycin, lincomycin or to any of the ingredients of this medicine.  OTHERS  Before applying ERYTOP, inform your doctor if you:  Have a history of inflammatory bowel disease Have a history of antibiotic associated colitis Have diarrhea Had previous history of diarrhea following antibiotic treatment Are going to have an operation
interactions: INTERACTIONS  Tell your healthcare provider about all the medicines you take, including:  Any other skin products that contain benzoyl peroxide
synopsis: SYNOPSIS Drug	:  	Clindamycin Pharmacological Category	:  	Antibiotics Therapeutic Indication	:  	Acne vulgaris Dosage Forms	:  	Tablet, Capsule, Injection, Gel, Topical solution, Lotion, Spray, Soap
moreInfo: MORE INFORMATION  Store below 20-25°C and keep out of reach of children.
faqs: FAQs ABOUT ERYTOP  Can I apply ERYTOP on my face?  Yes. This medicine is intended for application on the face to cure acne outbreaks.  How to use ERYTOP?  Wash your face and pat it dry. Apply a thin film of the medicine to the affected skin surface once or twice daily. Wash your hands thoroughly after application.  Can I apply moisturizer after applying ERYTOP?  Yes. If your skin feels too dry after using this medicine, you can apply a moisturizer to soothe and hydrate the affected area.

name: ERYTOP N Gel(Topical) 15gm
about: INTRODUCTION  ERYTOP N GEL(TOPICAL) is a combination of Clindamycin and Nicotinamide which belongs to a group of medicines called Lincomycin antibiotics and Vitamin B3 complex, respectively. ERYTOP N GEL(TOPICAL) is used to treat mild to moderate acne which is a skin condition that occurs when hair follicles become plugged with oil and dead skin cells which may occur due to variety of causes such as genetics, fluctuating hormone levels, stress, high humidity or using oily or greasy personal care products which may affect people of all ages.  It is characterized by symptoms such as open or closed plugged pores, small red & tender bumps, pimples, large, solid or painful lumps under the skin and painful & pus-filled lumps under the skin.  Before using ERYTOP N GEL(TOPICAL) inform your doctor if you have liver, kidney, lung or heart diseases. Avoid applying ERYTOP N GEL(TOPICAL) to a cut, scrapped, sunburnt or eczema affected skin.  ERYTOP N GEL(TOPICAL) should be used with caution in pregnant and in breastfeeding women. ERYTOP N GEL(TOPICAL) is not recommended for use in children and adolescents (below 12 years). Consult your doctor before applying.  The most common side effects of using ERYTOP N GEL(TOPICAL) are skin inflammation, contact dermatitis (red, itchy rash), inflammation of hair follicles, itchy skin, dry skin and peeling of skin. Consult your doctor if any of these symptoms worsen.
uses: USES OF ERYTOP N GEL(TOPICAL) Treats mild to moderate acne
working: HOW ERYTOP N GEL(TOPICAL) WORKS  ERYTOP N GEL(TOPICAL) helps to treat acne, where Clindamycin reduces free fatty acid concentrations on the skin and suppresses the growth of Propionibacterium acnes (Corynebacterium acnes), a bacteria found in sebaceous glands and follicles and Nicotinamide exerts anti-inflammatory effect in acne and interrupts sebum production.
directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Apply ERYTOP N GEL(TOPICAL) as advised by your physician. It is for external use only. Before applying the medicine normally wash and dry the affected area and apply a thin layer of this medicine on the affected area. Treated areas on the face need not be covered with a plaster or bandage. Do not apply this medicine beyond the recommended duration. Avoid applying ERYTOP N GEL(TOPICAL) around your eyes, including eyelids. Rinse it off with water if you accidentally get it in these areas.
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF ERYTOP N GEL(TOPICAL) COMMON Contact dermatitis (red, itchy rash) Inflammation of hair follicles Itchy skin Dry skin Peeling of skin
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY  ERYTOP N GEL(TOPICAL) should be used with caution in pregnant women. Consult your doctor before applying.  BREASTFEEDING  ERYTOP N GEL(TOPICAL) should be used with caution in breastfeeding women. Consult your doctor before applying.  ALLERGY  ERYTOP N GEL(TOPICAL) is not recommended for use if you are allergic to Clindamycin, Nicotinamide or any other ingredients of this medicine.  OTHERS  ERYTOP N GEL(TOPICAL) is not recommended for use if you have:  Eczema (skin inflammation) Cut, scrapped, sunburnt skin  Use in Pediatrics:  ERYTOP N GEL(TOPICAL) is not recommended for use in children and adolescents (below 12 years). Consult your doctor before using it for your child.  Use in Geriatrics:  There is no information on the use of ERYTOP N GEL(TOPICAL) in elderly patients. Consult with your doctor before using.
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug - Drug interactions:  Before using ERYTOP N GEL(TOPICAL), inform your doctor if you are taking any of the following medicines:  Acepromazine (used a sedative/tranquilizer) Acetaminophen (used to treat pain and inflammation)  Overdosage:  If you or anyone else accidentally ingests or applies too much of ERYTOP N GEL(TOPICAL), consult your doctor immediately or visit the nearby hospital.
synopsis: SYNOPSIS Drug	:  	Clindamycin, Nicotinamide Pharmacological Category	:  	Lincomycin antibiotics, Vitamin B3 complex Therapeutic Indication	:  	Mild to moderate acne Dosage Forms	:  	Gel, Cream, Ointment
moreInfo: MORE INFORMATION Keep ERYTOP N GEL(TOPICAL) out of reach of children Store ERYTOP N GEL(TOPICAL) at a temperature below 25°C
faqs: FAQs ABOUT ERYTOP N GEL(TOPICAL)  What special precautions should I follow while using ERYTOP N GEL(TOPICAL)?  Before using ERYTOP N GEL(TOPICAL) inform your doctor if you have liver, kidney, lung or heart diseases. Avoid applying ERYTOP N GEL(TOPICAL) to a cut, scrapped, sunburnt or eczema affected skin. This medicine is not for oral, ophthalmic or intravaginal use.  What is ERYTOP N GEL(TOPICAL) used for?  ERYTOP N GEL(TOPICAL) is indicated for the treatment of mild to moderate acne in patients above 12 years of age. Do not use it for any other condition other than that prescribed by your doctor.  How should I use ERYTOP N GEL(TOPICAL)?  Always apply ERYTOP N GEL(TOPICAL), as directed by your physician. It is for external use only. On the affected area, apply a thin layer of this medicine. Treated areas on the face need not be covered with a plaster or bandage. Do not apply this medicine on your face beyond 5 days. Avoid applying ERYTOP N GEL(TOPICAL) around your eyes, including eyelids.  Is ERYTOP N GEL(TOPICAL) safe to use in pregnant and breastfeeding women?  ERYTOP N GEL(TOPICAL) should be used with caution during pregnancy, women planning for pregnancy and in breastfeeding women. Consult your doctor before applying.  Can ERYTOP N GEL(TOPICAL) cause skin irritation or itchy skin?  ERYTOP N GEL(TOPICAL) may cause skin irritation or itchy skin. Avoid hot bath because hot water can irritate your skin further. Do not scratch the affected area. Use protective clothing when going outdoors. Regularly moisturize your skin and apply calamine lotion as a coolant. Discuss with your doctor if the symptom worsens.

name: Ethitret 10mg Capsule 10'S
about: INTRODUCTION  ETHITRET 10MG CAPSULE contains Isotretinoin which belongs to the group of medicines called Retinoids. It is used in adults and children (older than 12 years of age) to treat severe form of acne (such as nodular acne, conglobate acne, and acne that is at risk of permanent scarring), which has not improved after other anti-acne treatments. Acne is an inflammatory skin condition which is characterized by spots, oily skin, nodular lesions etc. on face, back, and chest, which can be painful.  During treatment with ETHITRET 10MG CAPSULE your doctor might conduct certain blood tests and pregnancy tests, and you will be supervised by a skin doctor. You will be advised to reduce intensive exercise and physical activity. Before you go out in the sun, use a sunscreen with a high protection factor (SPF 15 or higher).  Avoid too much sun and using a sun-lamp or sun-bed. Avoid consuming alcohol while taking ETHITRET 10MG CAPSULE as it may cause side effects. Do not donate blood while consuming ETHITRET 10MG CAPSULE and after stopping ETHITRET 10MG CAPSULE at least for one month or undergo cosmetic procedures while taking ETHITRET 10MG CAPSULE or at least for 6 months after stopping it.  ETHITRET 10MG CAPSULE is not recommended for use in patients having liver or kidney disease, hyperlipidaemia (high blood lipid levels), high levels of Vitamin A. ETHITRET 10MG CAPSULE should be used with caution in patients who have or had mental illness or family history of mental illness, asthma, diabetes, heart or bone problems like osteoporosis, or eating disorder.  ETHITRET 10MG CAPSULE is not recommended for use in pregnant women, women planning a pregnancy, breast feeding women, and in children (below 12 years of age) so, consult your doctor for advice. ETHITRET 10MG CAPSULE should be used with caution in elderly patients (65 years and older).  ETHITRET 10MG CAPSULE may cause depression, psychosis, suicidal thoughts, or thoughts of self-harm in some patients. Consult your doctor if you experience any such behaviour or thoughts.  Most common side effects of taking ETHITRET 10MG CAPSULE are dry skin of face and lips, joint or muscle pain, headache, easy bruising or bleeding, weakness, etc. Consult your doctor if any of the symptoms deteriorate.
uses: USES OF ETHITRET 10MG CAPSULE Used in adults and children (older than 12 years of age) to treat severe form of acne which has not improved after other anti-acne treatments
working: HOW ETHITRET 10MG CAPSULE WORKS  ETHITRET 10MG CAPSULE helps in treating acne by inhibiting the function of sebaceous glands (oil glands in skin) thus, reducing the secretion of oil (sebum) in the skin. ETHITRET 10MG CAPSULE also inhibits keratinization (development of a horn-like character by the epithelial tissue), which might be a cause of acne.
directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Take ETHITRET 10MG CAPSULE as advised by your physician. Do not crush or chew it. Swallow ETHITRET 10MG CAPSULE as whole with a glass of water or a mouthful of food. Take it on a full stomach. Your doctor will decide the right dose and duration of therapy for you according to your age, body weight and disease condition.
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF ETHITRET 10MG CAPSULE COMMON Dry skin, especially of the lips and face, inflamed skin, chapped and inflamed lips, rash, mild itching, slight peeling More fragile and red skin than usual, especially of the face Back, muscle or joint pain (particularly in children and teenagers) Inflammation of the eye and eyelid area, dry and irritated eyes Raised liver enzymes Changed blood fat and cholesterol levels Easy bruising, bleeding or clotting Anaemia (weakness, dizziness, pale skin) Headache Protein or blood in the urine Becoming more prone to get infections Dry and crusted inside of the nose causing mild nosebleeds Sore or inflamed throat and nose RARE Hair loss  Stop taking ETHITRET 10MG CAPSULE and consult your doctor immediately in case you experience any of the following:  Persistent pain in your lower back or buttocks (signs of sacroiliitis) Severe skin reactions (Ex. erythema multiforme, Stevens-Johnson Syndrome, toxic epidermal necrolysis) (blistering and peeling of skin, severe rashes, fever, multiple lesions especially in mouth, nose, eyes and genitals, conjunctivitis, flu-like symptoms) Depression or related disorders (sad or altered mood, anxiety, emotional discomfort), worsening depression, becoming violent or aggressive Thoughts or feelings about hurting self or ending own lives, suicide attempts or suicide Unusual behaviour Psychosis (loss of contact with reality, like hearing voices or seeing things that are not real) Serious reactions (trouble breathing or swallowing due to sudden swelling of the throat, face, lips and mouth, sudden swelling of the hands, feet and ankles, hives, bruises, eczema, bruising, red patches on hands and legs) Sudden tight chest, breathlessness and wheezing, particularly if you have asthma Rhabdomyolysis (muscle weakness along with trouble moving arms or legs, painful, swollen, bruised areas of the body, dark urine, reduced or no urination, confusion or dehydration) Hepatitis (yellow skin or eyes, tiredness) Kidney inflammation (difficulty urinating, swollen and puffy eyelids, excessive tiredness) Increased intracranial pressure (continuous headache, along with nausea, vomiting and eyesight changes including blurred vision) Serious gut conditions (severe tummy pain, with or without severe bloody diarrhoea, nausea, vomiting) Vision problems like night vision problems, persistent dryness of eyes, intolerance to contact lenses Inflamed pancreas Hearing problems, ringing sound in ears Severe muscle weakness, muscle, joint, back pain, difficulty moving especially after exercise
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY  ETHITRET 10MG CAPSULE is not recommended for use in pregnant women and women planning a pregnancy. Inform your doctor if you become pregnant during treatment with ETHITRET 10MG CAPSULE. It is not recommended to get pregnant for one month after stopping ETHITRET 10MG CAPSULE treatment because some medicine may still be left in your body. Consult your doctor before taking it.  Contraception must be used for a month before taking ETHITRET 10MG CAPSULE, during treatment and for a month afterwards. Discuss with your doctor regarding suitable contraceptive methods.  BREASTFEEDING  ETHITRET 10MG CAPSULE is not recommended for use in breast feeding women as it may pass through breast milk. Consult your doctor before taking it.  DRIVING AND USING MACHINES  Do not drive or operate machinery if you experience dizziness, drowsiness or decreased night vision after taking ETHITRET 10MG CAPSULE.  ALCOHOL  Avoid consuming alcohol while taking ETHITRET 10MG CAPSULE as it may increase side effects. Inform your doctor if you are an alcoholic.  KIDNEY  ETHITRET 10MG CAPSULE should be used with caution in patients with kidney problems. Consult your doctor before taking it.  LIVER  ETHITRET 10MG CAPSULE is not recommended for use in patients with liver disease. Consult your doctor before taking it.  ALLERGY  Do not take ETHITRET 10MG CAPSULE if you are allergic to Isotretinoin, soya, peanuts or any of the other ingredients of this medicine.  LUNGS  ETHITRET 10MG CAPSULE should be used with caution in patients having asthma. Consult your doctor before taking it.  OTHERS  ETHITRET 10MG CAPSULE is not recommended for use if you have:  High blood fat levels High levels of Vitamin A  Before taking ETHITRET 10MG CAPSULE inform your doctor if you:  Have or had mental illness or family history of mental illness such as depression, mood disorders, psychosis, aggressive behaviour, or hurting or killing self Have diabetes Are fructose intolerant Are overweight  Use in paediatrics:  ETHITRET 10MG CAPSULE is not recommended for use in children below 12 years of age. ETHITRET 10MG CAPSULE can be used in adolescents (more than 12 years of age) only after puberty. Consult your child’s doctor for advice.  Use in geriatrics:  There is no proper information about the use of ETHITRET 10MG CAPSULE in elderly patients. Consult your doctor before taking it.
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug-Drug interactions:  Before taking ETHITRET 10MG CAPSULE, inform your doctor if you are taking any of the following medicines:  Vitamin A supplements Medicines used to treat bacterial infections (Ex. minocycline, doxycycline) Phenytoin (used to treat fits) Medicines used to treat various inflammatory conditions (Ex. betamethasone, prednisolone, dexamethasone) Medicines used to prevent pregnancy (Ex. Norethindrone, ethinyl Oestradiol) St. John’s wort (herbal medicine used to treat mental disorders) Other medicines used to treat acne like keratolytic or exfoliative agents (Ex. salicylic acid, benzoyl peroxide)  Overdosage:  In case you or anybody else accidently take too much of ETHITRET 10MG CAPSULE, consult your doctor immediately or visit the nearby hospital. Symptoms of ETHITRET 10MG CAPSULE overdose are severe headache, abdominal pain, nausea, dizziness, redness of face, vomiting, somnolence, irritability, and itching.
synopsis: SYNOPSIS Drug	:  	  Isotretinoin   Pharmacological Category	:  	  Retinoids    Therapeutic Indication	:  	  Severe Acne   Dosage Forms	:  	  Tablet, Soft gel Capsule, Capsule
moreInfo: MORE INFORMATION Keep ETHITRET 10MG CAPSULE out of reach of children Store ETHITRET 10MG CAPSULE between 15-30°C
faqs: FAQs ABOUT ETHITRET 10MG CAPSULE  Can ETHITRET 10MG CAPSULE cause irregular periods?  According to some studies, menstrual irregularity was observed during treatment follow-ups. Consult your doctor if you experience irregularity in your periods during treatment with ETHITRET 10MG CAPSULE.  Is ETHITRET 10MG CAPSULE safe to take in pregnancy?  No. ETHITRET 10MG CAPSULE is not recommended for use in pregnant women and women planning a pregnancy. Inform your doctor if you become pregnant during treatment with ETHITRET 10MG CAPSULE. It is not recommended to get pregnant for one month after stopping ETHITRET 10MG CAPSULE treatment because some medicine may still be left in your body. Consult your doctor before taking it. Contraception must be used for a month before taking ETHITRET 10MG CAPSULE, during treatment and for a month afterwards. Discuss with your doctor regarding suitable contraceptive methods.  Can I play sports during ETHITRET 10MG CAPSULE treatment?  Cut down on extreme exercise and physical activity as ETHITRET 10MG CAPSULE can cause muscle and joint pain especially in children and teenagers taking up vigorous physical activity. Consult your doctor if you can play sports during this treatment.  Can I go out in the sun during ETHITRET 10MG CAPSULE treatment?  Sensitivity to light may increase during treatment with ETHITRET 10MG CAPSULE so, avoid going too much into the sun and don’t use a sun-lamp or sun-bed. Before you go out in the sun, wear sunglasses and use sunscreen with a high protection factor (SPF 15 or higher).  Can undergo cosmetic procedures while taking ETHITRET 10MG CAPSULE?  No. Do not undergo cosmetic procedures such as skin waxing, dermabrasion, laser, or artificial UV light detanning while taking ETHITRET 10MG CAPSULE or at least for 6 months after stopping it as they could cause scarring, skin irritation, or changes in your skin colour. Consult your doctor before undergoing any cosmetic procedure while taking ETHITRET 10MG CAPSULE.

ETHITRET 20MG CAPSULE may cause depression, psychosis, suicidal thoughts, or thoughts of self-harm in some patients. Consult your doctor if you experience any such behaviour or thoughts.  Most common side effects of taking ETHITRET 20MG CAPSULE are dry skin of face and lips, joint or muscle pain, headache, easy bruising or bleeding, weakness, etc. Consult your doctor if any of the symptoms deteriorate.
uses: USES OF ETHITRET 20MG CAPSULE Used in adults and children (older than 12 years of age) to treat severe form of acne which has not improved after other anti-acne treatments
working: HOW ETHITRET 20MG CAPSULE WORKS  ETHITRET 20MG CAPSULE helps in treating acne by inhibiting the function of sebaceous glands (oil glands in skin) thus, reducing the secretion of oil (sebum) in the skin. ETHITRET 20MG CAPSULE also inhibits keratinization (development of a horn-like character by the epithelial tissue), which might be a cause of acne.
directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Take ETHITRET 20MG CAPSULE as advised by your physician. Do not crush or chew it. Swallow ETHITRET 20MG CAPSULE as whole with a glass of water or a mouthful of food. Take it on a full stomach. Your doctor will decide the right dose and duration of therapy for you according to your age, body weight and disease condition.
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF ETHITRET 20MG CAPSULE COMMON Dry skin, especially of the lips and face, inflamed skin, chapped and inflamed lips, rash, mild itching, slight peeling More fragile and red skin than usual, especially of the face Back, muscle or joint pain (particularly in children and teenagers) Inflammation of the eye and eyelid area, dry and irritated eyes Raised liver enzymes Changed blood fat and cholesterol levels Easy bruising, bleeding or clotting Anaemia (weakness, dizziness, pale skin) Headache Protein or blood in the urine Becoming more prone to get infections Dry and crusted inside of the nose causing mild nosebleeds Sore or inflamed throat and nose RARE Hair loss  Stop taking ETHITRET 20MG CAPSULE and consult your doctor immediately in case you experience any of the following:  Persistent pain in your lower back or buttocks (signs of sacroiliitis) Severe skin reactions (Ex. erythema multiforme, Stevens-Johnson Syndrome, toxic epidermal necrolysis) (blistering and peeling of skin, severe rashes, fever, multiple lesions especially in mouth, nose, eyes and genitals, conjunctivitis, flu-like symptoms) Depression or related disorders (sad or altered mood, anxiety, emotional discomfort), worsening depression, becoming violent or aggressive Thoughts or feelings about hurting self or ending own lives, suicide attempts or suicide Unusual behaviour Psychosis (loss of contact with reality, like hearing voices or seeing things that are not real) Serious reactions (trouble breathing or swallowing due to sudden swelling of the throat, face, lips and mouth, sudden swelling of the hands, feet and ankles, hives, bruises, eczema, bruising, red patches on hands and legs) Sudden tight chest, breathlessness and wheezing, particularly if you have asthma Rhabdomyolysis (muscle weakness along with trouble moving arms or legs, painful, swollen, bruised areas of the body, dark urine, reduced or no urination, confusion or dehydration) Hepatitis (yellow skin or eyes, tiredness) Kidney inflammation (difficulty urinating, swollen and puffy eyelids, excessive tiredness) Increased intracranial pressure (continuous headache, along with nausea, vomiting and eyesight changes including blurred vision) Serious gut conditions (severe tummy pain, with or without severe bloody diarrhoea, nausea, vomiting) Vision problems like night vision problems, persistent dryness of eyes, intolerance to contact lenses Inflamed pancreas Hearing problems, ringing sound in ears Severe muscle weakness, muscle, joint, back pain, difficulty moving especially after exercise
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY  ETHITRET 20MG CAPSULE is not recommended for use in pregnant women and women planning a pregnancy. Inform your doctor if you become pregnant during treatment with ETHITRET 20MG CAPSULE. It is not recommended to get pregnant for one month after stopping ETHITRET 20MG CAPSULE treatment because some medicine may still be left in your body. Consult your doctor before taking it.  Contraception must be used for a month before taking ETHITRET 20MG CAPSULE, during treatment and for a month afterwards. Discuss with your doctor regarding suitable contraceptive methods.  BREASTFEEDING  ETHITRET 20MG CAPSULE is not recommended for use in breast feeding women as it may pass through breast milk. Consult your doctor before taking it.  DRIVING AND USING MACHINES  Do not drive or operate machinery if you experience dizziness, drowsiness or decreased night vision after taking ETHITRET 20MG CAPSULE.  ALCOHOL  Avoid consuming alcohol while taking ETHITRET 20MG CAPSULE as it may increase side effects. Inform your doctor if you are an alcoholic.  KIDNEY  ETHITRET 20MG CAPSULE should be used with caution in patients with kidney problems. Consult your doctor before taking it.  LIVER  ETHITRET 20MG CAPSULE is not recommended for use in patients with liver disease. Consult your doctor before taking it.  ALLERGY  Do not take ETHITRET 20MG CAPSULE if you are allergic to Isotretinoin, soya, peanuts or any of the other ingredients of this medicine.  LUNGS  ETHITRET 20MG CAPSULE should be used with caution in patients having asthma. Consult your doctor before taking it.  OTHERS  ETHITRET 20MG CAPSULE is not recommended for use if you have:  High blood fat levels High levels of Vitamin A  Before taking ETHITRET 20MG CAPSULE inform your doctor if you:  Have or had mental illness or family history of mental illness such as depression, mood disorders, psychosis, aggressive behaviour, or hurting or killing self Have diabetes Are fructose intolerant Are overweight  Use in paediatrics:  ETHITRET 20MG CAPSULE is not recommended for use in children below 12 years of age. ETHITRET 20MG CAPSULE can be used in adolescents (more than 12 years of age) only after puberty. Consult your child’s doctor for advice.  Use in geriatrics:  There is no proper information about the use of ETHITRET 20MG CAPSULE in elderly patients. Consult your doctor before taking it.
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug-Drug interactions:  Before taking ETHITRET 20MG CAPSULE, inform your doctor if you are taking any of the following medicines:  Vitamin A supplements Medicines used to treat bacterial infections (Ex. minocycline, doxycycline) Phenytoin (used to treat fits) Medicines used to treat various inflammatory conditions (Ex. betamethasone, prednisolone, dexamethasone) Medicines used to prevent pregnancy (Ex. Norethindrone, ethinyl Oestradiol) St. John’s wort (herbal medicine used to treat mental disorders) Other medicines used to treat acne like keratolytic or exfoliative agents (Ex. salicylic acid, benzoyl peroxide)  Overdosage:  In case you or anybody else accidently take too much of ETHITRET 20MG CAPSULE, consult your doctor immediately or visit the nearby hospital. Symptoms of ETHITRET 20MG CAPSULE overdose are severe headache, abdominal pain, nausea, dizziness, redness of face, vomiting, somnolence, irritability, and itching.
synopsis: SYNOPSIS Drug	:  	  Isotretinoin   Pharmacological Category	:  	  Retinoids    Therapeutic Indication	:  	  Severe Acne   Dosage Forms	:  	  Tablet, Soft gel Capsule, Capsule
moreInfo: MORE INFORMATION Keep ETHITRET 20MG CAPSULE out of reach of children Store ETHITRET 20MG CAPSULE between 15-30°C
faqs: FAQs ABOUT ETHITRET 20MG CAPSULE  Can ETHITRET 20MG CAPSULE cause irregular periods?  According to some studies, menstrual irregularity was observed during treatment follow-ups. Consult your doctor if you experience irregularity in your periods during treatment with ETHITRET 20MG CAPSULE.  Is ETHITRET 20MG CAPSULE safe to take in pregnancy?  No. ETHITRET 20MG CAPSULE is not recommended for use in pregnant women and women planning a pregnancy. Inform your doctor if you become pregnant during treatment with ETHITRET 20MG CAPSULE. It is not recommended to get pregnant for one month after stopping ETHITRET 20MG CAPSULE treatment because some medicine may still be left in your body. Consult your doctor before taking it. Contraception must be used for a month before taking ETHITRET 20MG CAPSULE, during treatment and for a month afterwards. Discuss with your doctor regarding suitable contraceptive methods.  Can I play sports during ETHITRET 20MG CAPSULE treatment?  Cut down on extreme exercise and physical activity as ETHITRET 20MG CAPSULE can cause muscle and joint pain especially in children and teenagers taking up vigorous physical activity. Consult your doctor if you can play sports during this treatment.  Can I go out in the sun during ETHITRET 20MG CAPSULE treatment?  Sensitivity to light may increase during treatment with ETHITRET 20MG CAPSULE so, avoid going too much into the sun and don’t use a sun-lamp or sun-bed. Before you go out in the sun, wear sunglasses and use sunscreen with a high protection factor (SPF 15 or higher).  Can undergo cosmetic procedures while taking ETHITRET 20MG CAPSULE?  No. Do not undergo cosmetic procedures such as skin waxing, dermabrasion, laser, or artificial UV light detanning while taking ETHITRET 20MG CAPSULE or at least for 6 months after stopping it as they could cause scarring, skin irritation, or changes in your skin colour. Consult your doctor before undergoing any cosmetic procedure while taking ETHITRET 20MG CAPSULE.

name: EUKROMA PLUS NEW Cream 15gm
about: INTRODUCTION  EUKROMA PLUS NEW CREAM is a combination of Hydroquinone, Tretinoin, Mometasone furoate which belongs to the group of medicines called Depigmenting agents, Retinoids and Corticosteroids respectively. It is used in adults for the treatment of moderate to severe melasma (dark spots on the skin) in association with sun-avoidance measures, like using sunscreens and wearing protective clothing.  Melasma is one of the most frequently acquired hyperpigmentation (excess melanin production) disorders with symptoms such as symmetrical brown patches on sun exposed areas mainly on face.  It is advised to avoid exposure to sun during treatment with EUKROMA PLUS NEW CREAM for better results. While going out apply sunscreens and wear full covering protective clothes.  Before using EUKROMA PLUS NEW CREAM inform your doctor if you have any liver, kidney, lung or heart diseases.  Safety and efficacy of EUKROMA PLUS NEW CREAM is not established in pregnant women and in children below 12 years of age. Ask for your doctor’s advice before using. EUKROMA PLUS NEW CREAM should be used with caution in breastfeeding women.  The most common side effects of using EUKROMA PLUS NEW CREAM are mild burning, stinging, redness and dryness. Consult your doctor if any of the symptoms worsen or doesn’t improve.
uses: USES OF EUKROMA PLUS NEW CREAM  It is used in adults to  Treats moderate to severe melasma (dark spots on the skin)
working: HOW EUKROMA PLUS NEW CREAM WORKS  EUKROMA PLUS NEW CREAM helps in treating melasma where Hydroquinone is a skin bleaching agent that blocks enzyme tyrosinase which is responsible for the production of melanin that cause pigmentation. Thus, it helps for fading of dark spots in skin. Tretinoin helps to recover the damage to the skin caused by sun exposure (photodamage) by thickening skin layer and loss of keratinized cells.it helps to rejuvenate the skin. Mometasone furoate blocks prostaglandin synthesis and reduces redness, swelling and itching caused by tretinoin and other skin infections.
directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Apply EUKROMA PLUS NEW CREAM as advised by your physician. It is for external use only. Wash your hands before and after applying EUKROMA PLUS NEW CREAM. Wash your face with a mild soap and dry properly. Apply EUKROMA PLUS NEW CREAM at night and gently massage it in until it is absorbed. Avoid contact with your eyes, nose, mouth, mucous membrane. Avoid exposure to sunlight while using this medicine. Your doctor will decide the correct dose and duration for you depending upon your age, body weight and disease condition.
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF EUKROMA PLUS NEW CREAM COMMON Mild burning Stinging Redness Dryness RARE  Stop using EUKROMA PLUS NEW CREAM and consult your doctor immediately if you experience any of the following:  Infraorbital and paranasal fissures
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY  The safety and efficacy of EUKROMA PLUS NEW CREAM is not being established in pregnant women. Consult with your doctor before using.  BREASTFEEDING  EUKROMA PLUS NEW CREAM should be used with caution in breast feeding women. Consult with your doctor before using.  DRIVING AND USING MACHINES  Do not use EUKROMA PLUS NEW CREAM if you are allergic to Hydroquinone, Tretinoin, Mometasone or any other constituents of this medicine. Consult your doctor before using.  OTHERS  Use in paediatrics:  The safety and efficacy of EUKROMA PLUS NEW CREAM is not being established in children below 12 years of age. Consult with your child’s doctor before using it for your child.  Use in geriatrics:  There is no information on the use of EUKROMA PLUS NEW CREAM in elderly patients. Consult your doctor before using EUKROMA PLUS NEW CREAM.
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug – drug interactions:  Before using EUKROMA PLUS NEW CREAM, inform your doctor if you are taking, have taken or might take any other medicine, including prescription, non-prescription or any herbal medicine.  Overdosage:  If you or anyone else accidentally ingests or apply too much of EUKROMA PLUS NEW CREAM, consult your doctor immediately.
synopsis: SYNOPSIS Drug	:  	Hydroquinone, Tretinoin, Mometasone Pharmacological Category	:  	Hypopigmenting agents, Retinoids, Corticosteroids Therapeutic Indication	:  	Melasma Dosage Forms	:  	Cream, Gel, Ointment, Soap
moreInfo: MORE INFORMATION Keep EUKROMA PLUS NEW CREAM out of reach of children Store EUKROMA PLUS NEW CREAM at room temperature not exceeding 25°C
faqs: FAQs ABOUT EUKROMA PLUS NEW CREAM  What is EUKROMA PLUS NEW CREAM used for?  EUKROMA PLUS NEW CREAM is used in adults for the treatment of moderate to severe melasma (dark spots on the skin) in association with sun-avoidance measures, like using sunscreens and wearing protective clothing. Consult doctor before using.  How to use EUKROMA PLUS NEW CREAM?  Apply EUKROMA PLUS NEW CREAM as advised by your physician. It is for external use only. Wash your hands before and after applying EUKROMA PLUS NEW CREAM. Wash your face with a mild soap and dry properly and gently massage the medicine until it is absorbed. Avoid contact with your eyes, nose, mouth, mucous membrane. Your doctor will decide the correct dose and duration for you depending upon your age, body weight and disease condition.  Can I use EUKROMA PLUS NEW CREAM to treat wounds?  EUKROMA PLUS NEW CREAM is not recommended to use on wounds and  ulcerated skin . Consult doctor before using EUKROMA PLUS NEW CREAM.  Do I need to take any precaution while using EUKROMA PLUS NEW CREAM?  It is advised to reduce exposure to sun during treatment with EUKROMA PLUS NEW CREAM for better results. While going out apply sunscreens and wear full covering protective clothes. Exposure to sunlight or ultra-violet light will cause repigmentation of lightened skin. Do not apply EUKROMA PLUS NEW CREAM to broken skin.  What is the best time to use EUKROMA PLUS NEW CREAM?  It is advised to use EUKROMA PLUS NEW CREAM before bedtime. This will reduce the chances of exposure of the treated skin to sun. However, ask for your doctor’s advice before using.

name: Exazel 10% Cream 15gm
about: INTRODUCTION  EXAZEL 10% CREAM contains Azelaic acid which belongs to the group of medicines called Dicarboxylic acids. It is used to treat common acne (acne vulgaris). It is also used for the treatment of mild to moderate papulopustular rosacea.  Acne is a skin condition that occurs when the hair follicles become plugged with oil and dead skin cells. It causes whiteheads, blackheads or pimples. Rosacea is a skin condition that causes blushing or redness, pus-filled bumps and small visible blood vessels in the face.  EXAZEL 10% CREAM should be applied with caution in patients with lung problems such as asthma. Consult your doctor before applying it.  Inform your doctor if you are pregnant or breastfeeding before applying this medicine. Your doctor will decide whether you can use this medicine.  EXAZEL 10% CREAM is generally not recommended for use in children under 12 years of age for the treatment of acne and also not recommended for use in children under 18 years of age for the treatment of rosacea. Consult your doctor before applying it.  The most common side effects of applying EXAZEL 10% CREAM are burning, itching or redness of the skin (erythema) at the application site, scaling, pain, dryness, skin discolouration or irritation at the application site. Contact your doctor if any of the symptoms worsen.
uses: USES OF EXAZEL 10% CREAM Common acne (acne vulgaris) Mild to moderate papulopustular rosacea
working: HOW EXAZEL 10% CREAM WORKS  EXAZEL 10% CREAM attacks the bacteria called propionibacterium acnes, which plays an essential part in causing acne. It also reduces growth of the harder outermost skin cells (keratin surface cells) that block the pores of the skin to cause blackheads and whiteheads.
directions: DIRECTIONS FOR USE  Apply EXAZEL 10% CREAM as directed by your physician. It is for external use only. Wash your hands with soap and water before and after using EXAZEL 10% CREAM. Apply a thin layer of this medicine on the affected area and rub it gently into the skin.  Avoid applying this medicine around your eyes, mouth and other mucous membranes or open wounds. If it does, wash the eyes, mouth or other mucous membranes immediately with large amounts of cool water.
sideEffects: SIDE EFFECTS OF EXAZEL 10% CREAM COMMON Burning, itching or redness of the skin (erythema) at the application site Scaling, pain, dryness, skin discolouration or irritation at the application site UNCOMMON Greasy skin Acne or loss of skin colour Tingling Dermatitis Discomfort or swelling at the application site RARE Cracking of the lips, small blisters Eczema, ulceration Warmth at the site of application Allergic reaction such as urticaria or hives, rash at the site of application Worsening of asthma  Stop applying EXAZEL 10% CREAM and contact your doctor immediately if you experience any of the following side effects:  Allergic reaction such as rash, angioedema (swelling under the skin), swelling of face, eyes and dyspnoea (shortness of breath)
warnings: WARNING & PRECAUTIONS PREGNANCY  Inform your doctor if you are pregnant or are planning to have a baby before applying this medicine. Your doctor will decide whether you can use EXAZEL 10% CREAM.  BREASTFEEDING  EXAZEL 10% CREAM should be used with caution in breastfeeding women. Consult your doctor before applying it. Infants must not come into contact with treated skin or breasts.  DRIVING AND USING MACHINES  EXAZEL 10% CREAM has no influence on the ability to drive and use machines.  ALLERGY  Do not apply EXAZEL 10% CREAM if you are allergic to Azelaic acid or any of the other ingredients of this medicine.  LUNGS  EXAZEL 10% CREAM should be applied with caution in patients with lung problems such as asthma. Consult your doctor before applying it.  OTHERS  Use in pediatrics:  EXAZEL 10% CREAM is generally not recommended for use in children under 12 years of age for the treatment of acne. It is also not recommended for use in children under 18 years of age for the treatment of rosacea due to a lack of data on safety and efficacy. Consult your doctor before applying it.  Use in geriatrics:  There is limited information available on the use of EXAZEL 10% CREAM in elderly patients. Consult your doctor before applying it.
interactions: INTERACTIONS  A. Drug - Drug interactions:  Tell your doctor if you are taking or have recently taken any other medicines, including medicines obtained without a prescription, vitamin supplement or herbal products.  Overdosage:  If you or anyone else accidentally used too much of EXAZEL 10% CREAM or if you or a child accidentally swallow the medicine, consult your doctor immediately or visit the nearby hospital.
synopsis: SYNOPSIS Drug	:  	Azelaic acid Pharmacological Category	:  	Dicarboxylic acids Therapeutic Indication	:  	Common acne, Papulopustular rosacea Dosage Forms	:  	Cream, Gel, Gel (Topical)
moreInfo: MORE INFORMATION Keep EXAZEL 10% CREAM out of the sight and reach of children Store EXAZEL 10% CREAM below 30°C
faqs: FAQs ABOUT EXAZEL 10% CREAM  How long can I use EXAZEL 10% CREAM?  How long EXAZEL 10% CREAM has to be used varies from person to person. It depends upon how bad your acne is when you start treatment. In general, you may notice a distinct improvement after 4 weeks. In case of no improvement after 1 month or if the acne or rosacea becomes worse, you should discontinue EXAZEL 10% CREAM and consult your doctor.  How long does it take EXAZEL 10% CREAM to lighten skin?  EXAZEL 10% CREAM when applied twice daily for several (up to 8 months), skin lightening starts after 1 to 2 months of using it. But when EXAZEL 10% CREAM is used in combination with a medicine called tretinoin causes more skin lightening after 3 months than EXAZEL 10% CREAM alone. Consult your doctor for advice.  Can I use EXAZEL 10% CREAM for hair growth?  Yes. EXAZEL 10% CREAM may promote hair growth via induction of proteins in hair follicles, when used in combination with minoxidil. Contact your doctor before applying it.  Does EXAZEL 10% CREAM cause redness of skin?  Yes. EXAZEL 10% CREAM may cause burning, itching or redness of the skin (erythema) at the application site. Contact your doctor if any of the symptoms worsen.  Is EXAZEL 10% CREAM safe in pregnancy?  Inform your doctor if you are pregnant or are planning to have a baby before applying this medicine. Your doctor will decide whether you can use EXAZEL 10% CREAM.  Can I apply face creams while using EXAZEL 10% CREAM?  Yes, you may apply cosmetics after the EXAZEL 10% CREAM has dried. Do not wrap or bandage the skin unless your doctor has instructed to do so. Talk to your doctor for advice before using this medicine.

Overdosage:  If you or anyone else accidentally used too much of EXAZEL 20% CREAM or if you or a child accidentally swallow the medicine, consult your doctor immediately or visit the nearby hospital.
synopsis: SYNOPSIS Drug	:  	Azelaic acid Pharmacological Category	:  	Dicarboxylic acids Therapeutic Indication	:  	Common acne, Papulopustular rosacea Dosage Forms	:  	Cream, Gel, Gel (Topical)
moreInfo: MORE INFORMATION Keep EXAZEL 20% CREAM out of the sight and reach of children Store EXAZEL 20% CREAM below 30°C
faqs: FAQs ABOUT EXAZEL 20% CREAM  How long can I use EXAZEL 20% CREAM?  How long EXAZEL 20% CREAM has to be used varies from person to person. It depends upon how bad your acne is when you start treatment. In general, you may notice a distinct improvement after 4 weeks. In case of no improvement after 1 month or if the acne or rosacea becomes worse, you should discontinue EXAZEL 20% CREAM and consult your doctor.  How long does it take EXAZEL 20% CREAM to lighten skin?  EXAZEL 20% CREAM when applied twice daily for several (up to 8 months), skin lightening starts after 1 to 2 months of using it. But when EXAZEL 20% CREAM is used in combination with a medicine called tretinoin causes more skin lightening after 3 months than EXAZEL 20% CREAM alone. Consult your doctor for advice.  Can I use EXAZEL 20% CREAM for hair growth?  Yes. EXAZEL 20% CREAM may promote hair growth via induction of proteins in hair follicles, when used in combination with minoxidil. Contact your doctor before applying it.  Does EXAZEL 20% CREAM cause redness of skin?  Yes. EXAZEL 20% CREAM may cause burning, itching or redness of the skin (erythema) at the application site. Contact your doctor if any of the symptoms worsen.  Is EXAZEL 20% CREAM safe in pregnancy?  Inform your doctor if you are pregnant or are planning to have a baby before applying this medicine. Your doctor will decide whether you can use EXAZEL 20% CREAM.  Can I apply face creams while using EXAZEL 20% CREAM?  Yes, you may apply cosmetics after the EXAZEL 20% CREAM has dried. Do not wrap or bandage the skin unless your doctor has instructed to do so. Talk to your doctor for advice before using this medicine.
